None shall question Him about what He does, but they shall be questioned.

Have they taken gods other than Him? Say, (O Muhammad): "Bring forth your proof! Here is the Book with admonition for those of my time and there are also scriptures with admonition for people before me."<sup foot_note="179180">1</sup> But most people do not know the Truth, and have, therefore, turned away from it.<sup foot_note="179181">2</sup>
Never did We send any Messenger before you to whom We did not reveal: "There is no god but Me. So serve Me alone."
They say: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken to Himself a son."<sup foot_note="179182">1</sup> Glory be to Him! Those whom they so designate are only His honoured servants.
They do not outstrip Him in speech and only act as He commands.

He knows whatever is before them and whatsoever is remote from them and they do not intercede except for him, intercession on whose behalf pleases Him, and they stand constantly in awe of Him.<sup foot_note="179183">1</sup>
And if anyone of them were to claim: "Indeed I am a god apart from Him," We shall recompense both with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrong-doers.

Did the unbelievers (who do not accept the teaching of the Prophet) not realize that the heavens and the earth were one solid mass, then We tore them apart,<sup foot_note="179184">1</sup> and We made every living being out of water?<sup foot_note="179185">2</sup> Will they, then, not believe (that We created all this)?

And We placed firm mountains on earth lest it should sway with them,<sup foot_note="179186">1</sup> and We made wide paths<sup foot_note="179187">2</sup> in them that they may find their way;<sup foot_note="179188">3</sup>
and We made the sky a secure canopy;<sup foot_note="179189">1</sup> and yet they turn away from these Signs.<sup foot_note="179190">2</sup>
It is He Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Each of them is floating in its orbit.<sup foot_note="179191">1</sup>
(O Muhammad),<sup foot_note="179192">1</sup> We did not grant everlasting life to any human being even before you. If you were to die, will they live for ever?

Every living being shall taste death<sup foot_note="179193">1</sup> and We shall subject you to ill and good by way of trial,<sup foot_note="179194">2</sup> and to Us shall all of you be eventually sent back.

When the unbelievers see you they make you an object of fun, saying: "Is he the one who mentions your gods?"<sup foot_note="179195">1</sup> They say so, and yet they reject with disdain the very mention of the Most Compassionate Lord.<sup foot_note="179196">2</sup>
Man is hasty by nature.<sup foot_note="179197">1</sup> I shall certainly show you My Signs.<sup foot_note="179198">2</sup> Do not ask Me to be hasty.
They say: "(Tell us) when will the threat of punishment come to pass if you are truthful?"
If only the unbelievers knew of the Hour when they shall not be able to keep off the Fire from their faces, nor from their backs; nor shall they be helped.
That will suddenly come upon them and stupefy them. They shall not be able to ward it off, nor shall they be granted any respite.
Other Messengers before you were also mocked, but those who scoffed at the Messengers were overtaken by the same scourge that they had scoffed at.
Tell them, (O Muhammad): "Who protects you, during the night or the day from the Most Compassionate Lord?"<sup foot_note="179199">1</sup> And yet they turn away from the Admonition of their Lord.
Do they have any gods who would protect them against Us? They have no power even to help themselves; nor do they enjoy Our support.

Nay, We generously provided them and their fathers, and they enjoyed Our provision for long.<sup foot_note="179201">1</sup> Do they not see that We are now advancing into their territory, diminishing it from different sides?<sup foot_note="179202">2</sup> Is it they, then, who will triumph?"<sup foot_note="179203">3</sup>
Tell them: "I only warn you by the Revelation." But the deaf do not hear the cry when they are warned.
Were only the slightest whiff from your Lord's punishment to touch them,<sup foot_note="179204">1</sup> they would cry out: "Woe to us; we were indeed wrong-doers."

We shall set up just scales on the Day of Resurrection so that none will be wronged in the least. (We shall bring forth the acts of everyone), even if it be the weight of a grain of mustard seed. We shall suffice as Reckoners.<sup foot_note="179205">1</sup>

Surely<sup foot_note="179206">1</sup> We had granted to Moses and Aaron the Criterion<sup foot_note="179207">2</sup> (between right and wrong), and Light and Admonition for the good of the God-fearing,<sup foot_note="179208">3</sup>
for those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and dread the Hour<sup foot_note="179209">1</sup> (of Reckoning).
This is a Blessed Admonition that We have revealed. Are you, then, going to reject it?
Surely We had bestowed wisdom upon Abraham even earlier, and We knew him well.<sup foot_note="179210">1</sup>
Recall,<sup foot_note="179211">1</sup> when he said to his father and his people: "What are these images to which you are devoutly clinging?"
They answered: "We found our fathers worshipping them."
He said: "Certainly you and your fathers have all been in manifest error."
They said: "Are you expressing your true ideas before us or are you jesting?"<sup foot_note="179212">1</sup>
He said: "Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth which He created and to that I bear witness before you.
By Allah, I shall certainly carry out my plan against your gods after you are gone."<sup foot_note="179213">1</sup>
Then he broke them all into pieces,<sup foot_note="179214">1</sup> sparing only the supreme one among them that they may possibly return to him.<sup foot_note="179215">2</sup>
(When they saw the idols in this state) they said: "Who has done this to our gods? Surely he is one of the wrong-doers."
Some of them said: "We heard a youth called Abraham speak (ill) of them."
The others said: "Bring him, then, before the eyes of the people that they may see (what will be done to him)."<sup foot_note="179216">1</sup>
(On Abraham's arrival) they said: "Abraham, are you he who has done this to our gods?"
He answered: "Rather it was this supreme one who has done it. So ask them, if they can speak."<sup foot_note="179217">1</sup>
Thereupon they turned to their (inner) selves and said (to themselves): "Surely it is you who are the wrong-doers."
Then their minds were turned upside down,<sup foot_note="179218">1</sup> and they said: "You know well that they do not speak."
Abraham said: "Do you, then, worship beside Allah a thing that can neither benefit you nor hurt you?
Fie upon you and upon all that you worship beside Allah. Do you have no sense?"
They said: "Burn him, and come to the support of your gods, if you are going to do anything."
We said: "O fire, become coolness and safety for Abraham."<sup foot_note="179219">1</sup>
They had sought to do evil to him, but We caused them to be the worst losers,
and We saved him and Lot<sup foot_note="179220">1</sup> and brought him to the land upon which We had bestowed Our blessings for all the people of the world.<sup foot_note="179221">2</sup>
And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob as an additional gift,<sup foot_note="179222">1</sup> making each of them righteous.

And We made them into leaders to guide people in accordance with Our command, and We inspired them to good works, and to establish Prayers and to give Zakah. They worshipped Us alone.<sup foot_note="179223">1</sup>

We bestowed upon Lot sound judgement and knowledge,<sup foot_note="179224">1</sup> and We delivered him from the city that was immersed in foul deeds. They were indeed a wicked people, exceedingly disobedient.
And We admitted him into Our mercy. Verily he was of the righteous.

We bestowed the same favour upon Noah. Recall, when he cried to Us before;<sup foot_note="179225">1</sup> We accepted his prayer and delivered him and his household from the great distress<sup foot_note="179226">2</sup>
and We helped him against a people who rejected Our signs as false. They were indeed an evil people and so We drowned them all.

We bestowed the same favour upon David and Solomon. Recall, when they gave judgement regarding a tillage into which the sheep of some people had strayed at night, and We were witnesses to their judgement.

We guided Solomon to the right verdict, and We had granted each of them<sup foot_note="179227">1</sup> judgement and knowledge. We made the mountains and the birds celebrate the praise of Allah<sup foot_note="179228">2</sup> with David. It was We Who did all this.

It was We Who taught him the art of making coats of mail for your benefit so that it may protect you from each other's violence.<sup foot_note="179229">1</sup> Do you, then, give thanks?<sup foot_note="179230">2</sup>
And We subdued the strongly raging wind to Solomon which blew at his bidding towards the land We blessed.<sup foot_note="179231">1</sup> We know everything.
And We subdued many devils who dived (into the sea) for him and carried out other jobs besides that. We kept watch over all of them.<sup foot_note="179232">1</sup>

We bestowed (the same wisdom, judgement and knowledge) upon Job.<sup foot_note="179233">1</sup> Recall, when he cried to his Lord: "Behold, disease has struck me and You are the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."<sup foot_note="179234">2</sup>

We accepted his prayer and removed the affliction<sup foot_note="179235">1</sup> from him, and We not only restored to him his family but as many more with them as a mercy from Us and as a lesson to the worshippers.<sup foot_note="179236">2</sup>
And (We bestowed the same favour) upon Ishmael, Idris<sup foot_note="179237">1</sup> and Dhu al-Kifl,<sup foot_note="179238">2</sup> for they were all steadfast.
And We admitted them into Our mercy, for they were of the righteous.

And We bestowed Our favour upon Dhu al-Nun.<sup foot_note="179239">1</sup> Recall, when he went forth enraged,<sup foot_note="179240">2</sup> thinking We have no power to take him to task.<sup foot_note="179241">3</sup> Eventually he cried out in the darkness:"<sup foot_note="179242">4</sup> There is no god but You. Glory be to You! I have done wrong."
Thereupon We accepted his prayer, and rescued him from grief. Thus do We rescue the believers.
And We bestowed favour upon Zechariah, when he cried to his Lord: "Lord! Leave me not solitary (without any issue). You are the Best Inheritor."

So We accepted his prayer and bestowed upon him John, and We made his wife fit<sup foot_note="179243">1</sup> (to bear a child). Verily they hastened in doing good works and called upon Us with longing and fear, and humbled themselves to Us.<sup foot_note="179244">2</sup>

And also recall the woman who guarded her chastity:<sup foot_note="179245">1</sup> We breathed into her of Our spirit,<sup foot_note="179246">2</sup> and made her and her son a Sign to the whole world.<sup foot_note="179247">3</sup>
Verily this community of yours is a single community, and I am your Lord; so worship Me.
But they tore asunder their faith into many parts.<sup foot_note="179248">1</sup> But to Us they are bound to return.
Then whosoever does righteous works, while believing, his striving will not go unappreciated. We record them all for him.
It has been ordained against every town that We ever destroyed that they shall not return<sup foot_note="179249">1</sup> (to enjoy a new lease of life)
until Gog and Magog are let loose, and begin swooping from every mound,

and the time for the fulfilment of the true promise of Allah draws near,<sup foot_note="179250">1</sup> whereupon the eyes of those who disbelieved will stare in fear, and they will say: "Woe to us, we were indeed heedless of this; nay, we were wrongdoers."<sup foot_note="179251">2</sup>
(They will be told): "Verily you and the gods you worshipped beside Allah are the fuel of Hell. All of you are bound to arrive there.<sup foot_note="179252">1</sup>
Had these indeed been gods they would not have gone there. But (as it is), all of you shall ever abide in it."
There they shall groan<sup foot_note="179253">1</sup> with anguish and the din and noise in Hell will not let them hear anything.
But for those whom We had decided to favour with good reward, they shall be kept far removed from Hell.<sup foot_note="179254">1</sup>
They shall not hear even a whisper of it, and they shall live for ever in the delights which they had desired.
The Hour of the Great Terror shall not grieve them,<sup foot_note="179255">1</sup> and the angels shall receive them saying: "This is your Day which you had been promised."
On that Day We shall roll up the heavens like a scroll for writing. Even as We originated the creation first so We shall repeat it. This is a promise binding on Us; and so We shall do.
Surely We wrote in the Psalms, after the exhortation, that the earth shall be inherited by My righteous servants.
Herein, surely, is a message for those devoted to worship.<sup foot_note="179256">1</sup>
We have sent you forth as nothing but mercy to people of the whole world.<sup foot_note="179257">1</sup>
Say: "It is revealed to me that your God is only One God. Will you, then, submit to Him?"
If they turn away, say to them: "I have warned you all alike; and I cannot say whether what you have been promised<sup foot_note="179258">1</sup> is near or distant.
Indeed He knows what you say loudly and what you hide.<sup foot_note="179259">1</sup>
I think that this [reprieve] is possibly a trial for you,<sup foot_note="179260">1</sup> an opportunity to enjoy yourselves until an appointed time."
The Messenger said: "My Lord! Judge with truth. Our Compassionate Lord alone is our support against your (blasphemous) utterances."
O mankind, fear the (wrath of) your Lord! Indeed, the earthquake of the Hour (of Judgement) will be an awesome thing.<sup foot_note="179261">1</sup>

On the Day when you witness it, the suckling woman shall utterly neglect the infant she suckles,<sup foot_note="179262">1</sup> and every pregnant woman shall cast her burden, and you will see people as though they are drunk, when they are not drunk; but dreadful shall be Allah's chastisement.<sup foot_note="179263">2</sup>
Among people there are some who wrangle about Allah without knowledge<sup foot_note="179264">1</sup> and follow every rebellious devil,
although it is decreed about him that he shall lead into error whosoever takes him for a friend, and will direct him to the torment of the Fire.

O mankind! If you have any doubt concerning Resurrection, then know that it is surely We Who created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm,<sup foot_note="179265">1</sup> then from a clot of blood, then from a little lump of flesh, some of it shapely and other shapeless.<sup foot_note="179266">2</sup> (We are rehearsing this) that We may make the reality clear to you. We cause (the drop of sperm) that We please to remain in the wombs till an appointed time. We bring you forth as infants (and nurture you) that you may come of age. Among you is he that dies (at a young age) and he who is kept back to the most abject age so that after once having known, he reaches a stage when he knows nothing.<sup foot_note="179267">3</sup> You see the earth dry and barren and then no sooner than We send down water upon it, it begins to quiver and swell and brings forth every kind of beauteous vegetation.
All this is because Allah, He is the Truth,<sup foot_note="179268">1</sup> and because He resurrects the dead, and because He has power over everything,
(all of which shows that) the Hour shall surely come to pass - in this there is no doubt - and Allah shall surely resurrect those that are in graves.<sup foot_note="179269">1</sup>

And among people are those that wrangle<sup foot_note="179270">1</sup> about Allah without knowledge,<sup foot_note="179271">2</sup> without any true guidance,<sup foot_note="179272">3</sup> and without any scripture to enlighten them.<sup foot_note="179273">4</sup>

They wrangle arrogantly, intent on leading people astray from the Way of Allah.<sup foot_note="179274">1</sup> Such shall suffer disgrace in this world and We shall cause them to taste the chastisement of burning (in the Next).
That is the outcome of what your own hands have wrought, for Allah never wrongs His creatures.

And among people is he who worships Allah on the borderline; if any good befalls him,<sup foot_note="179275">1</sup> he is satisfied; but if a trial afflicts him, he utterly turns away.<sup foot_note="179276">2</sup> He will incur the loss of this world and the Hereafter. That indeed is a clear loss.<sup foot_note="179277">3</sup>
He invokes, instead of Allah, those who can neither harm nor benefit him. That indeed is straying far away.
He invokes those that are more likely to cause him harm than benefit.<sup foot_note="179278">1</sup> Such is surely an evil patron, and an evil associate.<sup foot_note="179279">2</sup>

(In contrast) Allah will assuredly cause those who believe and act righteously<sup foot_note="179280">1</sup> to enter Gardens beneath which rivers flow. For, most certainly, Allah does whatever He pleases.<sup foot_note="179281">2</sup>

Anyone who fancies that Allah will not support him in this world and in the Hereafter, let him reach out to heaven through a rope, and then make a hole in the sky and see whether his device can avert that which enrages him.<sup foot_note="179282">1</sup>
Even so We have revealed the Qur'an with Clear Signs. Verily Allah guides whomsoever He wills.

On the Day of Resurrection<sup foot_note="179283">1</sup> Allah will most certainly judge among those who believe,<sup foot_note="179284">2</sup> and those who became Jews,<sup foot_note="179285">3</sup> and Sabaeans,<sup foot_note="179286">4</sup> and Christians,<sup foot_note="179287">5</sup> and Magians,<sup foot_note="179288">6</sup> and those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity.<sup foot_note="179289">7</sup> Surely Allah watches over everything.

Have you not seen that all those who are in the heavens and all those who are in the earth prostrate themselves before Allah; and so do the sun and the moon, and the stars and the mountains, and the trees, and the beasts, and so do many human beings, and even many of those who are condemned to chastisement? And he whom Allah humiliates, none can give him honour. Allah does whatever He wills.

These two groups (the believers and unbelievers) are in dispute about their Lord.<sup foot_note="179290">1</sup> As for those that disbelieve, garments of fire have been cut out for them;<sup foot_note="179291">2</sup> boiling water shall be poured down over their heads,
causing (not only) their skins but all that is in their bellies as well to melt away.
There shall be maces of iron to lash them.
Whenever they try, in their anguish, to escape from Hell, they will be driven back into it, (and shall be told): "Now taste the torment of burning."

(On the other hand), Allah will cause those who believed and acted righteously to enter the Gardens beneath which rivers flow. They shall be decked in them with bracelets of gold and pearls<sup foot_note="179292">1</sup> and their raiment shall be of silk.
They were guided (to accept) the pure word;<sup foot_note="179293">1</sup> they were guided to the Way of the Praiseworthy (Lord).<sup foot_note="179294">2</sup>

Indeed those who disbelieve<sup foot_note="179295">1</sup> and who (now) hinder people from the Way of Allah and hinder them from the Holy Mosque<sup foot_note="179296">2</sup> which We have set up (as a place of worship) for all people, equally for those who dwell therein and for those who come from outside,<sup foot_note="179297">3</sup> (they surely deserve punishment). Whosoever deviates therein from the Right Way and acts with iniquity,<sup foot_note="179298">4</sup> We shall cause him to taste a painful chastisement.

Call to mind when We assigned to Abraham the site of the House (Kabah), directing him: "Do not associate aught with Me" and "Keep My House pure for those who walk around it,<sup foot_note="179299">1</sup> and for those who stand and who bow down and who prostrate themselves (in worship),
and publicly proclaim Pilgrimage for all mankind so that they come to you on foot and mounted on lean<sup foot_note="179300">1</sup> camels<sup foot_note="179301">2</sup> from every distant point

to witness the benefits in store for them,<sup foot_note="179302">1</sup> and pronounce the name of Allah during the appointed days over the cattle that He has provided them.<sup foot_note="179303">2</sup> So eat of it and feed the distressed and the needy.<sup foot_note="179304">3</sup>
Thereafter, let them tidy up<sup foot_note="179305">1</sup> and fulfil their vows<sup foot_note="179306">2</sup> and circumambulate the Ancient House."<sup foot_note="179307">3</sup>

Such (was the purpose of building the Kabah). Whosoever, then, venerates Allah's sanctities will find it to be good for him in the sight of his Lord.<sup foot_note="179308">1</sup> Cattle have been made lawful for you<sup foot_note="179309">2</sup> except those mentioned to you (as unlawful).<sup foot_note="179310">3</sup> So shun the abomination of idols<sup foot_note="179311">4</sup> and shun all words of falsehood.<sup foot_note="179312">5</sup>

Become exclusively devoted to Allah, ascribing Divinity to none other than Him. Whoso ascribes Divinity to aught beside Allah, it is as though he fell down from the sky whereafter either the birds will snatch him away, or the wind will sweep him to a distant place<sup foot_note="179314">1</sup> (causing him to be shattered to pieces).

Such is the fact. And whoso venerates the sanctity of all that have been ordained as symbols<sup foot_note="179315">1</sup> of Allah surely does so because it is part of the true piety of the hearts.<sup foot_note="179316">2</sup>

You may derive benefit (from sacrificial animals) until an appointed time.<sup foot_note="179317">1</sup> Thereafter their place (of sacrifice) is near the Ancient House.<sup foot_note="179318">2</sup>

For every people We have laid down a ritual of sacrifice (- although the purpose of the ritual is the same -) that they pronounce the name of Allah over the cattle He has provided them.<sup foot_note="179319">1</sup> Your Lord is One God; so submit yourselves to Him alone. And give, (O Prophet), glad tidings to those that humble<sup foot_note="179320">2</sup> themselves (before Allah),

whose hearts shiver whenever Allah is mentioned, who patiently bear whatever affliction comes to them, who establish Prayer, and who spend (for good purposes) out of what We have provided them.<sup foot_note="179321">1</sup>

We have appointed sacrificial camels<sup foot_note="179322">1</sup> among the symbols of (devotion to) Allah. There is much good in them for you.<sup foot_note="179323">2</sup> So make them stand<sup foot_note="179324">3</sup> (at the time of sacrifice) and pronounce the name of Allah over them,<sup foot_note="179325">4</sup> and when they fall down on their sides<sup foot_note="179326">5</sup>(after they are slaughtered), eat and also feed them who do not ask and those who ask. Thus have We subjected these animals that you may give thanks.<sup foot_note="179327">6</sup>

Neither their flesh reaches Allah nor their blood; it is your piety that reaches Him.<sup foot_note="179328">1</sup> He has subjected these animals (to you) that you may magnify Allah for the guidance He has bestowed upon you. Give glad tidings,<sup foot_note="179329">2</sup> (O Prophet), to those who do good.
Surely<sup foot_note="179330">1</sup> Allah defends those who believe.<sup foot_note="179331">2</sup> Certainly Allah has no love for the perfidious, the thankless.<sup foot_note="179332">3</sup>
Permission (to fight) has been granted to those for they have been wronged.<sup foot_note="179333">1</sup> Verily Allah has the power to help them:<sup foot_note="179334">2</sup>

those who were unjustly expelled from their homes<sup foot_note="179335">1</sup> for no other reason than their saying: "Allah is Our Lord."<sup foot_note="179336">2</sup> If Allah were not to repel some through others, monasteries and churches and synagogues<sup foot_note="179337">3</sup> and mosques wherein the name of Allah is much mentioned, would certainly have been pulled down.<sup foot_note="179338">4</sup> Allah will most certainly help those who will help Him. Verily Allah is Immensely Strong, Overwhelmingly Mighty.

(Allah will certainly help) those<sup foot_note="179339">1</sup> who, were We to bestow authority on them in the land, will establish Prayers, render Zakah, enjoin good, and forbid evil.<sup foot_note="179340">2</sup> The end of all matters rests with Allah.<sup foot_note="179341">3</sup>
(O Prophet), if they<sup foot_note="179342">1</sup> give the lie to you, then before them the people of 'Ad and Thamud, also gave the lie (to the Prophets),
and so too did the people of Abraham and the people of Lot;

and so did the dwellers of Midian, and Moses too was branded a liar. Initially I granted respite to the unbelievers for a while and then seized them.<sup foot_note="179343">1</sup> How dreadful was My punishment!<sup foot_note="179344">2</sup>

How many towns have We destroyed because their people were steeped in iniquity:<sup foot_note="179345">1</sup> so they lie fallen down upon their turrets! How many wells lie deserted; and how many towering palaces lie in ruins!

Have they not journeyed in the land that their hearts might understand and their ears might listen? For indeed it is not the eyes that are blinded;<sup foot_note="179346">1</sup> it is rather the hearts in the breasts that are rendered blind.

They ask you to hasten the punishment.<sup foot_note="179347">1</sup> Allah shall most certainly not fail His promise; but a Day with your Lord is as a thousand years of your reckoning.<sup foot_note="179348">2</sup>
How many towns did I respite at first though they were steeped in iniquity, and then I seized them! To Me are all destined to return.
Say (O Muhammad): "O people! I have been sent to you only as a plain warner<sup foot_note="179349">1</sup> (before the Doom strikes you)."
So those who believe and act righteously shall be granted forgiveness and an honourable sustenance,<sup foot_note="179350">1</sup>
whereas those who strive against Our Signs, seeking to profane them, they are the friends of the Fire!

Never did We send a Messenger or a Prophet<sup foot_note="179351">1</sup> before you (O Muhammad), but that whenever he had a desire,<sup foot_note="179352">2</sup> Satan interfered with that desire.<sup foot_note="179353">3</sup> Allah eradicates the interference of Satan and strengthens His Signs.<sup foot_note="179354">4</sup> Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.<sup foot_note="179355">5</sup>

(He does this) in order that He may make the evil caused by Satan a trial for those in whose hearts there is sickness (of hypocrisy), whose hearts are hard (and vitiated). Surely these wrong-doers have gone too far in their dissension.

(He also does this) in order that those endowed with knowledge may know that it is the Truth from your Lord and that they may have faith in it and their hearts may humble themselves before Him. Verily Allah always directs those that believe to the Right Way.<sup foot_note="179356">1</sup>
The unbelievers will not cease to be in doubt about it until the Hour suddenly comes upon them, or the chastisement of an ominous day<sup foot_note="179357">1</sup> overtakes them.
On that Day all sovereignty shall be Allah's and He will judge among them. Then those who believed and acted righteously shall be in Gardens of Bliss.
A humiliating chastisement awaits those who disbelieved and denied Our Signs.
As for those who migrated in the way of Allah, whereafter they were slain, or died, Allah will certainly grant them a goodly provision. Indeed, Allah is the Best of all those who provide.
He will surely admit them to a resort which will please them. Most certainly Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing.<sup foot_note="179358">1</sup>

That indeed is so, as for him who retaliates in proportion to the excess committed against him, and is thereafter again subjected to transgression, Allah will surely aid him.<sup foot_note="179359">1</sup> Verily Allah is All-Pardoning, All-Forgiving.<sup foot_note="179360">2</sup>

So shall it be<sup foot_note="179361">1</sup> because it is Allah Who causes the night to emerge out of the day and causes the day<sup foot_note="179362">2</sup> to emerge out of the night and Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.<sup foot_note="179363">3</sup>
So shall it be because Allah, He is the Truth, and all whom they invoke instead of Him are false.<sup foot_note="179364">1</sup> Allah is Most High, All-Great.
Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky whereby the earth turns green?<sup foot_note="179365">1</sup> Verily Allah is Subtle, All-Aware.<sup foot_note="179366">2</sup>
To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Surely Allah - He alone is Self- Sufficient, Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="179367">1</sup>

Have you not seen how Allah has subjected to you all that is in the earth, and the vessels that sail in the sea by His command,<sup foot_note="179368">1</sup> and it is He Who holds back the sky that it may not fall on earth except by His leave? Surely Allah is Most Gentle, Ever Compassionate to people.

And it is He Who has endowed you with life and it is He who causes you to die, and it is He Who will then resurrect you. Man is indeed extremely prone to denying the Truth.<sup foot_note="179369">1</sup>

For every people<sup foot_note="179370">1</sup> We have prescribed a way of worship<sup foot_note="179371">2</sup> which they follow. So, (O Muhammad), let them not dispute with you concerning this,<sup foot_note="179372">3</sup> and call them to Your Lord. You are certainly on the Straight Way.<sup foot_note="179373">4</sup>
And if they dispute with you, say: "Allah knows well what you do.
Allah will judge among you on the Day of Resurrection concerning matters about which you disagreed."
Are you not aware that Allah knows all that is in the heaven and the earth? Surely it is all preserved in a Book. Indeed that is easy with Allah.<sup foot_note="179374">1</sup>

Instead of Allah they worship those concerning whom He has revealed no sanction and concerning whom they have no true knowledge.<sup foot_note="179375">1</sup> None shall be able to help such evil-doers.<sup foot_note="179376">2</sup>

When Our Signs are plainly recited to them, you will perceive utter repugnance on their faces and it all but seems as if they will soon pounce upon those who recite Our Signs to them. Say: "Shall I tell you what is worse than that?<sup foot_note="179377">1</sup> The Fire with which Allah has threatened those who disbelieve. That is truly an evil end."

O people, a parable is set forth: pay heed to it. Those who call upon aught other than Allah shall never be able to create even a fly, even if all of them were to come together to do that. And if the fly were to snatch away anything from them, they would not be able to recover that from it. Powerless is the supplicant; and powerless is he to whom he supplicates.<sup foot_note="179378">1</sup>
They have not formed a true estimate of Allah. Indeed, Allah is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.
Allah chooses Messengers from among angels and from among human beings (to convey His command)<sup foot_note="179313">1</sup>. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
He knows all that is before them and that which is hidden from them.<sup foot_note="179379">1</sup> And it is to Allah that all affairs are returned.<sup foot_note="179380">2</sup>
Believers, bow down and prostrate yourselves before Your Lord and serve Your Lord and do good that you may prosper.<sup foot_note="179381">1</sup>

Strive in the cause of Allah in a manner worthy of that striving.<sup foot_note="179382">1</sup> He has chosen you<sup foot_note="179383">2</sup> (for His task), and He has not laid upon you any hardship in religion.<sup foot_note="179384">3</sup> Keep to the faith of your father Abraham.<sup foot_note="179385">4</sup> Allah named you Muslims earlier and even in this<sup foot_note="179386">5</sup> (Book), that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over all mankind.<sup foot_note="179387">6</sup> So establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and hold fast to Allah.<sup foot_note="179388">7</sup> He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector; what an excellent Helper!
The believers have indeed attained true success:<sup foot_note="179389">1</sup>
those who,<sup foot_note="179390">1</sup> in their Prayers, humble themselves;<sup foot_note="179391">2</sup>
who avoid whatever is vain and frivolous;<sup foot_note="179392">1</sup>
who observe Zakah;<sup foot_note="179393">1</sup>
who strictly guard their private parts<sup foot_note="179394">1</sup>
save from their wives, or those whom their right hands possess; for with regard to them they are free from blame "
As for those who seek beyond that, they are transgressors"<sup foot_note="179395">1</sup>
who are true to their trusts and their covenants,<sup foot_note="179396">1</sup>
and who guard their Prayers.<sup foot_note="179397">1</sup>
Such are the inheritors
that shall inherit Paradise;<sup foot_note="179398">1</sup> and in it they shall abide for ever.<sup foot_note="179399">2</sup>
We created man out of the extract of clay,
then We made him into a drop of life-germ, then We placed it in a safe depository,

then We made this drop into a clot, then We made the clot into a lump, then We made the lump into bones, then We clothed the bones with flesh,<sup foot_note="179400">1</sup> and then We caused it to grow into another creation.<sup foot_note="179401">2</sup> Thus Most Blessed is Allah, the Best of all those that create.<sup foot_note="179402">3</sup>
Thereafter you are destined to die,
and then on the Day of Resurrection you shall certainly be raised up.
We have indeed fashioned above you seven paths.<sup foot_note="179403">1</sup> Never were We unaware of the task of creation.<sup foot_note="179404">2</sup>

We sent down water from the sky in right measure, and caused it to stay in the earth,<sup foot_note="179405">1</sup> and We have the power to cause it to vanish<sup foot_note="179406">2</sup> (in the manner We please).

Then through water We caused gardens of date-palms and vines to grow for you wherein you have an abundance of delicious fruits<sup foot_note="179407">1</sup> and from them you derive your livelihood.<sup foot_note="179408">2</sup>
And We also produced the tree which springs forth from Mount Sinai,<sup foot_note="179409">1</sup> containing oil and sauce for those that eat.

And indeed there is also a lesson for you in cattle. We provide you with drink out of what they have in their bellies;<sup foot_note="179410">1</sup> and you have many other benefits in them: you eat of them,
and are carried on them and also on ships.<sup foot_note="179411">1</sup>
We sent Noah to his people,<sup foot_note="179412">1</sup> and he said: "My people! Serve Allah; you have no deity other than He. Do you have no fear?"<sup foot_note="179413">2</sup>

But the notables among his people had refused to believe, and said: "This is none other than a mortal like yourselves<sup foot_note="179414">1</sup> who desires to attain superiority over you.<sup foot_note="179415">2</sup> Had Allah wanted (to send any Messengers) He would have sent down angels.<sup foot_note="179416">3</sup> We have heard nothing like this in the time of our forebears of old (that humans were sent as Messengers).
He is a person who has been seized with a little madness; so wait for a while (perhaps he will improve)."
Noah said: "My Lord! Come to my help at their accusation that I am lying."<sup foot_note="179417">1</sup>

Thereupon We revealed to him, saying: "Build the Ark under Our eyes and according to Our revelation. And when Our command comes to pass<sup foot_note="179418">1</sup> and the oven boils over, take on board a pair each from every species, and also take your household except those of them against whom sentence has already been passed and do not plead to Me on behalf of the wrong-doers. They are doomed to be drowned.
And then when you and those accompanying you are firmly seated in the Ark, say: "Thanks be to Allah Who has delivered us from the wrong-doing people."<sup foot_note="179419">1</sup>
And say: "My Lord! Make my landing a blessed landing, for You are the Best of those Who can cause people to land in safety."<sup foot_note="179420">1</sup>
There are great Signs in this story;<sup foot_note="179421">1</sup> and surely We do put people to test.<sup foot_note="179422">2</sup>
Then, after them, We brought forth another generation;<sup foot_note="179423">1</sup>
and We sent among them a Messenger from among themselves, saying: "Serve Allah; you have no god other than He. Do you have no fear?"

The notables among his people who had refused to believe and who denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and those whom We had endowed with ease and comfort in this life,<sup foot_note="179424">1</sup> cried out: "This is no other than a mortal like yourselves who eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.
If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, you will certainly be losers.<sup foot_note="179425">1</sup>
Does he promise you that when you are dead and are reduced to dust and bones, you will be brought forth to life?
Far-fetched, utterly far-fetched is what you are being promised.
There is no other life than the life of the world. We shall live here and here shall we die; and we are not going to be raised again.
This man has forged a mere lie in the name of Allah and we shall never believe what he says."
The Messenger said: "My Lord! Come to my help at their accusing me of lying."
He answered: "A short while, and they shall be repenting."
Then a mighty blast quite justly overtook them, and We reduced them to a rubble.<sup foot_note="179426">1</sup> So away with the wrong-doing folk!
Then, after them, We brought forth other generations.
No nation can outstrip its term, nor can it put it back.

Then We sent Our Messengers in succession. Whenever a Messenger came to his people they rejected him, calling him a liar. Thereupon, We made each people to follow the other (to its doom), reducing them to mere tales (of the past). Scourged be the people who do not believe!<sup foot_note="179427">1</sup>
Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our Signs and a clear authority<sup foot_note="179428">1</sup>
to Pharaoh and to his chiefs, but they behaved superciliously and they were haughty.<sup foot_note="179429">1</sup>
They said: "Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves<sup foot_note="179430">1</sup> when their people are slaves to us?"<sup foot_note="179431">2</sup>
So they rejected them, calling them liars, and they too eventually became of those that were destroyed.<sup foot_note="179432">1</sup>
And We gave Moses the Book that people might be guided by it.
And We made Mary's son, and his mother, a Sign,<sup foot_note="179433">1</sup> and We gave them refuge on a lofty ground, a peaceful site with springs flowing in it.<sup foot_note="179434">2</sup>
Messengers!<sup foot_note="179435">1</sup> Partake of the things that are clean, and act righteously.<sup foot_note="179436">2</sup> I know well all that you do.
This community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord; so hold Me alone in fear.<sup foot_note="179437">1</sup>
But people later cut up their religion into bits, each group rejoicing in what they have.<sup foot_note="179438">1</sup>
So leave them immersed in their heedlessness till an appointed time.<sup foot_note="179439">1</sup>
Do they fancy that Our continuing to give them wealth and children (means) that
We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.<sup foot_note="179440">1</sup>
Surely those who stand in awe for fear of their Lord,<sup foot_note="179441">1</sup>
who have full faith in the Signs of their Lord;<sup foot_note="179442">1</sup>
who associate none with their Lord in His Divinity,<sup foot_note="179443">1</sup>
who give, whatever they give in charity, with their hearts trembling at the thought that they are destined to return to their Lord;<sup foot_note="179444">1</sup>
it is these who hasten to do good works and vie in so doing with one another.

We do not lay a burden on anyone beyond his capacity.<sup foot_note="179445">1</sup> We have a Book with Us that speaks the truth(about everyone)<sup foot_note="179446">2</sup>; and they shall in no wise be wronged.<sup foot_note="179447">3</sup>
Nay, their hearts are lost in ignorance of all this;<sup foot_note="179448">1</sup> and their deeds too vary from the way (mentioned above). They will persist in these deeds
until We seize with Our chastisement those of them that are given to luxuriant ways.<sup foot_note="179449">1</sup> They will then begin to groan.<sup foot_note="179450">2</sup>
"Put<sup foot_note="179451">1</sup> a stop to your groaning now! Surely no help shall be provided to you from Us.
My Signs were rehearsed to you and you turned back on your heels and took to flight,<sup foot_note="179452">1</sup>
behaving arrogantly, and making fun,<sup foot_note="179453">1</sup> and talking nonsense (about the Book in your nightly chats)."

Did they never ponder over this Word<sup foot_note="179454">1</sup> (of God)? Or has he (to wit, the Messenger) brought something the like of which did not come to their forefathers<sup foot_note="179455">2</sup> of yore?
Or is it that they were unaware of their Messenger and were therefore repelled by him for he was a stranger to them?<sup foot_note="179456">1</sup>
Or do they say that there is madness in him?<sup foot_note="179457">1</sup> Nay, he has brought them the Truth and it is the Truth that most of them disdain.

Were the Truth to follow their desires, the order of the heavens and the earth and those who dwell in them would have been ruined.<sup foot_note="179458">1</sup> Nay, the fact is that We have brought to them their own remembrance; and yet it is from their own remembrance that they are turning away.<sup foot_note="179459">2</sup>
Are you asking them for something? What Allah has given you is the best. He is the Best of providers.<sup foot_note="179460">1</sup>
You are calling them to a Straight Way,
but those who do not believe in the Hereafter are ever prone to deviate from the Right Way.<sup foot_note="179461">1</sup>
Were We to be merciful to them and remove from them their present afflictions, they would persist in their transgression, blindly wandering on.<sup foot_note="179462">1</sup>
(They are such) that We seized them with chastisement (and yet) they did not humble themselves before their Lord, nor do they entreat
until We opened upon them the door of a severe chastisement. Then lo, in this state they become utterly despaired of any good.<sup foot_note="179463">1</sup>
It is He Who has endowed you with the faculties of hearing and sight and has given you hearts (to think). Scarcely do you give thanks.<sup foot_note="179464">1</sup>
It is He Who has dispersed you all around the earth, and it is unto Him that you shall all be mustered.
It is He Who gives life and causes death, and He holds mastery over the alternation of night and day.<sup foot_note="179465">1</sup> Do you not understand this?<sup foot_note="179466">2</sup>
Nay, but they say the like of what their predecessors of yore had said.
They say: "Is it that when we are dead and have been reduced to dust and bones, shall we then be raised up again?
We were promised such things and so were our forefathers before us. All these are no more than tales of the past."<sup foot_note="179467">1</sup>
Ask them: "Whose is the earth and those who are in it? Tell us if you know"
They will surely say: "Allah's." Say: "Then why do you not take heed?"<sup foot_note="179468">1</sup>
Ask them: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, the Lord of the Great Throne?"
They will surely say: "Allah."<sup foot_note="179469">1</sup> Say: "Will you not, then, fear (Allah)?"<sup foot_note="179470">2</sup>
Ask them: "Say, if you indeed know, to whom belongs the dominion<sup foot_note="179471">1</sup> over all things; (Who is it) that grants asylum, but against Whom no asylum is available?"
They will surely say: "(The dominion over all things) belongs to Allah." Say: "Whence are you then deluded?"<sup foot_note="179472">1</sup>
We have brought before them the Truth, and there is no doubt that they are lying.<sup foot_note="179473">1</sup>

Never did Allah take unto Himself any son,<sup foot_note="179474">1</sup> nor is there any god other than He. (Had there been any other gods) each god would have taken his creatures away with him, and each would have rushed to overpower the other.<sup foot_note="179475">2</sup> Glory be to Allah from all that they characterize Him with!
He knows both what is visible and what is not visible.<sup foot_note="179476">1</sup> Exalted is Allah above all that they associate with Him.
Pray, (O Muhammad): "My Lord, if You should bring the scourge of which they had been warned in my presence,
then do not include me, my Lord, among these wrong-doing people."<sup foot_note="179477">1</sup>
Surely We are able to show you what We warn them against.
(O Muhammad)! Repel evil in the best manner. We are well aware of all that they say about you.
And pray: "My Lord! I seek Your refuge from the suggestions of the evil ones;
I even seek Your refuge, my Lord, lest they should approach me."<sup foot_note="179478">1</sup>
(They shall persist in their deeds) until when death comes to anyone of them he will say: "My Lord, send me back to the world<sup foot_note="179479">1</sup>

that I have left behind. I am likely to do good."<sup foot_note="179480">1</sup> Nay,<sup foot_note="179481">2</sup> it is merely a word that he is uttering.<sup foot_note="179482">3</sup> There is a barrier behind all of them (who are dead) until the Day<sup foot_note="179483">4</sup> when they will be raised up.
And then no sooner the Trumpet is blown than there will remain no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask one another.<sup foot_note="179484">1</sup>
It will be an Hour when those whose scales are heavy,<sup foot_note="179485">1</sup> they alone will attain success;
and those whose scales are light, those will be the ones who will have courted loss.<sup foot_note="179486">1</sup> They will abide in Hell.
The Fire shall scorch their faces, exposing their jaws.<sup foot_note="179487">1</sup>
"Are you not those to whom My revelations were recited, and you dubbed them as lies?"
They will say: "Our Lord! Our misfortune prevailed over us. We were indeed an erring people.
Our Lord! Take us out of this. Then if we revert (to evil-doing) we shall indeed be wrongdoers."
Allah will say: "Away from Me; stay where you are and do not address Me.<sup foot_note="179488">1</sup>
You are those that when a party of My servants said: 'Our Lord, we believe, so forgive us, and have mercy on us, for You are the Best of those that are merciful,'
you made a laughingstock of them and your hostility to them caused you to forget Me, and you simply kept laughing.
Lo! I have rewarded them this Day for their steadfastness, so that they, and they alone, are triumphant."<sup foot_note="179489">1</sup>
Then Allah will ask them: "For how many years did you stay on earth?"
They will say: "We stayed for a day or part of a day.<sup foot_note="179490">1</sup> Ask of those who keep count of this."
He will say: "You stayed only for a while, if you only knew that.<sup foot_note="179491">1</sup>
Did you imagine that We created you without any purpose,<sup foot_note="179492">1</sup> and that you will not be brought back to Us?"
So, exalted be Allah,<sup foot_note="179493">1</sup> the True King! There is no god but He, the Lord of the Great Throne.

He who invokes any other god along with Allah " one for whom he has no evidence"<sup foot_note="179494">1</sup> his reckoning is with his Lord alone.<sup foot_note="179495">2</sup> Indeed, these unbelievers shall not prosper.<sup foot_note="179496">3</sup>
And say, (O Muhammad): "My Lord, forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the Best of those that are merciful."<sup foot_note="179497">1</sup>
This is a surah which We have revealed, and which We have made obligatory; We have revealed in it clear instructions<sup foot_note="179498">1</sup> so that you may take heed.

Those who fornicate - whether female or male - flog each one of them with a hundred lashes.<sup foot_note="179499">1</sup> And let not tenderness for them deter you from what pertains to Allah's religion, if you do truly believe in Allah and the Last Day<sup foot_note="179500">2</sup>; and let a party of believers witness their punishment.<sup foot_note="179501">3</sup>

Let the fornicator not marry any except a fornicatress or idolatress and let the fornicatress not marry any except a fornicator or an idolater. That is forbidden to the believers.<sup foot_note="179502">1</sup>
Those who accuse honourable women (of unchastity) but do not produce four witnesses, flog them with eighty lashes, and do not admit their testimony ever after. They are indeed transgressors,
except those of them that repent thereafter and mend their behaviour. For surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Ever Compassionate.<sup foot_note="179503">1</sup>

As for those who accuse their wives (of unchastity), and have no witnesses except themselves: the testimony of such a one is that he testify, swearing by Allah four times, that he is truthful (in his accusation),
and a fifth time, that the curse of Allah be on him if he be lying (in his accusation).
And the punishment shall be averted from the woman if she were to testify, swearing by Allah four times that the man was lying,
and a fifth time that the wrath of Allah be on her if the man be truthful (in his accusation).<sup foot_note="179504">1</sup>

Were it not for Allah's Bounty and His Mercy unto you and that Allah is much prone to accept repentance and is Wise, (you would have landed yourselves into great difficulty on the question of unsubstantiated accusation of your spouses).

Surely those who invented this calumny<sup foot_note="179505">1</sup> are a band from among you.<sup foot_note="179506">2</sup> Do not deem this incident an evil for you; nay, it is good for you.<sup foot_note="179507">3</sup> Every one of them has accumulated sin in proportion to his share in this guilt;<sup foot_note="179508">4</sup> and he who has the greater part of it shall suffer a mighty chastisement.
When you heard of it, why did the believing men and women not think well of their own folk<sup foot_note="179509">1</sup> and say: "This is a manifest calumny?"<sup foot_note="179510">2</sup>
Why did they not bring four witnesses in support of their accusation? Now that they have brought no witnesses, it is indeed they who are liars in the sight of Allah.<sup foot_note="179511">1</sup>
Were it not for Allah's Bounty and His Mercy unto you in the world and in the Hereafter a grievous chastisement would have seized you on account of what you indulged in.

(Just think, how wrong you were) when one tongue received it from another and you uttered with your mouths something you knew nothing about. You deemed it to be a trifle while in the sight of Allah it was a serious matter.
And why, no sooner than you had heard it, did you not say: "It becomes us not even to utter such a thing? Holy are You (O Allah)! This is a mighty calumny."
Allah admonishes you: If you are true believers, never repeat the like of what you did.
Allah clearly expounds to you His instructions. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.<sup foot_note="179512">1</sup>

Verily those who love that indecency should spread among the believers deserve a painful chastisement in the world and the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="179513">1</sup> Allah knows, but you do not know.<sup foot_note="179514">2</sup>
Were it not for Allah's Bounty and His Mercy unto you, and that Allah is Most Forgiving and Wise, (the evil that had been spread among you would have led to terrible consequences).

Believers! Do not follow in Satan's footsteps. Let him who follows in Satan's footsteps (remember that) Satan bids people to indecency and evil. Were it not for Allah's Bounty and His Mercy unto you, not one of you would have ever attained purity.<sup foot_note="179515">1</sup> But Allah enables whomsoever He wills to attain purity. Allah is All- Hearing, All-Knowing.<sup foot_note="179516">2</sup>

Let those among you who are bounteous and resourceful not swear to withhold giving to the kindred, to the needy, and to those who have forsaken their homes in the cause of Allah; rather, let them forgive and forbear. Do you not wish that Allah should forgive you? Allah is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.<sup foot_note="179517">1</sup>
Those that accuse chaste, unwary, believing women,<sup foot_note="179518">1</sup> have been cursed in the world and the Hereafter, and a mighty chastisement awaits them.
(Let them not be heedless of) the Day when their own tongues, their hands, and their feet shall all bear witness against them as to what they have been doing.21a
On that Day Allah will justly requite them, and they will come to know that Allah - and He alone - is the Truth, the One Who makes the Truth manifest.

Corrupt women are for corrupt men, and corrupt men for corrupt women. Good women are for good men, and good men for good women. They are innocent of the calumnies people utter.<sup foot_note="179519">1</sup> There shall be forgiveness for them and a generous provision.

Believers!<sup foot_note="179520">1</sup> Enter not houses other than your own houses until you have obtained the permission of the inmates<sup foot_note="179521">2</sup> of those houses and have greeted them with peace. This is better for you. It is expected that you will observe this.<sup foot_note="179522">3</sup>

Then if you find no one in them, do not enter until you have been given permission (to enter).<sup foot_note="179523">1</sup> And if you are told to go back, then do go back. This is a purer way for you.<sup foot_note="179524">2</sup> Allah knows all what you do.

However, it is not blameworthy for you if you enter houses that are uninhabited but wherein there is something of use to you.<sup foot_note="179525">1</sup> Allah is well aware of what you disclose and what you conceal.

(O Prophet), enjoin believing men to cast down their looks<sup foot_note="179526">1</sup> and guard their private parts.<sup foot_note="179527">2</sup> That is purer for them. Surely Allah is well aware of all what they do.

And enjoin believing women to cast down their looks<sup foot_note="179528">1</sup> and guard their private<sup foot_note="179529">2</sup> parts<sup foot_note="179530">3</sup> and not reveal their adornment<sup foot_note="179531">4</sup> except that which is revealed of itself,<sup foot_note="179532">5</sup> and to draw their veils over their bosoms,<sup foot_note="179533">6</sup> and not to reveal their adornment save to their husbands,<sup foot_note="179534">7</sup> or their fathers, or the fathers of their husbands,<sup foot_note="179535">8</sup> or of their own sons, or the sons of their husbands,<sup foot_note="179536">9</sup> or their brothers,<sup foot_note="179537">10</sup> or the sons of their brothers,<sup foot_note="179538">11</sup> or the sons of their sisters,<sup foot_note="179539">12</sup> or the women with whom they associate,<sup foot_note="179540">13</sup> or those that are in their bondage,<sup foot_note="179541">14</sup> or the male attendants in their service free of sexual interest,<sup foot_note="179542">15</sup> or boys that are yet unaware of illicit matters pertaining to women.<sup foot_note="179543">16</sup> Nor should they stamp their feet on the ground in such manner that their hidden ornament becomes revealed.<sup foot_note="179544">17</sup> Believers, turn together, all of you, to Allah in repentance<sup foot_note="179545">18</sup> that you may attain true success.<sup foot_note="179546">19</sup>

Marry those of you that are single, (whether men or women),<sup foot_note="179547">1</sup> and those of your male and female slaves that are righteous.<sup foot_note="179548">2</sup><sup foot_note="179549">3</sup> If they are poor, Allah will enrich them out of His Bounty.<sup foot_note="179550">4</sup> Allah is Immensely Resourceful, All-Knowing.

Let those who cannot afford to marry keep themselves chaste until Allah enriches them out of His Bounty.<sup foot_note="179551">1</sup> And write out a deed of manumission for such of your slaves that desire their freedom<sup foot_note="179552">2</sup> in lieu of payment<sup foot_note="179553">3</sup> - if you see any good in them<sup foot_note="179554">4</sup> - and give them out of the wealth that Allah has given you.<sup foot_note="179555">5</sup> And do not compel your slave-girls to prostitution for the sake of the benefits of worldly life the while they desire to remain chaste.<sup foot_note="179556">6</sup> And if anyone compels them to prostitution, Allah will be Most Pardoning, Much Merciful (to them) after their subjection to such compulsion.

Verily We have sent down for you revelations which clearly expound true guidance, and examples of those who passed away before you, and an admonition for those who fear (Allah).<sup foot_note="179557">1</sup>

Allah<sup foot_note="179560">1</sup> is the Light of the heavens and the earth.<sup foot_note="179561">2</sup> His Light (in the Universe) may be likened to a niche wherein is a lamp, and the lamp is in the crystal which shines in star-like brilliance. It is lit from (the oil) of a blessed olive tree<sup foot_note="179562">3</sup> that is neither eastern nor western.<sup foot_note="179563">4</sup> Its oil well nigh glows forth (of itself) though no fire touched it: Light upon Light.<sup foot_note="179564">5</sup> Allah guides to His Light whom He wills.<sup foot_note="179565">6</sup> Allah sets forth parables to make people understand. Allah knows everything.<sup foot_note="179566">7</sup>

(Those who are directed to this Light are found) in houses which Allah has allowed to be raised and wherein His name is to be remembered:<sup foot_note="179567">1</sup> in them people glorify Him in the morning and in the evening,

people whom neither commerce nor striving after profit diverts them from remembering Allah, from establishing Prayer, and from paying Zakah; people who dread the Day on which all hearts will be overturned and eyes will be petrified;

(people who do all this so) that Allah may reward them in accordance with the best that they did; indeed He will bestow upon them more out of His Bounty, for Allah grants whomsoever He wills beyond all measure.<sup foot_note="179568">1</sup>

But for those who deny the Truth,<sup foot_note="179569">1</sup> their deeds are like a mirage in the desert, which the thirsty supposes to be water until he comes to it only to find that it was nothing; he found instead that Allah was with Him and He paid his account in full. Allah is swift in settling the account.<sup foot_note="179570">2</sup>

Or its similitude is that of depths of darkness upon an abysmal sea, covered by a billow, above which is a billow, above which is cloud, creating darkness piled one upon another; when he puts forth his hand, he would scarcely see it.<sup foot_note="179571">1</sup> He to whom Allah assigns no light, he will have no light.<sup foot_note="179572">2</sup>

Do you not see that all that is in the heavens and the earth, even the birds that go about spreading their wings in flight, extol His glory? Each knows the way of its prayer and of its extolling Allah's glory. Allah is well aware of whatever they do.
Allah's is the dominion of the heavens and the earth and to Him are all destined to return.

Do you not see<sup foot_note="179573">1</sup> that it is Allah Who gently drives the clouds, then He joins them together and then turns them into a thick mass and thereafter you see rain-drops fall down from its midst? And then He sends down hail from the heaven - thanks to the mountains<sup foot_note="179574">2</sup> - and causes it to smite whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of His lightning almost takes away the sight.
It is Allah Who alternates the night and the day. Surely there is a lesson in it for those that have sight.
Allah has created every animal from water. Of them some move on their bellies, some move on two legs and some on four. Allah creates whatever He wills. Surely Allah has power over everything.
Verily We have sent down revelations that clearly explain the Truth. Allah guides whomsoever He wills to a Straight Way.
They say: "We believe in Allah and the Messenger, and we obey," but thereafter a faction of them turns away (from obedience). These indeed are not believers.<sup foot_note="179575">1</sup>

When they are called to Allah and His Messenger that he (that is, the Messenger) may judge (the disputes) among them,<sup foot_note="179576">1</sup> a faction of them turns away.<sup foot_note="179577">2</sup>
However if the right is on their side they come to him (professing) their submissiveness.<sup foot_note="179578">1</sup>

Do their hearts suffer from the disease (of hypocrisy)? Or have they fallen prey to doubts? Or do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will wrong them? Nay, the truth is that they themselves are wrong-doers.<sup foot_note="179579">1</sup>

When those that believe are called to Allah and His Messenger in order that he (that is, the Messenger) may judge their disputes among them, nothing becomes them but to say: "We hear and we obey." Such shall attain true success.
Those who obey Allah and His Messenger and fear Him and avoid disobeying Him: such, indeed, shall triumph.

(The hypocrites) solemnly swear by Allah: "If you order us, we shall surely go forth (and fight in the cause of Allah)." Tell them: "Do not swear. The state of your obedience is known.<sup foot_note="179580">1</sup> Allah is well aware of all that you do."<sup foot_note="179581">2</sup>

Say: "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away, then (know well) that the Messenger is responsible for what he has been charged with and you are responsible for what you have been charged with. But if you obey him, you will be guided to the Right Way. The Messenger has no other responsibility but to clearly convey (the command)."

Allah has promised those of you who believe and do righteous deeds that He will surely bestow power on them in the land even as He bestowed power on those that preceded them, and that He will firmly establish their religion which He has been pleased to choose for them, and He will replace with security the state of fear that they are in. Let them serve Me and associate none with Me in My Divinity.<sup foot_note="179582">1</sup> Whoso thereafter engages in unbelief,<sup foot_note="179583">2</sup> such indeed are the ungodly.
Establish Prayer and pay Zakah and obey the Messenger so that mercy may be shown to you.
Do not even imagine that those who disbelieve can render Allah powerless in the land. Their abode is the Fire; what an evil abode!

Believers!<sup foot_note="179584">1</sup> At three times let those whom your right hands possess and those of your children<sup foot_note="179585">2</sup> who have not yet reached puberty<sup foot_note="179586">3</sup> ask leave of you before entering your quarters: before the Morning Prayer and when you take off your clothes at noon, and after the Night Prayer. These are the three times of privacy for you.<sup foot_note="179587">4</sup> If they come to you at other times then there is no sin for them<sup foot_note="179588">5</sup> nor for you, for you have to visit one another frequently.<sup foot_note="179589">6</sup> Thus does Allah clearly explain His directives to you. Allah is All- Knowing, All-Wise.

And when your children attain puberty<sup foot_note="179590">1</sup> let them ask leave to come to you like their elders used to ask leave. Thus does Allah clearly explain to you His Signs. He is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

The women who are past their youth (and can no longer bear children) and do not look forward to marriage<sup foot_note="179591">1</sup> will incur no sin if they cast off their outer garments<sup foot_note="179592">2</sup> without displaying their adornment.<sup foot_note="179593">3</sup> But if they remain modest, that is still better for them. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

There is no blame on the blind nor any blame on the lame nor any blame on the sick nor on yourselves that you eat in your own houses, or your fathers' houses, or your mothers' houses, or your brothers' houses, or the houses of your sisters, or the houses of your fathers' brothers or the houses of your fathers' sisters, or in the houses of your mothers' brothers, or in the houses of your mothers' sisters or in the houses whose keys you possess, or the house of a friend.<sup foot_note="179594">1</sup> There is no blame if you eat together or separately.<sup foot_note="179595">2</sup> But when you enter such houses, greet each other with a salutation appointed by Allah, a salutation that is blessed and good. Thus, does Allah expound His signs to you in order that you will act with understanding.

The true believers<sup foot_note="179596">1</sup> are only those who sincerely believe in Allah and in His Messenger and who, whenever they are with him on some common errand,<sup foot_note="179597">2</sup> they do not go away until they have asked leave of him. Verily those who ask leave of you, it is they who truly believe in Allah and His Messenger. So if they ask your leave in connection with some of their affairs,<sup foot_note="179598">3</sup> give leave to those whom you will,<sup foot_note="179599">4</sup> and ask Allah for forgiveness on their behalf.<sup foot_note="179600">5</sup> Surely Allah is Much Forgiving, Ever Merciful.

(Muslims!) Do not make the calling of the Messenger among you as your calling one another.<sup foot_note="179601">1</sup> Allah knows well those of you who surreptitiously steal away, taking shelter behind one another. Let those who go against the order (of the Messenger) beware lest a trial or severe punishment afflict them.

Lo! Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He is well aware of your ways. And the Day when they will be returned to Him, He will tell them all what they did. Allah knows everything.

Most blessed is He<sup foot_note="179602">1</sup> Who sent down this Criterion<sup foot_note="179603">2</sup><sup foot_note="179604">3</sup> on His servant, to be a warner to all mankind;<sup foot_note="179605">4</sup>

He to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth;<sup foot_note="179606">1</sup> Who has taken to Himself no son<sup foot_note="179607">2</sup> nor has He taken any partner in His kingdom;<sup foot_note="179608">3</sup> Who created everything and then determined its destiny.<sup foot_note="179609">4</sup>

Yet people have taken, instead of Him, other deities; those that create nothing but are themselves created;<sup foot_note="179610">1</sup> who do not have the power to hurt or benefit even themselves; who have no power over death, nor over life, nor over the resurrection of the dead.<sup foot_note="179611">2</sup>

Those who disbelieve in the Message of the Prophet say: "This (Criterion) is nothing but a lie which he has forged with the help of others." Such have indeed resorted to a grievous wrong and sheer falsehood.<sup foot_note="179612">1</sup>
They say: "These are merely fairy tales of the ancients which he has got inscribed and they are then recited to him morning and evening."

Say to them (O Muhammad): "It is He Who knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth<sup foot_note="179613">1</sup> Who has sent down this Book. Indeed, He is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate."<sup foot_note="179614">2</sup>

They say: "What sort of a Messenger is this: he eats food and walks about in the markets?<sup foot_note="179558">1</sup> Why was an angel not sent down to him so that he may remain with the Messenger and warn those that do not believe in him?<sup foot_note="179559">2</sup>

Why was a treasure not bestowed upon him, or a garden whereof he might obtain his sustenance?"<sup foot_note="179616">1</sup> The evil-doers say: "You are simply following a bewitched man."<sup foot_note="179617">2</sup>
See what specious arguments they put forth before you: they are so strayed that they will not find their way to anything sound.<sup foot_note="179618">1</sup>
Most blessed<sup foot_note="179619">1</sup> is He Who, if He wills, can grant you even better than what they propose: Gardens beneath which rivers flow, and stately mansions.
Nay, the truth is that it is the Hour<sup foot_note="179620">1</sup>  to which they give the lie.<sup foot_note="179621">2</sup>; We have kept a Blazing Fire ready for him who denies the Hour.
When it sees<sup foot_note="179622">1</sup> them from a place afar, they will hear its raging and roaring,
and when they are flung, chained together, into a narrow place in it, they will fervently call there for annihilation.
(They will then be told): "Do not call for a single annihilation, but for many an annihilation."
Ask them: "Is this state better or the Garden of Eternity which the God-fearing have been promised?" It shall be their recompense and the end-point of their journey;
the Garden wherein whatever they desire will be fulfilled. In it they shall abide for ever. This is a promise whose fulfilment Your Lord has made incumbent on Himself.<sup foot_note="179623">1</sup>

On the Day when He will muster together all the unbelievers as well as the deities that they worship beside Allah,<sup foot_note="179624">1</sup> and He will ask them: "Was it you who caused these servants of Mine to stray away, or did they themselves stray away from the Right Path?"<sup foot_note="179625">2</sup>

They will say: "Glory be to You! It did not behove us to take any other than You as our guardians, but You lavished the pleasures of life upon them and their forefathers until they forgot the Admonition and became doomed to destruction."<sup foot_note="179626">1</sup>

Thus will those deities give the lie to all what you now say,<sup foot_note="179627">1</sup> and you will not be able to avert your doom, nor obtain any succour. We shall cause whoever of you commits wrong<sup foot_note="179628">2</sup> to taste an enormous chastisement.

(O Muhammad), We never sent any Messengers before you but they ate food and walked about in the markets.<sup foot_note="179629">1</sup> We made some of you a means to test each by the other<sup foot_note="179630">2</sup> to see whether you remain patient.<sup foot_note="179631">3</sup> Your Lord is All-Seeing.<sup foot_note="179632">4</sup>

Those who do not look forward to meet Us say:<sup foot_note="179633">1</sup> "Why should angels not be sent to us, or why do we ourselves not observe our Lord?"<sup foot_note="179634">2</sup> Surely they are too proud of themselves<sup foot_note="179635">3</sup> and have gone beyond all limits in their rebellion.
On that Day - the Day when they will behold angels - there will be no good news for those immersed in evil,<sup foot_note="179636">1</sup> and they will cry out: "We seek refuge (in Allah)."
And We shall turn to their deeds and shall reduce them to scattered dust.<sup foot_note="179637">1</sup>
On that Day it is the inmates of Paradise that will be graced with a better abode and a fairer resting place.<sup foot_note="179638">1</sup>
On that Day the sky shall be rent asunder by a cloud and a whole cavalcade of angels will be made to descend.
On that Day the true kingdom will belong only to the Merciful Lord.<sup foot_note="179639">1</sup> That will be a hard day for those that deny the Truth;
a Day when the wrong-doer will bite his hands, saying: "Would that I had stood by the Messenger!
Woe is me! Would that I had not taken such a one for a friend!
He led me astray from the Admonition that had come to me. Satan proved to be a great betrayer of man."<sup foot_note="179640">1</sup>
And the Messenger will say: "My Lord! My own people had made this Qur'an an object of laughter."<sup foot_note="179641">1</sup>

(O Muhammad), thus did We make for every Prophet enemies<sup foot_note="179642">1</sup> from among those immersed in evil. Your Lord suffices you as a Guide and a Helper.<sup foot_note="179643">2</sup>

Those who disbelieve say: "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?"<sup foot_note="179644">1</sup> It was revealed thus that We may fully impress it on your mind;<sup foot_note="179645">2</sup> (and for the same end) We have revealed it gradually (according to a scheme) in fragments.
(This was also done so that) whenever they put any strange question to you, We sent its right answer and explained the matter in the best manner.<sup foot_note="179615">1</sup>
Those who shall be mustered in the Hell upon their faces, their stand is the worst and their way most erroneous.<sup foot_note="179646">1</sup>
Verily We granted Moses the Book<sup foot_note="179647">1</sup> and appointed his brother Aaron with him as his helper
and said to him: "Go the two of you to the people who have given the lie to Our Signs."<sup foot_note="179648">1</sup> Thereafter We utterly destroyed them.

(The same happened with) the people of Noah: when they gave the lie to the Messengers<sup foot_note="179649">1</sup> We drowned them and made of them a Sign of warning for all mankind. We have kept ready a painful chastisement for the wrong-doers<sup foot_note="179650">2</sup>.
And in like manner were the 'Ad and the Thamud destroyed and the people of al-Rass<sup foot_note="179651">1</sup> and many a nation in the centuries in between.
We warned each (of them) by examples (of the nations so destroyed in the past), and We totally annihilated each of them.

They have surely passed by the town which was rained upon by an evil rain.<sup foot_note="179652">1</sup> Have they not seen it? Nay; but they do not believe in being raised up after death.<sup foot_note="179653">2</sup>
Whenever they see you they take you for nothing else but an object of jest, saying: "Is this whom Allah has sent as a Messenger?

Had we not firmly persevered in our devotion to them<sup foot_note="179654">1</sup> (he had almost) led us astray from our gods." But soon, when they see the chastisement, they will come to know who had strayed too far from the Right Way.
Have you ever considered the case of him who has taken his carnal desire for his god?<sup foot_note="179655">1</sup> Can you take responsibility for guiding him to the Right Way?
Do you think that most of them hear or understand? For they are merely like cattle; nay, even worse than them.<sup foot_note="179656">1</sup>
Have you not seen how your Lord spreads the shade? If He will, He could have made it stationary; instead, We have made the sun its pilot.<sup foot_note="179657">1</sup>
So (as the sun rises), We gradually roll up that shade unto Us.<sup foot_note="179658">1</sup>
It is Allah Who has made night a garment for you,<sup foot_note="179659">1</sup> and sleep the repose (of death), and has made day the time of rising to life.<sup foot_note="179660">2</sup>
And He it is Who sends forth the winds as glad tidings, heralding His Mercy. Then We send down pure water<sup foot_note="179661">1</sup> from the sky
that We may revive through it a dead land and give it for drink to many cattle and human beings from among Our creation.<sup foot_note="179662">1</sup>

We present this wondrous phenomenon to them over and over again<sup foot_note="179663">1</sup> that they may learn a lesson from it. But most people simply decline everything except disbelief and ingratitude.<sup foot_note="179664">2</sup>
Had We so willed, We would have raised up in every town a warner.<sup foot_note="179665">1</sup>
So, (O Prophet), do not follow the unbelievers but engage in a mighty striving against them with this Qur'an.

And He it is Who has joined the two seas: one sweet and palatable and the other saltish and bitter; and He has set a barrier and an insurmountable obstruction between the two that keeps them apart.<sup foot_note="179666">1</sup>
And He it is Who has created man from water and then produced from him two sorts of kindred: by descent and by marriage. Your Lord is All-Powerful.<sup foot_note="179667">1</sup>

And yet people worship deities other than Allah that can neither benefit them nor hurt them. Besides, the unbeliever is ever prone to come to the support of everyone who rebels against his Lord.<sup foot_note="179668">1</sup>
We have not sent you, (O Muhammad), except as a bearer of good tidings and a warner.<sup foot_note="179669">1</sup>
Say to them: "I ask of you no reward for my work. My only reward is that whoever so wills may follow the way leading to His Lord."71a
(O Muhammad), put your trust in Him Who is Ever-Living, Who will never die, and glorify Him with His praise. He suffices as the Knower of the sins of His servants,

He Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them in six days, and then ascended the Throne;<sup foot_note="179670">1</sup> the Merciful One. Ask concerning Him the one who knows.

When they are told: "Prostrate yourselves before the Merciful One," they say: "What is the Merciful One? Shall we prostrate ourselves before whomsoever you command us to prostrate?"<sup foot_note="179671">1</sup> This even further increases their aversion.<sup foot_note="179672">2</sup>
Most blessed is He Who set a constellation in the heavens,<sup foot_note="179673">1</sup> and placed in it a great lamp<sup foot_note="179674">2</sup> and a shining moon.
He it is Who has appointed night and day to succeed one another (as a Sign) for him who desires to take heed, or desires to be thankful.<sup foot_note="179675">1</sup>

The true servants of the Merciful One are those<sup foot_note="179676">1</sup> who walk on the earth gently<sup foot_note="179677">2</sup> and when the foolish ones address them, they simply say: "Peace to you";<sup foot_note="179678">3</sup>
who spend the night prostrating themselves before their Lord and standing;<sup foot_note="179679">1</sup>
who entreat: "Our Lord! Ward off from us the chastisement of Hell, for its chastisement is one that clings.
Verily it is a wretched abode and restingplace."<sup foot_note="179680">1</sup>
(The true servants of the Merciful One are) those who are neither extravagant nor niggardly in their spending but keep the golden mean between the two;<sup foot_note="179681">1</sup>

who invoke no other deity along with Allah, nor take any life - which Allah has forbidden - save justly; who do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse<sup foot_note="179682">1</sup> - and whoso does that shall meet its penalty;
his torment shall be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection,<sup foot_note="179683">1</sup> and he will abide in it in ignominy -
unless he repents and believes and does righteous works. For such, Allah will change their evil deeds into good deeds.<sup foot_note="179684">1</sup> Allah is Ever Forgiving, Most Compassionate.
Whosoever repents<sup foot_note="179685">1</sup> and does good, he returns to Allah in the manner that he should.<sup foot_note="179686">2</sup>
