(The true servants of the Merciful One) are those who do not bear witness to any falsehood<sup foot_note="179687">1</sup> and who, when they pass by frivolity, pass by it with dignity;<sup foot_note="179688">2</sup>
who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord,<sup foot_note="179689">1</sup> do not fall at them deaf and blind;

who are prone to pray: "Our Lord! Grant us that our spouses and our offspring be a joy to our eyes,<sup foot_note="179690">1</sup> and do make us the leaders of the God-fearing."<sup foot_note="179691">2</sup>

They are the ones who will be rewarded for their patience: lofty palaces<sup foot_note="179692">1</sup> <sup foot_note="179693">2</sup> will be granted to them, and they will be received with greeting and salutation.
Therein they shall abide for ever: how good an abode, and how good a resting-place!

Say to them (O Muhammad): "My Lord would not care for you were it not for your prayer<sup foot_note="179694">1</sup>. But now that you have given the lie to (the Message of Allah), an inextricable punishment shall soon come upon you."
Ta'. Sin. Mim.
These are the verses of the Clear Book.<sup foot_note="179695">1</sup>
(O Muhammad), you will perhaps grieve yourself to death because these people do not believe.<sup foot_note="179696">1</sup>
If We will, We can send down a Sign to them from heaven, so their necks will be humbled to it.<sup foot_note="179697">1</sup>
Never does there come to them an admonition from the Merciful Lord but they turn away from it.
They will soon come to know the truth of that which they have been scoffing at.<sup foot_note="179698">1</sup>
Do they not look at the earth, how We caused a variety of fine vegetation to grow from it (in abundance)?
Surely there is a Sign in this,<sup foot_note="179699">1</sup> but most of them would not believe.<sup foot_note="179700">2</sup>
Verily Your Lord is Infinitely Mighty, Most Compassionate.
(Recount to them about the time) when Your Lord called Moses:<sup foot_note="179701">1</sup> "Go to the wrong-doing people,<sup foot_note="179702">2</sup>
the people of Pharaoh: do they have no fear?"<sup foot_note="177762">1</sup>
He said: "My Lord! I fear that they will brand me a liar.
My breast is constricted and my tongue is not fluent, so endow Messengership on Aaron.<sup foot_note="179703">1</sup>
As for me, they hold the charge of a crime against me. I fear they will put me to death."<sup foot_note="179704">1</sup>
He said: "Certainly not! So go both of you with Our Signs.<sup foot_note="179705">1</sup> We shall be with you listening to everything.
Go, then, to Pharaoh and say to him: 'The Lord of the Universe has sent us
that you let the Children of Israel go with us.'"<sup foot_note="179706">1</sup>
Pharaoh said: "Did we not bring you up among us when you were a child?<sup foot_note="179707">1</sup>
You spent many years of your life among us and then you committed that deed of yours.<sup foot_note="179708">1</sup> You are very ungrateful indeed."
Moses replied: "I committed that act erringly.<sup foot_note="179709">1</sup>
Then I fled for fear of you. Then my Lord bestowed wisdom and authority on me<sup foot_note="179710">1</sup> and made me one of the Messengers.
Now this is the favour that you tauntingly remind me of: that you enslaved the Children of Israel!"<sup foot_note="179711">1</sup>
Pharaoh said:<sup foot_note="179712">1</sup> "And who is this Lord of the Universe?"<sup foot_note="179713">2</sup>
Moses answered: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them, if you were only to believe."<sup foot_note="179714">1</sup>
Pharaoh said to those around him: "Do you hear (what he says)?"
Moses said: "(He is) Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of yore."<sup foot_note="179715">1</sup>
Pharaoh said to the audience: "This Messenger of yours who has been sent to you is simply mad."
Moses continued: "(He is) the Lord of the east and the west, and all between them. If you only had any understanding!"<sup foot_note="179716">1</sup>
Pharaoh said: "If you take any god other than me, I will certainly make you one of those (who are rotting) in prison."<sup foot_note="179717">1</sup>
Moses said: "Even if I were to bring a Clear Sign to you?"<sup foot_note="179718">1</sup>
Pharaoh said: "Then bring it if you are truthful at all."<sup foot_note="179719">1</sup>
(No sooner had he said this than) Moses threw down his rod and behold, it was a veritable serpent,<sup foot_note="179720">1</sup>
and he drew his hand (out of his armpit) and lo! it had become a shining object to the beholders.<sup foot_note="179721">1</sup>
Pharaoh said to the nobles around him: "Surely this man is a skilled magician
who wants to drive you out of your land by his magic.<sup foot_note="179722">1</sup> Tell us, what do you advise us?"<sup foot_note="179723">2</sup>
They said: "Detain him and his brother for a while and send forth heralds to the cities
to mobilise all skilled magicians."
So the magicians were brought together on a particular day at a set time<sup foot_note="179724">1</sup>
and the people were told: "Will you join the assembly?<sup foot_note="179725">1</sup>
We may perhaps follow the religion of the magicians if they triumph."<sup foot_note="179726">1</sup>
When the magicians came forth (for the encounter) they said to Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we triumph?"<sup foot_note="179727">1</sup>
He said: "Yes, you will then become those near-stationed to me."<sup foot_note="179728">1</sup>
Moses said to them: "Throw down whatever you wish to throw."
Thereupon they threw down their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall prevail."<sup foot_note="179729">1</sup>
Thereafter, Moses threw down his rod and behold, it went about swallowing up all the false devices they had contrived.
Thereupon the magicians fell down in prostration,
saying: "We (now) believe in the Lord of the Universe,
the Lord of Moses and Aaron."<sup foot_note="179730">1</sup>

Pharaoh said: "You accepted the word of Moses even before I granted you the leave to do so. Surely he is your chief who has taught you magic.<sup foot_note="179731">1</sup> Soon shall you come to know. I shall cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and shall crucify all of you."<sup foot_note="179732">2</sup>
They said: "We do not care, for we are bound to return to our Lord,
and we surely expect that Our Lord will forgive us our sins for we are the first ones to believe."<sup foot_note="179733">1</sup>
We revealed to Moses:<sup foot_note="179734">1</sup> "Set forth with My servants by night for you will be pursued."<sup foot_note="179735">2</sup>
Then Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities (to mobilise troops)
saying: "These (Israelites) are only a small band of people
who have certainly provoked our wrath.
But we are a numerous host, ever on guard."<sup foot_note="179736">1</sup>
Thus did We drive them out of their gardens and springs
and their treasures and excellent dwellings.<sup foot_note="179737">1</sup>
This happened with them; (but on the other hand), We enabled the Children of Israel to inherit those bounties.<sup foot_note="179738">1</sup>
At sunrise they set off in pursuit of them
and when the groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out: "We are overtaken!"
Moses said: "Certainly not. My Lord is with me; He will direct me."<sup foot_note="179739">1</sup>
Then We revealed to Moses, (commanding him): "Strike the sea with your rod." Thereupon the sea split up, and then each became like the mass of a huge mount.<sup foot_note="179740">1</sup>
We also brought the other party close to the same spot,
and We delivered Moses and his companions, all of them,
then We drowned the others.<sup foot_note="179741">1</sup>
Surely there is a Sign in this,<sup foot_note="179742">1</sup> but most of them would not believe.
Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.
And recount to them the story of Abraham:<sup foot_note="179743">1</sup>
when he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"<sup foot_note="179744">1</sup>
They answered: "There are some idols that we worship and are devoted to them with constancy."<sup foot_note="179745">1</sup>
He asked: "Do they hear you when you call them
or do they cause you any benefit or harm?"
They answered: "No; but we found our forefathers doing so."<sup foot_note="179746">1</sup>
Thereupon, Abraham said: "Have you seen (with your eyes) those whom you have been worshipping,
you and your forefathers of yore?<sup foot_note="179747">1</sup>
They are all enemies to me;<sup foot_note="179748">1</sup> all, except the Lord of the Universe<sup foot_note="179749">2</sup>
Who created me<sup foot_note="179750">1</sup> and Who guides me;
Who gives me food and drink,
and Who, when I am ill, heals me;<sup foot_note="179200">1</sup>
Who will cause me to die and then will again restore me to life;
Who, I hope, will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgement."<sup foot_note="179751">1</sup>
(And then Abraham prayed): "My Lord, endow me with knowledge and wisdom<sup foot_note="179752">1</sup> and join me with the righteous,<sup foot_note="179753">2</sup>
and grant me an honourable reputation among posterity,<sup foot_note="179754">1</sup>
and make me of those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss,
and forgive my father for he is among those who strayed,<sup foot_note="179755">1</sup>
and disgrace me not on the Day when people will be raised to life,<sup foot_note="179756">1</sup>
the Day when nothing will avail, neither wealth nor offspring,
but only he that brings to Allah a sound heart will (attain to success)."<sup foot_note="179757">1</sup>
(On that Day)<sup foot_note="179758">1</sup>the Garden will be brought near to the God-fearing,
and the Fire will be uncovered for those who strayed,<sup foot_note="179759">1</sup>
and they will be asked: "Where are the gods that you worshipped
beside Allah? Can they be of any help to you, or even be of any help to themselves?"
Then the idols and those who strayed will be hurled into the Fire headlong, one upon another,<sup foot_note="179760">1</sup>
and so too the hosts of Iblis, all of them.
There they will quarrel with one another and the erring ones will say (to their deities):
"By Allah, we were surely in clear error
when we assigned to you a position equal to that of the Lord of the Universe.
It is none but those steeped in guilt who led us into this error,<sup foot_note="179761">1</sup>
and now we have none to intercede on our behalf,<sup foot_note="179762">1</sup>
nor do we have a truly sincere friend.<sup foot_note="179763">1</sup>
If only we could return we would be among the believers."<sup foot_note="179764">1</sup>
Surely there is a Sign in this,<sup foot_note="179765">1</sup> but most of them would not believe.
Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.
The people of Noah<sup foot_note="179766">1</sup> gave the lie to the Messengers.<sup foot_note="179767">2</sup>
Recall when their brother Noah said to them: "Do you have no fear?<sup foot_note="179768">1</sup>
I am a trustworthy Messenger to you;<sup foot_note="179769">1</sup>
so fear Allah and obey me.<sup foot_note="179770">1</sup>
I seek of you no reward for this: my reward is with none except the Lord of the Universe.<sup foot_note="179771">1</sup>
So fear Allah and obey me."<sup foot_note="179772">1</sup>
They answered: "Shall we accept you even though it is the meanest of people who follow you?"<sup foot_note="179773">1</sup>
Noah said: "What knowledge do I have about their deeds?
It is only for my Lord to take account of them. Would that you made use of your understanding!<sup foot_note="179774">1</sup>
It is not for me to repel those who choose to believe.
I am none but a plain warner."<sup foot_note="179775">1</sup>
They said: "O Noah! If you do not desist, you will certainly become one of the accursed."<sup foot_note="179776">1</sup>
He said: "My Lord! My people have branded me a liar.<sup foot_note="179777">1</sup>
So pass a clear judgement between me and them and rescue me and the believers with me."<sup foot_note="179778">1</sup>
Thereafter We rescued him and those who were with him in the laden Ark<sup foot_note="179779">1</sup>
and drowned the rest.
Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.
Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.
The Ad gave the lie to the Messengers.<sup foot_note="179780">1</sup>
Recall, when their brother Hud said to them:<sup foot_note="179781">1</sup> "Have you no fear?
I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I seek of you no reward for this; my reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.
What, you build a monument on every hill merely for fun<sup foot_note="179782">1</sup>
and erect huge palaces as though you will live for ever,<sup foot_note="179783">1</sup>
and when you strike you strike like tyrants?<sup foot_note="179784">1</sup>
So fear Allah and obey me.
Have fear of Him Who has provided you with all the (good) things you know;
Who has provided you with flocks and children
and with gardens and springs.
I fear for you the chastisement of an Awesome Day."
They replied: "It is all the same for us whether you admonish us or not.
This has been happening all along.<sup foot_note="179785">1</sup>
We will not be subjected to any chastisement."
Eventually they gave the lie to him and We destroyed them.<sup foot_note="179786">1</sup> Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.
Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.
The Thamud gave the lie to the Messengers.<sup foot_note="179787">1</sup>
Recall when their brother Salih said to them: "Have you no fear?"
"I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.<sup foot_note="179788">1</sup>
So fear Allah and obey me.
I ask of you no reward. My reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.
Do you believe that you will be left here to live securely in the present state<sup foot_note="179789">1</sup>
amidst gardens and springs
and cornfields and date-palms laden with juicy fruits?<sup foot_note="179790">1</sup>
You hew dwellings in mountains and exult in that.<sup foot_note="179791">1</sup>
Fear Allah and obey me
and do not follow the biddings of those that go to excesses
and spread mischief in the land rather than set things right."<sup foot_note="179792">1</sup>
They replied: "You are nothing but one of those who are bewitched;<sup foot_note="179793">1</sup>
you are no different from a mortal like us. So produce a sign if you are truthful."<sup foot_note="179794">1</sup>
Salih said: "This is a she-camel.<sup foot_note="179795">1</sup> There is a day set for her to drink and there is a day set for you to drink.<sup foot_note="179796">2</sup>
Do not molest her lest the chastisement of an Awesome Day should seize you."
But they hamstrung her<sup foot_note="179797">1</sup> and then regretted it.
So the chastisement seized them.<sup foot_note="179798">1</sup> Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.
Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.
The people of Lot rejected the Messengers,<sup foot_note="179799">1</sup> branding them liars.
Recall, when their brother Lot said to them: "Have you no fear?
I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I seek of you no reward. My reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.
What, of all creation will you go to (fornicate with) the males,<sup foot_note="179800">1</sup>
leaving aside those whom Allah has created for you as your mates.<sup foot_note="179801">1</sup> Nay, you are a people that has transgressed all limits."<sup foot_note="179802">2</sup>
They said: "O Lot! If you do not desist, you will be one of those expelled (from our towns)."<sup foot_note="179803">1</sup>
He said: "I am one of those who abhor your practice.
My Lord, deliver me and my family from their wicked deeds."<sup foot_note="179804">1</sup>
Then We delivered him and all his family
except an old woman who was among those that stayed behind.<sup foot_note="179805">1</sup>
Thereafter, We utterly destroyed the rest,
and We sent upon them a rain, an evil rain that fell on those who had been warned.<sup foot_note="179806">1</sup>
Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.
Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.
The people of Aykah also gave the lie to the Messengers.<sup foot_note="179807">1</sup>
Recall, when Shuayb said to them: "Have you no fear?
I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I ask of you no reward for this. My reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.
Fill up the measure and do not diminish the goods of people,
weigh with an even balance
and do not deliver short, and do not go about creating mischief in the land,
and have fear of Him Who created you and the earlier generations."
They said: "You are no more than one of those who have been bewitched,
you are only a mortal like us. Indeed we believe that you are an utter liar.
So cause a piece of the sky to fall upon us if you are truthful."
Shuayb said: "My Lord knows well all what you do."<sup foot_note="179808">1</sup>
Then they branded him a liar, whereupon the chastisement of the Day of Canopy overtook them.<sup foot_note="179809">1</sup> It was the chastisement of a very awesome day.
Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.
Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.
Indeed this<sup foot_note="179810">1</sup> is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe;<sup foot_note="179811">2</sup>
which the truthful spirit<sup foot_note="179812">1</sup> has carried down
to your heart that you might become one of those who warn (others on behalf of Allah),
(a revelation) in clear Arabic language,<sup foot_note="179813">1</sup>
(a revelation embodied) in the scriptures of the ancients.<sup foot_note="179814">1</sup>
Is it not a Sign to them � (to wit, the Makkans) � that the learned men of the Children of Israel know that?<sup foot_note="179815">1</sup>
(But such is their adamance) that had We revealed it to one of the non-Arabs and even if he had recited(this clear Arabic discourse) to them
they would still not have believed in it.<sup foot_note="179816">1</sup>
Thus have We caused this (Admonition) to penetrate the hearts of the culprits (like a hot rod).<sup foot_note="179817">1</sup>
They will not believe in it until they clearly see the grievous chastisement.<sup foot_note="179818">1</sup>
But when it comes upon them suddenly, taking them unawares,
they say: "Can we be granted some respite?"<sup foot_note="179819">1</sup>
Do they really want Our chastisement to be expedited?
Did you consider that if We were to let them enjoy life for many years
and then the chastisement of which they were being warned were to come upon them,
of what avail will be the provisions of life which they have been granted to enjoy?<sup foot_note="179820">1</sup>
We never destroyed any habitation but that it had warners
to admonish them. We have never been unjust.<sup foot_note="179821">1</sup>
The satans<sup foot_note="179822">1</sup> did not bring down this (Clear Book),
nor does it behove them,<sup foot_note="179823">1</sup> nor does it lie in their power.<sup foot_note="179824">2</sup>
Indeed they are debarred from even hearing it.<sup foot_note="179825">1</sup>
So do not call any other god beside Allah lest you become of those who will be punished,<sup foot_note="179826">1</sup>
and warn your nearest kinsmen;<sup foot_note="179827">1</sup>
and be meek to the believers who follow you.
Then if they disobey you say to them: "I am quit of what you do."<sup foot_note="179828">1</sup>
And put your trust in Him Who is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate,<sup foot_note="179829">1</sup>
Who observes you when you rise (to pray)<sup foot_note="179830">1</sup>
and observes your movements among those who prostrate themselves.<sup foot_note="179831">1</sup>
He is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
O people, shall I tell you on whom it is that satans descend?
They descend on every forgerer steeped in sin,<sup foot_note="179832">1</sup>
on those who whisper hearsay in the ears of people; and most of them are liars.<sup foot_note="179833">1</sup>
As for poets, only the wayward follow them.<sup foot_note="179834">1</sup>
Do you not see that they wander about in every valley<sup foot_note="179835">1</sup>
and say things which they do not act upon,<sup foot_note="179836">1</sup>

except those who believed and acted righteously and remembered Allah much, and when they themselves were subjected to wrong, they exacted retribution no more than to the extent of the wrong?<sup foot_note="179837">1</sup> Soon will the wrong-doers know the end that they shall reach.
Ta'. Sin. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a Clear Book;<sup foot_note="179838">1</sup>
a guidance and good tidings<sup foot_note="179839">1</sup> for the believers
who establish Prayer and give Zakah,<sup foot_note="179840">1</sup> and have firm faith in the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="179841">2</sup>
As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds seem attractive to them so they stumble around in perplexity.<sup foot_note="179842">1</sup>
It is they for whom a grievous chastisement lies in store;<sup foot_note="179843">1</sup> it is they who shall be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.
As for you, (O Muhammad), you are receiving the Qur'an from the Most Wise, the All-Knowing.<sup foot_note="179844">1</sup>

(Recount to them) when Moses said to his family:<sup foot_note="179845">1</sup> "I perceive something like fire: soon will I bring to you some information from there, or I will bring you a burning brand that you may warm yourselves."<sup foot_note="179846">2</sup>

But when Moses came to the fire, a call was sounded:<sup foot_note="179847">1</sup> "Blessed is He Who is in the fire and whatever is around it. Glory be to Allah, the Sustainer of all in the Universe.<sup foot_note="179848">2</sup>
O Moses, verily this is Me, Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise!

Now cast your rod!" But when he saw the rod writhing as though it were a serpent,<sup foot_note="179849">1</sup> he turned his back in retreat and did not even look behind. "O Moses, have no fear. Messengers have no fear in My presence,<sup foot_note="179850">2</sup>
except he who has committed some wrong.<sup foot_note="179851">1</sup> But if he substitutes good in place of evil, I am Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="179852">2</sup>

Now put your hand into your bosom, and it will come forth shining without any blemish. (These are two of the) nine Signs<sup foot_note="179853">1</sup> to be carried to Pharaoh and his people. They are surely a wicked people."
But when Our Clear Signs came to them, they said: "This is plain magic."
They denied those Signs out of iniquity and arrogance although their hearts were convinced<sup foot_note="179854">1</sup> of their truth. So see how evil was the end of those mischief-makers!

(On the other hand), We granted knowledge to David and Solomon<sup foot_note="179855">1</sup> and they said: "All praise be to Allah Who has exalted us above many of His believing servants!"<sup foot_note="179856">2</sup>

And Solomon succeeded David<sup foot_note="179857">1</sup> and said: "O people, we have been taught the speech of birds<sup foot_note="179858">2</sup> and we have been endowed with all kinds of things.<sup foot_note="179859">3</sup> Surely this is a conspicuous favour (from Allah)."
Hosts of jinn and humans and birds<sup foot_note="179860">1</sup> were marshalled for Solomon and were kept under full control.

(Solomon was once on the move with them) until when they reached a valley of ants one of the ants said: "O ants, get into your holes, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you (under their feet) without even knowing."<sup foot_note="179861">1</sup>

Smiling at the ant's utterance, Solomon burst into laughter and said: "My Lord! Hold me under (Your) control<sup foot_note="179862">1</sup> that I may render thanks for the favour which You have bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may act righteously in a manner that would please You. Include me, out of Your Mercy, among Your righteous servants."<sup foot_note="179863">2</sup>
(On another occasion) Solomon inspected the birds<sup foot_note="179864">1</sup> and said: "Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe? Is he among the absentees?
I will inflict a severe punishment on him or maybe even slaughter him unless he comes forth with a convincing reason (for his absence)."<sup foot_note="179865">1</sup>
Not before long the hoopoe came up and said: "I have obtained a knowledge which you could not. I have brought for you sure news about Sheba.<sup foot_note="179866">1</sup>
I found there a woman ruling over them, one who has been endowed with all things and has a mighty throne.

I found that she and her people prostrate themselves before the sun rather than Allah.<sup foot_note="179867">1</sup>" Satan<sup foot_note="179868">2</sup> has made their deeds appear attractive to them<sup foot_note="179869">3</sup> and has, thus, debarred them from the Right Path so they do not find true guidance

that they would prostrate themselves before Allah Who brings to light all that is hidden in the heavens and the earth<sup foot_note="179870">1</sup> and knows all that you conceal and all that you reveal.<sup foot_note="179871">2</sup>
Allah - none is worthy of worship save He; He is the Lord of the Mighty Throne.<sup foot_note="179872">1</sup>
Solomon said: "Soon shall we see whether you have spoken the truth or are one of those that lie.
Take this letter of mine, deliver it to them, and then draw back from them, and observe what they do."<sup foot_note="179873">1</sup>
The Queen said:" Know my nobles that a gracious letter has been delivered to me.
It is from Solomon, and it is: "In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate."
(It says): "Do not act towards me with defiance, but come to me in submission."<sup foot_note="179874">1</sup>
(After reading the letter) the Queen said: "Nobles, let me have your counsel in this matter for I make no firm decision without you."<sup foot_note="179875">1</sup>
They said: "We are strong and are given to vehement fighting. But the decision is yours. Therefore, consider what you would like to command."

The Queen said: "When the kings enter a country they cause corruption in it and abase those of its people who are held in honour.<sup foot_note="179876">1</sup> This is what they are wont to do.<sup foot_note="179877">2</sup>
I will send them a gift and then see with what answer my envoys return."

Now, when (the envoy of the Queen) came to Solomon, he said: "Do you want to aid me with wealth? Whatever Allah has granted me is much more than what He has given you.<sup foot_note="179878">1</sup> (Keep for yourselves) your gift in which you are exulting.

Envoy, go back to those who sent you and we shall certainly come upon them with hosts<sup foot_note="179879">1</sup> whom they will be unable to resist. We shall drive them out from there, and they will suffer humiliation and disgrace."
Solomon said:<sup foot_note="179880">1</sup> "My nobles, which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"<sup foot_note="179881">2</sup>

A stalwart of the jinn said: "I will bring it to you before you rise from your council.<sup foot_note="179882">1</sup> Surely I have the power to do so and I am trustworthy."<sup foot_note="179883">2</sup>

And he who had some knowledge of the Book said: "I will bring it before the twinkling of your eye."<sup foot_note="179884">1</sup> When Solomon saw the throne placed firmly beside him, he cried out: "This is by the grace of my Lord so that He may test me whether I give thanks for (His Bounty) or act with ingratitude.<sup foot_note="179885">2</sup> Whoever is grateful is so to his own good; and whoever is ungrateful, let him know that my Lord is Immensely Resourceful, Most Bountiful."<sup foot_note="179886">3</sup>

Solomon said:<sup foot_note="179887">1</sup>" Set the throne before her casually, and let us see whether she gets to the Truth or is one of those who are not guided to what is right."<sup foot_note="179888">2</sup>

When the Queen arrived, she was asked: "Is your throne like this one?" She said: "It seems as if it is the same.<sup foot_note="179889">1</sup> We had already come to know this and we had submitted ourselves."<sup foot_note="179890">2</sup>
What prevented her (from accepting the True Faith) was her worshipping deities other than Allah, for she belonged to an unbelieving people.<sup foot_note="179891">1</sup>

She was told: "Enter the palace." But when she saw it, she thought it was a pool of water and she bared both her calves (to enter into it). Solomon said: "This is a slippery floor of crystal."<sup foot_note="179892">1</sup> Thereupon she cried out: "My Lord, I have been inflicting much wrong on myself. Now I submit myself with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe."<sup foot_note="179893">2</sup>

And<sup foot_note="179894">1</sup> We sent to Thamud their brother Salih (with the Message): "Serve Allah," but all of a sudden they became split into two quarrelling factions.<sup foot_note="179895">2</sup>

Salih said: "My people, why do you wish to hasten that evil rather than good<sup foot_note="179896">1</sup> should come upon you? Why should you not seek pardon from Allah so that mercy be shown to you?"

They said: "We augur ill of you and those who are with you."<sup foot_note="179898">1</sup> Salih replied: "Your augury is with Allah. The truth is that you are a people who are being tried."<sup foot_note="179899">2</sup>
Now there were nine ring-leaders<sup foot_note="179900">1</sup> in the city who created corruption in the land and never worked to set things right.

They said: "Swear to one another in the name of Allah that we shall make a sudden night swoop on Salih and his family and will then tell their heirs<sup foot_note="179901">1</sup> that we did not witness the destruction of his family. We are indeed truthful."<sup foot_note="179902">2</sup>
Thus they planned and We too planned, the while they did not know.<sup foot_note="179903">1</sup>
So see what was the outcome of the plan they made: We utterly destroyed them and their people, all of them.
Now behold their houses that lie in utter ruins because of their wrong-doing. Verily there is a Sign in this for the people who know.<sup foot_note="179904">1</sup>
And We delivered those who believed and were wont to avoid disobeying (Allah).
We also sent Lot,<sup foot_note="179905">1</sup> and recall when he told his people: "Do you commit shameless acts with your eyes open?<sup foot_note="179906">2</sup>
Do you lustfully approach men instead of women? Nay, you engage in acts of sheer ignorance."<sup foot_note="179907">1</sup>
But this had only one answer from his people. They said: "Expel Lot's folk from your city. They pretend to be absolutely clean."
Eventually We saved (Lot) and his family, except his wife. We had decreed that she should be among those who would remain behind.<sup foot_note="179908">1</sup>
And We rained down upon them a rain. It was an evil rain for those who had already been warned.

Say, (O Muhammad):<sup foot_note="179909">1</sup> "All praise be to Allah, and peace be on those of His servants whom He has chosen." (Ask them): "Who is better: Allah or the false gods that they associate with Him as His partners?<sup foot_note="179910">2</sup>

Who is it that has created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you water from the sky and then We caused to grow therewith orchards full of beauty whose trees you could never grow. Is there any god associated with Allah (in these tasks)?"<sup foot_note="179911">1</sup> Nay, they are a people who are veering away from the Right Path.

Who is it Who has made the earth a place of resort,<sup foot_note="179912">1</sup> and has caused rivers to flow in its midst, and has placed upon it firm mountains, and has placed a barrier between two masses of water?<sup foot_note="179913">2</sup> Is there any god associated with Allah (in these tasks)? Nay; but most of them do not know.

Who is it Who heeds the prayers of the distressed when he calls out to Him and Who removes his affliction?<sup foot_note="179914">1</sup> And who is it Who makes you vicegerents of the earth?<sup foot_note="179915">2</sup> Is there any god associated with Allah (in this task)? How little do you reflect!

Who is it Who guides you through the darkness on land and sea?<sup foot_note="179916">1</sup> And Who sends winds as heralds of good tidings ahead of His Mercy?<sup foot_note="179917">2</sup> Is there any god associated with Allah (in this task)? Exalted be Allah above whatever they associate with Him in His Divinity!

Who is it Who creates in the first instance and then repeats it?<sup foot_note="179918">1</sup> Who is it Who provides you with sustenance from the heavens and the earth?<sup foot_note="179919">2</sup> Is there any god associated with Allah (in these tasks)? Say: "Bring forth your evidence, if you are truthful."<sup foot_note="179920">3</sup>
Say: "None in the heavens or on the earth<sup foot_note="179921">1</sup> has knowledge of the Unseen save Allah. They do not know when they will be raised to life."<sup foot_note="179922">2</sup>
Nay, but they have lost their knowledge of the Hereafter. They are steeped in doubt and uncertainty about it: rather they are blind to it.<sup foot_note="179923">1</sup>
The unbelievers say: "When we become dust, we and our forefathers, shall we really be brought out (from our graves)?
We were told about this and so were our forefathers before us. But these are no more than fairy tales that have been recounted from ancient times."
Say: "Go about through the earth and see what has been the end of the evil-doers."<sup foot_note="179924">1</sup>
(O Prophet), do not grieve over them, nor be distressed at their designs.<sup foot_note="179925">1</sup>
They also say: "Tell us when this threat will come to pass, if you are truthful."<sup foot_note="179926">1</sup>
Say: "The chastisement whose hastening you have been asking for, maybe a part of it has drawn quite near to you."<sup foot_note="179927">1</sup>
Indeed Your Lord is exceedingly bountiful to mankind. Yet most of them do not give thanks.<sup foot_note="179928">1</sup>
Verily your Lord knows all that their hearts conceal as well as all that they reveal.<sup foot_note="179929">1</sup>
There is nothing that is hidden - be it in the heaven or the earth - but is recorded in a Clear Book.<sup foot_note="179930">1</sup>
Surely this Qur'an explains to the Children of Israel most of the matters concerning which they have disagreements<sup foot_note="179931">1</sup>
and it is a guidance and mercy for the believers.<sup foot_note="179932">1</sup>
Indeed your Lord will decide between them<sup foot_note="179933">1</sup> by His judgement. He is All-Mighty, All-Knowing.
So<sup foot_note="179934">1</sup> put your trust in Allah for you are on the manifest truth.
Surely you cannot make the dead hear you,<sup foot_note="179935">1</sup> nor can you make the deaf hear your call if they turn back in flight,<sup foot_note="179936">2</sup>

nor can you direct the blind to the Right Way,<sup foot_note="179937">1</sup> preventing them from falling into error. You can make only those who believe in Our verses to hear the call and then submit.

And when the time for the fulfilment of Our Word against them will come,<sup foot_note="179938">1</sup> We shall bring forth for them a beast from the earth who will speak to them because people did not believe in Our Signs.<sup foot_note="179939">2</sup>
Just imagine the Day when We shall muster from every nation a large group of those who gave the lie to Our Signs, and they shall be duly arranged in ranks

until, when all of them have arrived, Allah will say: "Did you give the lie to My Signs even without encompassing them with your knowledge?<sup foot_note="179940">1</sup> If that is not so, what did you do?"<sup foot_note="179941">2</sup>
And the Word will come to pass against them because of their wrong-doing: they will then be able to utter nothing.

Did they not perceive that We had made the night so that they may repose in it and made the day clear and shining.<sup foot_note="179942">1</sup> Surely there are Signs in this for those who believe.<sup foot_note="179943">2</sup>

The Day when the Trumpet will be blown all those who are in the heavens and on the earth shall be terror stricken<sup foot_note="179944">1</sup> - all except those whom Allah wills - and everyone shall come to Him utterly abject.

You now see the mountains and consider them firmly fixed, but then they shall pass away even as clouds pass away. That will be the handiwork of Allah Who has created everything with perfect wisdom. He is well aware of what you do.<sup foot_note="179945">1</sup>
Whosoever comes with good will receive a reward better than his deed,<sup foot_note="179946">1</sup> and they will be made secure from the terror of that Day.
And whosoever comes with evil, they will be flung upon their faces into the Fire. Will you be recompensed for aught other than what you do?<sup foot_note="179947">1</sup>

(Tell them, O Muhammad): "I have been commanded only to serve the Lord of this city that He has made inviolable, to serve Him to Whom all things belong.<sup foot_note="179948">1</sup> I have been commanded to be of those that submit to Allah,
and to recite the Qur'an." So, whosoever is guided, his guidance will be to his own good. As for those who stray, tell them: "I am none but a warner."
And say: "All praise be to Allah, Who will soon show you His Signs that you will recognize." Your Lord is not unaware of what you do.
Ta'. Sin. Mim
These are the verses of the Clear Book.
We recount to you with truth some parts of the story of Moses and Pharaoh<sup foot_note="179949">1</sup> for the benefit of those who believe.<sup foot_note="179950">2</sup>

Indeed Pharaoh transgressed in the land<sup foot_note="179952">1</sup> and divided its people into sections.<sup foot_note="179953">2</sup> One group of them he humiliated, and slew their sons and spared their daughters.<sup foot_note="179954">3</sup> Truly he was among the mischief-makers.
We wanted to bestow favour on those who were oppressed in the land. We wanted to make them leaders and heirs<sup foot_note="179955">1</sup>
and to grant them power in the land,<sup foot_note="179956">1</sup> and make Pharaoh and Haman<sup foot_note="179957">2</sup> and their hosts see what they had feared.

We<sup foot_note="179958">1</sup> suggested to the mother of Moses: "Suckle your child, but when you fear for his life cast him into the river and be not fearful nor grieve, for We shall restore him to you and make him one of the Messengers."<sup foot_note="179959">2</sup>

Then Pharaoh's household picked him up (from the river) that he may be their adversary and be a cause of sorrow to them.<sup foot_note="179960">1</sup> Surely Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts erred (in their scheming).

The wife of Pharaoh said: "Here is a delight of the eye to me and to you. Do not kill him. Maybe he will prove useful for us, or we may adopt him as a son."<sup foot_note="179961">1</sup> They were unaware of the end of it all.
On the other hand, the heart of Moses' mother was sorely distressed. Had We not strengthened her heart that she might have full faith (in Our promise), she would have disclosed the secret.
She told the sister of Moses: "Follow him." So she kept watch over him unperceived (by the enemies).<sup foot_note="179962">1</sup>

And We had already forbidden the breasts of the nurses for the child.<sup foot_note="179963">1</sup> (So seeing the girl) said: "Shall I direct you to the people of a household that will rear him with utter sincerity?"<sup foot_note="179964">2</sup>

Thus did We restore Moses<sup foot_note="179965">1</sup> to his mother that her eyes might be comforted and she might not grieve, and realise that the promise of Allah was true.<sup foot_note="179966">2</sup> But most people are unaware of this.

When Moses reached the age of full youth and grew to maturity,<sup foot_note="179967">1</sup> We bestowed upon him wisdom and knowledge.<sup foot_note="179968">2</sup> Thus do We reward those who do good.

Once he entered the city at a time when its people were heedless,<sup foot_note="179969">1</sup> and he encountered two men fighting, one of whom belonged to his own people and the other to his foes. Now the man belonging to Moses' own people cried out to him for help against the man from the foes, and Moses struck him with his fist<sup foot_note="179970">2</sup> and finished him. Moses said: "This is an act of Satan. Surely he is an enemy who openly misleads."<sup foot_note="179971">3</sup>

Then he prayed:<sup foot_note="179972">1</sup> "My Lord! I have indeed inflicted wrong on myself, so do forgive me," wherefore Allah forgave him for He is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.<sup foot_note="179973">2</sup>
Thereupon Moses vowed: "My Lord, because of the favour that You have done me I shall never support the guilty."<sup foot_note="179974">1</sup>

The next morning he proceeded to the city in fear and looking around as one apprehensive of danger when all of a sudden, the man who had sought his help the day before again called out to him for his help. Moses said to him: "Clearly, you are a very misguided fellow."<sup foot_note="179975">1</sup>

And when Moses decided to lay his violent hands on the man belonging to the enemy,<sup foot_note="179976">1</sup> he cried out:<sup foot_note="179977">2</sup> "Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed a person yesterday?" You simply want to live in the land as a tyrant, and do not wish to set things right."

Then a man came running from the farther end of the city<sup foot_note="179978">1</sup> and said: "O Moses, the nobles are deliberating about you that they may put you to death. So do be gone. I am one of your well-wishers."
Soon after hearing this Moses departed in a state of fear, looking around as one in apprehension and prayed: "My Lord, deliver me from these unjust people."
When (after his departure from Egypt) Moses headed towards Midian,<sup foot_note="179979">1</sup> he said: "I hope my Lord will show me the right Path."<sup foot_note="179980">2</sup>

When he arrived at the spring of Midian,<sup foot_note="179981">1</sup> he found there a crowd of people watering their flocks, and he found apart from them two women holding their flocks back. He asked the women: "What is it that troubles you?" They said: "We cannot water our flocks until the shepherds take their flocks away, and our father is a very old man."<sup foot_note="179982">2</sup>
On hearing this Moses watered their flocks for them, and then returned in a shaded place and said: "My Lord, I am truly in great need of any good that You might send down to me."

Soon thereafter one of the two women came to him, walking bashfully,<sup foot_note="179984">1</sup> and said: "My father invites you that he may reward you for your having watered our flocks for us.<sup foot_note="179985">2</sup>" When Moses came to him and narrated to him the whole of his story, he said: "Have no fear. You are now safe from the iniquitous people."
One of the two women said: "Father, employ this man in your service. The best whom you might employ is he who is strong and trustworthy."<sup foot_note="179986">1</sup>

Her father said to Moses:<sup foot_note="179987">1</sup> "I want to marry one of these two daughters of mine to you if you serve me for eight years. But if you complete ten years, that will be of your own accord (but not an obligation). I do not intend to treat you harshly. If Allah wills, you will find me an upright man."

Moses replied: "So that is agreed between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I fulfil, I trust that I shall not be wronged. Allah is a witness over the covenant we are committing ourselves to."<sup foot_note="179988">1</sup>

When Moses had fulfilled the term<sup foot_note="179989">1</sup> and was journeying with his family, he perceived a fire in the direction of the Mount (Sinai).<sup foot_note="179990">2</sup> He said to his family: "Wait here; I have observed a fire. Maybe I will bring to you some news or a brand of fire from there that you may warm yourselves."

But when he came to the fire, a cry was heard from the right bank<sup foot_note="179991">1</sup> of the valley, from a tree in the hallowed ground:<sup foot_note="179992">2</sup> "O Moses, verily I am Allah, the Lord of all creatures of the Universe."

He received the command: "Throw away your rod!" But when he saw the rod writhing as though it were a serpent, he turned back in retreat, and did not even look behind. (He was told): "O Moses, go ahead and have no fear. You are perfectly secure.

Put your hand into your bosom, and it will come out shining without any blemish;<sup foot_note="179993">1</sup> and draw your hand close to your body to still your fear.<sup foot_note="179994">2</sup> Those are the two clear Signs from your Lord for Pharaoh and his chiefs, for truly they are a disobedient people."<sup foot_note="179995">3</sup>
Moses said: "My Lord, I have killed one person from among them, and I fear that they will kill me.<sup foot_note="179996">1</sup>
My brother Aaron is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper to confirm my truthfulness for I fear that they will reject me as a liar."

He said: "We will certainly strengthen you through your brother and will invest both of you with such power that they shall not be able to hurt you. With the help of Our Signs the two of you and your followers will prevail."<sup foot_note="179997">1</sup>

But when Moses came to them with Our Clear Signs, they said: "This is nothing but a magic<sup foot_note="179998">1</sup> that has been contrived. We never heard anything like it from our ancestors of yore."<sup foot_note="179999">2</sup>

Moses replied: "My Lord knows best who comes with guidance from Him, and also whose end will be the best in the Hereafter. As for the wrongdoers, they shall not prosper."<sup foot_note="180000">1</sup>

Pharaoh said: "O nobles, I do not know that you have any god beside myself.<sup foot_note="180001">1</sup> Haman, bake bricks out of clay and build a lofty palace for me so that I may mount up and be able to observe the god of Moses, even though I believe that Moses is a liar."<sup foot_note="180002">2</sup>
And he and his hosts waxed arrogant in the land without any right,<sup foot_note="180003">1</sup> believing that they will never have to return to Us!<sup foot_note="180004">2</sup>
Eventually We seized him and his hosts and We flung them into the sea.<sup foot_note="180005">1</sup> So do see the end of the wrong-doers!
And We made them leaders who invite people to the Fire.<sup foot_note="180006">1</sup> On the Day of Judgement they shall not find help from any quarter.
We have made a curse to pursue them in this world, and on the Day of Judgement they shall be among the despised.<sup foot_note="180007">1</sup>
After We had destroyed the earlier generations We bestowed the Book on Moses - a source of enlightenment for people and a guidance and mercy - that they may take heed.<sup foot_note="180008">1</sup>
(O Muhammad), you were then not on the western side<sup foot_note="180009">1</sup> when We bestowed this commandment (of Law), and you were not among its witnesses.<sup foot_note="180010">2</sup>

Thereafter We raised up many a generation and a long time passed.<sup foot_note="180011">1</sup> You were then not even present among the people of Midian to rehearse Our verses to them.<sup foot_note="180012">2</sup> But it is We Who are sending news about that.

Nor were you on the side of the Mount (Sinai) when We called out to Moses (in the first instance). But it is out of Mercy from your Lord (that you are being informed of all this)<sup foot_note="180014">1</sup> so that you may warn a people to whom no warner came before you.<sup foot_note="180015">2</sup> Maybe they will take heed.

(We did so) lest a calamity might seize them because of the misdeeds they committed whereafter they would say: "Our Lord, why did you not send a Messenger to us that we follow Your revelation and become among those who believe?"<sup foot_note="180016">1</sup>

But when the Truth reached them from Us, they said: "Why was he not given that which was given to Moses?"<sup foot_note="180017">1</sup> But did they not reject before what had been given to Moses?<sup foot_note="180018">2</sup> They said: "Both are magic,<sup foot_note="180019">3</sup> each supporting the other!" And they said: "We deny each of these."
Tell them, (O Prophet): "Then do bring a Book from Allah which is a better guide than either of them, and I will follow it!<sup foot_note="180020">1</sup> Do so if you are truthful!"

But if they do not hearken to this, know well that they only follow their lusts and who is in greater error than he who follows his lusts without any guidance from Allah? Allah does not guide those given to wrong-doing.
We have constantly conveyed them the word (of admonition) that they may take heed.<sup foot_note="180021">1</sup>
Those on whom We bestowed the Book before do believe in this (to wit, the Qur'an).<sup foot_note="180022">1</sup>
When it is recited to them they say: "We believe in it for it is the Truth from our Lord. Indeed we were already Muslims."<sup foot_note="180023">1</sup>

These will be granted their reward twice<sup foot_note="180024">1</sup> over because they remained steadfast;<sup foot_note="180025">2</sup> they repel evil with good,<sup foot_note="180026">3</sup> and spend (in alms) out of the sustenance We provided them,<sup foot_note="180027">4</sup>

and when they hear any vain talk,<sup foot_note="180028">1</sup> they turn away from it, saying: "We have our deeds and you have your deeds. Peace be to you. We do not desire to act like the ignorant."
(O Prophet), you cannot grant guidance to whom you please. It is Allah Who guides those whom He will.<sup foot_note="180029">1</sup> He knows best who are amenable to guidance.

They say: "If we were to follow this guidance with you, we should be snatched away from our land."<sup foot_note="180030">1</sup> Have We not established for them a secure sanctuary to which fruits of all kinds are brought as a provision from Us? But most of them do not know.<sup foot_note="180031">2</sup>

And how many a town did We destroy whose inhabitants exulted on account of their affluence. These are their dwellings in which very few dwelt after them. Eventually it is We Who inherited them.<sup foot_note="180032">1</sup>

Your Lord would not destroy a town until He had sent to its centre a Messenger who would recite to them Our verses. Nor would We destroy any town unless its inhabitants were iniquitous.<sup foot_note="180033">1</sup>
Whatever you have been given is a provision for the life of this world and its glitter. But that which is with Allah is better and more enduring. Do you not use your intellect?

Now, he to whom We have promised a good which he is going to obtain � can he be like him whom We have given the good things of this life, but who will be brought up for punishment<sup foot_note="180034">1</sup> on the Day of Judgement?
(Let them not forget) that the Day when Allah will call unto them, and say: "Where are those whom you imagined to be My associates?"<sup foot_note="180035">1</sup>

Those against whom the Word will be realised<sup foot_note="180036">1</sup> will say: "Our Lord, these are the ones whom we led astray just as we ourselves strayed. We absolve ourselves before You of all blame.<sup foot_note="180037">2</sup> It was not us that they worshipped."<sup foot_note="180038">3</sup>

They will then be told: "Call upon those for help whom you declared to be Our associates."<sup foot_note="180039">1</sup> They will then call upon them but they will not answer them. They will have observed the chastisement in front of them. Would that they were guided!
(Let them not disregard) that the Day when Allah will call out to them saying: "What was the answer you gave to the Messengers?"
Then they will not be able to think of any reply, nor will they be able to ask one another.
But those who repented and believed and acted righteously, they will perhaps be among those who will prosper there.

Your Lord creates what He will and chooses (for His tasks) whomsoever He will. It is not for them to make the choice.<sup foot_note="179951">1</sup> Glory be to Allah. He is exalted far above their associating others in His Divinity.
Your Lord knows all that their hearts conceal and all that they reveal.<sup foot_note="180013">1</sup>
He is Allah; there is no god but He. His is the praise in this world and in the Hereafter. His is the command and to Him will all of you be returned.

(O Prophet), tell them: "Did you consider: if Allah were to make the night perpetual over you till the Day of Judgement, is there a god other than Allah who can bring forth light for you? Do you not hear?"

Say: "Did you consider: if Allah were to make the day become perpetual over you till the Day of Judgement, is there a god other than Allah who can bring in night for you that you may repose in it? Will you not see?"
It is out of His Mercy that He has made for you night and day that you may repose (during the night) and seek His Bounty (during the day) that you might be grateful.
(Let them bear in mind) that on that Day when He will call out to them saying: "Where are My associates, those whom you imagined to be so?"

And from each people We shall draw a witness,<sup foot_note="180040">1</sup> and shall say to them: "Do produce your evidence now."<sup foot_note="180041">2</sup> Then they shall know that the Truth is with Allah alone, and the lies which they had invented will forsake them.

To be sure,<sup foot_note="180042">1</sup> Qarun (Korah) was one of Moses' people; then he transgressed against them.<sup foot_note="180043">2</sup> We had bestowed on him such treasure that their very keys would have been raised with difficulty by a whole group of strong people.<sup foot_note="180044">3</sup> Once when his people said to him: "Do not exult, for Allah does not love those who exult (in their riches).

Seek by means of the wealth that Allah has granted you the Abode of the Hereafter, but forget not your share in this world and do good as Allah has been good to you and do not strive to create mischief in the land, for Allah loves not those who create mischief."

He replied: "All this has been given to me on account of a certain knowledge that I have."<sup foot_note="180045">1</sup> Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him those who were stronger in might<sup foot_note="180046">2</sup> than he and were more numerous in multitude? The wicked are not asked about their acts of sin.<sup foot_note="180047">3</sup>
Once Korah went forth among his people in full glitter. Those seeking the life of this world said: "Would that we had the like of what Korah has! He truly has a great fortune."

But those endowed with true knowledge said: "Woe to you. The reward of Allah is best for those who believe and act righteously. But none except those who are patient shall attain to this."<sup foot_note="180048">1</sup>
At last We caused the earth to swallow him and his house. Thereafter there was no group of people that could come to his aid against Allah; nor was he able to come to his own aid.

And those who had envied his position the day before began to say on the morrow: "Alas, we had forgotten that it is Allah Who increases the provision of those of His servants whom He will and grants in sparing measure to those whom He will.<sup foot_note="180049">1</sup> But for Allah's favour upon us, He could have made us to be swallowed too. Alas, we had forgotten that the unbelievers do not prosper."<sup foot_note="180050">2</sup>

As for the Abode of the Hereafter,<sup foot_note="180051">1</sup> We shall assign it exclusively for those who do not seek glory on earth<sup foot_note="180052">2</sup> nor want to cause mischief.<sup foot_note="180053">3</sup> The God-fearing shall have the best end.<sup foot_note="180054">4</sup>
He who shall bring a good deed shall be rewarded with what is better. But those who bring evil deeds shall not be requited more than their deeds.

(O Prophet), surely He Who has ordained the Qur'an on you<sup foot_note="180055">1</sup> will bring you to the best end.<sup foot_note="180056">2</sup> Say to them: "My Lord knows best who has brought true guidance and who is in clear error."

(O Prophet), you never looked forward for the Book to be revealed to you. It is out of sheer Mercy of your Lord that it was (revealed to you).<sup foot_note="180057">1</sup> So do not lend any support to the unbelievers.<sup foot_note="180058">2</sup>

And let it never happen that the unbelievers might turn you away<sup foot_note="180059">1</sup> from the revelations of Allah after they have been revealed to you. Call people to your Lord and never become one of the unbelievers,
and do not invoke any god beside Allah. There is no god but He. All will perish but He. To Him belongs the command.<sup foot_note="180060">1</sup> And to Him shall all of you return.
Alif. Lam. Mim.
Do people think that they will be let go merely by saying: “We believe,” and that they will not be tested,<sup foot_note="180061">1</sup>
for We indeed tested those who went before them?<sup foot_note="180062">1</sup> Allah will most certainly ascertain<sup foot_note="180063">2</sup> those who spoke the truth and those who lied.
Do the evil-doers<sup foot_note="180064">1</sup> suppose that they will get the better of Us?<sup foot_note="180065">2</sup> How evil is their judgement!
Let him who looks forward to meeting Allah know that Allah's appointed term will surely come to pass.<sup foot_note="180066">1</sup> He is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.<sup foot_note="180067">2</sup>
Whosoever strives(in the cause of Allah) does so to his own good.<sup foot_note="180068">1</sup> Surely Allah stands in no need of anyone in the whole Universe.<sup foot_note="180069">2</sup>
Those who believe and do good deeds, We shall cleanse them of their evil deeds and reward them according to the best of their deeds.<sup foot_note="180070">1</sup>

We have enjoined upon man kindness to his parents, but if they exert pressure on you to associate with Me in My Divinity any that you do not know (to be My associate), do not obey them.<sup foot_note="180071">1</sup> To Me is your return, and I shall let you know all that you have done.<sup foot_note="180072">2</sup>
As for those who believed and acted righteously, We shall certainly admit them among the righteous.

Among people there are some who say:<sup foot_note="180073">1</sup> “We believe in Allah.” But when such a person is made to endure suffering in Allah's cause, he reckons the persecution he suffers at the hands of people as though it is a chastisement from Allah.<sup foot_note="180074">2</sup> But if victory comes from your Lord, the same person will say “We were with you.”<sup foot_note="180075">3</sup> Does Allah not know whatever is in the hearts of the people of the world?
Allah will surely ascertain who are the believers and who are the hypocrites.<sup foot_note="180076">1</sup>

The unbelievers say to the believers: “Follow our way and we will carry the burden of your sins.”<sup foot_note="180077">1</sup> (They say so even though) they are not going to carry any part of their sins.<sup foot_note="180078">2</sup> Surely they are lying.

They will certainly carry their own burdens and other burdens besides their own.<sup foot_note="180079">1</sup> They will assuredly be called to account on the Day of Resurrection concerning the fabrications which they contrived.<sup foot_note="180080">2</sup>

We did indeed send Noah to his people<sup foot_note="180081">1</sup> and he lived among them a thousand years save fifty.<sup foot_note="180082">2</sup> Eventually the Flood overtook them while they were engaged in wrongdoing.<sup foot_note="180083">3</sup>
Then We rescued Noah together with the people in the Ark<sup foot_note="180084">1</sup> and made it (that is, the Ark) a lesson for all people.<sup foot_note="180085">2</sup>
We sent Abraham<sup foot_note="180086">1</sup> and he said to his people: “Serve Allah and fear Him.<sup foot_note="180087">2</sup>This is better for you if you only knew.

Those that you worship instead of Allah are merely idols, and you are simply inventing lies (about them).<sup foot_note="180088">1</sup> Indeed those whom you worship beside Allah have no power to provide you with any sustenance. So seek your sustenance from Allah and serve only Him and give thanks to Him alone. It is to Him that you will be sent back.<sup foot_note="180089">2</sup>

And if you give the lie (to the Messenger), then many nations before you also gave the lie<sup foot_note="180090">1</sup> (to their Messengers). The Messenger is charged with no other duty than to deliver the Message in clear terms.”

Have<sup foot_note="180091">1</sup> they never observed how Allah creates for the first time and then repeats it? Indeed (to repeat the creation of a thing) is even easier for Allah<sup foot_note="180092">2</sup> (than creating it for the first time).
Say: “Go about the earth and see how He created for the first time, and then Allah will recreate life.” Surely, Allah has power over everything.<sup foot_note="180093">1</sup>
He chastises whom He will and forgives whom He will. To Him all of you will be sent back.
You cannot overpower Allah, neither on the earth nor in the heaven.<sup foot_note="180094">1</sup> None can protect you from Allah<sup foot_note="180095">2</sup> nor come to your aid against Him.
Those who disbelieved in Allah's signs and in meeting Him, it is they who have despaired of My Mercy;<sup foot_note="180096">1</sup> it is they for whom a painful chastisement lies ahead.

The people<sup foot_note="180097">1</sup> (of Abraham) had no other answer than to say: “Kill him or burn him.”<sup foot_note="180098">2</sup> But Allah delivered him from the fire.<sup foot_note="180099">3</sup> There are many Signs in this for those who believe.<sup foot_note="180100">4</sup>

He said:<sup foot_note="180101">1</sup> “You have taken up idols instead of Allah as a bond of love among yourselves<sup foot_note="180102">2</sup> in the present life, but on the Day of Resurrection you will disown and curse one another.<sup foot_note="180103">3</sup> Your refuge shall be the Fire, and none will come to your aid.”
Then did Lot believe him,<sup foot_note="180105">1</sup> and Abraham said: “I am emigrating unto my Lord.<sup foot_note="180106">2</sup> He is All-Powerful, All-Wise,”<sup foot_note="180107">3</sup>

and We bestowed upon him (offspring like) Isaac and Jacob,<sup foot_note="180108">1</sup> and bestowed prophethood and the Book<sup foot_note="180109">2</sup> on his descendants and granted him his reward in this world; he will certainly be among the righteous<sup foot_note="180110">3</sup> in the Hereafter.
We sent Lot<sup foot_note="180111">1</sup> and he said to his people: “You commit the abomination that none in the world ever committed before you.

What! Do you go to men<sup foot_note="180112">1</sup> (to satisfy your lust), engage in highway robbery, and commit evil deeds in your gatherings?”<sup foot_note="180113">2</sup> Then they had no answer to offer other than to say: “Bring Allah's chastisement upon us if you are truthful.”
Lot said: “My Lord, aid me against these mischievous people.”

When Our emissaries brought the good news<sup foot_note="180114">1</sup> to Abraham, and said (to him): “We are surely going to destroy the inhabitants<sup foot_note="180115">2</sup> of this city; its inhabitants are immersed in wrong-doing.”

Abraham said: “But Lot is there.”<sup foot_note="180116">1</sup> They replied: “We are well aware of those who are there. We shall save him and all his household except his wife.” His wife is among those who will stay behind.<sup foot_note="180117">2</sup>

When Our emissaries came to Lot he was distressed and embarrassed on their account. They said: “Do not fear nor be distressed.<sup foot_note="180118">1</sup> We shall save you and all your household except your wife who is among those that will stay behind.
We shall bring down upon the people of this city a scourge from the heaven because of their evildoing.”
And We have left a vestige of it in that city as a Clear Sign for a people who use their reason.

And We sent to Midian their brother Shuayb.<sup foot_note="180119">1</sup> He said: “My people, serve Allah and look forward to the Last Day<sup foot_note="180120">2</sup> and do not go about the earth committing mischief.”
But they denounced him as a liar.<sup foot_note="180121">1</sup> So a mighty earthquake overtook them, and by the morning they lay overturned in their houses.<sup foot_note="180122">2</sup>

And We destroyed Ad and Thamud, whose dwellings you have observed.<sup foot_note="180123">1</sup> Satan had embellished their deeds for them and had turned them away from the Right Path although they were a people of clear perception.<sup foot_note="180124">2</sup>

And We destroyed Qarun (Korah) and Pharaoh and Haman. Moses came to them with Clear Signs but they waxed arrogant in the land although they could not have outstripped<sup foot_note="180125">1</sup> (Us).

So We seized each for their sin. We let loose upon some a violent tornado with showers of stones;<sup foot_note="180126">1</sup> some were overtaken by a mighty Cry;<sup foot_note="180127">2</sup> some were caused to be swallowed up by the earth,<sup foot_note="180128">3</sup> and some We drowned.<sup foot_note="180129">4</sup> Allah would not wrong them, but it is they who wronged themselves.<sup foot_note="180130">5</sup>

The case of those who took others than Allah as their protectors is that of a spider who builds a house; but the frailest of all houses is the spider's house; if they only knew.<sup foot_note="180131">1</sup>
Surely Allah knows fully what they call upon apart from Him. He is the Most Powerful, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="180132">1</sup>
These are the parables that We set forth to make people understand. But only those endowed with knowledge will comprehend them.
Allah has created the heavens and the earth in Truth.<sup foot_note="180133">1</sup> Certainly there is a Sign in this for those who believe.<sup foot_note="180134">2</sup>

(O Prophet), recite the Book that has been revealed to you and establish Prayer.<sup foot_note="180135">1</sup> Surely Prayer forbids indecency and evil.<sup foot_note="180136">2</sup> And Allah's remembrance is of even greater merit.<sup foot_note="180137">3</sup> Allah knows all that you do.

Argue not<sup foot_note="180138">1</sup> with the People of the Book except in the fairest manner,<sup foot_note="180139">2</sup> unless it be those of them that are utterly unjust.<sup foot_note="180140">3</sup> Say to them: “We believe in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to you. One is our God and your God; and we are those who submit<sup foot_note="180141">4</sup> ourselves to Him.”

(O Prophet), thus have We bestowed the Book on you.<sup foot_note="180142">1</sup> So those on whom We had bestowed the Book before believe in it,<sup foot_note="180143">2</sup> and of these (Arabs) too a good many believe in it.<sup foot_note="180144">3</sup> It is none but the utter unbelievers who deny Our Signs.<sup foot_note="180145">4</sup>
(O Prophet), you did not recite any Book before, nor did you write it down with your hand; for then the votaries of falsehood would have had a cause for doubt.<sup foot_note="180146">1</sup>
But it is a set of Clear Signs in the hearts of those who have been endowed with knowledge.<sup foot_note="180147">1</sup> None except the utterly unjust will deny Our Signs.
They say: “Why were Signs<sup foot_note="180148">1</sup> from his Lord not sent down upon him?” Say: “The Signs are only with Allah. As for me, I am no more than a plain warner.”

Does it not suffice for them (as a Sign) that We revealed to you the Book that is recited to them?<sup foot_note="180149">1</sup> Surely there is mercy and good counsel in it for those who believe.<sup foot_note="180150">2</sup>

Say (O Prophet): “Allah suffices as a witness between me and you. He knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. As for those who believe in falsehood and are engaged in infidelity with Allah, it is they who will be the losers.”

They ask you to hasten in bringing chastisement<sup foot_note="180151">1</sup> upon them. Had there not been an appointed term for it, the chastisement would have already visited them; in fact it will come down upon them all of a sudden (at its appointed time) while they will not be aware of it.
They ask you to hasten the chastisement upon them although Hell encompasses the unbelievers.

(They will become aware of it) the Day when the chastisement will overwhelm them from above and from under their feet, and He will say to them: “Taste now the consequence of the deeds that you used to commit.”
O My servants who believe, verily My earth is vast; so serve Me alone.<sup foot_note="180152">1</sup>
Every being shall taste death, then it is to Us that you shall be sent back.<sup foot_note="180153">1</sup>

We shall house those who believed and acted righteously in the lofty mansions of Paradise beneath which rivers flow. There they shall remain for ever. How excellent a reward it is for those who acted (in obedience to Allah),<sup foot_note="180154">1</sup>
who remained steadfast<sup foot_note="180155">1</sup> and put their trust in their Lord!<sup foot_note="180156">2</sup>
How many an animal there is that does not carry about its sustenance. Allah provides sustenance to them and to you. He is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.<sup foot_note="180157">1</sup>

If you were to ask them:<sup foot_note="180158">1</sup> “Who created the heavens and the earth and Who has kept the sun and the moon in subjection?” they will certainly say: “Allah.” How come, then, they are being deluded from the Truth?
Allah enlarges the sustenance of any of His servants whom He will, and straitens the sustenance of whom He will. Surely Allah has knowledge of everything.

If you were to ask them: “Who sent down water from the sky and therewith revived the earth after its death?” they will certainly say: “Allah.” Say: “To Allah alone be praise and thanks.”<sup foot_note="180159">1</sup> But most people do not understand.
The present life is nothing but sport and amusement.<sup foot_note="180160">1</sup> The true life is in the Abode of the Hereafter; if only they knew.<sup foot_note="180161">2</sup>

When they embark in the ships they call upon Allah, consecrating their faith to Him. But when He rescues them and brings them to land, they suddenly begin to associate others with Allah in His Divinity
that they may be ungrateful for the rescue that We granted them, and that they may revel in the pleasures (of the present life).<sup foot_note="180162">1</sup> Soon they shall come to know.

Do they not see that We have given them a sanctuary of safety whereas people around them are being snatched away?<sup foot_note="180163">1</sup> So, do they believe in falsehood and ungratefully deny Allah's bounties?
Who can be more unjust than he who foists a lie on Allah or gives the lie to the Truth after it has come to him?<sup foot_note="180164">1</sup> Is Hell not the resort of the unbelievers?
As for those who strive in Our cause, We shall surely guide them to Our Ways.<sup foot_note="180165">1</sup> Indeed Allah is with those who do good.
Alif. Lam. Mim.
The Romans have been defeated
in the neighbouring land;<sup foot_note="180166">1</sup> but after their defeat they shall gain victory in a few years.
All power belongs to Allah both before and after.<sup foot_note="180104">1</sup> On that day will the believers rejoice
at the victory granted by Allah.<sup foot_note="180167">1</sup> He grants victory to whomsoever He pleases. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Compassionate.
This is Allah's promise and He does not go back on His promise. But most people do not know.
People simply know the outward aspect of the worldly life but are utterly heedless<sup foot_note="180168">1</sup> of the Hereafter.

Do they not reflect on themselves?<sup foot_note="180169">1</sup> Allah created the heavens and the earth and whatever lies between them in Truth and for an appointed term.<sup foot_note="180170">2</sup> Yet many people deny that they will meet their Lord.<sup foot_note="180171">3</sup>

Have they not travelled through the earth that they may observe what was the end of their predecessors<sup foot_note="180172">1</sup> who were far mightier and tilled the land<sup foot_note="180173">2</sup> and built upon it more than these have ever built?<sup foot_note="180174">3</sup> And Allah's Messengers came to them with Clear Signs.<sup foot_note="180175">4</sup> It was not Allah Who wronged them, but it is they who wronged themselves.<sup foot_note="180176">5</sup>
Evil was the end of those evil-doers, for they gave the lie to Allah's Signs and scoffed at them.
Allah creates in the first instance and will later repeat it.<sup foot_note="180177">1</sup> Thereafter it is to Him that you shall be sent back.
On that Day when the Hour will come to pass,<sup foot_note="180178">1</sup> the criminals shall be dumbfounded.<sup foot_note="180179">2</sup>

None whom they had associated with Allah in His Divinity will intercede on their behalf;<sup foot_note="180180">1</sup> rather, they will disown those whom they had set up as Allah's associates in His Divinity.<sup foot_note="180181">2</sup>
On that Day when the Hour will come to pass, people will be split into groups.<sup foot_note="180182">1</sup>
Then those who believed and acted righteously will be placed in a Garden<sup foot_note="180183">1</sup> and will be happy and jubilant.<sup foot_note="180184">2</sup>
As for those who disbelieved<sup foot_note="180185">1</sup> and gave the lie to Our Signs and to the encounter of the Hereafter, they will be arraigned for chastisement.
So<sup foot_note="180186">1</sup> glorify Allah<sup foot_note="180187">2</sup> in the evening and the morning.
His is all praise in the heavens and in the earth; (and glorify Him) in the afternoon and when the sun begins to decline.<sup foot_note="180188">1</sup>

He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and revives the earth after it is dead.<sup foot_note="180189">1</sup> Likewise will you be raised to life (after you die).
And of His<sup foot_note="180190">1</sup> Signs is that He created you from dust and behold, you became human beings, and are multiplying around (the earth).<sup foot_note="180191">2</sup>

And of His Signs is that He has created mates for you from your own kind<sup foot_note="180192">1</sup> that you may find peace in them<sup foot_note="180193">2</sup> and He has set between you love and mercy.<sup foot_note="180194">3</sup> Surely there are Signs in this for those who reflect.

And of His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth<sup foot_note="180195">1</sup> and the diversity of your tongues and colours.<sup foot_note="180196">2</sup> Indeed there are Signs in this for the wise.
And of His Signs is your sleeping at night and your seeking His Bounty<sup foot_note="180197">1</sup> during the day. Indeed there are Signs in this for those who hearken.

And of His Signs is that He shows you lightning, arousing both fear and hope,<sup foot_note="180198">1</sup> and sends down water from the sky and revives the earth after it is dead.<sup foot_note="180199">2</sup> Indeed there are Signs in this for those who use their reason.

And of His Signs is that the sky and the earth stand firm by His command.<sup foot_note="180200">1</sup> Then no sooner than He summons you out of the earth you will come forth.<sup foot_note="180201">2</sup>
To Him belong all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth. All are in obedience to Him.

It is He Who creates in the first instance and it is He Who will repeat the creation, and that is easier for Him.<sup foot_note="180202">1</sup> His is the loftiest attribute in the heavens and the earth. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

He sets forth<sup foot_note="180204">1</sup> for you a parable from your own lives. Do you have among your slaves some who share with you the sustenance that We have bestowed on you so that you become equals in it, all being alike, and then you would hold them in fear as you fear each other?<sup foot_note="180205">2</sup> Thus do We make plain the Signs for those who use reason.
But the wrong-doers follow their desires without any knowledge. Who, then, can show the way to him whom Allah lets go astray?<sup foot_note="180206">1</sup> Such shall have no helpers.

(O Prophet and his followers),<sup foot_note="180207">1</sup> turn your face singlemindedly<sup foot_note="180208">2</sup> to the true Faith<sup foot_note="180209">3</sup> and adhere to the true nature on which Allah has created human beings.<sup foot_note="180210">4</sup> The mould fashioned by Allah cannot be altered.<sup foot_note="180211">5</sup> That is the True, Straight Faith,<sup foot_note="180212">6</sup> although most people do not know.

(Adhere to the True Faith and) turn to Him,<sup foot_note="180213">1</sup> and hold Him in awe,<sup foot_note="180214">2</sup> and establish Prayer,<sup foot_note="180215">3</sup> and do not be of those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity,
those who have split up their religion and have become divided into sects, each party exulting in what they have.<sup foot_note="180216">1</sup>

(Such are human beings) that when any misfortune befalls them, they cry to their Lord, penitently turning to Him.<sup foot_note="180217">1</sup> But no sooner that He lets them have a taste of His Mercy than some of them begin associating others with their Lord in His Divinity<sup foot_note="180218">2</sup>
so that they may show ingratitude to Us for the favours We had bestowed upon them. So, enjoy yourselves a while; but then you shall soon come to know.
Have We sent down any sanction which provides support to their associating others with Allah in His Divinity?<sup foot_note="180219">1</sup>
When We make people have a taste of Our Mercy, they exult in it; and when any misfortune befalls them in consequence of their deeds, then lo and behold, they despair.<sup foot_note="180220">1</sup>
Do they not see that Allah enlarges and straitens the sustenance of those whom He pleases? There are Signs in this for those who believe.<sup foot_note="180221">1</sup>

So give his due to the near of kin, and to the needy, and to the wayfarer.<sup foot_note="180222">1</sup> That is better for those who desire to please Allah. It is they who will prosper.<sup foot_note="180223">2</sup>

Whatever you pay as interest so that it may increase the wealth of people does not increase in the sight of Allah.<sup foot_note="180224">1</sup> As for the Zakah that you give, seeking with it Allah's good pleasure, that is multiplied manifold.<sup foot_note="180225">2</sup>

It is Allah<sup foot_note="180226">1</sup> Who created you, then bestowed upon you your sustenance,<sup foot_note="180227">2</sup> and He will cause you to die and then will bring you back to life.
