Can any of those whom you associate with Allah in His Divinity! do any such thing?<sup foot_note="180228">3</sup> Glory be to Him and exalted be He above whatever they associate with Allah in His Divinity.

Evil has become rife on the land and at sea because of men's deeds; this in order that He may cause them to have a taste of some of their deeds; perhaps they will turn back (from evil).<sup foot_note="180229">1</sup>
(O Prophet), say: “Traverse in the earth and see what was the end of those who went before you: most of them associated others with Allah in His Divinity.”<sup foot_note="180230">1</sup>
So turn your face exclusively towards the True Faith before there comes the Day whose coming from Allah cannot be averted,<sup foot_note="180231">1</sup> the Day when people will split into groups.
He who disbelieves will suffer the consequence of it<sup foot_note="180232">1</sup> and he who acts righteously, they will pave the way for their own good
so that Allah may, out of His Bounty, reward those who believe and act righteously. Verily He does not love the unbelievers.

And of His Signs is that He sends winds to herald good tidings<sup foot_note="180233">1</sup> and that He may give you a taste of His Mercy, and that ships may sail at His bidding,<sup foot_note="180234">2</sup> and you may seek His Bounty<sup foot_note="180235">3</sup> and give thanks to Him.

We sent Messengers before you to their respective nations, and they brought Clear Signs<sup foot_note="180236">1</sup> to them. Then We took vengeance upon those who acted wickedly.<sup foot_note="180237">2</sup> It was incumbent on Us to come to the aid of the believers.

Allah sends the winds that stir up clouds and then He spreads them in the sky as He pleases and splits them into different fragments, whereafter you see drops of rain pouring down from them. He then causes the rain to fall on whomsoever of His servants He pleases, and lo, they rejoice at it,
although before that they were given to despair.
See, then, the tokens of Allah's Mercy: how He revives the earth after it is dead.<sup foot_note="180203">1</sup> Verily He is the One Who will revive the dead. He has power over everything.
But if We were to send a wind and then their tilth has become yellow,<sup foot_note="180238">1</sup> they would never cease to disbelieve.<sup foot_note="180239">2</sup>
(O Prophet), you cannot make the dead hear,<sup foot_note="180240">1</sup> nor can you make the deaf hear your call when they turn back in retreat,<sup foot_note="180241">2</sup>
nor can you guide the blind out of their error.<sup foot_note="180242">1</sup> You can make none hear (your call) except those who believe in Our Signs and have surrendered themselves (to Him).

It is Allah Who created you in a state of weakness; then after weakness He gave you strength, then after strength He made you weak and old. He creates what He pleases.<sup foot_note="180243">1</sup> He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.

On that Day when the Hour will come to pass<sup foot_note="180244">1</sup> the wicked shall swear that they had stayed (in the world) no more than an hour.<sup foot_note="180245">2</sup> Thus they used to be deceived in the life of the world.<sup foot_note="180246">3</sup>

But those who had been endowed with knowledge and faith shall say: “According to Allah's Record you have stayed till the Day of Resurrection. Now, this is the Day of Resurrection. But you did not know.”
So that will be the Day when the excuses of the wrong-doers will not avail them, nor will they be asked to make amends.<sup foot_note="180247">1</sup>
In the Qur'an We have explained things to people in myriad ways. But no matter what Sign you bring to them, those who are resolved upon denying the Truth will say: “You are given to falsehood.”
Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who have no knowledge.
Therefore, (O Prophet), have patience. Surely Allah's promise is true.<sup foot_note="180248">1</sup> Let those who lack certainty not cause you to be unsteady.<sup foot_note="180249">2</sup>
Alif. Lam. Mim.
These are the verses of the Wise Book,<sup foot_note="180250">1</sup>
a guidance and mercy for the doers of good,<sup foot_note="180251">1</sup>
who establish Prayer and pay Zakah, and have firm faith in the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="180252">1</sup>
It is they who are on true guidance from their Lord, and it is they who shall prosper.<sup foot_note="180253">1</sup>

There are some human beings<sup foot_note="180254">1</sup> who purchase an enchanting diversion<sup foot_note="180255">2</sup> in order to lead people away from the way of Allah without having any knowledge,<sup foot_note="180256">3</sup> who hold the call to the Way of Allah to ridicule.<sup foot_note="180257">4</sup> A humiliating chastisement awaits them.<sup foot_note="180258">5</sup>

When Our verses are recited to such a person, he arrogantly turns away, as though he had not heard them, or as though there was a deafness in his ears. So announce to him the tidings of a grievous chastisement.
Surely those who believe and do good deeds shall have Gardens of Bliss.<sup foot_note="180259">1</sup>
They shall abide in them forever. This is Allah's promise that shall come true. He is the Most Powerful, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="180260">1</sup>

He<sup foot_note="180261">1</sup> created the heavens without any pillars visible to you<sup foot_note="180262">2</sup> and He placed mountains in the earth as pegs lest it should turn topsy turvy with you,<sup foot_note="180263">3</sup> and He dispersed all kinds of animals over the earth, and sent down water from the sky causing all kinds of excellent plants to grow on it.

Such is Allah's creation. Show me, then, what any others, apart from Allah, have created.<sup foot_note="180264">1</sup> Nay, the fact is that the wrong-doers are in manifest error.<sup foot_note="180265">2</sup>

We<sup foot_note="180266">1</sup> bestowed wisdom upon Luqman, (enjoining): “Give thanks to Allah.”<sup foot_note="180267">2</sup> Whoso gives thanks to Allah, does so to his own good. And whoso disbelieves (let him know that) Allah is All-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="180268">3</sup>

And call to mind when Luqman said to his son while exhorting him: “My son, do not associate others with Allah in His Divinity.<sup foot_note="180269">1</sup> Surely, associating others with Allah in His Divinity is a mighty wrong.”<sup foot_note="180270">2</sup>

We<sup foot_note="180271">1</sup> enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years.<sup foot_note="180272">2</sup> (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): “Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.

But if they press you to associate others with Me in My Divinity, (to associate) those regarding whom you have no knowledge<sup foot_note="180273">1</sup> (that they are My associates), do not obey them. And yet treat them well in this world, and follow the way of him who turns to Me in devotion. Eventually it is to Me that all of you shall return,<sup foot_note="180274">2</sup> and I shall then tell you all that you did.”<sup foot_note="180275">3</sup>

(Luqman said):<sup foot_note="180276">1</sup> “Son, Allah will bring forth<sup foot_note="180277">2</sup> everything even if it be as small as the grain of a mustard seed even though it be hidden inside a rock or (anywhere) in the heavens or earth. Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware.

Son, establish Prayer, enjoin all that is good and forbid all that is evil, and endure with patience whatever affliction befalls you.<sup foot_note="180278">1</sup> Surely these have been emphatically enjoined.<sup foot_note="180279">2</sup>

Do not (contemptuously) turn your face away from people,<sup foot_note="180280">1</sup> nor tread haughtily upon earth. Allah does not love the arrogant and the vainglorious.<sup foot_note="180281">2</sup>
Be moderate in your stride<sup foot_note="180282">1</sup> and lower your voice. Verily the most disgusting of all voices is the braying of the donkey.”<sup foot_note="180283">2</sup>

Have you not seen that Allah has subjected to your service all that is in the heavens<sup foot_note="180284">1</sup> and on the earth and has abundantly bestowed upon you all His bounties, both visible and invisible?<sup foot_note="180285">2</sup> Yet some persons dispute regarding Allah<sup foot_note="180286">3</sup> without having any knowledge or guidance or any illuminating Book.<sup foot_note="180287">4</sup>

When they are told: “Follow what Allah has revealed,” they say: “We will rather follow that which we have found our forefathers following.” (Will they follow that) even though Satan might invite them to the chastisement of the Blazing Fire?<sup foot_note="180288">1</sup>

Whoever surrenders himself to Allah<sup foot_note="180289">1</sup> and lives righteously<sup foot_note="180290">2</sup> grasps the most firm handle.<sup foot_note="180291">3</sup> The ultimate decision of all matters rests with Allah.

So let the unbelief of the unbeliever not grieve you.<sup foot_note="180292">1</sup> To Us is their return and then We shall inform them of all that they did. Surely Allah knows well even the secrets that are hidden in the breasts (of people).
We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

If you were to ask them: “Who created the heavens and the earth?” they will certainly reply: “Allah.” Say: “All praise and thanks be to Allah.”<sup foot_note="180293">1</sup> Yet most of them do not know.<sup foot_note="180294">2</sup>
All that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah.<sup foot_note="180295">1</sup> Verily He is All-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="180296">2</sup>

If all the trees on earth become pens, and the sea replenished by seven more seas were to supply them with ink, the Words of Allah would not be exhausted.<sup foot_note="180297">1</sup>Verily Allah is Most Mighty, Most Wise.
To create all of you or to resurrect all of you is to Him like (creating or resurrecting) a single person. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.<sup foot_note="180298">1</sup>

Do you not see that Allah makes the night phase into the day and makes the day phase into the night and has subjected the sun and the moon<sup foot_note="180299">1</sup> to His will so that each of them is pursuing its course till an appointed time? (Do you not know that)<sup foot_note="180300">2</sup> Allah is well aware of all that you do?

All this is because Allah, He alone, is the Truth<sup foot_note="180301">1</sup> and all that which they call upon beside Him is false.<sup foot_note="180302">2</sup> Surely Allah, He alone, is All-High, Incomparably Great.<sup foot_note="180303">3</sup>

Do you not see that ships sail in the sea by Allah's Grace that He may show you some of His Signs?<sup foot_note="180304">1</sup> Surely there are Signs in this for everyone who is steadfast, thankful.<sup foot_note="180305">2</sup>

When waves engulf them (in the sea) like canopies, they call upon Allah, consecrating their faith solely to Him. But when He delivers them safely to the land, some of them become lukewarm.<sup foot_note="180306">1</sup> None denies Our Signs except the perfidious, the ungrateful.<sup foot_note="180307">2</sup>

O people, fear (the wrath) of your Lord, and dread the Day when no father will stand for his child, nor any child stand for his father.<sup foot_note="180308">1</sup> Surely Allah's promise is true.<sup foot_note="180309">2</sup> So let the life of this world not beguile you,<sup foot_note="180310">3</sup> nor let the Deluder delude you about Allah.<sup foot_note="180311">4</sup>

Surely Allah alone has the knowledge of the Hour. It is He Who sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs, although no person knows what he will earn tomorrow, nor does he know in which land he will die. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.
Alif. Lam. Mim.
This Book, beyond all doubt, was revealed by the Lord of the Universe.<sup foot_note="180312">1</sup>

Or do<sup foot_note="180313">1</sup> they say: “He has fabricated it?”<sup foot_note="180314">2</sup> Nay, it is the Truth from your Lord so that you may warn a people to whom no warner came before you;<sup foot_note="180315">3</sup> perhaps they will be guided to the Right Way.<sup foot_note="180316">4</sup>

It is Allah<sup foot_note="180317">1</sup> Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between the two, in six days, and then He established Himself on the Throne.<sup foot_note="180318">2</sup> You have no guardian or intercessor other than He. Will you, then, not take heed?<sup foot_note="180319">3</sup>
He governs from the heaven to the earth and then the record (of this governance) goes up to Him in a day whose measure is a thousand years in your reckoning.<sup foot_note="180320">1</sup>

He knows<sup foot_note="180321">1</sup> all that is beyond as well as all that is within a creature's sense-perception. He is the Most Mighty,<sup foot_note="180322">2</sup> the Most Compassionate,<sup foot_note="180323">3</sup>
He Who excelled in the creation of all that He created.<sup foot_note="180324">1</sup> He originated the creation of man from clay,
then made his progeny from the extract of a mean fluid,<sup foot_note="180325">1</sup>

then He duly proportioned him,<sup foot_note="180326">1</sup> and breathed into him of His spirit,<sup foot_note="180327">2</sup> and bestowed upon you ears and eyes and hearts.<sup foot_note="180328">3</sup> And yet, little thanks do you give.<sup foot_note="180329">4</sup>

They say:<sup foot_note="180330">1</sup> “Shall we be created afresh after we have become lost in the earth?” Nay, the fact is that they deny that they will meet their Lord.<sup foot_note="180331">2</sup>
Tell them: “The angel of death who has been charged with your souls shall gather you, and then you shall be brought back to your Lord.”<sup foot_note="180332">1</sup>

Would<sup foot_note="180333">1</sup> that you could see the guilty standing before their Lord with their heads downcast, (saying to Him): “Our Lord, we have now seen and heard, so send us back (to the world) that we might act righteously. For now we have come to have firm faith.”

(They will be told): “If We had so willed, We could have bestowed guidance on every person.<sup foot_note="180334">1</sup> But the Word from Me that I will fill Hell with men and jinn,<sup foot_note="180335">2</sup> all together, has been fulfilled.

So taste the chastisement on account of your forgetting the encounter of this Day.<sup foot_note="180336">1</sup> We, too, have forgotten you. Taste the eternal chastisement as a requital for your misdeeds.”

None believes in Our Signs except those who, when they are given good counsel through Our verses, fall down prostrate and celebrate the praise of their Lord and do not wax proud.<sup foot_note="180337">1</sup>

Their sides forsake their beds, and they call upon their Lord in fear and hope,<sup foot_note="180338">1</sup> and expend (in charity) out of the sustenance We have granted them.<sup foot_note="180339">2</sup>
No one knows what delights of the eyes are kept hidden for them as a reward for their deeds.<sup foot_note="180340">1</sup>
Would a true believer be like him who was an evil-doer?<sup foot_note="180341">1</sup> Surely they are not equal.<sup foot_note="180342">2</sup>
As for those who believe and act righteously, theirs shall be Gardens to dwell in,<sup foot_note="180343">1</sup> a hospitality to reward them for their deeds.

As for the evil-doers, their refuge shall be the Fire. Every time they want to escape from it they shall be driven back and shall be told: “Taste the chastisement of the Fire which you used to reject as a lie.”

We shall certainly have them taste some chastisement in this world in addition to the greater chastisement (of the Hereafter); perhaps they will retract (from their transgression).<sup foot_note="180344">1</sup>

And who is more unjust than he who is given good counsel through the Signs of his Lord and yet he turns away from them?<sup foot_note="180345">1</sup> Surely We will exact full retribution from such criminals.

Verily We bestowed the Book upon Moses. So entertain no doubt if (the Prophet Muhammad) received the same.<sup foot_note="180346">1</sup> We had made that Book a guidance for the Children of Israel,<sup foot_note="180347">2</sup>
and when they remained steadfast and firmly believed in Our Signs, We created among them leaders who guided people by Our command.<sup foot_note="180348">1</sup>
Surely your Lord will judge among them on the Day of Resurrection concerning the matters about which the Children of Israel used to differ.<sup foot_note="180349">1</sup>

Did (these historical events) not make them realise that We destroyed many nations before them amidst whose dwellings they now move about?<sup foot_note="180350">1</sup> Surely there are many Signs in this. Are they unable to hear?
Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?<sup foot_note="180351">1</sup>
They say: “If you are truthful, (tell us) when will the Judgement come?”<sup foot_note="180352">1</sup>
Tell them: “If the unbelievers were to believe on the Day of Judgement that will not avail them. For then they will be granted no respite.”<sup foot_note="180353">1</sup>
So (leave them to themselves and) turn away from them and wait; they too are waiting.
O Prophet,<sup foot_note="180354">1</sup> fear Allah and do not obey the unbelievers and the hypocrites. Verily Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="180355">2</sup>
Follow that which is revealed to you from your Lord. Verily Allah is fully aware of all that you do.<sup foot_note="180356">1</sup>
Put your trust in Allah: Allah is sufficient as Guardian.<sup foot_note="180357">1</sup>

Allah has never put two hearts within one person's body;<sup foot_note="180358">1</sup> nor has He made your wives, whom you compare to your mothers' backs (to divorce them),<sup foot_note="180359">2</sup> your true mothers; nor has He made those whom you adopt as sons your own sons.<sup foot_note="180360">3</sup> These are only words that you utter with your mouths. But Allah proclaims the Truth and directs you to the Right Path.

Call your adopted sons after their true fathers; that is more equitable in the sight of Allah.<sup foot_note="180361">1</sup> But if you do not know their true fathers, then regard them as your brethren in faith and as allies.<sup foot_note="180362">2</sup> You will not be taken to task for your mistaken utterances, but you will be taken to task for what you say deliberately.<sup foot_note="180363">3</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="180364">4</sup>

Surely the Prophet has a greater claim over the believers than they have over each other,<sup foot_note="180365">1</sup> and his wives are their mothers.<sup foot_note="180366">2</sup> According to the Book of Allah, blood relatives have greater claim over each other than the rest of the believers and the Emigrants (in the cause of Allah), except that you may do some good to your allies (if you so wish).<sup foot_note="180367">3</sup> This is inscribed in the Book of Allah.

And call to mind, (O Prophet), when We took the covenant from all Prophets; and also from you and Noah and Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary. We took from them a solemn covenant<sup foot_note="180368">1</sup>

so that (their Lord) may question the truthful about their truthfulness.<sup foot_note="180369">1</sup> As for the unbelievers, He has kept a painful chastisement in store for them.<sup foot_note="180370">2</sup>

Believers,<sup foot_note="180371">1</sup> call to mind Allah's favour to you when enemy hosts invaded you. Then We sent against them a wind and hosts that you did not see although<sup foot_note="180372">2</sup> Allah was observing all that you were then doing.

When they came upon you from above you and from below you,<sup foot_note="180373">1</sup> when your eyes were stupefied with horror and your hearts leapt to your throats, and you began to entertain diverse thoughts about Allah.
The believers were then put to a severe test and were most violently convulsed.<sup foot_note="180374">1</sup>
And call to mind when the hypocrites and all those with diseased hearts said: “All that Allah and His Messenger had promised us<sup foot_note="180375">1</sup> was nothing but deceit.”

And when a section of them said: “(O people of Yathrib), now there is no place for you to stay, so turn back.”<sup foot_note="180376">1</sup> (And call to mind) when a section of them was seeking permission from the Prophet to leave, saying: “Our houses are exposed (to attack),”<sup foot_note="180377">2</sup> although they were not exposed (to attack); <sup foot_note="180378">3</sup> they only wished to flee (from the battle-front).

If the enemy were to enter the town from various directions, and they were summoned to act treacherously,<sup foot_note="180379">1</sup> they would have succumbed to it and would have shown little reluctance in doing so.
They had earlier covenanted with Allah that they would not turn their backs in flight. And a covenant made with Allah must needs be answered for.<sup foot_note="180380">1</sup>
(O Prophet), tell them: “If you run away from death or slaying, this flight will not avail you. You will have little time after that to enjoy<sup foot_note="180381">1</sup> (the pleasures of life).”

Say (to them): “Who can protect you from Allah if He desires an evil for you? And who can prevent Him if He desires to show mercy to you?” They shall find none other than Allah to be their protector or helper.
Allah knows well those of you who create obstructions (in war efforts) and say to their brethren: “Come and join us.”<sup foot_note="180382">1</sup> They hardly take any part in battle.

They are utterly niggardly<sup foot_note="180383">1</sup> (in coming to your aid). Whenever there is danger, you will see them looking at you, their eyes rolling as though they were on the verge of fainting at the approach of death. But when the danger passes away, their greed for wealth prompts them to greet you with their sharp, scissor-like tongues.<sup foot_note="180384">2</sup> These are the ones who never truly believed, and so Allah has caused their deeds to be reduced to naught.<sup foot_note="180385">3</sup> That is easy enough for Allah.<sup foot_note="180386">4</sup>

They think that the invading confederates have not yet gone. But if the confederates were to mount another assault, they would wish to be in the desert among the bedouins and keep themselves informed about you from there. But even if they remained in your midst, hardly would they fight.

Surely there was a good example for you in the Messenger of Allah,<sup foot_note="180387">1</sup> for all those who look forward to Allah and the Last Day and remember Allah much.<sup foot_note="180388">2</sup>

As for the true believers,<sup foot_note="180389">1</sup> when they saw the invading confederates, they cried out: “This is what Allah and His Messenger had promised us, and what Allah and His Messenger said was absolutely true.”<sup foot_note="180390">2</sup> This only increased their faith and submission. <sup foot_note="180391">3</sup>

Among the believers there are those who have remained true to the covenant they made with Allah. Among those some of them have fulfilled their vow and others await the appointed time.<sup foot_note="180392">1</sup> They have not changed in the least.

(All this is) in order that Allah may reward the truthful for their truthfulness, and either punish the hypocrites or, if He so wills, accept their repentance. Verily Allah is Most Pardoning, Most Compassionate.
Allah sent back the unbelievers empty-handed, their hearts seething with rage. Allah sufficed the believers in their fight. Allah is Most Powerful, Most Mighty.

Allah brought down from their fortresses those People of the Book who had supported the invading confederates<sup foot_note="180393">1</sup> and cast such terror into their hearts that some of them you kill and some of them you take captive.
Allah made you inherit their land, their dwellings, and their goods, and a piece of land on which you had not yet trodden. Verily Allah has power over all things.
O Prophet,<sup foot_note="180394">1</sup> tell your wives: “If you seek the world and its embellishments, then come and I will make some provision for you and release you in an honourable way.
But if you seek Allah and His Messenger and the Abode of the Hereafter, then surely Allah has prepared a great reward for those of you who do good.”<sup foot_note="180395">1</sup>
Wives of the Prophet, if any of you commit flagrant indecency, her chastisement shall be doubled.<sup foot_note="180396">1</sup> That is easy for Allah.<sup foot_note="180397">2</sup>
But whoever of you is obedient to Allah and His Messenger and does good deeds, Allah will double her reward.<sup foot_note="180398">1</sup> We have prepared for her a generous provision.

Wives of the Prophet, you are not like other women.<sup foot_note="180399">1</sup> If you fear Allah, do not be too complaisant in your speech lest those with diseased hearts should covet you; but speak in a straight forward manner.<sup foot_note="180400">2</sup>

And stay in your homes<sup foot_note="180401">1</sup> and do not go about displaying your allurements as in the former Time of Ignorance.<sup foot_note="180402">2</sup> Establish Prayer, give Zakah, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah only wishes to remove uncleanness from you, O members of the (Prophet's) household, and to purify you completely.<sup foot_note="180403">3</sup>
Remember the Signs of Allah and the words of wisdom which are rehearsed in your homes.<sup foot_note="180404">1</sup> Verily Allah is All-Subtle,<sup foot_note="180405">2</sup> All-Aware.

Surely<sup foot_note="180411">1</sup> the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah),<sup foot_note="180412">2</sup> the men who have faith and the women who have faith,<sup foot_note="180413">3</sup> the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient,<sup foot_note="180414">4</sup> the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful;<sup foot_note="180415">5</sup> the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast,<sup foot_note="180416">6</sup> the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah),<sup foot_note="180417">7</sup> the men who give alms and the women who give alms,<sup foot_note="180418">8</sup> the men who fast and the women who fast,<sup foot_note="180419">9</sup> the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity,<sup foot_note="180420">10</sup> the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much:<sup foot_note="180421">11</sup> for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.<sup foot_note="180422">12</sup>

It<sup foot_note="180423">1</sup> does not behove a believer, male or female, that when Allah and His Messenger have decided an affair they should exercise their choice. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has strayed to manifest error.<sup foot_note="180424">2</sup>

(O Prophet),<sup foot_note="180425">1</sup> call to mind when you said to him<sup foot_note="180426">2</sup>whom Allah had favoured and you had favoured: “Cleave to your wife and fear Allah,”<sup foot_note="180427">3</sup> and you concealed within yourself for fear of people what Allah was to reveal, although Allah has greater right that you fear Him.<sup foot_note="180428">4</sup> So when Zayd had accomplished what he would of her,<sup foot_note="180429">5</sup> We gave her in marriage to you<sup foot_note="180430">6</sup> so that there should not be any constraint for the believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons after they had accomplished whatever they would of them.<sup foot_note="180431">7</sup> And Allah's command was bound to be accomplished.

There could be no hindrance to the Prophet regarding what Allah ordained for him.<sup foot_note="180432">1</sup> Such has been Allah's Way (with the Prophets) who went before. Allah's command is a decree firmly determined.<sup foot_note="180433">2</sup>
(This is Allah's Way) regarding those who deliver the Messages of Allah and who fear Him, and fear no one else than Allah. Allah is Sufficient as a Reckoner.<sup foot_note="180434">1</sup>
Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the seal of the Prophets. Allah has full knowledge of everything.<sup foot_note="180435">1</sup>
Believers, remember Allah much
and glorify Him morning and evening.<sup foot_note="180436">1</sup>

It is He Who lavishes His blessings on you and His angels invoke blessings on you that He may lead you out of darkness into light. He is Most Compassionate to the believers.<sup foot_note="180437">1</sup>
On the Day they meet Him they will be greeted with: “Peace.”<sup foot_note="180438">1</sup> He has prepared for them a generous reward.
O Prophet,<sup foot_note="180439">1</sup> We have sent you forth as a witness,<sup foot_note="180440">2</sup> a bearer of good tidings, and a warner,<sup foot_note="180441">3</sup>
as one who calls people to Allah by His leave,<sup foot_note="180442">1</sup> and as a bright, shining lamp.
Announce to the believers the good tidings that Allah has kept bounteous blessings in store for them.
Do not yield to the unbelievers and the hypocrites, and disregard the hurt that comes from them, and put your trust in Allah. Allah suffices as the Guardian to entrust one's affairs to.

Believers, when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them,<sup foot_note="180443">1</sup> you may not require them to observe a waiting period that you might reckon against them. So make provision for them and release them in an honourable manner.<sup foot_note="180444">2</sup>

O Prophet, We have made lawful for you your wives whose bridal dues you have paid,<sup foot_note="180445">1</sup> and the slave-girls you possess from among the prisoners of war, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and maternal aunts who have migrated with you, and a believing woman who gives herself to the Prophet and whom he wants to take in marriage.<sup foot_note="180446">2</sup> (O Prophet), this privilege is yours alone to the exclusion of other believers.<sup foot_note="180447">3</sup> We know well what restrictions We have imposed upon them as regards their wives and those whom their right hands possess, (and have exempted you from those restrictions) that there may be no constraint upon you.<sup foot_note="180448">4</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

Of them you may put off any of them you wish, and you may take any of them whom you wish, and you may call back any of those whom you had (temporarily) set aside: there will be no blame on you (on this account). It is likelier that they will thus be comforted, and will not grieve, and every one of them will be well-pleased with what you give them.<sup foot_note="180449">1</sup> Allah knows what is in your hearts. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Forbearing.<sup foot_note="180450">2</sup>

Thereafter women will not be lawful for you, and it will not be lawful for you to take other wives in place of them, even though their beauty might please you,<sup foot_note="180406">1</sup>unless they be those whom your right hand owns.<sup foot_note="180407">2</sup> Allah is watchful over everything.

Believers, enter not the houses of the Prophet without his permission,<sup foot_note="180451">1</sup>nor wait for a meal to be prepared; instead enter when you are invited to eat,<sup foot_note="180452">2</sup> and when you have had the meal, disperse. Do not linger in idle talk.<sup foot_note="180453">3</sup> That is hurtful to the Prophet but he does not express it out of shyness; but Allah is not ashamed of speaking out the Truth. And if you were to ask the wives of the Prophet for something, ask from behind a curtain. That is more apt for the cleanness of your hearts and theirs.<sup foot_note="180454">4</sup> It is not lawful for you to cause hurt to Allah's Messenger,<sup foot_note="180455">5</sup> nor to ever marry his wives after him.<sup foot_note="180456">6</sup> Surely that would be an enormous sin in Allah's sight.
(It does not matter) whether you disclose something or conceal it, for Allah certainly knows everything.<sup foot_note="180457">1</sup>

It will not be blameworthy for the wives of the Prophet if their fathers, their sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons,<sup foot_note="180458">1</sup> and the women with whom they have social relations,<sup foot_note="180459">2</sup> and the persons whom their right hands possess enter their houses.<sup foot_note="180460">3</sup> (O women), shun disobeying Allah. Allah is watchful over everything.<sup foot_note="180461">4</sup>
Allah and His angels bless the Prophet.<sup foot_note="180462">1</sup> Believers, invoke blessings and peace on him.<sup foot_note="180463">2</sup>

Verily those who cause annoyance to Allah and His Messenger � Allah has cursed them in this world and in the Hereafter and has prepared for them a humiliating chastisement.<sup foot_note="180464">1</sup>
Those who cause hurt to believing men and to believing women have invited upon themselves a calumny<sup foot_note="180465">1</sup> and a manifest sin.

O Prophet, enjoin your wives and your daughters and the believing women, to draw a part of their outer coverings around them.<sup foot_note="180466">1</sup> It is likelier that they will be recognised and not molested.<sup foot_note="180467">2</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.<sup foot_note="180468">3</sup>

If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts there is a sickness,<sup foot_note="180469">1</sup> and the scandal mongers in Madinah<sup foot_note="180470">2</sup> do not desist from their vile acts, We shall urge you to take action against them, and then they will hardly be able to stay in the city with you.
They shall be cursed from all around and they shall be ruthlessly killed wherever they are seized.
This has been Allah's Way with those who have gone before, and you shall find no change in Allah's Way.<sup foot_note="180471">1</sup>
People ask you concerning the Hour (of Resurrection).<sup foot_note="180472">1</sup> Say: “Allah alone has knowledge of it. What do you know? Perhaps the Hour is nigh.”
Allah has cursed the unbelievers and has prepared for them a Blazing Fire;
therein they shall abide for ever. They shall find none to protect or help them.
On that Day when their faces shall be turned around in the Fire, they will say: “Would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger.”
They will say: “Our Lord, we obeyed our chiefs and our great ones, and they turned us away from the Right Way.
Our Lord, mete out to them a double chastisement and lay upon them a mighty curse.”<sup foot_note="180473">1</sup>

Believers,<sup foot_note="180474">1</sup> do not be like those who distressed Moses and then Allah declared him quit of the ill they spoke about him; and he had a high standing with Allah.<sup foot_note="180475">2</sup>
Believers, fear Allah and speak the truth:
Allah will set your deeds right for you and will forgive you your sins. Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has achieved a great triumph.

We offered the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to carry it and were afraid of doing so; but man carried it. Surely he is wrong-doing, ignorant.<sup foot_note="180476">1</sup>

(The consequence of man's carrying the trust is) that Allah may chastise hypocritical men and hypocritical women and accept the repentance of believing men and believing women. He is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

All praise be to Allah to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth,<sup foot_note="180477">1</sup> and all praise be to Him in the World to Come.<sup foot_note="180478">2</sup> He is Most Wise, All-Aware.<sup foot_note="180479">3</sup>
He knows what penetrates into the earth and what goes forth from it, what descends from the heaven and what ascends to it. He is the Most Merciful, the Most Forgiving.<sup foot_note="180480">1</sup>

The unbelievers say: “How come the Hour is not coming upon us!”<sup foot_note="180408">1</sup> Say to them: “Yes indeed, by my Lord, by Him Who fully knows the realm beyond the ken of perception, that the Hour shall inevitably come upon you.<sup foot_note="180409">2</sup>Nothing escapes Him, not even the smallest particle in the heavens or the earth; nor is anything smaller or bigger than that but is in a Manifest Book.”<sup foot_note="180410">3</sup>
(The Hour shall come) that He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds. Theirs shall be forgiveness and a generous provision.
As for those who worked against Our Signs in order to frustrate them, they shall suffer a painful chastisement.<sup foot_note="180481">1</sup>

(O Prophet), those who have knowledge see clearly that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the Truth and directs to the Way of the Most Mighty, the Immensely Praiseworthy Lord.<sup foot_note="180482">1</sup>
The unbelievers say: “Shall we direct you to the man who tells you that when you have been utterly broken to pieces, you will be raised to life again?

Has he forged a lie against Allah, or is he afflicted with madness?”<sup foot_note="180483">1</sup> Nay, but those who do not believe in the Hereafter are doomed to be chastised and are far gone in error.<sup foot_note="180484">2</sup>

Do they not see how the heavens and the earth encompass them from the front and the rear? We could, if We so wished, cause the earth to swallow them or let fragments of the sky fall upon them.<sup foot_note="180485">1</sup> Verily there is a Sign in this for every servant (of Allah) who penitently turns to Him.<sup foot_note="180486">2</sup>

We bestowed Our favour upon David.<sup foot_note="180487">1</sup> (We commanded): “O mountains, sing Allah's praises with him”; (and so did We command) the birds.<sup foot_note="180488">2</sup> We softened the iron for him, (saying):
“Fashion coats of mail and measure their links with care<sup foot_note="180489">1</sup> and act righteously. I am watching over whatever you do.”

And We subdued the wind to Solomon: its morning course was a month's journey and its evening course was a month's journey.<sup foot_note="180490">1</sup> We gave him a spring flowing with molten brass,<sup foot_note="180491">2</sup> and We subdued for him jinn who, by his Lord's permission,<sup foot_note="180492">3</sup> worked before him. Such of them as swerved from Our commandment, We let them taste the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.

They made for him whatever he would desire: stately buildings, images,<sup foot_note="180493">1</sup> basins like water-troughs and huge, built-in-cauldrons:<sup foot_note="180494">2</sup> “Work, O house of David, in thankfulness (to your Lord).<sup foot_note="180495">3</sup> Few of My servants are truly thankful.”

When We executed Our decree of death on Solomon, nothing indicated to the jinn that he was dead except a worm eating away his staff. So when Solomon fell down, the jinn realised<sup foot_note="180496">1</sup> that had they known what lies in the realm beyond perception, they would not have continued to be in this humiliating chastisement.<sup foot_note="180497">2</sup>

For Sheba<sup foot_note="180498">1</sup> there was also a Sign in their dwelling place:<sup foot_note="180499">2</sup> the two gardens<sup foot_note="180500">3</sup> to the right and to the left.“ Eat of your Lord's provision, and render thanks to Him. Most pleasant is your land and Most Forgiving is your Lord.”

But they turned away<sup foot_note="180501">1</sup> and so We let loose upon them a devastating flood<sup foot_note="180502">2</sup> that swept away the dams and replaced their gardens by two others bearing bitter fruits, tamarisks, and a few lote trees.<sup foot_note="180503">3</sup>
Thus did We retribute them for their ingratitude. And none do We retribute in this manner except the utterly ungrateful.

We placed other prominent towns between them, the towns that We had blessed and had set well-measured stages between them.<sup foot_note="180504">1</sup> Move back and forth between them, night and day, in perfect security.

But they said: “Lord, make the stages of our journeys longer.”<sup foot_note="180505">1</sup> They wronged their own selves so We reduced them to bygone tales, and utterly tore them to pieces.<sup foot_note="180506">2</sup> Verily there are Signs in this for everyone who is steadfast and thankful.<sup foot_note="180507">3</sup>
Iblis found his estimate of them to be true, and they followed him, except a party of the believers.<sup foot_note="180508">1</sup>

Iblis had no authority over them and whatever happened was in order that We might know him who believes in the Hereafter as distinct from him who is in doubt about it.<sup foot_note="180509">1</sup> Your Lord is watchful over everything.<sup foot_note="180510">2</sup>

(O Prophet),<sup foot_note="180511">1</sup> say to those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity: “Call upon those whom you fancied to be deities beside Allah.<sup foot_note="180512">2</sup> They own not even the smallest particle, neither in the heavens nor on the earth; nor do they have any share in the ownership of either of them. Nor is any of them even a helper of Allah.

No intercession can avail with Allah except for him whom Allah permits (to intercede).<sup foot_note="180513">1</sup> When their hearts are relieved of fright they will ask the intercessors: “What did your Lord say?” They will reply: “(He said) what is right, and He is the High, the Great.”<sup foot_note="180514">2</sup>

Ask them, (O Prophet): “Who provides you sustenance from the heavens and the earth?” Say: “Allah.<sup foot_note="180515">1</sup> Now, inevitably only one of us is rightly guided, either we or you; and the other is in manifest error.”<sup foot_note="180516">2</sup>
Tell them: “You will not be called to account about the guilt we committed, nor will we be called to account for what you did.”<sup foot_note="180517">1</sup>
Say: “Our Lord will bring us together and then He will rightly judge between us. He is the Great Judge, the All-Knowing.”<sup foot_note="180518">1</sup>
Say: “Show me those whom you have attached to Him as His associates (in Divinity).”<sup foot_note="180519">1</sup> Nay, Allah alone is Most Mighty, Most Wise.
(O Prophet), We have not sent you forth but as a herald of good news and a warner for all mankind. But most people do not know.<sup foot_note="180520">1</sup>
They ask you: “When will this promise (of Resurrection) be fulfilled, if what you say is true?”<sup foot_note="180521">1</sup>
Say: “Your day is appointed, you can neither hold back its coming by an hour, nor hasten it by an hour.”<sup foot_note="180522">1</sup>

The unbelievers say: “We shall never believe in this Qur'an, nor in any Scripture before it.”<sup foot_note="180523">1</sup> If you could only see the wrong-doers arrayed before their Lord, each bandying charges against the other. Those who were suppressed will say to those who waxed arrogant: “Had it not been for you, we would have been believers.”<sup foot_note="180524">2</sup>

The arrogant ones will retort to those who were suppressed: “What! Did we bar you from the guidance after it came to you? Not at all; rather you yourselves were evil-doers.”<sup foot_note="180525">1</sup>

Those who were suppressed will say to those who waxed arrogant: “By no means; it was your scheming, night and day, when you would enjoin us to disbelieve in Allah and set up others as equals to Him.”<sup foot_note="180526">1</sup> When they are confronted with the chastisement, they will be remorseful in their hearts. We shall put fetters around the necks of the unbelievers. Can people be requited except for their deeds?
We never sent a warner to any town but its wealthy ones said: “We disbelieve in the Message you have brought.”<sup foot_note="180527">1</sup>
They always said: “We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised.”<sup foot_note="180528">1</sup>
(O Prophet), say to them: “My Lord grants provision abundantly to whomsoever He pleases and straitens it for whomsoever He pleases. But most people do not know this.<sup foot_note="180529">1</sup>

It is not your riches nor your children that make you near-stationed to Us, except for him who has faith and acts righteously;<sup foot_note="180530">1</sup> it is they who will receive double the recompense for their deeds. They shall live in lofty mansions in perfect peace.<sup foot_note="180531">2</sup>
As for those who work against Our Signs so as to frustrate them, they shall be arraigned into the chastisement.

Say, (O Prophet): “Verily, my Lord grants provision abundantly to whomsoever He pleases and straitens it for whomsoever He pleases.<sup foot_note="180532">1</sup> Whatever you spend, He will replace it. He is the Best of all Providers.”<sup foot_note="180533">2</sup>
And on the Day when He will muster them all and will ask the angels: “Are they the ones who worshipped you?”<sup foot_note="180534">1</sup>
They will reply: “Glory to You! You are our Protector, not they.<sup foot_note="180535">1</sup> Nay, they rather used to worship the jinn. Most of them believe in them.”

Today none of you has the power to benefit or harm another;<sup foot_note="180536">1</sup> and We shall say to the evil-doers: “Taste now the chastisement of the Fire which you used to deny, calling it a lie.”

When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them they say: “This is a person who wants to turn you away from the deities whom your ancestors worshipped.” They say: “This is nothing but an invented falsehood.” And when the Truth came to the unbelievers they declared: “This is nothing but plain sorcery,”
whereas We gave them no Books that they could study nor sent to them any warner before you.<sup foot_note="180537">1</sup>

Those who went before them also denounced (Allah's Messengers) as liars. They have not attained even a tenth of what We had given them. But when they rejected My Messengers, calling them liars, how terrible was My chastisement!<sup foot_note="180538">1</sup>

Say to them, (O Prophet): “I give you but one counsel: stand up (for heaven's sake), singly and in pairs, and then think: what is it in your companion(to wit, Muhammad) that could be deemed as madness?”<sup foot_note="180539">1</sup> He is nothing but a warner, warning you before the coming of a grevious chastisement.<sup foot_note="180540">2</sup>
Say to them: “Whatever recompense I might ask of you, it shall be yours.<sup foot_note="180542">1</sup> My recompense is with Allah, and He is witness over everything.”<sup foot_note="180543">2</sup>
Say to them: “My Lord hurls down the Truth (upon me).<sup foot_note="180544">1</sup> He knows fully all that lies beyond the range of perception.”
Say: “The Truth has come and falsehood can neither originate nor recreate anything.”

Say: “If I go astray then the hurt of straying will come only upon me. But if I am rightly-guided, that is only because of the revelation that my Lord makes to me. He is All-Hearing, Ever Nigh.”<sup foot_note="180545">1</sup>
If you could only see when the unbelievers will go about in a state of terror. They will have no escape and will be seized from a place near at hand.<sup foot_note="180546">1</sup>
They will then say: “We believe in it”;<sup foot_note="180547">1</sup> but whence can they attain it from so far-off a place?<sup foot_note="180548">2</sup>
They disbelieved in it before and indulged in conjectures from far away.<sup foot_note="180549">1</sup>
A barrier will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with the likes of them before. Surely they were in a disquieting doubt.<sup foot_note="180550">1</sup>

All praise be to Allah, the Fashioner of the heavens and earth, Who appointed angels<sup foot_note="180551">1</sup> as His message bearers, having two, three, four wings.<sup foot_note="180552">2</sup> He adds to His creation whatever He pleases.<sup foot_note="180553">3</sup> Verily Allah has power over everything.

Whatever Mercy Allah accords to people, none can withhold; and whatever He withholds, no other will be able to release after Him.<sup foot_note="180554">1</sup> He is Most Mighty, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="180555">2</sup>

O people, remember Allah's favour upon you.<sup foot_note="180556">1</sup> Is there any creator, apart from Allah, who provides you your sustenance out of the heavens and earth? There is no god but He. Whither are you, then, being misdirected?<sup foot_note="180557">2</sup>

(O Prophet), (there is nothing novel in it) if they cry lies to you;<sup foot_note="180558">1</sup>Messengers before you were also cried lies to. To Allah shall all matters be sent back.<sup foot_note="180559">2</sup>

O people, assuredly Allah's promise is true.<sup foot_note="180560">1</sup> So let the life of the world not delude you,<sup foot_note="180561">2</sup> and let not the Deluder delude you concerning Allah.<sup foot_note="180562">3</sup>
Surely Satan is an enemy to you. Therefore, do take him as an enemy. He calls his followers to his way so that they may be among the inmates of the Fire.

A severe chastisement lies in store for those that disbelieve,<sup foot_note="180563">1</sup> but there is pardon and a great reward for those that believe and work righteous deeds.<sup foot_note="180564">2</sup>

(How<sup foot_note="180565">1</sup> awful is the straying of the person) for whom his evil deed has been embellished so that it looks fair to him?<sup foot_note="180566">2</sup> The fact is that Allah causes whomsoever He will to fall into error and shows the Right Way to whomsoever He will. So, (O Prophet), let not your life go to waste sorrowing over them.<sup foot_note="180567">3</sup> Allah is well aware of all that they do.<sup foot_note="180568">4</sup>

It is Allah Who sends forth winds which then set the clouds in motion, which We drive to some dead land giving a fresh life to earth after it had become dead. Such will be the resurrection of the dead.<sup foot_note="180569">1</sup>

He who seeks glory, let him know that all glory belongs to Allah alone. <sup foot_note="180570">1</sup> To Him do good words go up, and righteous action uplifts them.<sup foot_note="180571">2</sup> But those who contrive evil deeds,<sup foot_note="180572">3</sup> a severe punishment lies in store for them, and their contriving will come to naught.

Allah<sup foot_note="180573">1</sup> created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm,<sup foot_note="180574">2</sup> then He made you into pairs. No female conceives, nor delivers (a child) except with His knowledge. None is given a long life nor is any diminished in his life but it is written in a Book.<sup foot_note="180575">3</sup> Surely that is quite easy for Allah.<sup foot_note="180576">4</sup>

The two masses of water are not alike.<sup foot_note="180577">1</sup> The one is sweet, sates thirst, and is pleasant to drink from, while the other is salt, bitter on the tongue. Yet from both you eat fresh meat,<sup foot_note="180578">2</sup> and extract from it ornaments that you wear;<sup foot_note="180579">3</sup> and you see ships cruising through it that you may seek of His Bounty and be thankful to Him.

He causes the night to phase into the day and the day into the night,<sup foot_note="180581">1</sup> and He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running its course to an appointed term.<sup foot_note="180582">2</sup> That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs the Kingdom; but those whom you call upon, apart from Allah, possess not so much as the skin of a date-stone.<sup foot_note="180583">3</sup>

If you call upon them, they cannot hear your prayer. And if they hear it, they cannot answer it.<sup foot_note="180584">1</sup> On the Day of Resurrection they will disown you for associating others with Allah in His Divinity.<sup foot_note="180585">2</sup> No one can inform you of the truth save the All-Aware.<sup foot_note="180586">3</sup>
O people, it is you who stand in need of Allah;<sup foot_note="180587">1</sup> as for Allah, He is Self-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="180588">2</sup>
If He wishes, He can remove you and put in your place a new creation.
That surely is not difficult for Allah.<sup foot_note="180589">1</sup>

No one can bear another's burden.<sup foot_note="180590">1</sup> If a heavily laden one should call another to carry his load, none of it shall be carried by the other, even though he be a near of kin.<sup foot_note="180591">2</sup> (O Prophet), you can warn only those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and establish Prayer.<sup foot_note="180592">3</sup> Whoever purifies himself does so to his own good. To Allah is the final return.
The blind and the seeing are not alike,
nor darkness and light;
nor cool shade and torrid heat;

nor are the living and the dead alike.<sup foot_note="180593">1</sup> Allah makes to hear whomsoever He wishes, but you, (O Prophet), cannot cause to hear those who are in their graves.<sup foot_note="180594">2</sup>
You are no more than a warner.<sup foot_note="180595">1</sup>
We have sent you with the Truth to proclaim good news and to warn. Never has there been a nation but a warner came to it.<sup foot_note="180596">1</sup>

If they give the lie to you now, those that went before them also gave the lie to their Messengers when they came to them with Clear Proofs,<sup foot_note="180597">1</sup> with Scriptures, and with the Illuminating Book.<sup foot_note="180598">2</sup>
Then I seized those who denied the Truth, and how terrible was My punishment!
Do you not see that Allah sent down water from the sky with which We brought forth fruits of diverse hues? In the mountains there are white and red, of diverse hues, and pitchy black;

and human beings too, and beasts, and cattle � diverse are their hues.<sup foot_note="180599">1</sup>From among His servants, it is only those who know that fear Allah.<sup foot_note="180600">2</sup> Verily Allah is Most Mighty, Most Forgiving.<sup foot_note="180601">3</sup>
Surely those who recite the Book of Allah and establish Prayer and spend, privately and publicly, out of what We have provided them, look forward to a trade that shall suffer no loss;

(a trade in which they have invested their all) so that Allah may pay them their wages in full and may add to them out of His Bounty.<sup foot_note="180602">1</sup> He is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative.<sup foot_note="180603">2</sup>

(O Prophet), the Book We have revealed to you is the Truth, confirming the Books that came before it.<sup foot_note="180604">1</sup> Verily Allah is well aware of His servants and sees everything.<sup foot_note="180605">2</sup>

Then We bequeathed the Book to those of Our servants that We chose.<sup foot_note="180606">1</sup>Now, some of them wrong themselves and some follow the medium course; and some, by Allah's leave, vie with each other in acts of goodness. That is the great bounty.<sup foot_note="180607">2</sup>
They shall enter the everlasting Gardens,<sup foot_note="180608">1</sup> shall be adorned with bracelets of gold and with pearls, and their apparel therein shall be silk.
They will say: “All praise be to Allah Who has taken away all sorrow from us.<sup foot_note="180609">1</sup> Surely our Lord is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative;<sup foot_note="180610">2</sup>
(the Lord) Who, out of His Bounty, has made us dwell in an abode<sup foot_note="180611">1</sup>wherein no toil, nor fatigue affects us.<sup foot_note="180612">2</sup>

As for those who disbelieved, <sup foot_note="180613">1</sup> the Fire of Hell awaits them. There they shall not be finished off and die; nor will the torment (of Hell) be lightened for them. Thus do We requite every thankless being.

They will cry out in Hell and say: “Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before.” (They will be told): “Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed?<sup foot_note="180614">1</sup>Besides, there came a warner to you. So have a taste of the torment now. None may come to the help of the wrong-doers.”
Surely Allah knows the Unseen in the heavens and the earth. He even knows the secrets hidden in people's breasts.

It is He Who made you vicegerents in the earth.<sup foot_note="180615">1</sup> So whoever disbelieves will bear the burden of his unbelief.<sup foot_note="180616">2</sup> The unbelievers' unbelief adds nothing but Allah's wrath against them. The unbelievers' unbelief adds nothing but their own loss.

Say to them (O Prophet): “Have you ever seen those of your associates<sup foot_note="180617">1</sup> upon whom you call apart from Allah? Show me what have they created in the earth? Or do they have any partnership (with Allah) in the heavens? Or have We given them a Book so that they have a clear proof (for associating others with Allah in His Divinity)?”<sup foot_note="180618">2</sup> Nay, what these wrong-doers promise each other is nothing but delusion.<sup foot_note="180619">3</sup>

Surely Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they should be displaced there, for if they were displaced none would be able to hold them after Him.<sup foot_note="180620">1</sup>Surely He is Most Forbearing, Most Forgiving.<sup foot_note="180621">2</sup>

Swearing by Allah their strongest oaths they claimed that if a warner came to them they would be better-guided than any other people.<sup foot_note="180622">1</sup> But when a warner did come to them, his coming only increased their aversion (to the Truth).

They began to wax even more proud on earth and contrived evil designs although the contriving of evil designs only overtakes their authors. Are they waiting, then, for anything except what happened to the nations before them?<sup foot_note="180623">1</sup> You shall not find any change in the Way of Allah; and you shall not find anything that can ever alter the Way of Allah.

Have they not journeyed in the earth to behold the end of those who went before them though they were stronger than them in might? Nothing in the heavens nor on earth can frustrate Him in the least. He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.

If Allah were to take people to task for their deeds, He would not leave any living creature on earth, but He grants them respite to an appointed time. When their appointed time comes to an end, surely Allah fully observes His servants.
Ya'. Sin.<sup foot_note="180624">1</sup>
By the Wise Qur'an,
you are truly among the Messengers,<sup foot_note="180625">1</sup>
on a Straight Way,
(and this Qur'an) is a revelation from the Most Mighty, the Most Compassionate<sup foot_note="180626">1</sup>
so that you may warn a people whose ancestors were not warned before wherefore they are heedless.<sup foot_note="180627">1</sup>
Surely most of them merit the decree of chastisement; so they do not believe.<sup foot_note="180628">1</sup>
We have put fetters around their necks which reach up to their chins so that they are standing with their heads upright,<sup foot_note="180629">1</sup>
and We have put a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, and have covered them up, so they are unable to see.<sup foot_note="180630">1</sup>
It is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them for they shall not believe.<sup foot_note="180631">1</sup>
You can warn only him who follows the Admonition and fears the Merciful Lord without seeing Him. Give such a one good tidings of forgiveness and a generous reward.
We shall surely raise the dead to life and We record what they did and the traces of their deeds that they have left behind.<sup foot_note="180632">1</sup> We have encompassed that in a Clear Book.
Recite to them, as a case in point, the story of the people of the town when the Messengers came to them.<sup foot_note="180633">1</sup>
We sent to them two Messengers and they rejected both of them as liars. Then We strengthened them with a third (Messenger).

They said: “We have been sent to you as Messengers.” The people of the town said: “You are only human beings like ourselves,<sup foot_note="180634">1</sup> and the Merciful Lord has revealed nothing.<sup foot_note="180635">2</sup> You are simply lying.”
The Messengers said: “Our Lord knows that we have indeed been sent to you
and our duty is no more than to clearly convey the Message.”<sup foot_note="180541">1</sup>
The people of the town said: “We believe you are an evil omen for us. If you do not desist, we will stone you or you will receive a grievous chastisement from us.”<sup foot_note="180580">1</sup>

The Messengers replied: “Your evil omen is with you.<sup foot_note="180636">1</sup> (Are you saying this) because you were asked to take heed? The truth is that you are a people who have exceeded all bounds.”<sup foot_note="180637">2</sup>
In the meantime a man came running from the far end of the town, saying: “My people, follow the Messengers;
follow those who do not ask any recompense from you and are rightly-guided.<sup foot_note="180638">1</sup>
Why should I not serve the One Who created me and to Whom all of you shall be sent back?<sup foot_note="180639">1</sup>

What! Shall I take any deities apart from Him whose intercession will not avail me the least were the Merciful One to bring any adversity upon me, nor will they be able to rescue me?<sup foot_note="180640">1</sup>
Surely in that case<sup foot_note="180641">1</sup> I should indeed be in evident error.
I believe in your Lord;<sup foot_note="180642">1</sup> so listen to me.”
(Eventually they killed him and he was told): “Enter Paradise.”<sup foot_note="180643">1</sup> The man exclaimed: “Would that my people knew
for what reason Allah has forgiven me and placed me among the honoured ones.”<sup foot_note="180644">1</sup>
After him, We did not send down any hosts from the heaven; We stood in no need to send down any host.
There was but a single Blast and suddenly they became silent and still.<sup foot_note="180645">1</sup>
Alas for My servants! Never does a Messenger come to them but they mock him.
Have they not seen how many nations before them did We destroy? Thereafter they never came back to them.<sup foot_note="180646">1</sup>
All of them shall (one day) be gathered before Us.
Let the<sup foot_note="180647">1</sup> dead earth be a Sign for them.<sup foot_note="180648">2</sup> We gave it life and produced from it grain whereof they eat.
We made in it gardens of date-palms and vines, and We caused springs to gush forth
that they might eat of its fruits. It was not their hands that made them.<sup foot_note="180649">1</sup> Will they not, then, give thanks?<sup foot_note="180650">2</sup>
Holy is He<sup foot_note="180651">1</sup> Who created all things in pairs, whether it be of what the earth produces, and of themselves, and of what they do not know.<sup foot_note="180652">2</sup>
And the night is another Sign for them. We strip the day from it and they become plunged in darkness.<sup foot_note="180653">1</sup>
The sun is running its course to its appointed place.<sup foot_note="180654">1</sup> That is the ordaining of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
We have appointed stages for the moon till it returns in the shape of a dry old branch of palm-tree.<sup foot_note="180655">1</sup>

Neither does it lie in the sun's power to overtake the moon<sup foot_note="180656">1</sup> nor can the night outstrip the day.<sup foot_note="180657">2</sup> All glide along, each in its own orbit.<sup foot_note="180658">3</sup>
Another Sign for them is that We carried all their offspring in the laden vessel<sup foot_note="180659">1</sup>
and then created for them other vessels like those on which they ride.<sup foot_note="180660">1</sup>
Should We so wish, We can drown them, and there will be none to heed their cries of distress, nor will they be rescued.
It is only Our Mercy (that rescues them) and enables enjoyment of life for a while.<sup foot_note="180661">1</sup>
When it is said to such people: “Guard yourselves against what is ahead of you and what has preceded you<sup foot_note="180662">1</sup> that mercy be shown to you” (they pay scant heed to it).
Never does any Sign of their Lord come to them, but they turn away from it.<sup foot_note="180663">1</sup>

And when it is said to them: “Spend (in the Way of Allah) out of the sustenance that Allah has provided you,” the unbelievers say to the believers: “Shall we feed him whom, Allah would have fed, had He so wished?” Say: “You are in evident error.”<sup foot_note="180664">1</sup>
They<sup foot_note="180665">1</sup> say: “When will this threat (of Resurrection) come to pass? Tell us if indeed you are truthful.”<sup foot_note="180666">2</sup>
The Truth is that they are waiting for nothing but a mighty Blast to seize them the while they are disputing (in their worldly affairs),
and they will not even be able to make a testament, nor to return to their households.<sup foot_note="180667">1</sup>
Then the Trumpet shall be blown and lo! they will come out of their graves and be on the move towards their Lord,<sup foot_note="180668">1</sup>

(nervously) exclaiming. “Alas for us! Who roused us out of our sleeping-place?”<sup foot_note="180669">1</sup> “This is what the Merciful One had promised, and what (His) Messengers had said was true.”<sup foot_note="180670">2</sup>
Then there will simply be one single Blast, and all will have gathered before Us.
Today<sup foot_note="180671">1</sup> no one shall suffer the least injustice, and you shall not be recompensed except according to your deeds.
Indeed, the people of Paradise will be busy enjoying themselves:<sup foot_note="180672">1</sup>
they and their spouses shall be reclining on their couches in shady groves;
therein there will be all kinds of fruits to eat, and they shall have all that they desire.
“Peace” shall be the word conveyed to them from their Merciful Lord.
“Criminals, separate yourselves from others today!<sup foot_note="180673">1</sup>
Children of Adam, did I not command you not to serve Satan � he is to you an open enemy
and serve Me alone: this is the Straight Way?<sup foot_note="180674">1</sup>
Still, he misguided a whole throng of you. Did you have no sense?<sup foot_note="180675">1</sup>
Now this is the Hell of which you were warned.
Burn in it on account of your disbelieving.
Today We shall put a seal on their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us and their feet shall bear witness to what they had been doing.<sup foot_note="180676">1</sup>
If We so willed, We would have put out their eyes, then they would rush to see the Way, but how would they be able to see?
If We so willed, We would have transformed them where they were so that they would not go forward or backward.<sup foot_note="180677">1</sup>
Whomsoever We grant a long life, We reverse him in his constitution.<sup foot_note="180678">1</sup> Do they still not understand?
We did not teach him (to wit, the Messenger) poetry and it does not behove him.<sup foot_note="180679">1</sup> This is none but an Admonition, and a Clear Book
that he may warn him who is alive<sup foot_note="180680">1</sup> and establish an argument against those that deny the Truth.
Do they not see Our handiwork:<sup foot_note="180681">1</sup> We created for them cattle which they own?
We have subjected the cattle to them so that some of them they ride and eat the flesh of others.
They derive a variety of benefits and drinks from them. Will they, then, not give thanks?<sup foot_note="180682">1</sup>
They set up deities apart from Allah, hoping that they will receive help from them.
Those deities can render them no help. Yet these devotees act as though they were an army in waiting for them.<sup foot_note="180683">1</sup>
Let not their words grieve you. Surely We know all things about them, what they conceal and what they reveal.<sup foot_note="180684">1</sup>
Does<sup foot_note="180685">1</sup> man not see that We created him of a sperm drop, and lo! he is flagrantly contentious?<sup foot_note="180686">2</sup>
He strikes for Us<sup foot_note="180687">1</sup> a similitude and forgot his own creation.<sup foot_note="180688">2</sup> He says: “Who will quicken the bones when they have decayed?”
Say: “He Who first brought them into being will quicken them; He knows well about every kind of creation;
He Who created from a green tree a fire for you, a fire to light your stoves with.”<sup foot_note="180689">1</sup>
Has He Who created the heavens and the earth no power to create the likes of them? Yes, indeed, He is the Superb Creator.
Whenever He wills a thing, He just commands it “Be” and it is.
Holy is He Who has full control over everything, and to Him you shall all be recalled.
By those who range themselves in rows;
by those who reprove severely,
and those who recite the Exhortation;<sup foot_note="180690">1</sup>
surely your God is One,<sup foot_note="180691">1</sup>
the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of whatever lies between the two, the Lord<sup foot_note="180692">1</sup> of the Easts.<sup foot_note="180693">2</sup>
We have adorned the lower heaven with the adornment of the stars<sup foot_note="180694">1</sup>
and have protected it from every rebellious satan.<sup foot_note="180695">1</sup>
These satans cannot listen to what transpires in the High Council for they are pelted away from every side
and are repelled. Theirs is an unceasing chastisement.
And if any is able to snatch a fragment, he is pursued by a piercing flame.<sup foot_note="180696">1</sup>
So ask them (that is, human beings): “Were they harder to create than the objects We created?”<sup foot_note="180697">1</sup> We created them from sticky clay.<sup foot_note="180698">2</sup>
You marvel (at the wondrous creations of Allah) and they scoff at it,
and when they are admonished, they pay no heed;
and if they see any Sign, they laugh it away
and say: “This is nothing but plain sorcery.<sup foot_note="180699">1</sup>
Is it ever possible that after we die and are reduced to dust and (a skeleton of) bones, we will be raised to life?
And so also shall our forefathers of yore be raised to life?”
Tell them: “Yes; and you are utterly helpless (against Allah).”<sup foot_note="180700">1</sup>
There will be a single stern rebuff and lo, they will be observing with their own eyes (all that they had been warned against).<sup foot_note="180701">1</sup>
They will then say: “Woe for us. This is the Day of Judgement.”
“Yes, this is the Day of Final Decision that you used to deny as a lie.”<sup foot_note="180702">1</sup>
(Then will the command be given): “Muster all the wrong-doers<sup foot_note="180703">1</sup> and their spouses<sup foot_note="180704">2</sup> and the deities whom they used to serve
apart from Allah,<sup foot_note="180705">1</sup> and direct them to the path of Hell,
and detain them there; they will be called to account.
How is it that you are not helping one another?
Indeed, today they are surrendering themselves completely.”<sup foot_note="180706">1</sup>
They will then turn towards each other (and start wrangling).
(The followers will say to their leaders): “You used to come to us from the right hand.”<sup foot_note="180707">1</sup>
They will say: “Nay, you yourselves were not the ones who would believe.
We had no power over you. You were a rebellious people,
and so we became deserving of the Word of our Lord that we shall be made to suffer chastisement.
So we led you astray; we ourselves were strayed.”<sup foot_note="180708">1</sup>
On that Day, they will all share the chastisement.<sup foot_note="180709">1</sup>
Thus do We treat the culprits.
Whenever it was said to them: “There is no true deity apart from Allah,” they waxed proud
and said: “Shall we forsake our deities for the sake of a distracted poet?”
(They say so although) he brought the Truth and confirmed the veracity of the Messengers.<sup foot_note="180710">1</sup>
(They will be told): “You shall taste the grievous chastisement.
You will only be recompensed according to your deeds.”
But Allah's chosen servants (shall be spared this woeful end).
For them awaits a known provision,<sup foot_note="180711">1</sup>
a variety of delicious fruits; and they shall be honoured<sup foot_note="180712">1</sup>
in the Gardens of Bliss.
They will be seated upon couches set face to face;
a cup filled with wine<sup foot_note="180713">1</sup> from its springs,<sup foot_note="180714">2</sup> will be passed around to them;<sup foot_note="180715">3</sup>
white, sparkling (wine), a delight to the drinkers.
There will neither be any harm in it for their body nor will it intoxicate their mind.<sup foot_note="180716">1</sup>
Theirs shall be wide-eyed maidens<sup foot_note="180717">1</sup> with bashful, restrained glances,<sup foot_note="180718">2</sup>
so delicate as the hidden peel under an egg's shell.<sup foot_note="180719">1</sup>
Then some of them will turn to others, and will ask each other.
One of them will say: “I had a companion in the world
who used to say: �Are you also one of those who confirm the Truth (of life after death)?
After we are dead and have become all dust and bones shall we still be requited?'<sup foot_note="180720">1</sup>
He will say: �Do you wish to know where he is now?'
Then he will look downwards, and will see him in the depths of Hell.
He will say to him: �By Allah, you almost ruined me.
But for Allah's favour, I should be one of those who have been mustered here.<sup foot_note="180721">1</sup>
So, are we not going to die,
except for our first death? And shall we suffer no chastisement?'”<sup foot_note="180722">1</sup>
Surely this is the supreme triumph.
For the like of it should the workers work.
Is this a better hospitality or the tree of al-Zaqqum?<sup foot_note="180723">1</sup>
We have made this tree a trial for the wrong-doers.<sup foot_note="180724">1</sup>
It is a tree that grows in the nethermost part of Hell.
Its spathes are like the heads of satans.<sup foot_note="180725">1</sup>
(The people of Hell) will surely eat of it, filling their bellies with it.
Then on top of it they will have a brew of boiling water.
Then their return will be to the same blazing Hell.<sup foot_note="179897">1</sup>
These are the ones who found their fathers steeped in error,
and they are running in their footsteps.
Before them a multitude of people of olden times had erred,
and We had sent among them Messengers to warn them.
Observe, then, what was the end of those that had been warned,
except for the chosen servants of Allah?<sup foot_note="180726">1</sup>
Noah<sup foot_note="180727">1</sup> had called upon Us (earlier).<sup foot_note="180728">2</sup> See, how excellent We were in answering him!
We delivered him and his household from the great calamity;<sup foot_note="180729">1</sup>
and made his offspring the only ones to survive,<sup foot_note="180730">1</sup>
and We established for him a good name among posterity.
Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.<sup foot_note="180731">1</sup>
Thus do We reward all those who do good.
Surely he was one of Our truly believing servants.
Thereafter We caused the others to be drowned.
Abraham was on the self-same way (as Noah).
When he came to his Lord with a pure heart,<sup foot_note="180732">1</sup>
and said to his father and his people:<sup foot_note="180733">1</sup> “Whom do you worship?
Is it false deities that you want to serve rather than Allah?
What do you think of the Lord of the whole Universe?”<sup foot_note="180734">1</sup>
Then<sup foot_note="180735">1</sup> he looked carefully at the stars<sup foot_note="180736">2</sup>
and said: “I am sick.”<sup foot_note="180737">1</sup>
So turning their backs, they went away from him.<sup foot_note="180738">1</sup>
Then he went quietly to the (temple of the deities) and said: “What is the matter with you, why do you not eat?<sup foot_note="180739">1</sup>
What is the matter with you, why do you not speak?”
Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand,
whereupon people came to him running.<sup foot_note="180740">1</sup>
Abraham said to them: “Do you worship what you yourselves have carved with your own hands
while it is Allah Who has created you and all that you make?”
They spoke among themselves: “Build him a pyre and then throw him into the furnace.”
They had contrived an evil plan against him, but We abased them all.<sup foot_note="180741">1</sup>
Abraham said:<sup foot_note="180742">1</sup> “I am going to my Lord;<sup foot_note="180743">2</sup> He will guide me.
Lord, grant me a righteous son.”<sup foot_note="180744">1</sup>
(In response to this prayer) We gave him the good news of a prudent boy;<sup foot_note="180745">1</sup>

and when he was old enough to go about and work with him, (one day) Abraham said to him: “My son, I see in my dream that I am slaughtering you.<sup foot_note="180746">1</sup> So consider (and tell me) what you think.”<sup foot_note="180747">2</sup> He said: “Do as you are bidden.<sup foot_note="180748">3</sup> You will find me, if Allah so wills, among the steadfast.”
When both surrendered (to Allah's command) and Abraham flung the son down on his forehead,<sup foot_note="180749">1</sup>
We cried out:<sup foot_note="180750">1</sup> “O Abraham,
you have indeed fulfilled your dream.<sup foot_note="180751">1</sup> Thus do We reward the good-doers.”<sup foot_note="180752">2</sup>
This was indeed a plain trial.<sup foot_note="180753">1</sup>
And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,<sup foot_note="180754">1</sup>
and We preserved for him a good name among posterity.
Peace be upon Abraham.
Thus do We reward the good-doers.
Surely he was one of Our believing servants.
And We gave him the good news of Isaac,<sup foot_note="180755">1</sup> a Prophet and among the righteous ones.<sup foot_note="180756">2</sup>
And We blessed him and Isaac. Among the offspring of the two some did good and some plainly wronged themselves.
Verily We bestowed Our favours on Moses and Aaron
and We delivered both of them and their people from the great calamity.<sup foot_note="180757">1</sup>
We succoured them, and they gained the upper hand (against their enemies).
We granted them a Clear Book,
and showed them the Straight Way,
and preserved for them a good name among posterity.
Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.
Thus do We reward the good-doers.
Surely both of them were among Our believing servants.
Surely, Elias too was among the Messengers.<sup foot_note="180758">1</sup>
(Call to mind) when he said to his people: “Will you not fear Allah?
Do you call upon Baal<sup foot_note="180759">1</sup> and forsake the Best of the Creators?
Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors of yore.”
But they denounced him as a liar, so they will surely be arraigned (for punishment),
except Allah's chosen servants.<sup foot_note="180760">1</sup>
We preserved a good name for him among posterity.<sup foot_note="180761">1</sup>
Peace be upon Elias.<sup foot_note="180762">1</sup>
Thus do We reward the good-doers.
He was one of Our believing servants.
And Lot too was one of the Messengers.
(Call to mind) when We delivered him and all his kinsfolk,
except for an old woman who was among those that stayed behind.<sup foot_note="180763">1</sup>
Then We utterly destroyed the rest of them.
