You pass by their desolate habitations in the morning<sup foot_note="180764">1</sup>
and at night. Do you still not understand?
And Jonah too was one of the Messengers.<sup foot_note="180765">1</sup>
Call to mind when he fled to the laden ship,<sup foot_note="180766">1</sup>
cast lots, and was among the losers.
Then a fish swallowed him, and he was blameworthy.<sup foot_note="180767">1</sup>
Had he not been one of those who glorify Allah,<sup foot_note="180768">1</sup>
he would certainly have remained in its belly till the Day of Resurrection.<sup foot_note="180769">1</sup>
But We threw him on a wide bare tract of land while he was ill;<sup foot_note="180770">1</sup>
and caused a gourd tree<sup foot_note="180771">1</sup> to grow over him,
and We sent him forth to a nation of a hundred thousand or more,<sup foot_note="180772">1</sup>
and they believed. So We let them enjoy life for a while.<sup foot_note="180773">1</sup>
So ask their opinion:<sup foot_note="180774">1</sup> “(Are you convinced) that your Lord should have daughters and you should have sons?<sup foot_note="180775">2</sup>
Did We create the angels as females the while they witnessed?”
Behold, it is one of their fabrications that they say:
“Allah has begotten.” They are liars!
Did He choose daughters rather than sons?
What is the matter with you that you make such strange judgements?
Will you then not take heed?
Do you have any clear authority for such claims?
Bring your Book, if you are truthful.<sup foot_note="180776">1</sup>
They have established a kinship between Allah and the angels;<sup foot_note="180777">1</sup> and the angels know well that these people will be arraigned (as culprits).
(They say): “Exalted be Allah above what they attribute to Him,
all of them except the chosen servants of Allah.
So you and your deities
shall not be able to tempt anyone away from Allah
except him who shall roast in the Blazing Fire.<sup foot_note="180778">1</sup>
As for us, there is none but has an appointed station.<sup foot_note="180779">1</sup>
Verily we range ourselves in rows (as humble servants)
and we are of those who glorify Allah.”
They used to say before:
“If only we had the Reminder which had been granted to the people of yore
we would surely have been Allah's chosen servants.”<sup foot_note="180780">1</sup>
But when it came to them, they rejected it. They shall soon come to know (the end of such an attitude).
We have already given Our promise to Our Messengers
that they shall certainly be succoured,
and that Our hosts shall triumph.<sup foot_note="180781">1</sup>
So, (O Prophet), leave them alone for a while,
and see, and soon they too shall see.<sup foot_note="180782">1</sup>
Do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?
When that chastisement will descend upon their courtyard, evil shall that Day be for those who had been warned.
Leave them alone for a while,
and see; and they too shall soon see.
Exalted be your Lord, the Lord of Glory, above what they attribute to Him,
and peace be upon the Messengers,
and all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Universe.
Sad,<sup foot_note="180783">1</sup> and by the Qur'an full of exhortation!<sup foot_note="180784">2</sup>
Nay, but the unbelievers are steeped in arrogance and stubborn defiance.<sup foot_note="180785">1</sup>
How many a nation did We destroy before them! (When they approached their doom) they cried out (for deliverance), but the time for deliverance was already past.

They wondered that a warner had come to them from among themselves,<sup foot_note="180786">1</sup>and the deniers of the Truth said: “This is a sorcerer,<sup foot_note="180787">2</sup> and a big liar.
Has he made the gods one single God? This is truly astounding.”

And the elders among them went forth<sup foot_note="180788">1</sup> saying: “Go ahead and be steadfast in adhering to your deities.<sup foot_note="180789">2</sup> What is being said is with a design.”<sup foot_note="180790">3</sup>
We have not heard this in the religious community close to our time.<sup foot_note="180791">1</sup> This is nothing but a fabrication.

Has this Exhortation been sent down among us only to him, to the exclusion of all others?” Nay, they are in doubt regarding My Exhortation,<sup foot_note="180792">1</sup> and are saying all this because they have not yet had any taste of My chastisement.
Do they possess the treasures of your Lord, the Most Mighty, the Great Bestower?
Or do they possess the dominion of the heavens and the earth and of all that is in between them? If so, let them ascend the heights of the realm of causation and see!<sup foot_note="180793">1</sup>
This is only a small army out of the several armies that will suffer defeat here.<sup foot_note="180794">1</sup>
Before them the people of Noah, Ad, and Pharaoh of the tent-pegs gave the lie (to the Messengers)<sup foot_note="180795">1</sup>
and so did Thamud and the people of Lot and the people of Aykah. These were all leagued together.
Each of them gave the lie to Messengers and My decree of chastisement came upon them.
They are waiting for nothing except a single Cry, after which there will be no second Cry.<sup foot_note="180796">1</sup>
They say: “Our Lord, hasten to us our share (of chastisement) before the Day of Reckoning.”<sup foot_note="180797">1</sup>

(O Prophet), bear with patience what they say,<sup foot_note="180798">1</sup> and call to mind Our servant David,<sup foot_note="180799">2</sup> who was endowed with great strength<sup foot_note="180800">3</sup> and who constantly turned (to Allah).
With him We had subjected the mountains that they join him in celebrating Allah's glory, evening and morning,
and the birds, too, in their flocks, and turn again and again to celebrating Allah's glory.<sup foot_note="180801">1</sup>
And We strengthened his kingdom and endowed him with wisdom and decisive judgement.<sup foot_note="180802">1</sup>
Has the story of the litigants reached you � of those who entered his private chambers by climbing over the wall?<sup foot_note="180803">1</sup>

As they came upon David � and he was frightened of them<sup foot_note="180804">1</sup> � they said: “Be not afraid. We are just two litigants: one of us has committed excess against the other. So judge rightly between us, and be not unjust; and guide us to the Right Way.

Behold, this is my brother;<sup foot_note="180805">1</sup> he has ninety-nine ewes and I have only one ewe.” And yet he said: “Give her into my charge,” and he got the better of me in argument.<sup foot_note="180806">2</sup>

David said: “He has certainly wronged you in seeking to add your ewe to his ewes;<sup foot_note="180807">1</sup> and indeed many who live together commit excesses, one to the other, except those that believe and act righteously; and they are but few.” (While so saying) David realized that it is We Who have put him to test; therefore, he sought the forgiveness of his Lord, and fell down, bowing and penitently turning (to Him).<sup foot_note="180808">2</sup>
Thereupon We forgave him his shortcoming and indeed (an exalted position of) nearness awaits him, and an excellent resort.<sup foot_note="180809">1</sup>

(We said to him): “O David, We have appointed you vicegerent on earth. Therefore, rule among people with justice and do not follow (your) desire lest it should lead you astray from Allah's Path. Allah's severe chastisement awaits those who stray away from Allah's Path, for they had forgotten the Day of Reckoning.<sup foot_note="180810">1</sup>

We did not create this heaven and earth and all that lies between them in vain. That is the fancy of those who denied the Truth.<sup foot_note="180811">1</sup> So woe from the Fire to all who deny the Truth.
Shall We then treat alike those that believe and act righteously and those that create mischief on earth? Or treat alike the God-fearing and the wicked?<sup foot_note="180812">1</sup>

This is the Blessed Book<sup foot_note="180813">1</sup> that We have revealed to you, (O Muhammad), that people with understanding may reflect over its verses and those with understanding derive a lesson.
We bestowed upon David (an illustrious son), Solomon.<sup foot_note="180814">1</sup> How excellent a servant (of Ours he was)! Indeed he constantly turned to Us in devotion.
And when one evening well-trained and running horses of noble breed were brought to him<sup foot_note="180815">1</sup>
he said: “Lo! I have come to love this wealth<sup foot_note="180816">1</sup> on account of the remembrance of my Lord.” And when the horses disappeared,
(he ordered): “Bring these horses back to me,” and then he began to gently stroke their shanks and necks.<sup foot_note="180817">1</sup>
Surely We put Solomon to the test and cast upon his throne a mere body. Thereupon he penitently turned (to Us).
He said: “My Lord, forgive me and bestow upon me a kingdom such as none other after me will deserve. Surely You are the Bounteous Giver.”<sup foot_note="180818">1</sup>
We subjected the wind to him, so that it blew gently at his bidding, wherever he directed it,<sup foot_note="180819">1</sup>
and We also subjected the devils to him � all kinds of builders and divers;
and others that were bound with chains.<sup foot_note="180820">1</sup>
“This is Our bestowal. So give or withhold as you wish without account.”<sup foot_note="180821">1</sup>
Indeed an exalted position of nearness awaits him and an excellent resort.<sup foot_note="180822">1</sup>
And remember Our servant Job:<sup foot_note="180823">1</sup> when he cried to his Lord: “Behold, Satan has afflicted me with much hardship and suffering.”<sup foot_note="180824">2</sup>
(We commanded him): “Stamp your foot on earth, and here is cool water to wash with and to drink.”<sup foot_note="180825">1</sup>
And We granted to him his family and also the like of them,<sup foot_note="180826">1</sup> as a mercy from Us, and as a reminder to people of understanding,<sup foot_note="180827">2</sup>

(and We said to him): “Take in your hand a bundle of rushes and strike with it, and do not break your oath.”<sup foot_note="180828">1</sup> Indeed We found him steadfast. How excellent a servant (of Ours) he was. Indeed he constantly turned (to his Lord).<sup foot_note="180829">2</sup>
And remember Our servants � Abraham, Isaac and Jacob � they were endowed with great strength and vision.<sup foot_note="180830">1</sup>
Verily We exalted them in consideration of a sterling quality: their remembrance of the Abode of the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="180831">1</sup>
In Our sight they are among the chosen and excellent ones.
And remember Ishmael, Elisha,<sup foot_note="180832">1</sup> and Dhu al-Kifl.<sup foot_note="180833">2</sup>All were of the best.
This was a remembrance. An excellent retreat awaits the God-fearing
� everlasting Gardens with gates wide open for them<sup foot_note="180834">1</sup>
wherein they shall recline, wherein they shall ask for abundant fruit and drinks,
and wherein there shall be with them well-matched, bashful mates.<sup foot_note="180835">1</sup>
All this is what you are promised for the Day of Judgement.
This is Our provision for you, never to end.
All this (is for the God-fearing). But for the transgressors, an evil resort awaits them �
Hell, where they will be roasted. An evil place to dwell!
All this (is for them); so let them taste boiling water and pus,<sup foot_note="180836">1</sup>
and other sufferings of the kind.
(Observing their followers advancing to Hell they will say, among themselves: “This is a troop rushing in to you. There is no welcome for them. They are destined to roast in the Fire.”
They will reply: “Rather, no welcome to you. (You will roast in Hell.) It is you who led us to this end. What an evil resort!”
They will say: “Our Lord, give twofold punishment in the Fire to him who has led us to this.”
They will say to one another: “But why do we not see those whom we considered him among the wicked?<sup foot_note="180837">1</sup>
Is it that we mistakenly made fun of them; or have they disappeared from our sight?”
Verily all this is true. This is how the inmates of the Fire will dispute among themselves.
Tell them, (O Prophet):<sup foot_note="180838">1</sup> “I am nothing but a warner.<sup foot_note="180839">2</sup> There is no deity but Allah, the One, the Supreme,
the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them, the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving.”
Say: “This is a tiding of tremendous import
from which you are turning away.”<sup foot_note="180840">1</sup>
(Tell them): “I had no knowledge of the High Council when they were disputing.
I am told (about matters) by means of revelation only because I am a clear warner.”
When your Lord said to the angels:<sup foot_note="180841">1</sup> “Verily I am creating a human being from clay.<sup foot_note="180842">2</sup>
After I have created him and breathed into him of My spirit,<sup foot_note="180843">1</sup> fall you down, prostrating yourselves to him.”<sup foot_note="180844">2</sup>
Then the angels, all of them, prostrated themselves before Adam
except Iblis. He waxed proud and became one of the unbelievers.<sup foot_note="180845">1</sup>

The Lord said: “O Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating yourself before him whom I created of My Two Hands.<sup foot_note="180846">1</sup> Are you waxing proud, or fancy yourself to be too exalted?”
He replied: “I am nobler than he. You created me from fire and created him from clay.”
He said: “Get out of here;<sup foot_note="180847">1</sup> surely you are accursed,<sup foot_note="180848">2</sup>
and My curse shall remain upon you till the Day of Resurrection.”<sup foot_note="180849">1</sup>
Satan said: “My Lord, then grant me respite till the Day that they are raised up.”
He said: “You are of those who have been granted respite
till the Day whose Hour I know.”
(Iblis) said: “By Your glory, I shall mislead them all
except those of Your servants, the chosen ones from amongst them.”<sup foot_note="180850">1</sup>
He (i.e. Allah) said: “This is the Truth � and I only speak the Truth �
I will certainly fill the Gehenna with you<sup foot_note="180851">1</sup> and with all those among them who follow you.”<sup foot_note="180852">2</sup>
(O Prophet), tell them: “I do not ask you for any recompense for the performance of this task;<sup foot_note="180853">1</sup> nor am I given to affectation.<sup foot_note="180854">2</sup>
This is nothing but an Admonition for all people the world over.
You will know the truth of the matter after a while.”<sup foot_note="180855">1</sup>
The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="180856">1</sup>
(O Prophet), it is We Who have revealed this Book to you with Truth.<sup foot_note="180857">1</sup> So serve only Allah, consecrating your devotion to Him.<sup foot_note="180858">2</sup>

Lo, religion is exclusively devoted to Allah.<sup foot_note="180859">1</sup> Your religion is entirely consecrated to Him. As for those who have taken others than Allah for their guardians, (they say): “We worship them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah.”<sup foot_note="180860">2</sup> Allah will judge between them concerning what they differ about.<sup foot_note="180861">3</sup> Verily Allah does not guide anyone who is given to sheer lying, is an utter unbeliever.<sup foot_note="180862">4</sup>

If Allah had wanted to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen anyone He wanted out of those whom He creates.<sup foot_note="180863">1</sup> Glory be to Him (that He should have a son). He is Allah: the One, the Overpowering.<sup foot_note="180864">2</sup>

He created the heavens and the earth with Truth,<sup foot_note="180865">1</sup> and He folds up the day over the night and folds up the night over the day. He has subjected the sun and the moon, each is running its course until an appointed time. Lo, He is the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving.<sup foot_note="180866">2</sup>

He it is Who created you from a single being, and He it is Who made from it its mate.<sup foot_note="180867">1</sup> He it is Who created for you eight heads of cattle in pairs.<sup foot_note="180868">2</sup> He creates you in your mothers' wombs, giving you one form after another in threefold depths of darkness.<sup foot_note="180869">3</sup> That, then, is Allah, your Lord.<sup foot_note="180870">4</sup> His is the kingdom.<sup foot_note="180871">5</sup> There is no god but He.<sup foot_note="180872">6</sup> So, whence are you being turned astray?<sup foot_note="180873">7</sup>

If you disbelieve, know well that Allah has no need of you.<sup foot_note="180874">1</sup> Yet He does not like unbelief in His servants.<sup foot_note="180875">2</sup> But if you are thankful, your thankfulness will please Him.<sup foot_note="180876">3</sup> No one shall bear another's burden.<sup foot_note="180877">4</sup> You are destined to return to your Lord and He will tell you what you used to do. He is well aware even of what lies hidden in your breasts.

When any affliction befalls man,<sup foot_note="180878">1</sup> he cries out to his Lord, penitently turning to Him.<sup foot_note="180879">2</sup> But when his Lord bestows His favour upon him, he forgets the affliction regarding which he had cried out<sup foot_note="180880">3</sup> and sets up compeers to Allah<sup foot_note="180881">4</sup> that they may lead others astray from His Path.<sup foot_note="180882">5</sup> Say, (O Prophet): “Enjoy your unbelief for a while. Surely you will be among the inmates of the Fire.”

Is such a person (preferable or he) who is obedient, and prostrates himself in the watches of the night, stands (in Prayer), is fearful of the Hereafter, and looks forward to the mercy of His Lord? Ask them: “Are those who know equal to those who do not know?”<sup foot_note="180883">1</sup> Only those endowed with understanding take heed.

Tell them (O Prophet): “O you servants of Mine who believe, have fear of your Lord.<sup foot_note="180884">1</sup> A good end awaits those who did good in this world.<sup foot_note="180885">2</sup> Allah's earth is spacious.<sup foot_note="180886">3</sup> Verily those who persevere shall be granted their reward beyond all reckoning.”<sup foot_note="180887">4</sup>
Tell them, (O Prophet): “I am bidden to serve Allah, consecrating my devotion to Him,
and I am bidden to be the first of those who surrender to Him.”<sup foot_note="180888">1</sup>
Say: “If I disobey my Lord, I fear the chastisement of an Awesome Day.”
Say: “Allah alone shall I serve, consecrating my devotion to Him.

So serve, apart from Him, whomsoever you please.” Say: “Behold, the real losers shall be those who will have lost their own selves and their kith and kin on the Day of Resurrection. Behold, that is the obvious loss.<sup foot_note="180889">1</sup>
There shall be sheets of fire above them and beneath them. This is the end against which Allah warns His servants. So dread My wrath, O you servants of Mine!”
(On the other hand), good tidings await those who eschew serving false gods<sup foot_note="180890">1</sup> and penitently return to Allah. (O Prophet), give good tidings to My servants,
to those who pay heed to what is said and follow the best of it.<sup foot_note="180891">1</sup> They are the ones whom Allah has guided to the Right Way; they are the ones endowed with understanding.
(O Prophet), can you save him (from chastisement) against whom the sentence of chastisement has become due;<sup foot_note="180892">1</sup> him who has, (as it were), already fallen into the Fire?”
But those who fear their Lord shall have lofty mansions built over one another beneath which rivers flow. This is Allah's promise and never does Allah fail to fulfil His promise.

Do you not see that Allah sent down water from the sky, then made it flow on earth as springs and streams and rivers<sup foot_note="180894">1</sup> and then with it He brings forth vegetation of various hues; then this vegetation ripens and dries up, turning yellow, whereafter He reduces it to broken straw? Surely there is a lesson in this for those endowed with understanding.<sup foot_note="180895">2</sup>

Can he whose breast Allah has opened up for Islam<sup foot_note="180896">1</sup> and who is thus (moving along a Path) illumined by a light from Allah<sup foot_note="180897">2</sup> (be likened to him who derives no lesson from what he observes)? Woe, then, to those whose hearts were further hardened<sup foot_note="180898">3</sup> after Allah's admonition. Such are indeed in obvious error.

Allah has revealed the best teaching, a self-consistent Book<sup foot_note="180899">1</sup> which repeats its contents in manifold forms whereat shiver the skins of those that hold their Lord in awe, and then their skins and their hearts soften for Allah's remembrance. That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.

How woeful is the plight of him who has nothing except his face to shield him from severe chastisement on the Day of Resurrection?<sup foot_note="180900">1</sup> Such evil-doers shall be told: “Taste now the consequence of your deeds.”<sup foot_note="180901">2</sup>
Their predecessors gave the lie to the Truth and then chastisement came upon them from whence they could not imagine.
So Allah made them taste degradation in the life of this world, and certainly the chastisement of the Hereafter will be much more grievous. Would that they knew!
We have indeed propounded for mankind all kinds of parables in this Qur'an that they may take heed.
It is an Arabic Qur'an<sup foot_note="180902">1</sup> free of all crookedness<sup foot_note="180903">2</sup> that they may guard against their evil end.

Allah propounds a parable: there is a man whose ownership is shared by several quarrelsome masters, each pulling him to himself; and there is another who is exclusively owned by one man. Can the two be alike?<sup foot_note="180904">1</sup> All praise and thanks be to Allah.<sup foot_note="180905">2</sup> But most of them are unaware.<sup foot_note="180906">3</sup>
(O Prophet), you are destined to die and they too are destined to die.<sup foot_note="180907">1</sup>
Then eventually all of you will contend before your Lord on the Day of Resurrection.
Who, then, can be more unjust than he who lied against Allah and denied the Truth when it came to him, calling it a lie? Is there no room for such unbelievers in Hell?
But he who brought the Truth, and those who confirmed it as true, such are the ones who shall be guarded against the chastisement.<sup foot_note="180908">1</sup>
They shall have from their Lord all that they wish for.<sup foot_note="180909">1</sup> That is the reward of those that do good,
so that Allah may remit their worst deeds and reward them according to the best of their deeds.<sup foot_note="180910">1</sup>

(O Prophet), does Allah not suffice for His servant? They frighten you with others apart from Him,<sup foot_note="180911">1</sup> although he whom Allah lets go astray, none can guide him to the Right Way.
And he whom Allah guides to the Right Way, none can lead him astray. Is not Allah the Most Mighty, the Lord of Retribution?<sup foot_note="180912">1</sup>

If you ask them: “Who created the heavens and the earth?” they will surely answer: “Allah.” Tell them: “What do you think, then, of the deities whom you call upon instead of Allah? If Allah should will that an affliction befall me, will those deities remove the harm inflicted by Him? Or if Allah should will that I receive (His) Mercy, will they be able to withhold His Mercy from me?” Say: “Allah is sufficient for me; those who have to put their trust, let them put their trust in Him.<sup foot_note="180913">1</sup>
Tell them: “My people, continue to work in your position as you will, I too will continue with my work.<sup foot_note="180914">1</sup> Soon you shall know
whom the degrading chastisement will visit and upon whom the everlasting chastisement will alight.

(O Prophet), We revealed to you the Book with the Truth for all mankind. So he who follows the Right Way does so to his own benefit, and he who goes astray, shall hurt only himself by straying. You are not accountable on their behalf.<sup foot_note="180915">1</sup>

It is Allah Who takes away the souls of people at the hour of their death, and takes away at the time of sleep the souls of those that have not died.<sup foot_note="180916">1</sup> Then He retains the souls of those against whom He had decreed death and returns the souls of others till an appointed time. Surely there are Signs in this for a people who reflect.<sup foot_note="180917">2</sup>
Or have they taken others instead of Allah as intercessors?<sup foot_note="180893">1</sup> Say: “Will they intercede though they may have no power and though they may not even understand?”
Say: “All intercession lies with Allah.<sup foot_note="180918">1</sup> His is the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And to Him will all of you be sent back.”

When Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter contract with bitterness, but when deities apart from Allah are mentioned, they are filled with joy.<sup foot_note="180919">1</sup>
Say: “O Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, the Knower of the unseen and the seen, You it is Who will judge among Your servants concerning what they differed.

If the wrong-doers possessed the treasures of the earth in their entirety and as much besides, they would gladly offer it on the Day of Resurrection to redeem themselves from the harrowing chastisement. This because there will appear to them from Allah something (exceedingly dismal which) they had never even imagined.
The evil consequences of their deeds will become fully apparent to them, and what they had scoffed at will encompass them.

When an affliction befalls man,<sup foot_note="180920">1</sup> he cries out to Us; but when We grant him a favour from Us, he says: “I have been granted this on account of my knowledge.”<sup foot_note="180921">2</sup> Nay; this (favour) is a test; but most of them do not know.<sup foot_note="180922">3</sup>
Their predecessors also said the same, but their earnings proved of no avail to them,<sup foot_note="180923">1</sup>
and the evil consequences of their deeds overtook them. The wrongdoers among these will also be overtaken by the evil consequences of their deeds. They will be utterly unable to frustrate (Us).
Do they not know that Allah enlarges and straitens the provision of whomsoever He pleases?<sup foot_note="180924">1</sup> Therein are Signs for those that believe.

Tell them, (O Prophet): “My servants<sup foot_note="180925">1</sup> who have committed excesses against themselves, do not despair of Allah's Mercy. Surely Allah forgives all sins. He is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.<sup foot_note="180926">2</sup>
Turn to your Lord and surrender yourselves to Him before the chastisement over-takes you; for then you will receive no help.
Follow the best<sup foot_note="180927">1</sup> of what has been revealed to you from your Lord before the chastisement suddenly comes upon you without you even being aware of it.”
Lest a person should say: “Alas for me for neglecting my duty towards Allah and for being among those that scoffed”;
and lest a person should say: “If only Allah had guided me, I should have been one of the God-fearing”;
or lest he should say, when he sees the chastisement: “O that I might return again, and be among those who do good.”
Yes indeed! But My Signs came to you and you rejected them as lies, and waxed arrogant and were among those who disbelieved.
On the Day of Resurrection you shall see that the faces of those who had lied against Allah have turned dark. Is Hell not vast enough to provide a room to the vainglorious?
But as for the God-fearing, Allah will deliver them on account of their achievements: no harm shall visit them nor shall they grieve.
Allah is the Creator of everything; He is the Guardian over everything.<sup foot_note="180928">1</sup>
To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. It is those who disbelieve in Allah's Signs who will be the losers.
(O Prophet), say: “Ignorant people! Do you bid me to serve any other beside Allah?”

(Tell them clearly that) it was revealed to you and to all Prophets before you: “If you associate any others with Allah in His Divinity, your works will surely come to naught<sup foot_note="180929">1</sup> and you will certainly be among the losers.”
Therefore, serve Allah alone and be among those who give thanks.

They did not recognise the true worth of Allah.<sup foot_note="180930">1</sup> (Such is Allah's power that) on the Day of Resurrection the whole earth will be in His grasp, and the heavens shall be folded up in His Right Hand.<sup foot_note="180931">2</sup> Glory be to Him! Exalted be He from all that they associate with Him.<sup foot_note="180932">3</sup>

And the Trumpet shall be blown<sup foot_note="180933">1</sup> and all who are in the heavens and the earth shall fall down dead save those whom Allah wills. Then the Trumpet shall be blown again, and lo! all of them will be standing and looking on.<sup foot_note="180934">2</sup>

The earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, and the Scroll (of deeds) shall be set in place, and the Prophets and all witnesses<sup foot_note="180935">1</sup> shall be brought, and judgement shall be justly passed among them, and they shall not be wronged;
and everyone shall be paid in full for all that he did. Allah is best aware of all that they do.

(After the judgement has been passed) the unbelievers shall be driven in companies to Hell so that when they arrive there, its gates shall be thrown open<sup foot_note="180936">1</sup> and its keepers shall say to them: “Did Messengers from among yourselves not come to you, rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord and warning you against your meeting of this Day?” They will say: “Yes indeed; but the sentence of chastisement was bound to be executed against the unbelievers.”
It will be said: “Enter the gates of Hell. Herein shall you abide.” How evil is the abode of the vainglorious!

And those who eschewed disobeying their Lord shall be driven in companies to Paradise so that when they arrive there its gates will have already been thrown open and its keepers shall say to them: “Peace be upon you; you have done well. So enter. Herein you shall abide.”

They will say: “All thanks and praise be to Allah Who has made His promise to us come true, and Who gave us the earth to inherit.<sup foot_note="180937">1</sup> We may now dwell in Paradise wherever we please.”<sup foot_note="180938">2</sup> How excellent is the reward of those who laboured!<sup foot_note="180939">3</sup>

You shall see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying their Lord with His praise, and judgement will have been made among them with fairness, and it will be proclaimed: “All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe.” <sup foot_note="180940">1</sup>
Ha'. Mim.
This Book is a revelation from Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing;
the Forgiver of sins, the Accepter of repentance, the Stern in retribution, the Bountiful. There is no god but He. To Him are all destined to return.<sup foot_note="180941">1</sup>

None but the unbelievers<sup foot_note="180942">1</sup> dispute regarding the Signs of Allah.<sup foot_note="180943">2</sup> So let not their strutting about in the land delude you.<sup foot_note="180944">3</sup>

Before them the people of Noah also gave the lie (to Messengers), and so did many parties after them. Each nation sallied forth against its Messenger to seize him, and they disputed with false arguments seeking therewith to repudiate the Truth. Then I seized them; and behold, how woeful was My retribution!
Thus has the decree of your Lord become due against the unbelievers. They are destined for the Fire.<sup foot_note="180945">1</sup>

The angels that bear the Throne and those that are around to extol your Lord's glory with His praise, they believe in Him, and ask forgiveness for the believers,<sup foot_note="180946">1</sup>saying: “Our Lord! You encompass everything with Your Mercy and Knowledge.<sup foot_note="180947">2</sup> So forgive those that repent and follow Your Path,<sup foot_note="180948">3</sup> and guard them against the chastisement of Hell.<sup foot_note="180949">4</sup>

Our Lord, admit them to the everlasting Gardens You have promised them<sup foot_note="180950">1</sup> and those of their fathers and spouses and progeny that were righteous.<sup foot_note="180951">2</sup> Surely You alone are Most Mighty, Most Wise;

and guard them against all ills.<sup foot_note="180952">1</sup> He whom You guard against ills on that Day,<sup foot_note="180953">2</sup> to him You have surely been Most Merciful. That is the great triumph.”

It will be announced to the unbelievers (on the Day of Resurrection): “Surely Allah's abhorrence of you when you were called to believe but you disbelieved was greater than is your abhorrence of yourselves today.”<sup foot_note="180954">1</sup>

They will say: “Our Lord, twice have You caused us to die and twice have You given us life.<sup foot_note="180955">1</sup> We have now confessed our sins.<sup foot_note="180956">2</sup> Is there, then, any way out?”<sup foot_note="180957">3</sup>

(They will be told): “(The cause of your present state is that) when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved; and when others instead of Him were invoked, you believed. Today all judgement lies with Allah, the Most High, the All-Great.”<sup foot_note="180958">1</sup>

He it is Who shows you His Signs<sup foot_note="180959">1</sup> and sends down provision for you from the sky.<sup foot_note="180960">2</sup> Yet none takes heed except he who constantly turns to Allah.<sup foot_note="180961">3</sup>
So call upon Allah, consecrating all your devotion to Him,<sup foot_note="180962">1</sup> howsoever much the unbelievers may dislike it.

Exalted in Rank,<sup foot_note="180963">1</sup> Lord of the Throne:<sup foot_note="180964">2</sup> He causes the spirit to descend on whomsoever of His servants He pleases<sup foot_note="180965">3</sup> so as to warn them of the Day of Encounter;<sup foot_note="180966">4</sup>

the Day when they will emerge and nothing of them shall be hidden from Allah. (On that Day they will be asked): “Whose is the kingdom today?”<sup foot_note="180967">1</sup> (The whole world will cry out): “It is Allah's, the One, the Overpowering.”

(It will then be said): “Today shall everyone be fully recompensed for his deeds. None shall be wronged today.<sup foot_note="180968">1</sup> Surely Allah is Swift in Reckoning.”<sup foot_note="180969">2</sup>

(O Prophet), then warn them of the Day that has drawn near,<sup foot_note="180970">1</sup> the Day when hearts full of suppressed grief will leap up to the throats and the wrong-doers shall neither have any sincere friend<sup foot_note="180971">2</sup> nor intercessor whose word will be heeded.<sup foot_note="180972">3</sup>
He knows even the most stealthy glance of the eyes and all the secrets that hearts conceal.
Allah will judge with justice, whereas those whom they call upon beside Him cannot judge at all. Surely Allah � and He alone � is All- Hearing, All-Seeing.<sup foot_note="180973">1</sup>

Have they not journeyed in the land that they might observe the end of those who came before them? They were even greater in strength than they and left behind more splendid traces in the land. Then Allah seized them because of their sins and they had none who could protect them from Allah.

They came to this end because their Messengers would come to them with Clear Signs<sup foot_note="180974">1</sup> and yet they would refuse to believe. So Allah seized them. He is indeed Strong, Terrible in Retribution.
Verily We sent Moses<sup foot_note="180975">1</sup> with Our Signs and a clear authority<sup foot_note="180976">2</sup>
to Pharaoh and Haman<sup foot_note="180977">1</sup> and Korah. They said: “(He is) a sorcerer, an utter liar.”<sup foot_note="180978">2</sup>

When Moses brought them the Truth from Us they said: “Kill the sons of all the believers who have joined him, but spare the women.”<sup foot_note="180979">1</sup> The guile of the unbelievers always ends in vain.<sup foot_note="180980">2</sup>

One day<sup foot_note="180981">1</sup> Pharaoh said: “Let me go and kill Moses;<sup foot_note="180982">2</sup> then let him invoke his Lord. I fear that he will change your religion or cause disruption in the land.”<sup foot_note="180983">3</sup>
Moses said: “I have taken refuge with my Lord and your Lord from everyone who waxes arrogant and does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.”<sup foot_note="180984">1</sup>

Then a man endowed with faith, from Pharaoh's folk, who had kept his faith hidden, said: “Do you kill a person simply because he says: 'My Lord is Allah' even though he brought to you clear Signs from your Lord?<sup foot_note="180985">1</sup> If he is a liar, his lying will recoil upon him;<sup foot_note="180986">2</sup> but if he is truthful, you will be smitten with some of the awesome consequences of which he warns you. Allah does not guide to the Right Way any who exceeds the limits and is an utter liar.<sup foot_note="180987">3</sup>

My people, today the kingdom is yours, and you are supreme in the land. But if Allah's chastisement were to come upon you, who will come to our help?”<sup foot_note="180988">1</sup> Pharaoh said: “I only counsel what I consider right; I only direct you to the Path of Rectitude.”<sup foot_note="180989">2</sup>
He who had faith said: “My people, I fear that you will confront a day like that which overtook many parties before you,
like the day that overtook the people of Noah and Ad and Thamud, and those who came after them. Allah does not wish to subject His servants to any injustice.<sup foot_note="180990">1</sup>
My people, I fear that you will encounter a day when there will be much wailing and you will cry out to one another for help,
the day when you will turn around to retreat, there will be none to protect you from Allah. He whom Allah lets go astray, none will be able to show him the Right Way.

Verily Joseph came to you with Clear Signs before, yet you continued to doubt his Message. Thereafter when he died, you said: 'Allah shall send no Messenger after him.'”<sup foot_note="180991">1</sup> Thus Allah leads astray those who transgress the limits and are given to much doubting;

those<sup foot_note="180992">1</sup> who contend regarding Allah's Signs without any evidence that might have come to them.<sup foot_note="180993">2</sup> That is exceedingly loathsome to Allah and to those that believe. Thus does Allah seal the heart of everyone who is proud and high-handed.<sup foot_note="180994">3</sup>
Pharaoh said: “Haman, build for me a lofty tower that I may scale the highways �

the highways to the heavens � and have a look at the God of Moses, although I am certain that Moses is a liar.”<sup foot_note="180995">1</sup> Thus Pharaoh's evil deed was made to seem fair to him, and he was barred from the Right Path. Pharaoh's guile only led him to his own perdition.
The person endowed with faith said: “My people, follow me; I shall direct you to the Path of Rectitude.
My people, the life of this world is ephemeral,<sup foot_note="180996">1</sup> whereas the Hereafter, that is the permanent abode.

Whosoever does an evil deed will be requited only with the like of it; and whosoever acts righteously and has attained to faith � be he a male or a female � they shall enter Paradise and be provided sustenance beyond all reckoning.
My people, how is it that I call you to salvation while you call me to the Fire;

you call me to deny Allah and to associate with Him as His partners those regarding whom I have no knowledge (that they are Allah's partners in His Divinity),<sup foot_note="180997">1</sup> whereas I call you to the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving?

There is no doubt that those whom you call me to have no claim to be called upon in this world and in the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="180998">1</sup> Certainly to Allah shall be our return, and those who exceed the limits<sup foot_note="180999">2</sup> are destined to the Fire.
Soon you shall remember what I say to you. I entrust my affairs to Allah. Surely Allah is watchful over His servants.”<sup foot_note="181000">1</sup>

Eventually Allah saved the person endowed with faith from all the evils of their guile,<sup foot_note="181001">1</sup> and a woeful chastisement<sup foot_note="181002">2</sup> encompassed the Pharaonites.

They are exposed to the Fire every morning and evening; and when the Last Hour will come to pass, a command shall be given: “Admit the Pharaonites to an even more severe chastisement.”<sup foot_note="181003">1</sup>

Just imagine when they will remonstrate with one another in Hell. The weak ones will say to those who waxed proud: “We were your followers. Will you, then, lighten for us a part of our suffering of the Fire?”<sup foot_note="181004">1</sup>
Those who had waxed proud will reply: “All of us are in it. Allah has already passed His judgement among His servants.”<sup foot_note="181005">1</sup>
Those suffering in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell: “Call upon your Lord to lighten the chastisement for us just for a day.”

The keepers of Hell will ask: “Did your Messengers not come to you with Clear Signs?” They will say: “Yes (they did).” The keepers of Hell will say: “Then you yourselves should call (upon the Lord). And the call of the unbelievers will end in vain.”<sup foot_note="181006">1</sup>
Surely We shall help Our Messengers and the believers in the life of this world<sup foot_note="181007">1</sup> and on the Day when witnesses will rise to testify,<sup foot_note="181008">2</sup>
the Day when the excuses offered by the wrong-doers shall not avail them. They shall be victims of the curse and a woeful abode.
We surely guided Moses<sup foot_note="181009">1</sup> and made the Children of Israel the heirs of the Book
which was a guidance and good counsel to people endowed with understanding and wisdom.<sup foot_note="181010">1</sup>

Be steadfast,<sup foot_note="181011">1</sup> then, (O Prophet), Allah's promise is true.<sup foot_note="181012">2</sup> Seek forgiveness for your shortcomings,<sup foot_note="181013">3</sup> and celebrate the praise of your Lord, evening and morning.<sup foot_note="181014">4</sup>

Verily those who dispute regarding the Signs of Allah without any evidence that might have come to them, nothing but vain pride fills their hearts. Yet they shall never be able to satisfy the pride<sup foot_note="181015">1</sup> with which they are puffed up.<sup foot_note="181016">2</sup> So seek refuge with Allah.<sup foot_note="181017">3</sup> Verily He is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
Surely<sup foot_note="181018">1</sup> the creation of the heavens and the earth is a greater act than the creation of human beings. But most people do not know.<sup foot_note="181019">2</sup>
Never can the blind and the seeing be equal; nor those that believe and act righteously and those that do evil. Little do you understand.<sup foot_note="181020">1</sup>
The Hour will indeed come; there is no doubt about that. Yet most people do not believe.<sup foot_note="181021">1</sup>

Your<sup foot_note="181022">1</sup> Lord said: “Pray to Me, and I will accept your prayers.<sup foot_note="181023">2</sup> Surely those who wax too proud to worship Me shall enter Hell, utterly abased.”<sup foot_note="181024">3</sup>

Allah it is Who made the night so that you may seek repose in it, and made the day radiant. Surely Allah is Most Bounteous to people; but most people do not give thanks.<sup foot_note="181025">1</sup>

Allah (Who bestowed all these favours upon you) is your Lord, the Creator of everything. There is no god but He.<sup foot_note="181026">1</sup> Whence are you, then, being led astray?<sup foot_note="181027">2</sup>
Thus it is only those who had denied Allah's Signs that were led astray.<sup foot_note="181028">1</sup>

Allah it is Who made the earth a dwelling place for you<sup foot_note="181029">1</sup> and made the sky a canopy,<sup foot_note="181030">2</sup> Who shaped you � and shaped you exceedingly well � and gave you good things as sustenance.<sup foot_note="181031">3</sup> That is Allah, your Lord; blessed be Allah, the Lord of the Universe.

He is the Ever-Living:<sup foot_note="181032">1</sup> there is no god but He. So call upon Him, consecrating to Him all your devotion.<sup foot_note="181033">2</sup> All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe.<sup foot_note="181034">3</sup>

Say, (O Prophet): “I have been forbidden to worship those beside Allah whom you call upon.<sup foot_note="181035">1</sup> (How can I worship any beside Allah) when clear Signs have come to me from my Lord and I have been commanded to surrender to Allah, the Lord of the Universe?”

He it is Who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clot; then He brings you out as an infant, then causes you to grow into full maturity, and then causes you to grow further so that you may reach old age, while some of you He recalls earlier.<sup foot_note="181036">1</sup> All this is in order that you may reach an appointed term<sup foot_note="181037">2</sup> and that you may understand (the Truth).<sup foot_note="181038">3</sup>
He it is Who gives life and causes death. Whenever He decrees a thing, He only commands to it “Be”, and it is.
Did you not see those who dispute concerning Allah's Signs? Whence are they, then, being turned astray?<sup foot_note="181039">1</sup>
Those who gave the lie to this Book and all the Books which We had sent with Our Messengers<sup foot_note="181040">1</sup> shall soon come to know the Truth
when fetters and chains shall be on their necks, and they shall be dragged into
boiling water, and cast into the Fire.<sup foot_note="181041">1</sup>
It will then be said to them: “Where are those whom you

associated with Allah in His Divinity?”<sup foot_note="181042">1</sup> They will say: “We have lost them; rather, we never used to call upon anyone before.”<sup foot_note="181043">2</sup> Thus will Allah cause them to stumble in error.
(They will be told): “This is because while you were on earth you took delight in untruth and exulted in it.<sup foot_note="181044">1</sup>
Enter Hell now to abide in it. How woeful is the abode of those who wax proud!

So be patient,<sup foot_note="181045">1</sup> (O Prophet). Surely Allah's promise is true. Whether We show them a part of the woeful consequences against which We warn them (while you are still in their midst) or We recall you (from this world) before that, eventually it is to Us that they shall be brought back.<sup foot_note="181046">2</sup>

Indeed We sent many Messengers before you: of them there are some whose account We have narrated to you and there are others whose account We have not narrated to you.<sup foot_note="181047">1</sup> It did not lie in any Messenger's power to bring any Sign<sup foot_note="181048">2</sup> except with Allah's leave. So when Allah's decree came, the matter was decided with justice, and those steeped in error courted utter loss,<sup foot_note="181049">3</sup> then and there.
Allah it is Who has made cattle for you so that you ride some of them and from some of them you derive food.
In them there are also other benefits for you, and through them you fulfil your heartfelt need (to reach places), and you are borne along upon them as upon the ships.
Allah shows His Signs to you; then which of Allah's Signs will you deny?<sup foot_note="181050">1</sup>

Did<sup foot_note="181051">1</sup> they not journey in the land that they may behold the end of those who had gone before them? They were more numerous and greater in strength and left behind more splendid traces in the land. Yet their attainments did not avail them.
When their Messengers came to them with Clear Signs, they arrogantly exulted in whatever knowledge they had.<sup foot_note="181052">1</sup> They were then encompassed by what they had mocked.
When they saw Our chastisement, they said: “We have come to believe in Allah, the Only One, and we reject all what we had associated (with Allah in His Divinity).”

But their believing after they had seen Our chastisement did not avail them. That has been Allah's Way concerning His servants.<sup foot_note="181053">1</sup> And the unbelievers courted utter loss, then and there.
Ha'. Mim.
This is a revelation from the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate,
a Book whose verses have been well-expounded; an Arabic Qur'an for those who have knowledge,
one bearing good news and warning.<sup foot_note="181054">1</sup> Yet most of them turned away and are not wont to give heed.

They say: “Our hearts are securely wrapped up against what you call us to,<sup foot_note="181055">1</sup> and in our ears is a heaviness, and between you and us there is a veil.<sup foot_note="181056">2</sup> So act; we too are acting.”<sup foot_note="181057">3</sup>

Tell them, (O Prophet): “I am only a human being like you.<sup foot_note="181058">1</sup> It is revealed to me that your God is One God;<sup foot_note="181059">2</sup> so direct yourselves straight to Him,<sup foot_note="181060">3</sup> and seek His forgiveness. Woe to those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity,<sup foot_note="181061">4</sup>
who do not pay Zakah,<sup foot_note="181062">1</sup> and who deny the Hereafter.
As to those who have faith and do good works, surely theirs shall be a never-ending reward.<sup foot_note="181063">1</sup>
Tell them, (O Prophet): “Do you indeed disbelieve in Him and assign compeers to Him Who created the earth in two days? He is the Lord of all beings of the Universe.

(After creating the earth) He set up firm mountains on it, blessed it,<sup foot_note="181064">1</sup> and provided it with sustenance in proportion to the needs of all who seek (sustenance). <sup foot_note="181065">2</sup> All this was done in four days.<sup foot_note="181066">3</sup>

Then He turned to the heaven while it was all smoke.<sup foot_note="181067">1</sup> He said to the heaven and the earth: “Come (into being), willingly or unwillingly.” They said: “Here we come (into being) in willing obeisance.”<sup foot_note="181068">2</sup>

Then He made them seven heavens in two days and revealed to each heaven its law. And We adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and firmly secured it.<sup foot_note="181069">1</sup> All this is the firm plan of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
But if they turn away,<sup foot_note="181070">1</sup> tell them: “I warn you against a sudden scourge like that which struck Ad and Thamud.”

When the Messengers (of Allah) came to them from the front and from the rear,<sup foot_note="181071">1</sup> saying: “Do not serve any but Allah”; they said: “Had our Lord so willed, He would have sent down angels. So we deny the Message you have brought.”<sup foot_note="181072">2</sup>

As for Ad, they waxed proud in the land without justification and said: “Who is greater than we in strength?” Did they not see that Allah, Who created them, is greater in strength than they? They continued to deny Our Signs,

whereupon We sent upon them a fierce wind on inauspicious days<sup foot_note="181073">1</sup> that We might make them taste a degrading chastisement in the life of this world.<sup foot_note="181074">2</sup> And surely the chastisement of the Hereafter is even more degrading. There will be none to help them there.
As for Thamud, We bestowed guidance upon them, but they preferred to remain blind rather than be guided. At last a humiliating scourge overtook them on account of their misdeeds.
Yet We delivered those who believed and were God-fearing.<sup foot_note="181075">1</sup>

Imagine the Day when Allah's enemies will be mustered to the Fire,<sup foot_note="181076">1</sup> and the people of the former times will be detained until the arrival of people of the later times,<sup foot_note="181077">2</sup>
and when all have arrived, their ears, their eyes, and their skins shall bear witness against them, stating all that they had done in the life of the world.<sup foot_note="181078">1</sup>

They will ask their skins: “Why did you bear witness against us?” The skins will reply: “Allah gave us speech,<sup foot_note="181079">1</sup> as He gave speech to all others. He it is Who created you for the first time and it is to Him that you will be sent back.

When you used to conceal yourselves (while committing misdeeds) you never thought that your ears or your eyes or your skins would ever bear witness against you; you rather fancied that Allah does not know a great deal of what you do.
This thought of yours about your Lord has led to your perdition and you have become among the losers.”<sup foot_note="181080">1</sup>
In this state, whether they bear with patience (or not), Fire alone shall be their abode. And if they seek to make amends, they will not be allowed to do so.<sup foot_note="181081">1</sup>

We had assigned to them companions who embellished for them all that was before them and behind them.<sup foot_note="181082">1</sup> Thus the same decree (of chastisement) which had overtaken the previous generations of jinn and human beings (also) became due against them. Surely they became the losers.
The deniers of the Truth say: “Do not give ear to the Qur'an and cause interruption when it is recited; thus perhaps you will gain the upper hand.”<sup foot_note="181083">1</sup>
We shall certainly make these unbelievers taste a terrible chastisement and shall fully requite them according to the worst deeds that they committed.
That is the recompense of the enemies of Allah � the Fire, their abiding home. That will be the re-compense for their denying Our Signs.

There the unbelievers will say: “Our Lord, show us those that led us astray, both jinn and humans, and we will trample them under our feet so that they are utterly degraded.”<sup foot_note="181084">1</sup>

Those<sup foot_note="181085">1</sup> who say “Allah is our Lord” and then remain steadfast,<sup foot_note="181086">2</sup> upon them descend angels<sup foot_note="181087">3</sup> (and say): “Do not fear nor grieve,<sup foot_note="181088">4</sup> and receive good tidings of Paradise which you were promised.
We are your companions in this world and in the Hereafter. There you shall have all that you desire and all what you will ask for.
This is by way of hospitality from Him Who is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.”
And who is fairer in speech than he who calls to Allah and acts righteously and says: “I am a Muslim”?<sup foot_note="181089">1</sup>

(O Prophet), good and evil are not equal. Repel (evil) with that which is good, and you will see that he, between whom and you there was enmity, shall become as if he were a bosom friend (of yours).<sup foot_note="181090">1</sup>
But none attains to this except those who are steadfast;<sup foot_note="181091">1</sup> none attains to this except those endowed with mighty good fortune.<sup foot_note="181092">2</sup>
And if you are prompted by a provocation from Satan, seek refuge with Allah.<sup foot_note="181093">1</sup> He, and He alone, is All-Hearing, All- Knowing.<sup foot_note="181094">2</sup>

And<sup foot_note="181095">1</sup> of His Signs are the night and the day, and the sun and the moon.<sup foot_note="181096">2</sup> Do not prostrate yourselves before the sun, nor before the moon, but prostrate yourselves before Allah Who created them, if it is Him that you serve.<sup foot_note="181097">3</sup>

But if they wax proud<sup foot_note="181098">1</sup> (and persist in their attitude, it does not matter, for) the angels near-stationed to your Lord glorify Him night and day, and never grow weary.<sup foot_note="181099">2</sup>

And of His Signs is that you see the earth withered, then We send down water upon it, and lo! it quivers and swells. Surely He Who gives life to the dead earth will also give life to the dead.<sup foot_note="181100">1</sup> Surely He has power over everything.

Those<sup foot_note="181101">1</sup> who pervert Our Signs<sup foot_note="181102">2</sup> are not hidden from Us.<sup foot_note="181103">3</sup> Is he who will be cast into the Fire better, or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do as you wish; He sees all what you do.
These are the ones who rejected the Good Counsel when it came to them, although it is certainly a Mighty Book.<sup foot_note="181104">1</sup>
Falsehood may not enter it from the front or from the rear.<sup foot_note="181105">1</sup> It is a revelation that has been sent down from the Most Wise, the Immensely Praiseworthy.

(O Prophet), nothing is said to you but what was already said to the Messengers before you. Surely your Lord is the Lord of forgiveness<sup foot_note="181106">1</sup> and the Lord of grievous chastisement.

Had We revealed this as a non-Arabic Qur'an they would have said: “Why were its verses not clearly expounded? How strange, a non-Arabic scripture and an Arab audience!”<sup foot_note="181107">1</sup> Tell them: “It is a guidance and a healing to the believers. But to those who do not believe, it serves as a plug in their ears and a covering over their eyes. It is as if they are being called from a place far away.<sup foot_note="181108">2</sup>

And in the past We gave Moses the Book and yet it became an object of dispute.<sup foot_note="181109">1</sup> If your Lord's decree had not gone forth before, a decisive judgement would have been made among them, once and for all.<sup foot_note="181110">2</sup> Surely they are in a disquieting doubt about it.<sup foot_note="181111">3</sup>
Whoever does good, does so to his own benefit; and whoever does evil, will suffer its evil consequence. Your Lord does no wrong to His servants.<sup foot_note="181112">1</sup>

The knowledge of the Hour<sup foot_note="181113">1</sup> rests solely with Him.<sup foot_note="181114">2</sup> Not a fruit comes forth from its sheath, nor does any female conceive nor give birth to a child but it is in His knowledge.<sup foot_note="181115">3</sup> On that Day He will call out to them: “Where are those associates of Mine?” They will answer: “We have declared to You that none of us can bear witness to that.”<sup foot_note="181116">4</sup>
Then all those deities whom they once used to call upon shall vanish<sup foot_note="181117">1</sup> and they will come to know for sure that there is no escape for them.
Man wearies not of praying for good,<sup foot_note="181118">1</sup> but when evil visits him, he despairs and gives up all hope.

And if We bestow Our Mercy upon him after hardship, he will surely say: “This is what I truly deserve,<sup foot_note="181119">1</sup> and I do not believe that the Hour (of Resurrection) will ever come to pass; and if I am returned to my Lord, there too I shall enjoy the best.” Surely We shall fully apprise the unbelievers of what they have done, and We shall certainly make them taste a severe chastisement.
When We bestow Our favour upon man, he turns away and waxes proud;<sup foot_note="181120">1</sup> but when a misfortune touches him, he is full of supplication.<sup foot_note="181121">2</sup>

Tell them, (O Prophet): “Did you ever consider: if this Qur'an is indeed from Allah and you still deny it, who can be in greater error than he who goes far in fiercely opposing it?”<sup foot_note="181122">1</sup>

Soon shall We show them Our Signs on the horizons and in their own beings until it becomes clear to them that it is the Truth.<sup foot_note="181123">1</sup> Is it not enough that your Lord is a witness over everything?<sup foot_note="181124">2</sup>
Lo, they are in doubt concerning their meeting with their Lord.<sup foot_note="181125">1</sup> Surely He fully encompasses everything.<sup foot_note="181126">2</sup>
Ha'. Mim.
Ayn. Sin. Qaf.
Thus does Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Wise reveal to you even as (He revealed) to those (Messengers) who preceded you.<sup foot_note="181127">1</sup>
His is all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth; He is the Most High, the All-Great.<sup foot_note="181128">1</sup>

The heavens may well nigh rend asunder from above<sup foot_note="181129">1</sup> while the angels proclaim the praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on earth.<sup foot_note="181130">2</sup> Lo, it is Allah, and He alone, Who is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.<sup foot_note="181131">3</sup>
Those who have taken others than Him as their protectors beside Him,<sup foot_note="181132">1</sup> it is Allah Who oversees them; you are no guardian over them.<sup foot_note="181133">2</sup>

And thus did We reveal this Arabic Qur'an<sup foot_note="181134">1</sup> to you that you may warn the people of the Mother of Cities (to wit, Makkah) and those who dwell around it;<sup foot_note="181135">2</sup> and warn them of the Day of Gathering<sup foot_note="181136">3</sup> concerning which there is no doubt: whereon some will be in Paradise, and some in the Blazing Fire.

If Allah had so willed, He could have made them all a single community. But He admits whomsoever He pleases into His Mercy. As to those given to wrong-doing, they shall have none as protector or helper.<sup foot_note="181137">1</sup>

(Are they so foolish that) they have chosen others rather than Allah as their protectors? Yet it is Allah Who is the Protector and Who resurrects the dead and Who has power over everything.<sup foot_note="181138">1</sup>

The<sup foot_note="181139">1</sup> judgement on whatever you differ rests with Allah.<sup foot_note="181140">2</sup> Such is Allah,<sup foot_note="181141">3</sup> my Lord; in Him I have put all my trust and to Him I always turn in devotion.<sup foot_note="181142">4</sup>

The Originator of the heavens and the earth, He has appointed for you pairs of your own kind, and pairs also of cattle. Thus does He multiply you. Naught in the universe is like Him.<sup foot_note="181143">1</sup> He is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.<sup foot_note="181144">2</sup>
His are the keys of the heavens and the earth. He enlarges and straitens the sustenance of whomsoever He pleases. Surely He has knowledge of everything.<sup foot_note="181145">1</sup>

He has prescribed for you the religion which He enjoined upon Noah and which We revealed to you (O Muhammad), and which We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus, commanding: “Establish this religion and do not split up regarding it.”<sup foot_note="181148">1</sup> What you are calling to is very hard upon those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity. Allah chooses for Himself whomsoever He pleases and guides to Himself whoever penitently turns to Him.<sup foot_note="181149">2</sup>

They did not split up except after knowledge had come to them,<sup foot_note="181150">1</sup> and then only because they wished to commit excesses against each other.<sup foot_note="181151">2</sup> Had your Lord not already decreed that judgement would be made later at an appointed time, the matter between them would surely have been decided once and for all.<sup foot_note="181152">3</sup> Indeed those who were later made the heirs of the Book are in disquieting doubt about it.<sup foot_note="181153">4</sup>

(This being so, O Muhammad), call people to the same religion and be steadfast about it as you were commanded, and do not follow their desires,<sup foot_note="181154">1</sup> and say (to them): “I believe in the Book Allah has sent down.<sup foot_note="181155">2</sup> I have been commanded to establish justice among you.<sup foot_note="181156">3</sup> Allah is our Lord and your Lord. We have our deeds and you have your deeds.<sup foot_note="181157">4</sup> There is no contention between us and you.<sup foot_note="181158">5</sup> Allah will bring us all together. To Him all are destined to return.”

Those who contend concerning Allah<sup foot_note="181159">1</sup> (after His call has been responded to), their contention is absolutely void in the sight of their Lord. Allah's wrath is upon them and a grievous chastisement awaits them.

Allah it is Who sent down this Book with the Truth and the Balance.<sup foot_note="181160">1</sup> And what would make you know that the Hour (of Judgement) has drawn near?<sup foot_note="181161">2</sup>

Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten its coming. But those who believe (in it) hold it in dread and know that the Hour (of Judgement) is bound to come. Lo, those who dispute concerning the coming of the Hour are gone far in error.

Allah is Most Gentle to His servants<sup foot_note="181162">1</sup> and grants sustenance to whomsoever He pleases.<sup foot_note="181163">2</sup> He is All-Strong, Most Mighty.<sup foot_note="181164">3</sup>

Whoever seeks the harvest of the Hereafter, We shall increase for him his harvest, and whoever seeks the harvest of this world, We shall give him thereof; but he will have no share in the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="181165">1</sup>

Do they have any associates (of Allah) who have laid down for them a way pertaining to faith which Allah did not sanction?<sup foot_note="181166">1</sup> But for the fact that a decree had already been made, the matter between them would have been decided once and for all. Surely a grievous chastisement awaits the wrong-doers.<sup foot_note="181167">2</sup>

You will see the wrongdoers fearful of the consequence of their deeds which will certainly overtake them. But those who have faith and do good deeds will be in the meadows of the Gardens, wherein they shall have whatever they desire from their Lord; that is the great Bounty.

That is the Bounty of which Allah gives tidings to His servants who have faith and do good deeds. Tell them, (O Prophet): “I do not ask you for any recompense for my work<sup foot_note="181168">1</sup> except love towards kinsfolk.”<sup foot_note="181169">2</sup> Whoever does a good deed, We shall increase its merit for him. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative.<sup foot_note="181170">3</sup>

Do they say: “He has forged a lie against Allah?”<sup foot_note="181171">1</sup> If Allah so wanted He could seal up your heart.<sup foot_note="181172">2</sup> Allah blots out falsehood and confirms the truth by His Words.<sup foot_note="181173">3</sup> He is well aware of all the secrets hidden in the breasts (of people).<sup foot_note="181174">4</sup>
He it is Who accepts repentance from His servants and forgives sins and knows all what you do,<sup foot_note="181175">1</sup>
and answers the prayers of those who believe and do good deeds and bestows upon them even more out of His Bounty. As for those who deny (the Truth), a grievous chastisement awaits them.

If Allah were to grant ample sustenance to His servants they would go about transgressing in the land. But He sends down in due measure whatever (sustenance) He wills. Surely He is Well-Aware and All-Seeing concerning matters that relate to His servants.<sup foot_note="181176">1</sup>
He it is Who sends down the rain after they despair of it, spreading out His Mercy. He is the Protector, the Immensely Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="181177">1</sup>

And of His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the living creatures that He has spread out in them.<sup foot_note="181178">1</sup> He has the power to bring them together when He so wills.<sup foot_note="181179">2</sup>
Whatever misfortune befalls you is a consequence of your own deeds. But much of it He forgives.<sup foot_note="181180">1</sup>
You cannot frustrate Him in the earth; you have no protector nor helper against Allah.
And of His Signs are the ships that sail in the sea like mountains.

If He so wills, He can cause the winds to become still so that they will remain motionless on its surface. Surely there are many Signs in this for those who are wont to be steadfast and give thanks.<sup foot_note="181146">1</sup>
He may, while forgiving much of the sins of those that ride these ships, drown them on account of some of their misdeeds.
Then those who wrangle about Our Signs will come to know that there is no escape for them.<sup foot_note="181181">1</sup>

That which has been given to you is only the wherewithal of the transient life of this world.<sup foot_note="181182">1</sup> But that which is with Allah is better and more enduring<sup foot_note="181183">2</sup> for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord;<sup foot_note="181184">3</sup>
who eschew grave sins and shameful deeds,<sup foot_note="181185">1</sup> and whenever they are angry, forgive;<sup foot_note="181186">2</sup>

who obey their Lord<sup foot_note="181187">1</sup> and establish Prayer; who conduct their affairs by consultation,<sup foot_note="181188">2</sup> and spend out of what We have bestowed upon them;<sup foot_note="181189">3</sup>
who, when a wrong is done to them, seek its redress.<sup foot_note="181190">1</sup>

The recompense<sup foot_note="181191">1</sup> of evil is evil the like of it.<sup foot_note="181192">2</sup> But he who forgives and makes amends, his reward lies with Allah.<sup foot_note="181193">3</sup>Surely He does not love the wrong-doers.<sup foot_note="181194">4</sup>
There is no blame against him who avenges himself after he has been wronged.
Blame attaches only to those who subject people to wrong and commit excesses on earth. A painful chastisement awaits them.
But he who patiently endures and forgives, that is a conduct of great resolve.<sup foot_note="181195">1</sup>

He whom Allah lets go astray, none after Him can be his protector.<sup foot_note="181196">1</sup> You will see that when the wrong-doers observe the chastisement, they will exclaim: “Is there any way to go back?”<sup foot_note="181197">2</sup>

You shall see them, as they are brought face to face with the chastisement, in a state of abject humiliation, looking with a furtive glance.<sup foot_note="181198">1</sup> But the believers will say: “Surely the true losers are they who lose themselves and their kindred on the Day of Resurrection.” Lo, the wrong-doers will be in an enduring torment.
They shall have no protectors to help them against Allah. For he whom Allah causes to go astray will have no way to save himself.

Accept the command of your Lord before there comes a Day from Allah that cannot be averted.<sup foot_note="181199">1</sup> On that Day there shall be no shelter for you, and none may change your predicament.<sup foot_note="181200">2</sup>

(O Prophet), if they turn away from the Truth, know that We did not send you to them as their overseer.<sup foot_note="181201">1</sup> Your task is only to convey (the Message). Indeed when We give man a taste of Our Mercy, he exults in it. But if any misfortune afflicts them on account of their deeds, man is utterly ungrateful.<sup foot_note="181202">2</sup>
The dominion of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah.<sup foot_note="181203">1</sup> He creates whatever He pleases. He grants females to whomever He pleases and males to whomever He pleases,
or grants them a mix of males and females, and causes whomever He pleases to be barren. He is All- Knowing, All-Powerful.<sup foot_note="181204">1</sup>

It<sup foot_note="181205">1</sup> is not given to any human being that Allah should speak to him except through revelation,<sup foot_note="181206">2</sup> or from behind a veil,<sup foot_note="181207">3</sup> or that a messenger (an angel) be sent to him who reveals to him by Allah's leave whatever He wishes.<sup foot_note="181208">4</sup> He is All-High, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="181209">5</sup>

Even so We revealed to you, (O Prophet), a spirit by Our command.<sup foot_note="181210">1</sup> (Ere to that) you knew neither what the Book nor what the faith was.<sup foot_note="181211">2</sup> But We made that spirit a light whereby We guide those of Our servants whom We please to the Right Way. Surely you are directing people to the Right Way,
the Way of Allah, to Whom belongs the dominion of all that is in the heavens and the earth. Lo, it is to Allah that all things ultimately revert.<sup foot_note="181212">1</sup>
Ha'. Mim.
By the Clear Book;
verily We have made it an Arabic Qur'an that you may understand.<sup foot_note="181213">1</sup>
Indeed it is transcribed in the Original Book with Us;<sup foot_note="181214">1</sup> sublime and full of wisdom.<sup foot_note="181215">2</sup>
Should We divert this Good Counsel from you because you are a people immersed in extravagance?<sup foot_note="181216">1</sup>
How many a Prophet did We send to the earlier peoples!
Yet never did a Prophet come to them but they mocked him.<sup foot_note="181147">1</sup>
We utterly destroyed them although they were greater in might than these. The examples of ancient peoples have gone before.<sup foot_note="181217">1</sup>
Yet if you were to ask them: “Who created the heavens and the earth?” they will certainly say: “The All-Mighty, the All-Knowing has created them.”

He it is Who made this earth for you a cradle<sup foot_note="181218">1</sup> and made in it pathways<sup foot_note="181219">2</sup> for you that you may find the way to your destination;<sup foot_note="181220">3</sup>

He Who sent down water from the sky in a determined measure,<sup foot_note="181221">1</sup> and thereby We revived a dead land: likewise will you be raised up (from the earth)<sup foot_note="181222">2</sup> �
He Who created these pairs,<sup foot_note="181223">1</sup> all of them, and provided you ships and cattle on which you ride,

so that when you are mounted upon them you may remember the bounty of your Lord, and say: “Glory be to Him Who has subjected this to Us whereas we did not have the strength to subdue it.<sup foot_note="181224">1</sup>
It is to our Lord that we shall eventually return.”<sup foot_note="181225">1</sup>
Yet they have made some of His servants a part of Him.<sup foot_note="181226">1</sup> Indeed man is most evidently thankless.
Has Allah taken for Himself daughters out of those whom He creates and has chosen you to have sons?<sup foot_note="181227">1</sup>
(They believe so although when) any of them is given tidings of the birth of a female child the like of which he assigns to the Merciful One, his countenance darkens and he is choked with grief.
Do they assign to Allah one who grows up amidst ornaments and is not well-versed in the art of disputation?<sup foot_note="181228">1</sup>

They claim that angels, who are Allah's chosen servants,<sup foot_note="181229">1</sup> are females. Did they witness how their body is constituted?<sup foot_note="181230">2</sup> Their testimony shall be written and they shall be called to account.
They say: “Had the Merciful One so willed, we would never have worshipped these deities.”<sup foot_note="181231">1</sup> But they have no knowledge of the matter and are simply conjecturing.
Or did We bestow upon them a Book before on whose authority they are holding on (to angel-worship)?<sup foot_note="181232">1</sup>
Nay; they simply claim: “We found our forefathers on a way, and we continue to find guidance in their footsteps.”<sup foot_note="181233">1</sup>
And thus it is: whenever We sent any warner to a city its affluent ones said: “We found our forefathers on a way and we continue to follow in their footsteps.”<sup foot_note="181234">1</sup>
Each Prophet asked them: “Will you do so even if we were to show you a way better than the way of your forefathers?” They answered: “We disbelieve in the religion with which you have been sent.”
Then We exacted retribution from them. So do consider the end of those who gave the lie (to the Prophets).
Call to mind when Abraham said to his father and his people:<sup foot_note="181235">1</sup> “I totally disown all whom you serve
except the One Who created me; and, behold, it is He Who will direct me to the Right Way.”<sup foot_note="181236">1</sup>
And Abraham left behind this word<sup foot_note="181237">1</sup> to endure among his posterity so that they may return to it.<sup foot_note="181238">2</sup>

(Even when they began worshipping others than Allah We did not destroy them) but bestowed sustenance on them and on their forefathers until there came to them the Truth and a Messenger who clearly expounded things to them.<sup foot_note="181239">1</sup>
And when the Truth came to them they said: “This is just sorcery<sup foot_note="181240">1</sup> and we reject it.”
They say: “Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon some great man from the two (main) cities?”<sup foot_note="181241">1</sup>

Is it they who distribute the Mercy of your Lord? It is We Who have distributed their livelihood among them in the life of this world, and have raised some above others in rank that some of them may harness others to their service.<sup foot_note="181242">1</sup> Your Lord's Mercy is better than all the treasures that they hoard.<sup foot_note="181243">2</sup>

Were it not that all mankind would become a single community (and follow the same way), We would have provided for all those who disbelieve in the Merciful One silver roofs for their houses, and (silver) stairs on which to go up,
and (silver) doors to their houses, and couches (of silver) upon which they would recline;<sup foot_note="181245">1</sup>
or that they be made of gold. Surely all this is only the enjoyment of the life of the world. But (true prosperity) in the Hereafter with Your Lord is only for the God-fearing.
He who is negligent to remember the Merciful One,<sup foot_note="181246">1</sup> to him We assign a satan as his boon companion,
and these satans hinder them from the Right Path, while he still reckons himself to be rightly-guided.
But when he comes to Us, he will say (to his satan): “Would that there had been between me and you the distance as between the East and the West. How evil a companion you were!”
(He will then be told): “Today it will not benefit you the least that after your wrong-doing you and your satans now share the chastisement.”<sup foot_note="181247">1</sup>
Can you, (O Prophet), then make the deaf hear, or direct to the Right Way the blind or one lost in manifest error?<sup foot_note="181248">1</sup>
We shall inflict retribution on them, whether We take you away from the world (before We do that),
or make you see the end that We had promised them, for We have full power over them.<sup foot_note="181249">1</sup>
So hold fast to what has been revealed to you. Surely you are on the Straight Way.<sup foot_note="181250">1</sup>
Verily it is a great source of eminence for you and your people, and soon you will be called to account concerning that.<sup foot_note="181251">1</sup>
Ask all Our Messengers whom We sent before you whether We had appointed any deities beside the Merciful One to be worshipped.<sup foot_note="181252">1</sup>
Indeed We<sup foot_note="181253">1</sup> sent Moses with Our Signs<sup foot_note="181254">2</sup> to Pharaoh and his nobles. He told them: “I am a Messenger of the Lord of the Universe.”
Yet when he brought forth Clear Signs from Us, then lo, they burst into laughter.
Every Sign that We showed them was greater than its predecessor; and then We seized them with Our chastisement so that they may return (to the Right Way).<sup foot_note="181255">1</sup>
(Whenever they faced an affliction) they would say: “O magician, pray for us to your Lord according to your station with Him. We shall certainly be guided to the Right Way.”
But lo, each time We removed Our affliction from them, they would go back on their word.<sup foot_note="181256">1</sup>

And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people:<sup foot_note="181257">1</sup> “My people, do I not have dominion over Egypt, and are these streams not flowing beneath me? Can't you see?<sup foot_note="181258">2</sup>
