Am I better or this contemptible man<sup foot_note="181259">1</sup> who is scarcely able to express himself?<sup foot_note="181260">2</sup>
Why were bracelets of gold not bestowed upon him? Why did a retinue of angels not accompany him as attendants?”<sup foot_note="181261">1</sup>
He incited his people to levity and they obeyed him. Surely they were an iniquitous people.<sup foot_note="181262">1</sup>
So when they incurred Our wrath, We exacted retribution from them, and drowned them all,
and made them a thing of the past and an example for those who would come after them.<sup foot_note="181263">1</sup>
No sooner the example of the son of Mary was mentioned than, lo and behold, your people raised a clamour
and said: “Who is better, our deities or he?”<sup foot_note="181264">1</sup> They said so only out of contentiousness. They are a disputatious people.
He was no more than a servant (of Ours), one upon whom We bestowed Our favours and whom We made an example (of Our infinite power) for the Children of Israel.<sup foot_note="181265">1</sup>
If We had so willed We could have made some of you into angels<sup foot_note="181266">1</sup> to become your successors on earth.
Verily he [i.e., Jesus) is a portent of the Hour.<sup foot_note="181267">1</sup> So be in no doubt concerning it and follow Me. This is the Straight Way.
Let not Satan hinder you (from believing in the Hour),<sup foot_note="181268">1</sup> for surely he is your open enemy.
When Jesus came with Clear Signs and said: “I have brought wisdom to you that I may make plain to you some of the things you differ about. So fear Allah and follow me.
Allah is my Lord and your Lord; therefore, serve Him. That is the Straight Way.”<sup foot_note="181269">1</sup>
Then the factions fell apart among themselves.<sup foot_note="181270">1</sup> So woe to the wrong-doers from the chastisement of a grievous Day.
Are they awaiting anything other than the Last Hour that it should suddenly come upon them without their even perceiving it?
On that Day even bosom friends shall become enemies to one another, all except the God-fearing.<sup foot_note="181271">1</sup>
(It will be said to them): “My servants, today you have nothing to fear or regret,
you who believed in Our Signs and had surrendered yourselves (to Us)!
Enter Paradise joyfully, both you and your spouses.”<sup foot_note="181272">1</sup>
Platters and cups of gold shall be passed around them, and there shall be all that they might desire and all that their eyes might delight in. (They shall be told): “Herein shall you abide for ever.
Such is the Paradise that you shall inherit by virtue of your good deeds in the life of the world.
Herein you will have abundant fruits of which you will eat.”
But the evil-doers shall abide in the torment of Hell.
Never will their torment be lightened for them. They shall remain in utter despair.
It is not We Who wronged them; rather, it is they who wronged themselves.
They shall call out: “O Malik,<sup foot_note="181273">1</sup> let your Lord put an end to us.” He will reply: “You must stay on in it.
We brought you the Truth; but to the truth most of you were averse.”<sup foot_note="181274">1</sup>
Have they contrived some scheme?<sup foot_note="181275">1</sup> If so, We too will contrive a scheme.
Or do they think that We do not hear their secret talks and their whispering counsels? Yes, indeed We do and Our messengers [i.e., angels) are with them, writing.
Say: “If the Merciful One had a son, I would have been the first one to worship him.”<sup foot_note="181276">1</sup>
Exalted be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, above what they attribute to Him.
So leave them alone to indulge in their vanities and to frolic about until they encounter that Day of theirs against which they have been warned.
He it is Who is God in the heavens and the earth. He is the Most Wise, the All-Knowing.<sup foot_note="181277">1</sup>

Blessed is He Who has dominion over the heavens and the earth and all that is between them.<sup foot_note="181278">1</sup> With Him is the knowledge of the Hour; and to Him you shall all be sent back.<sup foot_note="181279">2</sup>
Those whom they call upon, instead of Allah have no power of intercession, except such that testify to the truth based on knowledge.<sup foot_note="181280">1</sup>
If you were to ask them: “Who created them?” they will surely say: “Allah.”<sup foot_note="181281">1</sup> Whence are they, then, being led astray?
We call to witness the cry of the Messenger: “O Lord, these are a people not wont to believe!”<sup foot_note="181282">1</sup>
Indulge them, (O Prophet), and say to them: “Peace to you.”<sup foot_note="181283">1</sup> For soon they shall come to know.
Ha'. Mim.
By the Clear Book.
We revealed it on a Blessed Night, for We were intent on warning;<sup foot_note="181244">1</sup>
(We revealed it on the Night) wherein every matter is wisely determined<sup foot_note="181284">1</sup>
by Our command.<sup foot_note="181285">1</sup> Verily, We were set to send a Messenger
as a Mercy from your Lord.<sup foot_note="181286">1</sup> Surely He is All-Hearing, All-Seeing,<sup foot_note="181287">2</sup>
the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them: if you would only have sure faith.<sup foot_note="181288">1</sup>

There is no god but He:<sup foot_note="181289">1</sup> He gives life and causes death.<sup foot_note="181290">2</sup> He is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of yore.<sup foot_note="181291">3</sup>
(But the fact is, they lack certainty) and frolic about in doubt.<sup foot_note="181292">1</sup>
So watch for the Day when the sky will come down with a pall of smoke,
enveloping people. That will be a grievous scourge.
(People will then say): “Our Lord, remove this scourge from us; we shall believe.”
But how will they take heed? Such are they that a Messenger<sup foot_note="181293">1</sup> came to them clearly expounding the Truth,
yet they turned away from him and said: “This is a well-tutored madman.”<sup foot_note="181294">1</sup>
Yet We will hold the scourge back for a while, (but no sooner than We will do so) you will revert to your old ways.
The Day when We shall seize them with a mighty seizing, that will be the Day on which We shall inflict upon you full retribution.<sup foot_note="181295">1</sup>
Indeed before that We subjected the Pharaonites to the same test. A noble Messenger<sup foot_note="181296">1</sup> came to them
(and said):<sup foot_note="181297">1</sup> “Deliver to me Allah's servants.<sup foot_note="181298">2</sup> I am a trustworthy Messenger to you,<sup foot_note="181299">3</sup>
and do not exalt yourselves in defiance of Allah. I have come to you with a clear authority<sup foot_note="181300">1</sup> (as a Messenger).
I have taken refuge with my Lord and your Lord lest you should attack me with stones.
But if you do not believe what I say, leave me alone<sup foot_note="181301">1</sup> (and desist from laying hands on me).”
Then he called upon his Lord: “These are a criminal people.”<sup foot_note="181302">1</sup>
(He was told): “Set out with My servants by night<sup foot_note="181303">1</sup> for you will certainly be pursued.<sup foot_note="181304">2</sup>
And leave the sea behind you as calm as ever. Surely they are an army that is doomed to be drowned.”<sup foot_note="181305">1</sup>
How many gardens did they leave behind, and how many fountains
and sown fields and splendid mansions,
and the life of ease in which they took delight!
Thus it was; and We made another people inherit all that.<sup foot_note="181306">1</sup>
Then neither the sky shed tears over them nor the earth.<sup foot_note="181307">1</sup> They were granted no respite.
Thus did We deliver the Children of Israel from the humiliating chastisement,
from Pharaoh<sup foot_note="181308">1</sup> who was most prominent among the prodigals.<sup foot_note="181309">2</sup>
We knowingly exalted them (i.e., the Children of Israel) above other peoples of the world<sup foot_note="181310">1</sup>
and bestowed upon them the Signs wherein lay an evident test for them.<sup foot_note="181311">1</sup>
Indeed these people say:
“This is our first and only death, and we shall never be raised again.<sup foot_note="181312">1</sup>
Bring back to us our fathers if you are truthful.”<sup foot_note="181313">1</sup>
Are these better or the people of Tubba<sup foot_note="181314">1</sup> and those who went before them? We destroyed them for they were a criminal people.<sup foot_note="181315">2</sup>
It was not in idle sport that We created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them.
We did not create them except in Truth. But most of them do not know.<sup foot_note="181316">1</sup>
The Day of Final Decision is the appointed time for all;<sup foot_note="181317">1</sup>
the Day when a friend shall be of no avail to his friend<sup foot_note="181318">1</sup> nor shall they be helped,
except those to whom Allah shows mercy. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="181319">1</sup>
The tree of al-Zaqqum<sup foot_note="181320">1</sup>
shall be the food of the sinful.
Like dregs of oil,<sup foot_note="181321">1</sup> it will boil in their bellies
like boiling water.
“Seize him and drag him to the middle of the Blazing Fire,
then pour boiling water over his head as chastisement.
Taste this, you are a person mighty and noble!
This is what you used to doubt.”
Verily the God-fearing shall be in a secure place<sup foot_note="181322">1</sup>
amidst gardens and springs.
Attired in silk and brocade,<sup foot_note="181323">1</sup> they shall be arrayed face to face.
Thus shall it be: and We shall espouse them to fair, wide-eyed maidens.<sup foot_note="181324">1</sup>
While resting in security, they shall call for all kinds of fruit.<sup foot_note="181325">1</sup>
They shall not taste death except the death in this world. And Allah will save them from the chastisement of Hell<sup foot_note="181326">1</sup>
as a favour from your Lord. That is the great triumph.
(O Prophet), We have made this Book easy in your tongue so that they may take heed.
Wait, then; they too are waiting.<sup foot_note="181327">1</sup>
Ha'. Mim.
This Book is a revelation from the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="181328">1</sup>
Behold, for those who believe<sup foot_note="181329">1</sup> there are (myriad) Signs in the heavens and the earth
and in your own creation; and in the animals which He spreads out over the earth too there are Signs for those endowed with sure faith;<sup foot_note="181330">1</sup>

and in the succession of night and day,<sup foot_note="181331">1</sup> and in the provision<sup foot_note="181332">2</sup> that Allah sends down from the sky wherewith He gives life to the earth after it had been lifeless,<sup foot_note="181333">3</sup> and in the change of the winds:<sup foot_note="181334">4</sup> (in all these) there are Signs for people who use reason.
These are Allah's Signs that We rehearse to you in Truth. In what kind of discourse after Allah and His Signs will they, then, believe?<sup foot_note="181335">1</sup>
Woe to every guilty impostor

who hears Allah's Signs being rehearsed to him, and yet persists in his pride, as though he had not heard it.<sup foot_note="181336">1</sup> Announce to him, then, the tidings of a grievous chastisement.
Whenever he comes to know anything of Our Signs, he makes them an object of jest.<sup foot_note="181337">1</sup> For such there awaits a humiliating chastisement.

Hell is behind them.<sup foot_note="181338">1</sup> Their worldly earnings shall not avail them, nor those whom they took as protectors instead of Allah.<sup foot_note="181339">2</sup> An awesome chastisement lies in store for them.
This (Qur'an) is the true guidance. Those who deny the Signs of their Lord shall suffer the torment of a woeful scourge.

Allah it is Who has subjected the sea to you so that ships may sail upon it at His bidding<sup foot_note="181340">1</sup> and you may seek of His Bounty<sup foot_note="181341">2</sup> and give thanks to Him.

He has subjected to you all that is in the heavens and the earth,<sup foot_note="181342">1</sup> all being from Him.<sup foot_note="181343">2</sup> Verily there are Signs in this for those who reflect.<sup foot_note="181344">3</sup>

(O Prophet), tell the believers to indulge those who have no fear of any evil days coming upon them from Allah<sup foot_note="181345">1</sup> so that Allah may Himself requite them for their deeds.<sup foot_note="181346">2</sup>
Whoever acts righteously, does so to his own good; and whoever commits an evil will suffer its consequence. All of you will then be sent back to your Lord.

Indeed We endowed the Children of Israel with the Book and Wisdom<sup foot_note="181347">1</sup> and Prophethood, and provided them with good things<sup foot_note="181348">2</sup> as sustenance, and exalted them above the peoples of the whole world.

We gave them clear directions in matters pertaining to religion. Yet they differed among themselves (not out of ignorance but) after knowledge had come to them; and they did so out of the desire to commit excesses against one another.<sup foot_note="181349">1</sup> On the Day of Resurrection Allah will judge among them regarding what they had differed.
And then We set you, (O Prophet), on a clear high road in religious matters.<sup foot_note="181350">1</sup> So follow that and do not follow the desires of those who do not know.
Surely they will be of no avail to you against Allah.<sup foot_note="181351">1</sup> Indeed the wrong-doers are friends of each other, whereas Allah is the friend of the God-fearing.
These are the lights of discernment for people and guidance and mercy for those endowed with sure faith.<sup foot_note="181352">1</sup>

Do<sup foot_note="181353">1</sup> the evil-doers imagine that We shall make them equal to those who believe and do good, making their lives and deaths alike? How vile is their judgement!<sup foot_note="181354">2</sup>
Allah created the heavens and the earth in Truth<sup foot_note="181355">1</sup> that each person may be requited for his deeds. They shall not be wronged.<sup foot_note="181356">2</sup>

Did you ever consider the case of him who took his desire as his god,<sup foot_note="181357">1</sup> and then Allah caused him to go astray despite knowledge,<sup foot_note="181358">2</sup> and sealed his hearing and his heart, and cast a veil over his sight?<sup foot_note="181359">3</sup> Who, after Allah, can direct him to the Right Way? Will you not take heed?<sup foot_note="181360">4</sup>

They say: “There is no life other than our present worldly life: herein we live and we die, and it is only (the passage of) time that destroys us. Yet the fact is that they know nothing about this and are only conjecturing.<sup foot_note="181361">1</sup>
And when Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them,<sup foot_note="181362">1</sup> their only contention is: “Bring back to us our fathers if you are truthful.”<sup foot_note="181363">2</sup>

Tell them, (O Prophet): “It is Allah Who gives you life and then causes you to die,<sup foot_note="181364">1</sup> and He it is Who will then bring all of you together on the Day of Resurrection, a Day regarding which there can be no doubt.<sup foot_note="181365">2</sup> Yet most people do not know.<sup foot_note="181366">3</sup>

Allah's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth,<sup foot_note="181367">1</sup> and on the Day when the Hour (of Resurrection) shall come to pass, the followers of falsehood shall be in utter loss.

On that Day you shall see every people fallen on their knees.<sup foot_note="181368">1</sup> Every people will be summoned to come forth and see its Record and will be told: “Today you shall be requited for your deeds.
This is Our Record which bears witness against you with truth; We used to record all what you did.”<sup foot_note="181369">1</sup>
As for those who believe and act righteously, their Lord shall admit them to His Mercy. That indeed is the manifest triumph.
But those who denied the Truth, they shall be told: “Were My Signs not rehearsed to you? But you waxed proud<sup foot_note="181370">1</sup> and became a guilty people.”

And when it was said to them: “Surely Allah's promise is true, and there is no doubt regarding the Hour of Resurrection,” you were wont to say: “We do not know what the Hour (of Resurrection) is. We are simply making conjectures and are not at all certain.”<sup foot_note="181371">1</sup>
(On that Day) the evil of their deeds will become apparent to them<sup foot_note="181372">1</sup> and what they had mocked at will encompass them,
and it will be said: “We will forget you today as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours. The Fire shall now be your abode, and you shall have none to come to your aid.

You reached this end because you made Allah's Signs an object of jest and the life of the world deluded you.” So they shall not be taken out of the Fire nor shall they be asked to make amends (and thus please their Lord).<sup foot_note="181373">1</sup>
So all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the heavens, the Lord of the earth, the Lord of the whole Universe.
His is the glory in the heavens and the earth. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.
Ha'. Mim.<sup foot_note="181374">1</sup>
The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

We have created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in Truth and for an appointed term.<sup foot_note="181375">1</sup> But those who disbelieve have turned away from what they were warned against.<sup foot_note="181376">2</sup>

Tell them, (O Prophet): “Did you consider those whom you call upon beside Allah? Show me, which part of the earth they created? Or do they have any share in creating the heavens? Bring to me any Scripture earlier than this one, or any vestige of knowledge (in support of your belief) if you are truthful.<sup foot_note="181377">1</sup>

Who is farther strayed from the Right Path than he who calls upon others than Allah that cannot answer his call till the Day of Resurrection,<sup foot_note="181378">1</sup> the while they are not even conscious that callers are calling upon them?<sup foot_note="181379">2</sup>
When all human beings will be gathered together those who had been called upon will become the enemies to their votaries and will disown their worship.<sup foot_note="181380">1</sup>
When Our Clear Messages are rehearsed to them, the unbelievers exclaim about the Truth when it came to them: “This is plain sorcery.”<sup foot_note="181381">1</sup>

Do they claim that the Messenger himself has fabricated it?<sup foot_note="181382">1</sup> (If so), tell them: “If I have fabricated it, then you have no power to protect me from Allah's chastisement. He knows well the idle talk in which you indulge. He suffices as a witness between me and you.<sup foot_note="181383">2</sup> He is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.”<sup foot_note="181384">3</sup>

Tell them: “I am not the first of the Messengers; and I do not know what shall be done with me or with you. I follow only what is revealed to me, and I am nothing but a plain warner.”<sup foot_note="181385">1</sup>

Tell them, (O Prophet): “Did you consider (what would be your end)<sup foot_note="181386">1</sup> if this Qur'an were indeed from Allah and yet you rejected it? And this even though a witness from the Children of Israel has testified to the like of it. But he believed, while you waxed arrogant.<sup foot_note="181387">2</sup> Verily Allah does not guide such wrong-doers to the Right Way.

The unbelievers say to the believers: If there was any good in this Book, others would not have beaten us to its acceptance.”<sup foot_note="181388">1</sup> But since they have not been guided to it, they will certainly say: “This is an old fabrication.”<sup foot_note="181389">2</sup>

Yet before this the Book was revealed to Moses as a guide and a mercy. This Book, which confirms it, is in the Arabic tongue to warn the wrong-doers<sup foot_note="181390">1</sup> and to give good tidings to those who do good.
Surely those who said: “Our Lord is Allah” and then remained steadfast shall have nothing to fear nor to grieve.<sup foot_note="181391">1</sup>
They are the people of Paradise. They shall remain in it forever as a reward for their deeds.

We have enjoined man to be kind to his parents. In pain did his mother bear him and in pain did she give birth to him. The carrying of the child to his weaning is a period of thirty months.<sup foot_note="181392">1</sup> And when he is grown to full maturity and reaches the age of forty, he prays: “My Lord, dispose me that I may give thanks for the bounty that You have bestowed upon me and my parents, and dispose me that I may do righteous deeds that would please You,<sup foot_note="181393">2</sup> and also make my descendants righteous. I repent to You, and I am one of those who surrender themselves to You.”

Such are those from whom We accept their best deeds and whose evil deeds We overlook.<sup foot_note="181394">1</sup> They will be among the people of Paradise in consonance with the true promise made to them.

But he who says to his parents: “Fie on you! Do you threaten me that I shall be resurrected, although myriad generations have passed away before me (and not one of them was resurrected)?” The parents beseech Allah (and say to their child): “Woe to you, have faith. Surely Allah's promise is true.” But he says: “All this is nothing but fables of olden times.”

It is against such that Allah's sentence (of punishment) has become due. They will join the communities of humans and jinn that have preceded them. Verily all of them will court utter loss.<sup foot_note="181395">1</sup>
Of these all have ranks according to their deeds so that Allah may fully recompense them for their deeds. They shall not be wronged.<sup foot_note="181396">1</sup>

And on the Day when the unbelievers will be exposed to the Fire, they will be told: “You have exhausted your share of the bounties in the life of the world, and you took your fill of enjoyments. So, degrading chastisement shall be yours on this Day for you waxed arrogant in the earth without justification and acted iniquitously.”<sup foot_note="181397">1</sup>

Recount to them the story of (Hud), the brother of (the tribe of) 'Ad. Hud warned his people beside the sand-dunes<sup foot_note="181398">1</sup> � and there have been other warners before him and since his time � saying: “Serve none but Allah. Verily I fear that the chastisement of an awesome day shall come upon you.”
They said: “Have you come to us to turn us away from our gods? Then, bring upon us the scourge that you threaten us with. Do so if you are truthful.”

He replied: “Allah alone knows about this.<sup foot_note="181399">1</sup> I only convey to you the Message that I have been sent with. But I see that you are an ignorant people.”<sup foot_note="181400">2</sup>

When they saw the scourge advancing towards their valleys, they said: “This is a cloud that will bring much rain to us.” “By no means;<sup foot_note="181401">1</sup> it is what you had sought to hasten � a wind-storm bearing a grievous chastisement
that will destroy everything by the command of its Lord.” Thereafter nothing was left to be seen except their dwellings. Thus do We requite the wrong-doers.<sup foot_note="181402">1</sup>

We had established them firmly in a manner We have not established you.<sup foot_note="181403">1</sup> We had given them ears and eyes and hearts. But nothing availed them � neither their ears, nor their eyes, nor their hearts, for they denied the Signs of Allah.<sup foot_note="181404">2</sup> Then what they had mocked at encompassed them.
Surely We destroyed many a town around you. We sent Our Messages to them repeatedly and in diverse forms that they may eschew (their evil ways) and return (to Allah).

So why did those whom they had set up as gods apart from Allah, hoping that they would bring them nearer to Him, not come to their aid?<sup foot_note="181405">1</sup> Instead, they failed them. This was the end of the lie they had fabricated and the false beliefs they had invented.

And call to mind when We sent to you a party of the jinn that they may listen to the Qur'an.<sup foot_note="181406">1</sup> When they reached the place (where you were reciting the Qur'an), they said to one another: “Be silent (and listen).” And when the recitation ended, they went back to their people as warners.
They said: “Our people, We have heard a Scripture revealed after Moses, verifying the Scriptures revealed before it; it guides to the Truth and to the Straight Way.<sup foot_note="181407">1</sup>
Our people, respond to the call of him who calls you to Allah and believe in him. Allah will forgive your sins and will protect you from a grievous chastisement.”<sup foot_note="181408">1</sup>

And<sup foot_note="181409">1</sup> he who does not respond to the one who calls to Allah will not be able to frustrate Him on earth, nor will they have anyone to protect them from Allah. Such people are in manifest error.

Do they not see that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth � and creating them did not wear Him out � has the power to bring the dead back to life? Why not! He certainly has the power over everything.

On the Day when the unbelievers will be brought within sight of the Fire, they will be asked: “Is this not the Truth?” and they will answer “Yes, by Our Lord (this is the Truth).” Allah will say: “Then suffer the chastisement as a requital for your disbelieving.”

So bear with patience, (O Prophet), even as the Messengers endowed with firmness of resolve<sup foot_note="181410">1</sup> (before you) bore with patience, and do not be hasty in their regard. The Day when they see what they had been warned against they will feel as though they had remained in the world no more than an hour of a day. (The Truth has been conveyed.) Will any, then, suffer perdition except those who disobey?
Allah has caused the works of those who disbelieve<sup foot_note="181411">1</sup> and hinder people from the way of Allah<sup foot_note="181412">2</sup> to go to waste.<sup foot_note="181413">3</sup>

As for those who attained to faith and did righteous works and believed in what was revealed to Muhammad<sup foot_note="181414">1</sup> � which indeed is the Truth from their Lord<sup foot_note="181415">2</sup> � Allah has remitted their evil deeds and has set their condition right.<sup foot_note="181416">3</sup>

That is because those who disbelieved followed falsehood whereas those who believed followed the Truth that came to them from their Lord. Thus does Allah set forth to people parables showing their true state.<sup foot_note="181417">1</sup>

When you meet the unbelievers (in battle), smite their necks until you have crushed them, then bind your captives firmly; thereafter (you are entitled to) set them free, either by an act of grace, or against ransom, until the war ends.<sup foot_note="181418">1</sup> That is for you to do. If Allah had so willed, He would have Himself exacted retribution from them. (But He did not do so) that He may test some of you by means of others.<sup foot_note="181419">2</sup> As for those who are slain in the way of Allah, He shall never let their works go to waste.<sup foot_note="181420">3</sup>
He will guide them and set their condition right
and will admit them to Paradise with which He has acquainted them.<sup foot_note="181421">1</sup>
Believers, if you aid Allah, He will come to your aid<sup foot_note="181422">1</sup> and will plant your feet firmly.
As to those who disbelieve, perdition lies in store for them<sup foot_note="181423">1</sup> and Allah has reduced their works to nought.
That was because they were averse to what Allah had revealed;<sup foot_note="181424">1</sup> so He let their works go to waste.
Have they not journeyed through the land to see the end of those who went before them? Allah utterly destroyed them. These unbelievers are doomed to the same end.<sup foot_note="181425">1</sup>
That is because Allah is the Protector of the believers whereas the unbelievers have none to protect them.<sup foot_note="181426">1</sup>

Allah shall admit those who believe and do righteous works to the Gardens beneath which rivers flow. As for the unbelievers, they enjoy the pleasures of this transient life and eat as cattle eat.<sup foot_note="181427">1</sup> The Fire shall be their resort.
(O Prophet), how many are the cities that had greater power than your city that drove you out? We destroyed them and there was none to protect them.<sup foot_note="181428">1</sup>
Then, can he, who is on a Clear Guidance from His Lord, be like him whose evil deeds have been embellished to him, and who pursued their lusts?<sup foot_note="181429">1</sup>

Here is the parable of Paradise which the God-fearing have been promised: in it shall be rivers of incorruptible water,<sup foot_note="181430">1</sup> rivers of milk unchanging in taste,<sup foot_note="181431">2</sup>and rivers of wine, a delight to those that drink;<sup foot_note="181432">3</sup> and rivers of pure honey.<sup foot_note="181433">4</sup> In it they will have every kind of fruit as well as forgiveness from their Lord.<sup foot_note="181434">5</sup> Can such be like those who will abide in the Fire and will be given a boiling water to drink that will tear their bowels apart?

Among them some give ear to you. But no sooner do they leave your presence than they ask those endowed with knowledge: “What is it that he said just now?”<sup foot_note="181435">1</sup> Such are those whose hearts Allah has sealed and who pursue their lusts.<sup foot_note="181436">2</sup>
As for those who were led to the Guidance,<sup foot_note="181437">1</sup> Allah increases them in their guidance and causes them to grow in God-fearing.<sup foot_note="181438">2</sup>

Are they waiting, then, for anything else than the Last Hour to suddenly come upon them?<sup foot_note="181439">1</sup> Already some of its tokens have come.<sup foot_note="181440">2</sup> But when it does actually come upon them, where will any time be left for them to take heed?

Know, therefore, (O Prophet), that there is no god but Allah, and ask forgiveness for your shortcomings and also for (the shortcomings of) believing men and believing women.<sup foot_note="181441">1</sup> Allah knows the places where you move about and where you dwell.

The believers used to say: “Why is a surah (that would ordain fighting) not revealed?” But when a definitive surah was revealed wherein fighting was mentioned, you saw that those in whose hearts there was a sickness looked at you as though they were about to faint at the approach of death.<sup foot_note="181442">1</sup> Pity on them!
(They keep affirming their) obedience and saying good words. But when a course of action was clearly determined, it would have been better for them if they had proved true to Allah.
Now, if you were to turn away,<sup foot_note="181443">1</sup> what else can be expected but that you will work corruption in the land and fly at each other's throats?<sup foot_note="181444">2</sup>
It is these upon whom Allah has laid His curse: so He made them deaf and deprived them of their sight.
Do they, then, not reflect on the Qur'an? Or are there locks on their hearts?<sup foot_note="181445">1</sup>
Certainly those who have turned their backs on the True Guidance after it became manifest to them, Satan has embellished their ways for them and has buoyed them up with false hopes.

This, because they said to those who are averse to the faith that Allah has revealed: “In some matters we shall obey you.”<sup foot_note="181446">1</sup> Allah has full knowledge of their secret parleys.
But how will they fare when angels will take their souls at death and will carry them, striking their faces and backs?<sup foot_note="181447">1</sup>
That is because they have followed a way that angered Allah, and have been averse to His good pleasure. So He reduced all their works to nought.<sup foot_note="181448">1</sup>
Or do they, in whose hearts there is a sickness, believe that Allah will not bring their failings to light?
If We were to so will, We could have shown them to you so that you would recognise them by their faces, and you would certainly know them by the manner of their speech. Allah knows all your deeds.
We shall certainly test you until We know those of you who truly strive and remain steadfast, and will ascertain about you.

Those who disbelieved and barred others from Allah's Way and opposed the Messenger after the True Guidance had become manifest to them, they shall not be able to cause Allah the least harm; rather, Allah will reduce all their works to nought.<sup foot_note="181449">1</sup>
Believers, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and do not cause your works to be nullified.<sup foot_note="181450">1</sup>
Verily Allah shall not forgive those who disbelieved and barred others from Allah's Way and clung to their unbelief until their death.
So, be not faint-hearted and do not cry for peace.<sup foot_note="181451">1</sup> You shall prevail. Allah is with you and will not bring your works to nought.

The life of this world is but sport and amusement.<sup foot_note="181452">1</sup> If you believe and are God-fearing, He will grant you your reward, and will not ask you for your possessions.<sup foot_note="181453">2</sup>
If He were to ask you for your possessions and press you (in that regard), you would have grown niggardly, and Allah would have brought your failings to light.<sup foot_note="181454">1</sup>

Behold, you are those who are called upon to spend in Allah's Way, but some of you are niggardly. Whoever is niggardly is in fact niggardly to himself. For Allah is All-Sufficient, whereas it is you who are in need of Him. If you turn away, He will replace you by a people other than you, and they will not be like you.
(O Prophet), surely We have granted you a clear victory<sup foot_note="181455">1</sup>

so that Allah may forgive you your shortcomings, whether earlier or later,<sup foot_note="181456">1</sup> and may complete His favours upon you<sup foot_note="181457">2</sup> and guide you to the Straight Way,<sup foot_note="181458">3</sup>
and that Allah may bestow upon you a mighty help.<sup foot_note="181459">1</sup>

He it is Who bestowed inner peace on the hearts of the believers<sup foot_note="181460">1</sup> so that they may grow yet more firm in their faith.<sup foot_note="181461">2</sup> To Allah belong the legions of the heavens and the earth; Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="181462">3</sup>

(He did this) to admit the believers, both men and women,<sup foot_note="181463">1</sup> to Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they shall abide, and to efface their evil deeds from them.<sup foot_note="181464">2</sup> That, in Allah's sight, is the supreme triumph.

(He also did this) to chastise the hypocrites, both men and women, and those who associate others in His Divinity, both men and women, and who harbour evil thoughts about Allah.<sup foot_note="181465">1</sup> They shall be afflicted with misfortune,<sup foot_note="181466">2</sup> Allah is wroth with them. He has laid His curse upon them and has prepared for them Hell. What an evil end!
To Allah belong the legions of the heavens and the earth. Allah is Most Mighty, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="181467">1</sup>
(O Prophet), We have sent you forth as a witness,<sup foot_note="181468">1</sup> as a bearer of good news, and as a warner<sup foot_note="181469">2</sup>
so that (all of) you may all believe in Allah and His Messenger, and support him, and revere him, and celebrate Allah's glory, morning and evening.<sup foot_note="181470">1</sup>

Those who swore fealty to you, (O Prophet),<sup foot_note="181471">1</sup> in fact swore fealty to Allah. The Hand of Allah is above their hands.<sup foot_note="181472">2</sup> So whoever breaks his covenant breaks it to his own hurt; and whoever fulfils the covenant that he made with Allah,<sup foot_note="181473">3</sup> He will bestow on him a great reward.

(O Prophet), the bedouins who were left behind say to you:<sup foot_note="181474">1</sup> “We were occupied with our goods and families. So ask forgiveness for us.” They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts.<sup foot_note="181475">2</sup> Say to them: “Who can be of any avail to you against Allah if He should intend to cause you any harm or confer upon you any benefit?” Allah is well aware of all that you do.<sup foot_note="181476">3</sup>

(But the truth is not what you say.) You had imagined that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and this notion was embellished in your hearts.<sup foot_note="181477">1</sup> You harboured an evil thought, and you are an immensely evil people.”<sup foot_note="181478">2</sup>
As for those who do not believe in Allah and His Messenger, for such unbelievers We have prepared a Blazing Fire.<sup foot_note="181479">1</sup>
To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He pleases and chastises whom He pleases. He is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="181480">1</sup>

When you press forth for the spoils, those who were left behind will say: “Let us accompany you.”<sup foot_note="181481">1</sup> They want to change the command of Allah.<sup foot_note="181482">2</sup> Say to them (in clear words): “You shall not accompany us. Thus has Allah already said.”<sup foot_note="181483">3</sup> Then they will say: “Nay; but you are jealous of us.” The truth is that they understand little.

Say to the bedouins who were left behind: “You will be called against those who possess great might and be asked to fight against them unless they surrender.<sup foot_note="181484">1</sup> If you obey (the command to fight), Allah will bestow upon you a goodly reward. But if you turn away, as you turned away before, He shall inflict upon you a grievous chastisement.”

There is no blame on the blind, nor on the lame, nor on the sick (if they do not go forth to fight).<sup foot_note="181485">1</sup> Allah will admit those who obey Allah and His Messenger to the Gardens beneath which rivers flow and will inflict a grievous chastisement on those who turn away.

Allah was much pleased with the believers when they swore fealty to you under the tree.<sup foot_note="181486">1</sup> He knew what was in their hearts. So He bestowed inner peace upon them<sup foot_note="181487">2</sup> and rewarded them with a victory near at hand
and with abundant spoils which they shall acquire.<sup foot_note="181488">1</sup> Allah is Most Mighty, Most Wise.

Allah has promised you abundant spoils which you shall acquire.<sup foot_note="181489">1</sup> He has instantly granted you this (victory)<sup foot_note="181490">2</sup> and has restrained the hands of people from you<sup foot_note="181491">3</sup> that it may be a Sign for the believers<sup foot_note="181492">4</sup> and He may guide you to a Straight Way.<sup foot_note="181493">5</sup>
He also promises you other spoils which you have not yet taken, but Allah has encompassed them.<sup foot_note="181494">1</sup> Allah has power over everything.
Had the unbelievers fought against you at that time, they would have turned their backs (in flight), and would have found none to protect or help them.<sup foot_note="181495">1</sup>
Such is Allah's Way that has come down from the past.<sup foot_note="181496">1</sup> Never shall you find any change in the Way of Allah.
He it is Who restrained their hands from you, and your hands from them in the valley of Makkah, even though He had made you victorious against them. Allah was watching all that you did.

They are the ones who disbelieved and barred you from the Inviolable Mosque and prevented the animals you had designated for sacrifice from reaching the place of their offering.<sup foot_note="181497">1</sup> If it had not been for the believing men and believing women (who lived in Makkah and) whom you did not know, and had there not been the fear that you might trample on them and unwittingly incur blame on their account, (then fighting would not have been put to a stop. It was stopped so that) Allah may admit to His Mercy whomsoever He pleases. Had those believers been separated from the rest, We would certainly have inflicted a grievous chastise-ment on those of them [i.e. the Makkans) who disbelieved.<sup foot_note="181498">2</sup>

(This is why) when the unbelievers set in their hearts a fierce bigotry � the bigotry of ignorance<sup foot_note="181499">1</sup> � Allah bestowed inner peace upon His Messenger and upon the believers<sup foot_note="181500">2</sup> and made the word of piety binding on them. They were more deserving and worthier thereof. Allah has knowledge of everything.

Allah indeed showed His Messenger the true vision,<sup foot_note="181502">1</sup> one fully in accord with reality. If Allah so wills<sup foot_note="181503">2</sup> you shall certainly enter the Inviolable Mosque, in full security,<sup foot_note="181504">3</sup> you will shave your heads and cut your hair short,<sup foot_note="181505">4</sup> and do so without any fear. He knew what you did not know, and He granted you a victory near at hand even before (the fulfilment of the vision).

He it is Who sent His Messenger with the True Guidance and the Religion of Truth that He may make it prevail over every religion. Sufficient is Allah as a witness (to this).<sup foot_note="181506">1</sup>

Muhammad is Allah's Messenger, and those who are with him are firm with the unbelievers<sup foot_note="181507">1</sup> but compassionate with one another.<sup foot_note="181508">2</sup> You see them occupied in bowing and prostrating and in seeking Allah's bounty and good pleasure. They are distinguished<sup foot_note="181509">3</sup> from others by the marks of prostration on their faces. Thus are they described in the Torah.<sup foot_note="181510">4</sup> And their parable in the Gospel is that of<sup foot_note="181511">5</sup> a tilth that puts forth its shoot, then strengthens it so that it becomes stout and stands firmly on its stem. This is a sight pleasing to the sowers and one by which the unbelievers will be enraged. As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, Allah has promised them forgiveness and a great reward.<sup foot_note="181512">6</sup>
Believers, do not advance before Allah and His Messenger,<sup foot_note="181513">1</sup> and fear Allah. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.<sup foot_note="181514">2</sup>

Believers, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and when speaking to him do not speak aloud as you speak aloud to one another,<sup foot_note="181515">1</sup> lest all your deeds are reduced to nothing without your even realising it.<sup foot_note="181516">2</sup>

The ones who lower their voices in the presence of the Messenger of Allah are those whose hearts Allah has tested for God-fearing.<sup foot_note="181517">1</sup> Theirs shall be forgiveness and a great reward.
Surely most of those who call out to you, (O Prophet), from behind the apartments, are devoid of understanding.
If they were patient until you went out to them, that would have been better for them.<sup foot_note="181518">1</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.<sup foot_note="181519">2</sup>

Believers, when an ungodly person brings to you a piece of news, carefully ascertain its truth, lest you should hurt a people unwittingly and thereafter repent at what you did.<sup foot_note="181520">1</sup>

Know that Allah's Messenger is among you. Were he to follow you in many an affair, you yourselves would suffer.<sup foot_note="181521">1</sup> But Allah has endeared faith to you and has embellished it in your hearts, and has made unbelief and evil-doing and disobedience abhorrent to you. Such are those who are rightly guided,
by Allah's favour and bounty.<sup foot_note="181522">1</sup> Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.<sup foot_note="181523">2</sup>

If two parties of the believers happen to fight,<sup foot_note="181524">1</sup> make peace between them.<sup foot_note="181525">2</sup> But then, if one of them transgresses against the other, fight the one that transgresses<sup foot_note="181526">3</sup> until it reverts to Allah's command.<sup foot_note="181527">4</sup> And if it does revert, make peace between them with justice,<sup foot_note="181528">5</sup> and be equitable for Allah loves the equitable.<sup foot_note="181529">6</sup>
Surely the believers are none but brothers unto one another, so set things right between your brothers,<sup foot_note="181530">1</sup> and have fear of Allah that you may be shown mercy.

Believers,<sup foot_note="181531">1</sup> let not a group (of men) scoff at another group, it may well be that the latter (at whom they scoff) are better than they;<sup foot_note="181532">2</sup> nor let a group of women scoff at another group, it may well be that the latter are better than they.<sup foot_note="181533">3</sup> And do not taunt one another,<sup foot_note="181534">4</sup> nor revile one another by nicknames.<sup foot_note="181535">5</sup> It is an evil thing to gain notoriety for ungodliness after belief.<sup foot_note="181536">6</sup> Those who do not repent are indeed the wrong-doers.

Believers, avoid being excessively suspicious, for some suspicion is a sin.<sup foot_note="181537">1</sup> Do not spy,<sup foot_note="181538">2</sup> nor backbite one another.<sup foot_note="181539">3</sup> Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother?<sup foot_note="181540">4</sup> You would surely detest it. Have fear of Allah. Surely Allah is much prone to accept repentance, is Most Compassionate.

Human beings, We created you all from a male and a female, and made you into nations and tribes so that you may know one another. Verily the noblest of you in the sight of Allah is the most God-fearing of you.<sup foot_note="181541">1</sup> Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.<sup foot_note="181542">2</sup>

The Bedouins say: “We believe.”(O Prophet),<sup foot_note="181543">1</sup> say to them: “You do not believe; you should rather say: 'We have submitted'”;<sup foot_note="181544">2</sup> for belief has not yet entered your hearts. If you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not diminish anything from the reward of any of your deeds. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

Indeed the ones possessed of true faith are those who believed in Allah and His Messenger and then they did not entertain any doubt and strove hard in the Way of Allah with their lives and their possessions. These are the truthful ones.
Say, (O Prophet), (to these pretenders to faith): “Are you apprising Allah of your faith? Allah knows all that is in the heavens and the earth. Allah has full knowledge of everything.”

They count it as a favour to you that they accepted Islam. Say: “Do not regard your (accepting) Islam as a favour to me; rather, Allah has bestowed a favour on you by guiding you to faith, if you are truthful (in your claim to be believers).
Surely Allah knows every hidden thing of the heavens and the earth. Allah sees all that you do.
Qaf. By the glorious Qur'an.<sup foot_note="181545">1</sup>
Nay; they wondered that a warner should have come to them from among themselves.<sup foot_note="181546">1</sup> The unbelievers said: “This indeed is a strange thing.
What! When we are dead and reduced to mere dust, (shall we be raised to life)? Such a return is far-fetched.”<sup foot_note="181547">1</sup>
(Thus do they imagine, although) We know well what the earth takes away from them. With Us is a Record that preserves everything.<sup foot_note="181548">1</sup>
They gave the lie to the Truth when it came to them. So they are now in a state of great perplexity.<sup foot_note="181549">1</sup>
Did they<sup foot_note="181550">1</sup> never observe the sky above them: how We built it and beautified it;<sup foot_note="181551">2</sup> and it has no cracks;<sup foot_note="181552">3</sup>
and We have spread out the earth, and have set upon it firm mountains, and have caused it to bring out plants of all beauteous kinds?<sup foot_note="181553">1</sup>
All these are to serve as eye openers and as a lesson to every being who is prone to turn (to the Truth).
We also sent down blessed water from the heaven, wherewith We caused gardens and harvest-grain to grow,
and tall palm-trees with their thickly-clustered spathes;

all this as sustenance for Our servants. And thus We do bring the dead land back to life with water.<sup foot_note="181554">1</sup> Such shall be the coming forth (of human beings from the earth).<sup foot_note="181555">2</sup>
In the past Noah's people, and the people of Rass<sup foot_note="181556">1</sup> and Thamud gave the lie (to Messengers),
and so did 'Ad, and Pharaoh<sup foot_note="181557">1</sup> and Lot's brethren,
and the people of Aykah, and the people of Tubba'. They all gave the lie to the Messengers. Thereafter My threat of chastisement against them was fulfilled.
Did We, then, become worn out by the first creation? Not at all; but they are in doubt about a fresh creation.<sup foot_note="181558">1</sup>
Surely We<sup foot_note="181559">1</sup> have created man, and We know the promptings of his heart, and We are nearer to him than even his jugular vein.<sup foot_note="181560">2</sup>
Moreover, there are two scribes, one each sitting on the right and the left, recording everything.
He utters not a word, but there is a vigilant watcher at hand.<sup foot_note="181561">1</sup>
Lo, the agony of death has indeed come with the Truth.<sup foot_note="181562">1</sup> That is what you had sought to avoid.<sup foot_note="181563">2</sup>
And then the Trumpet was blown.<sup foot_note="181564">1</sup> This is the day of the promised chastisement.
Everyone has come, each attended by one who will drive him on, and another who will bear witness.<sup foot_note="181565">1</sup>
You were heedless of this. Now We have removed your veil and so your vision today is sharp.<sup foot_note="181566">1</sup>
His companion said:“ Here is he who was in my charge.”<sup foot_note="181567">1</sup>
The command was given: “Cast into Hell<sup foot_note="181568">1</sup> every hardened, stubborn unbeliever,<sup foot_note="181569">2</sup>
who hinders good,<sup foot_note="181570">1</sup> exceeds the limits,<sup foot_note="181571">2</sup> is immersed in doubts,<sup foot_note="181572">3</sup>
and has set up another deity with Allah. Hurl him into the grievous torment.”<sup foot_note="181573">1</sup>
His companion said:“ I did not incite him to rebel; he was far gone into error of his own accord.”<sup foot_note="181574">1</sup>
(It was said): “Do not remonstrate in My presence. I had warned you.<sup foot_note="181575">1</sup>
My Word is not changed;<sup foot_note="181576">1</sup> and never do I inflict the least wrong upon My servants.”<sup foot_note="181577">2</sup>
On that Day We shall ask Hell: “Are you full?” And it will reply: “Are there any more?”<sup foot_note="181578">1</sup>
And when Paradise shall be brought close to the God-fearing, and will no longer be far away,<sup foot_note="181579">1</sup>
it will be said: “This is what you were promised, a promise made to everyone who turned much (to Allah)<sup foot_note="181580">1</sup> and was watchful of his conduct,<sup foot_note="181581">2</sup>

to everyone who feared the Merciful One though He is beyond the reach of perception,<sup foot_note="181582">1</sup> to everyone who has come with a heart ever wont to turn (to Him).<sup foot_note="181583">2</sup>
Enter this Paradise in peace.”<sup foot_note="181584">1</sup> That will be the Day of Eternity.
Therein they shall get whatever they desire; and with Us there is even more.<sup foot_note="181585">1</sup>

How many a nation did We destroy before them that were stronger in prowess than these. They searched about the lands of the world.<sup foot_note="181586">1</sup> But could they find a refuge?<sup foot_note="181587">2</sup>
Verily there is a lesson in this for everyone who has a (sound) heart and who listens with an attentive mind.<sup foot_note="181588">1</sup>
We created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days,<sup foot_note="181589">1</sup> and weariness did not even touch Us.
Hence bear with patience whatever they say,<sup foot_note="181590">1</sup> and celebrate your Lord's glory before the rising of the sun and before its setting;
and in the night, too, celebrate His glory, in the wake of prostration.<sup foot_note="181591">1</sup>
Hearken on the Day when the caller will call from a place nearby,<sup foot_note="181592">1</sup>
the Day when they shall hear the Blast in truth. That will be the Day (for the dead) to come forth.<sup foot_note="181593">1</sup>
Surely it is We Who give life and cause death, and to Us shall all return
on the Day when the earth will be rent asunder and people, rising from it, will hasten forth. To assemble them all will be easy for Us.<sup foot_note="181594">1</sup>

(O Prophet), We are well aware of what they say;<sup foot_note="181595">1</sup> and you are not required to force things on them. So exhort with the Qur'an all those who fear My warning.<sup foot_note="181596">2</sup>
By the winds which scatter dust,
which carry clouds laden with water,<sup foot_note="181597">1</sup>
which then smoothly speed along,
and execute the great task of apportioning (rainfall):<sup foot_note="181598">1</sup>
surely what you are being warned against<sup foot_note="181599">1</sup> is true,
and the Judgement shall doubtlessly take place.<sup foot_note="181600">1</sup>
By the heaven with its numerous forms:<sup foot_note="181601">1</sup>
surely you are at variance (about the Hereafter);<sup foot_note="181602">1</sup>
though only those who are averse to the Truth will turn away from (believing in it).<sup foot_note="181603">1</sup>
Doomed are the conjecturers<sup foot_note="181604">1</sup>
who are steeped in ignorance and heedlessness.<sup foot_note="181605">1</sup>
They ask: “When will the Day of Judgement be?”
It will be the Day when they shall be scourged by the Fire<sup foot_note="181501">1</sup>
(and be told): “Taste your ordeal!<sup foot_note="181606">1</sup> This is what you were seeking to hasten.”<sup foot_note="181607">2</sup>
As for the God-fearing,<sup foot_note="181608">1</sup> they shall be in the midst of gardens and fountains,
joyously receiving what their Lord will have granted them.<sup foot_note="181609">1</sup> Verily they did good works before (the coming of this Day):
they used to sleep but little by night,<sup foot_note="181610">1</sup>
and would ask for forgiveness at dawn,<sup foot_note="181611">1</sup>
and in their wealth there was a rightful share for him who would ask and for the destitute.<sup foot_note="181612">1</sup>
There are many Signs on earth for those of sure faith,<sup foot_note="181613">1</sup>
and also in your own selves.<sup foot_note="181614">1</sup> Do you not see?
And in heaven is your provision and also what you are being promised.<sup foot_note="181615">1</sup>
So, by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, this is certainly true, as true as the fact of your speaking.
(O Prophet), did<sup foot_note="181616">1</sup> the story of Abraham’s honoured guests reach you?<sup foot_note="181617">2</sup>
When they came to him, they said: “Peace”; he said: “Peace also be to you; (you seem to be) a group of strangers.”<sup foot_note="181618">1</sup>
Then he went back to his family<sup foot_note="181619">1</sup> and brought a fat roasted calf<sup foot_note="181620">2</sup>
and laid it before them, saying: “Will you not eat?”
Then he became afraid of them.<sup foot_note="181621">1</sup> They said: “Fear not,” and announced to him the good news of (the birth of) a boy endowed with knowledge.<sup foot_note="181622">2</sup>
So hearing his wife went forth shouting. She struck her face and exclaimed: “A barren old woman am I.”<sup foot_note="181623">1</sup>
They said: “So has your Lord said (that you shall have a boy). Surely He is Most Wise, All-Knowing.”<sup foot_note="181624">1</sup>
Abraham said: “Envoys (of Allah), what is your errand?”<sup foot_note="181625">1</sup>
They replied: “Behold, we have been sent to a wicked people<sup foot_note="181626">1</sup>
that we may unleash a shower of clay-stones
marked by your Lord upon those who go beyond the limits.”<sup foot_note="181627">1</sup>
Then<sup foot_note="181628">1</sup> We evacuated there from all the believers
– and We did not find there any, apart from a single house of Muslims<sup foot_note="181629">1</sup> –
and We left therein a Sign for those who fear the grievous chastisement.<sup foot_note="181630">1</sup>
There is also a Sign for you in the story of Moses when We sent him with a clear authority to Pharaoh.<sup foot_note="181631">1</sup>
But Pharaoh turned away, showing arrogance on account of his power, and said (about Moses): “He is either a sorcerer or a madman.”<sup foot_note="181632">1</sup>
So We seized him and his hosts, and cast them into the sea. He became an object of much blame.<sup foot_note="181633">1</sup>
There is also a Sign for you in (the story of) Ad, when We let loose upon them an ominous wind
that left nothing that it came upon without reducing it to rubble.<sup foot_note="181634">1</sup>
There is also a Sign for you in (the story of) Thamud. They were told: “Enjoy yourselves for a while.”<sup foot_note="181635">1</sup>
But they brazenly disobeyed their Lord’s command, and then a sudden chastisement<sup foot_note="181636">1</sup> overtook them while they looked on.
They were unable even to stand up or protect themselves.<sup foot_note="181637">1</sup>
Before all these We destroyed the people of Noah: they were a wicked people.
And heaven – We<sup foot_note="181638">1</sup> made it with Our Own Power and We have the Power to do so.<sup foot_note="181639">2</sup>
And the earth – We spread it out, and how well have We smoothed it!<sup foot_note="181640">1</sup>
And of everything We have created pairs;<sup foot_note="181641">1</sup> perhaps you will take heed.<sup foot_note="181642">2</sup>
Flee, therefore, to Allah. Surely I am a clear warner to you from Him;
and do not set up any deity with Allah. Surely I am a clear warner to you from Him.<sup foot_note="181643">1</sup>
Thus has it been (in the past): never did a Messenger come to the nations that preceded them but they said: “(He is) a sorcerer, or a mad-man.”<sup foot_note="181644">1</sup>
Have they arrived at a common understanding concerning this? No; but they are a people given to transgression.<sup foot_note="181645">1</sup>
So turn your attention away from them; you shall incur no blame.<sup foot_note="181646">1</sup>
Do, however, keep exhorting them; for exhortation benefits those endowed with faith.<sup foot_note="181647">1</sup>
I created the jinn and humans for nothing else but that they may serve Me;<sup foot_note="181648">1</sup>
I desire from them no provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.<sup foot_note="181649">1</sup>
Surely Allah is the Bestower of all provision, the Lord of all power, the Strong.<sup foot_note="181650">1</sup>
The wrong-doers<sup foot_note="181651">1</sup> shall receive a portion of the chastisements as their fellows (of yore). So let them not rush Me.
Woe, then, betide those who disbelieved in that Day of theirs which they are being asked to hold in dread.
By the Mount,<sup foot_note="181652">1</sup>
and the Book inscribed
on fine parchment;<sup foot_note="181653">1</sup>
by the much-frequented House,<sup foot_note="181654">1</sup>
by the elevated canopy;<sup foot_note="181655">1</sup>
and by the swelling sea:<sup foot_note="181656">1</sup>
verily your Lord's chastisement shall come to pass,
none can avert that.<sup foot_note="181657">1</sup>
(It shall come to pass) on the Day when the heaven will convulse in a great convulsion,<sup foot_note="181658">1</sup>
and the mountains shall violently fly about.<sup foot_note="181659">1</sup>
Woe, then, on that Day to those who give the lie (to this Message)
and amuse themselves with vain argumentation.<sup foot_note="181660">1</sup>
On the Day when they shall be thrust into Hell with a violent thrust (and shall be told):
“This is the Hell which you used to give the lie to.”
Is this, then, any feat of magic or are you unable to see?<sup foot_note="181661">1</sup>
Go now and burn in it. It is all the same whether you bear it patiently or do not bear it with patience. You are only being recompensed for your deeds.”
Surely the God-fearing<sup foot_note="181662">1</sup> shall be in Gardens and bliss,
enjoying what Allah will have endowed them with; and their Lord will have saved them from the torment of the Blazing Fire.<sup foot_note="181663">1</sup>
(They will be told): “Eat and drink to your hearts'<sup foot_note="181664">1</sup> content as a reward for your deeds.”
The God-fearing shall be reclining on couches facing each other, and We shall wed them to maidens with large, beautiful eyes.<sup foot_note="181665">1</sup>

We shall unite the believers with those descendants of theirs who followed them in their faith, and shall not deny them any part of the reward for their good deeds.<sup foot_note="181666">1</sup> Every person is pledged to what he did.<sup foot_note="181667">2</sup>
We shall provide them in abundance with all kinds of fruit and meat,<sup foot_note="181668">1</sup> whatever they may desire.
They shall pass on to one another a cup that will incite neither levity nor sin.<sup foot_note="181669">1</sup>
Youths as fair as hidden pearls will be set apart to wait upon them; they will be running to and fro to serve them.<sup foot_note="181670">1</sup>
They will turn to one another and ask (regarding the past events).
They will say: “When we were living before among our kinsfolk we lived in constant fear (of Allah's displeasure).<sup foot_note="181671">1</sup>
Then Allah graced us with His favour and saved us from the chastisement of the scorching wind.<sup foot_note="181672">1</sup>
Formerly we had always prayed to Him. Surely He is Most Benign, Most Compassionate.”
So exhort (them, O Prophet), for by your Lord's Grace, you are neither a soothsayer nor a madman.<sup foot_note="181673">1</sup>
Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await an adverse turn of fortune.”<sup foot_note="181674">1</sup>
Tell them: “Wait; I too am waiting with you.”<sup foot_note="181675">1</sup>
Do their minds prompt them to say such things, or are they a people immersed in transgression?”<sup foot_note="181676">1</sup>
Do they say: “He has himself fabricated the Qur'an?” No; the truth is that they are altogether averse to believing.<sup foot_note="181677">1</sup>
(If they are truthful in this), then let them produce a discourse of similar splendour.<sup foot_note="181678">1</sup>
Did they come into being without any creator? Or were they their own creators?
Or is it they who created the heavens and the earth? No; the truth is that they lack sure faith.<sup foot_note="181679">1</sup>
Or do they have your Lord's treasures in their keeping? Or have absolute authority over them?<sup foot_note="181680">1</sup>
Or do they have a ladder whereon they can climb and attempt to listen (to what is transpiring in the Higher Realm)? Then, let any of them who has listened to it produce a clear proof of it.
Or does Allah have daughters whereas you have sons?<sup foot_note="181681">1</sup>
Or is it that you ask of them any recompense so that they should fear to be weighed down under the burden of debt?<sup foot_note="181682">1</sup>
Or is it that they have access to (the Truths in) the realm beyond sense-perception which they are writing down?<sup foot_note="181683">1</sup>
Or are they contriving a stratagem against you?<sup foot_note="181684">1</sup> If so, that stratagem will rebound against the unbelievers.<sup foot_note="181685">2</sup>
Do they have any god other than Allah? Exalted be Allah above whatever they associate (with Him in His Divinity).<sup foot_note="181686">1</sup>
(So obstinate are they that) even if they were to see some fragments of the sky falling down they would still say: “It is only a mass of cloud.”<sup foot_note="181687">1</sup>
So leave them alone until they encounter that Day of theirs when they shall be struck down,
when their stratagem shall be of no avail to them, nor shall they be succoured.
Surely a chastisement awaits the wrong-doers even before the coming of that Day; but most of them do not know.<sup foot_note="181688">1</sup>

Be patient, then, (O Prophet), until the judgement of your Lord comes.<sup foot_note="181689">1</sup> For surely you are before Our eyes.<sup foot_note="181690">2</sup> And celebrate the praise of your Lord when you rise,<sup foot_note="181691">3</sup>
and also celebrate His praise at night,<sup foot_note="181692">1</sup> and at the retreat of the stars.<sup foot_note="181693">2</sup>
By the star when it sets:<sup foot_note="181694">1</sup>
your companion<sup foot_note="181695">1</sup> has neither strayed nor is he deluded;<sup foot_note="181696">2</sup>
nor does he speak out of his desire.
This is nothing but a revelation that is conveyed to him,<sup foot_note="181697">1</sup>
something that a very powerful one has imparted to him,<sup foot_note="181698">1</sup>
one endowed with immense wisdom.<sup foot_note="181699">1</sup> He came forth and stood poised,
being on the higher horizon.<sup foot_note="181700">1</sup>
Then he drew near and hung above suspended,
until he was two bows' length away, or nearer.<sup foot_note="181701">1</sup>
Then he revealed to Allah's servant whatever he had to reveal.<sup foot_note="181702">1</sup>
His heart added no untruth to what he saw.<sup foot_note="181703">1</sup>
Are you, then, going to contend with him regarding what he sees with his eyes?
Indeed he saw him a second time,
by the lote-tree at the farthest boundary,
near which is the Garden of Abode.<sup foot_note="181704">1</sup>
(This was) when the lote-tree was covered with that which covered it. <sup foot_note="181705">1</sup>
His eye did not waver, nor did it stray,<sup foot_note="181706">1</sup>
and he certainly saw some of the greatest Signs of His Lord.<sup foot_note="181707">1</sup>
Have you ever thought about al-Lat and al-Uzza,<sup foot_note="181708">1</sup>
and about the third deity, al-Manat?
Shall you have the male issues, and He the female issues?<sup foot_note="181709">1</sup>
That is indeed an unfair division!

These are nothing but names that you and your forefathers have invented, for which Allah has sent down no authority.<sup foot_note="181710">1</sup> They are merely following their conjectures and their carnal desires<sup foot_note="181711">2</sup> although guidance has come to them from their Lord.<sup foot_note="181712">3</sup>
Does man imagine that whatever he wishes for is right for him?<sup foot_note="181713">1</sup>
To Allah belong both the Next World and the present.

Numerous are the angels in the heavens; yet their intercession shall be of no avail, except in regard to those whom He grants the leave of intercession and whose plea He is pleased to accept.<sup foot_note="181714">1</sup>
Those who do not believe in the Hereafter give angels the names of females,<sup foot_note="181715">1</sup>
although they have no knowledge regarding that. They only follow their conjecture<sup foot_note="181716">1</sup> and conjecture can never take the place of the Truth.
So leave alone those who turn away from the remembrance of Us<sup foot_note="181717">1</sup> and who seek nothing but the life of the world<sup foot_note="181718">2</sup> –

that<sup foot_note="181719">1</sup> being the utmost of their knowledge.<sup foot_note="181720">2</sup> Surely your Lord fully knows those who have strayed away from His Path and He also fully knows those who are rightly guided.

To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth.<sup foot_note="181721">1</sup> He will<sup foot_note="181722">2</sup> requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

on those who avoid grave sins<sup foot_note="181723">1</sup> and shameful deeds,<sup foot_note="181724">2</sup> even if they may sometimes stumble into lesser offences.<sup foot_note="181725">3</sup> Surely your Lord is abounding in His Forgiveness.<sup foot_note="181726">4</sup> Very well is He aware of you since He produced you from the earth, and while you were still in your mothers' wombs and not yet born. So do not boastfully claim yourselves to be purified. He fully knows those that are truly Godfearing.
(O Prophet), did you see him who turned away (from the Path of Allah),
who gave a little, and then stopped?<sup foot_note="181727">1</sup>
Does he have any knowledge of the world beyond the ken of sense-perception, and therefore, clearly sees (the Truth)?<sup foot_note="181728">1</sup>
Has he not been informed of what is in the Scrolls of Moses,
and of Abraham, who lived up to the trust?<sup foot_note="181729">1</sup>
“That no bearer of a burden shall bear the burden of another,<sup foot_note="181730">1</sup>
and that man shall have nothing but what he has striven for,<sup foot_note="181731">1</sup>
and that (the result of) his striving shall soon be seen,<sup foot_note="181732">1</sup>
and that he shall then be fully recompensed,
and that the final end is with your Lord,
and that He it is Who causes people to laugh and to cry,<sup foot_note="181733">1</sup>
and that He it is Who causes death and grants life,
and He it is Who created the two kinds, the male and the female,
from a drop of sperm when it was emitted,<sup foot_note="181734">1</sup>
and that it is for Him to grant the second life,<sup foot_note="181735">1</sup>
that He it is Who bestowed wealth and riches,<sup foot_note="181736">1</sup>
that He is the Lord of Sirius,<sup foot_note="181737">1</sup>
that He it is Who destroyed the ancient 'Ad,<sup foot_note="181738">1</sup>
and Thamud, leaving no trace of them,
and that He it is Who destroyed the people of Noah before for they were much given to iniquity and transgression.
And He brought perdition upon the subverted cities
and caused them to be covered with that which He covered them with.<sup foot_note="181739">1</sup>
So,<sup foot_note="181740">1</sup> which of your Lord's bounties will you doubt?”<sup foot_note="181741">2</sup>
This is a warning among the warnings of yore.<sup foot_note="181742">1</sup>
The imminent Hour has drawn near,<sup foot_note="181743">1</sup>
and none but Allah can avert it.<sup foot_note="181744">1</sup>
Will you, then, wonder at this?<sup foot_note="181745">1</sup>
Will you laugh at it rather than weep?<sup foot_note="181746">1</sup>
Will you occupy yourselves simply in merriment?<sup foot_note="181747">1</sup>
Prostrate yourselves before Allah, and serve Him.<sup foot_note="181748">1</sup>
The Hour of Resurrection drew near and the moon split asunder.<sup foot_note="181749">1</sup>
(Regardless of any Signs these people see), they turn away and say: “This is an ongoing sorcery.”<sup foot_note="181750">1</sup>

They also gave the lie to (the splitting asunder of the moon) and only followed their desires.<sup foot_note="181751">1</sup> Yet everything is destined to reach an end. <sup foot_note="181752">2</sup>
Surely there came to them narratives (of the ancient nations) that should suffice to deter (them from transgression),
narratives that are full of consummate wisdom. But warnings do not avail them.
So turn away from them, (O Prophet).<sup foot_note="181753">1</sup> On the Day when a caller shall call them to a thing most terrible,<sup foot_note="181754">2</sup>
with down-cast eyes<sup foot_note="181755">1</sup> they shall go forth from their graves,<sup foot_note="181756">2</sup> as though they were scattered locusts.
They shall be hurrying forth towards the caller, and the unbelievers (who had once denied this Day), will say: “This is a woeful Day.”

Before them Noah's people also gave the lie (to his Message).<sup foot_note="181757">1</sup> They rejected Our servant as a liar, saying: “He is a madman”; and he was rebuffed.<sup foot_note="181758">2</sup>
Then he called upon His Lord: “Verily I am vanquished; so come You to my aid.”
Thereupon We opened the gates of the sky for water to pour down,
and We made the earth burst forth with springs,<sup foot_note="181759">1</sup> and all this water converged to fulfil that which had been decreed.
And We bore Noah on the vessel built of planks and nails,<sup foot_note="181760">1</sup>
which sailed on under Our supervision: a reward for him who had been shown ingratitude.<sup foot_note="181761">1</sup>
And We left the Ark as a Sign.<sup foot_note="181762">1</sup> Is there, then, any who will take heed?
So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!
We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder.<sup foot_note="181763">1</sup> Is there, then, any who will take heed?
'Ad also gave the lie (to Hud). So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!
We sent a tumultuous wind against them on a day of unremitting misfortune,<sup foot_note="181764">1</sup>
which tore people away and hurled them as though they were trunks of uprooted palm-trees.
So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!
We have made the Qur'an easy to derive lessons from. Is there, then, any who will take heed?
Thamud gave the lie to the warnings,
saying: “Are we to follow a single mortal,<sup foot_note="181765">1</sup> one from among ourselves? If we do that, we shall surely be in error and folly.
Was there none but he to whom the Reminder could be vouchsafed excluding all others? Nay; he is an insolent liar.”<sup foot_note="181766">1</sup>
(We told Our Messenger): “Tomorrow they shall know who is the insolent liar.
We shall send the she-camel as a trial for them; so watch their end with patience.
Let them know that the water should be divided between them and the she-camel, each availing their turn.”<sup foot_note="181767">1</sup>
Eventually, they summoned their companion, and he undertook the (outrageous) task and hamstrung the she-camel.<sup foot_note="181768">1</sup>
So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!
Behold, We sent a single Blast against them, and they became like the trampled twigs of a sheep pen-builder.<sup foot_note="181769">1</sup>
Surely We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder. Is there, then, any who will take heed?
Lot's people also gave the lie to the warnings,
and behold, We let loose upon them a tempest which rained stones upon them, except upon Lot's household whom We rescued in the last hours of the night
as a favour from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.
Surely Lot warned his people that We shall seize them (with Our chastisement), but they doubted the warnings.
Then they even solicited his guests from him, whereupon We blotted out their eyes, (telling them): “Now have a taste of My chastisement and My warnings.” <sup foot_note="181770">1</sup>
Indeed an abiding chastisement came upon them in the morning.
So have a taste of My chastisement and My warnings.
Surely We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder. Is there, then, any who will take heed?
Warnings also came to the Pharaonites,
but they gave the lie to Our Signs, to all of them. Thereupon We seized them with the seizing of the Most Mighty, the Most Powerful.
Are your unbelievers (of Makkah) any better than they?<sup foot_note="181771">1</sup> Or have you been granted any immunity in the Scriptures?
Or do they say: “We are a strong legion, strong enough for victory?”
Soon shall this legion be routed and shall turn their backs and flee.<sup foot_note="181772">1</sup>
Nay; the Hour of Doom is their appointed time, and the Hour shall be more calamitous and bitter.
The evil-doers are victims of error and madness.
There shall come a Day when they will be dragged on their faces into the Fire and will be told: “Now taste the flame of Hell.”
We have created everything in a determined measure.<sup foot_note="181773">1</sup>
Our command consists of only one Word which is carried out in the twinkling of an eye.<sup foot_note="181774">1</sup>
We did indeed destroy many like you.<sup foot_note="181775">1</sup> Is there, then, any who will heed?
All their deeds are recorded in the Scrolls;
everything large or small, is duly inscribed.<sup foot_note="181776">1</sup>
Surely those who shun disobedience will dwell amidst Gardens and running streams
where they will be honourably seated in the presence of a King, Mighty in Power.
The Merciful One
has taught the Qur'an,<sup foot_note="181777">1</sup>
has created man,<sup foot_note="181778">1</sup>
and has taught him articulate speech.<sup foot_note="181779">1</sup>
The sun and the moon follow a reckoning,<sup foot_note="181780">1</sup>
and the stars<sup foot_note="181781">1</sup> and the trees all prostrate themselves,<sup foot_note="181782">2</sup>
and He has raised up the heaven and has set a balance<sup foot_note="181783">1</sup>
that you may not transgress in the balance,
but weigh things equitably and skimp not in the balance.<sup foot_note="181784">1</sup>
And He<sup foot_note="181785">1</sup> has set up the earth for all beings.<sup foot_note="181786">2</sup>
Therein are fruit and palm-trees with their dates in sheaths,
and a variety of corn with both husk and grain.<sup foot_note="181787">1</sup>
Which of the bounties of your Lord<sup foot_note="181788">1</sup> will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181789">2</sup>
He has created man from dry, rotten clay like the potter's,<sup foot_note="181790">1</sup>
and has created the jinn from the flame of fire.<sup foot_note="181791">1</sup>
Which of the wonders of your Lord's power<sup foot_note="181792">1</sup> will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Lord of the two easts and of the two wests is He.<sup foot_note="181793">1</sup>
Which of the powers of your Lord<sup foot_note="181794">1</sup> will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
He unleashed the two seas so that they merge together,
and yet there is a barrier between them which they may not overstep.<sup foot_note="181795">1</sup>
Which of the wonders of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
From these seas come forth pearls<sup foot_note="181796">1</sup> and coral.<sup foot_note="181797">2</sup>
Which of the wonders of your Lord's power will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181798">1</sup>
His are the ships,<sup foot_note="181799">1</sup> towering on the sea like mountains.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181800">1</sup>
All<sup foot_note="181801">1</sup> that is on earth will perish,
only the Person of your Lord, full of majesty and splendour, will endure.
So which of the wonders of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181802">1</sup>
All in the heavens and the earth entreat Him for their needs; a new, mighty task engages Him each day.<sup foot_note="181803">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's laudable attributes will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181804">1</sup>
O you twain, who are a burden (on the earth),<sup foot_note="181805">1</sup> We shall attend to you and call you to account.<sup foot_note="181806">2</sup>
(We shall then see), which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181807">1</sup>

O company of jinn and men, if you have the power to go beyond the bounds of the heavens and the earth, go beyond them! Yet you will be unable to go beyond them for that requires infinite power.<sup foot_note="181808">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
