(If you so venture) a flame of fire and smoke<sup foot_note="181809">1</sup> shall be lashed at you, which you shall be unable to withstand.
Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
(What will happen) when the heaven will be split asunder and will become crimson like leather?<sup foot_note="181810">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181811">1</sup>
On that Day there will be no need to ask either men or jinn about their sins.<sup foot_note="181812">1</sup>
(We shall see) which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181813">1</sup>
The culprits shall be known by their marks, and shall be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
Which of the powers of your Lord, will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
(It will be said): “This is the Hell that the culprits had cried lies to.
They will keep circling around between Hell and boiling water.<sup foot_note="181814">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181815">1</sup>
For any who fears to stand before his Lord<sup foot_note="181816">1</sup> are two Gardens.<sup foot_note="181817">2</sup>
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181818">1</sup>
These Gardens will abound in green, blooming branches.
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In each of the two Gardens are two flowing springs.
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In both these is a pair of every fruit.<sup foot_note="181819">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
They shall recline on couches lined with brocade,<sup foot_note="181820">1</sup> and within reach shall hang the fruits of the two Gardens.
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In the midst of these shall be maidens with modest, restrained glances;<sup foot_note="181821">1</sup> maidens whom no man or jinn has ever touched before.<sup foot_note="181822">2</sup>
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Lovely as rubies and pearls.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Can the reward of goodness be any other than goodness?<sup foot_note="181823">1</sup>
Which of the laudable attributes of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181824">1</sup>
And besides these two there shall be two other Gardens.<sup foot_note="181825">1</sup>
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Two Gardens, dark green and fresh.<sup foot_note="181826">1</sup>
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In them will be two gushing springs.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Therein will be fruits and dates and pomegranates.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In the midst of these will be maidens, good and comely.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
There shall be maidens sheltered in tents.<sup foot_note="181827">1</sup>
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
No man or jinn ever touched them before.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
They shall be reclining on green cushions and splendid carpets.<sup foot_note="181828">1</sup>
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Blessed be the name of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty and Glory.
When the Event will come to pass
– and then there will be no one to deny its occurrence<sup foot_note="181829">1</sup> –
(a calamitous Event) that shall turn things upside down:<sup foot_note="181830">1</sup>
when the earth will suddenly shake with a terrible shaking,<sup foot_note="181831">1</sup>
and the mountains will crumble
and will scatter abroad into fine dust.
You shall then become three groups.<sup foot_note="181832">1</sup>
The People on the Right:<sup foot_note="181833">1</sup> and how fortunate will be the People on the Right!
And the People on the Left:<sup foot_note="181834">1</sup> and how miserable will be the People on the Left!
As for the Foremost, they will be the foremost!<sup foot_note="181835">1</sup>
They shall be near-stationed (to their Lord),
in the Gardens of Bliss.
A throng of the ancients,
and a few from later times.<sup foot_note="181836">1</sup>
They (will be seated) on gold-encrusted couches,
reclining on them, arrayed face to face;
immortal youths shall go about them<sup foot_note="181837">1</sup>
with goblets and ewers and a cup filled with a drink drawn from a running spring,
a drink by which their minds will not be clouded nor will it cause drunkenness;<sup foot_note="181838">1</sup>
they will also go about them with the fruits of which they may choose,
and with the flesh of any fowl that they may desire to eat;<sup foot_note="181839">1</sup>
and there shall be wide-eyed maidens,
beautiful as pearls hidden in their shells.<sup foot_note="181840">1</sup>
All this shall be theirs as a reward for their deeds.
There they shall hear no idle talk nor any sinful speech.<sup foot_note="181841">1</sup>
All talk will be sound and upright.<sup foot_note="181842">1</sup>
As for the People on the Right, how fortunate shall be the people on the Right!
They shall be in the midst of thornless lote trees,<sup foot_note="181843">1</sup>
and flower-clad acacias,
and extended shade,
and gushing water,
and abundant fruit,<sup foot_note="181844">1</sup>
never-ending and unforbidden.
They shall be on upraised couches,
and their spouses We shall have brought them into being afresh,
and shall have made them virgins,<sup foot_note="181845">1</sup>
intensely loving<sup foot_note="181846">1</sup> and of matching age.<sup foot_note="181847">2</sup>
All this will be for the People on the Right;
a large throng from the ancients,
and also a large throng from those of later times.
As for the People on the Left: how miserable will be the People on the Left!
They will be in the midst of scorching wind and boiling water,
and a shade of thick, pitch-black smoke,
which will neither be cool nor soothing.
Surely they had lived before in luxury,
and had persisted in the Great Sin.<sup foot_note="181848">1</sup>
They used to say: “What! Once we are dead and are reduced to dust and bones, shall we still be raised to a new life from the dead?
(We) and our fore-fathers of yore?”
Tell them, (O Prophet): “The earlier ones and the later ones
shall all be brought together on an appointed Day.
Then you, the erring ones and those that gave the lie to the Truth,
shall all eat from the Tree of al-Zaqqum,<sup foot_note="181849">1</sup>
filling your bellies with it;
and thereupon you shall drink boiling water,
drinking it as thirsty camels do.”
Thus shall they be entertained on the Day of Recompense.
We have created you,<sup foot_note="181850">1</sup> then why would you not confirm it?<sup foot_note="181851">2</sup>
Did you ever consider the sperm that you emit?
Do you create a child out of it, or are We its creators?<sup foot_note="181852">1</sup>
It is We Who ordained death upon you<sup foot_note="181853">1</sup> and We are not to be frustrated.
Had We so wished, nothing could have hindered Us from replacing you by others like yourselves, or transforming you into beings you know nothing about.<sup foot_note="181854">1</sup>
You are well aware of the first creation; then, do you learn no lesson from it?<sup foot_note="181855">1</sup>
Have you considered the seeds you till?
Is it you or We Who make them grow?<sup foot_note="181856">1</sup>
If We so wished, We could have reduced your harvest to rubble, and you would have been left wonder-struck to exclaim:
“We have been penalised;
nay; we have been undone!”
Did you cast a good look at the water that you drink?
Is it you who brought it down from the clouds or is it We Who brought it down?<sup foot_note="181857">1</sup>
If We had so pleased, We could have made it bitter.<sup foot_note="181858">1</sup> So why would you not give thanks?<sup foot_note="181859">2</sup>
Did you consider the fire which you kindle?
Did you make its tree<sup foot_note="181860">1</sup> grow or was it We Who made it grow?
We made it a reminder<sup foot_note="181861">1</sup> and a provision for the needy.<sup foot_note="181862">2</sup>
Glorify, then, (O Prophet), the name of your Great Lord.<sup foot_note="181863">1</sup>
No!<sup foot_note="181864">1</sup> I swear by the positions of the stars –
and this is indeed a mighty oath, if only you knew –
that this indeed is a noble Qur'an,<sup foot_note="181865">1</sup>
inscribed in a well-guarded Book,<sup foot_note="181866">1</sup>
which none but the pure may touch;<sup foot_note="181867">1</sup>
a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.
Do you, then, take this discourse in light esteem,<sup foot_note="181868">1</sup>
and your portion in it is simply that you denounce it as false?<sup foot_note="181869">1</sup>
Why, then, when the soul leaps up to the throat,
the while you are helplessly watching that he is on the verge of death,
– at that moment when We are closer to him than you, although you do not see (Us)
if you are not subject to anyone's authority,
why are you then not able to bring them back to life if you are truthful?
So if he is one of those who are near-stationed (to Allah),
then happiness and delight and Gardens of Bliss are his.
And if he is one of the People on the Right,
he will be welcomed by the words: “Peace to you” from the People on the Right.
And if he is one of those who give the lie (to this Message) and go astray,
then he will be served boiling water,
and will be scorched by the Fire.
That indeed is the absolute truth.
So glorify the name of your Great Lord.<sup foot_note="181870">1</sup>
All that is in the heavens and the earth extols the glory of Allah.<sup foot_note="181871">1</sup> He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="181872">2</sup>
His is the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and causes death, and He has power over everything.
He is the First and the Last, and the Manifest and the Hidden,<sup foot_note="181873">1</sup> and He has knowledge of everything.

He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself on the Throne.<sup foot_note="181874">1</sup> He knows all that enters the earth and all that comes forth from it, and all that comes down from the heaven and all that goes up to it.<sup foot_note="181875">2</sup> He is with you wherever you are.<sup foot_note="181876">3</sup> Allah sees all that you do.
His is the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Him are all matters referred (for judgement).
He causes the night to pass into the day, and causes the day to pass into the night, and He fully knows all that is hidden in the breasts of people.

Believe in Allah and in His Messenger<sup foot_note="181877">1</sup> and expend<sup foot_note="181878">2</sup> of what He has entrusted to you.<sup foot_note="181879">3</sup> A great reward awaits those of you who believe and spend their wealth.<sup foot_note="181880">4</sup>

How is it that you do not believe in Allah when the Messenger calls you to believe in your Lord<sup foot_note="181881">1</sup> and although he has taken a covenant from you,<sup foot_note="181882">2</sup> if indeed you are believers?
He it is Who sends down Clear Signs to His servant so as to bring you out from darkness into light. Surely Allah is Most Kind and Most Compassionate to you.

How is it that you do not expend in the Way of Allah when to Allah belongs the inheritance of the heavens and the earth?<sup foot_note="181883">1</sup> Those who spent their wealth and took part in fighting before the Victory cannot be equated (with those who spent their wealth and took part in fighting afterwards). They are higher in rank than those who spent and fought afterwards.<sup foot_note="181884">2</sup> But to each Allah has promised a good reward. Allah is well aware of all that you do.<sup foot_note="181885">3</sup>
Who is it that will give Allah a beautiful loan? A loan that Allah will repay after increasing it many times and grant him a generous reward.<sup foot_note="181886">1</sup>

On that Day you will see believing men and women that their light will be running before them and on their right hands.<sup foot_note="181887">1</sup> (They will be told): “A good tiding to you today.” There shall be Gardens beneath which rivers flow; therein they shall abide. That indeed is the great triumph.

On that Day the hypocrites, both men and women, shall say to the believers: “Look at us that we may extract some light from your light.”<sup foot_note="181888">1</sup> They will be told: “Go back and seek light for yourselves elsewhere.” Then a wall shall be erected between them with a door in it. On the inside of it there will be mercy, and on the outside of it there will be chastisement.<sup foot_note="181889">2</sup>

The hypocrites will call out to the believers: “Were we not with you?”<sup foot_note="181890">1</sup> The believers will reply: “Yes; but you allowed yourselves to succumb to temptations,<sup foot_note="181891">2</sup> and you wavered<sup foot_note="181892">3</sup> and you remained in doubt<sup foot_note="181893">4</sup> and false expectations deluded you until Allah's command came to pass,<sup foot_note="181894">5</sup> and the Deluder<sup foot_note="181895">6</sup> deluded you concerning Allah.

So no ransom shall be accepted from you today, nor from those who disbelieved.<sup foot_note="181896">1</sup> You are destined for the Fire. That will be your guardian.<sup foot_note="181897">2</sup> And that indeed is a grievous destination.

Is the time not come that the hearts of the believers should be humbled to Allah's remembrance and to the Truth that He has revealed,<sup foot_note="181898">1</sup> and that they should not be like those who were vouchsafed the Book and then a long time elapsed so that their hearts were hardened? A great many of them are now evil-doers.<sup foot_note="181899">2</sup>
Know well that Allah revives the earth after it becomes lifeless. We have clearly shown Our Signs to you, perchance you will use your reason.<sup foot_note="181900">1</sup>
Verily those who give alms<sup foot_note="181901">1</sup> be they men or women, and give Allah a beautiful loan shall be repaid after increasing it many times; and theirs shall be a generous reward.

In Allah's sight only those who truly believe in Allah and His Messengers<sup foot_note="181902">1</sup> are utterly truthful<sup foot_note="181903">2</sup> and true bearers of witness(for the sake of Allah).<sup foot_note="181904">3</sup> For them is their reward and their light.<sup foot_note="181905">4</sup> As for those who gave the lie to Our Signs, they are the people of Hell.

Know well that the life of this world is merely sport and diversion and adornment and an object of your boasting with one another, and a rivalry in the multiplication of riches and children. Its likeness is that of rain: when it produces vegetation it delights the tillers. But then it withers and you see it turn yellow, and then it crumbles away. In the Hereafter there is (either) grievous chastisement (or) forgiveness from Allah and (His) good pleasure. The life of this world is nothing but delusion.<sup foot_note="181906">1</sup>

So vie with one another<sup foot_note="181907">1</sup> in seeking to attain your Lord's forgiveness and a Garden whose width is as the width of the heaven and the earth,<sup foot_note="181908">2</sup> one which has been prepared for those who believe in Allah and His Messengers. That is Allah's bounty which He bestows upon those whom He pleases. Allah is the Lord of abounding bounty.

No misfortune ever befalls on earth, nor on yourselves but We have inscribed it in the Book<sup foot_note="181909">1</sup> before We make it manifest.<sup foot_note="181910">2</sup> Surely that is easy for Allah.<sup foot_note="181911">3</sup>
(We do so) that you may not grieve over<sup foot_note="181912">1</sup> the loss you suffer, nor exult over what He gave you. Allah does not love the vainglorious, the boastful,

those who are niggardly and bid others to be niggardly.<sup foot_note="181913">1</sup> And he who turns away, (should know that) Allah is Self-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="181914">2</sup>

Indeed We sent Our Messengers with Clear Signs, and sent down with them the Book and the Balance that people may uphold justice.<sup foot_note="181915">1</sup> And We sent down iron, wherein there is awesome power and many benefits for people,<sup foot_note="181916">2</sup> so that Allah may know who, without even having seen Him, helps Him and His Messengers. Surely Allah is Most Strong, Most Mighty.<sup foot_note="181917">3</sup>

Indeed We<sup foot_note="181918">1</sup> sent forth Noah and Abraham and established in their line Prophecy and the Book.<sup foot_note="181919">2</sup> Then some of them embraced the guidance and many of them are wicked.<sup foot_note="181920">3</sup>

In their wake, We sent a succession of Our Messengers, and raised Jesus, son of Mary, after all of them, and bestowed upon him the Evangel, and We set tenderness and mercy<sup foot_note="181921">1</sup> in the hearts of those that followed him. As for monasticism,<sup foot_note="181922">2</sup> it is they who invented it;<sup foot_note="181923">3</sup> We did not prescribe it for them. They themselves invented it in pursuit of Allah's good pleasure, and then they did not observe it as it ought to have been observed.<sup foot_note="181924">4</sup> So We gave their reward to those of them that believed. But many of them are wicked.

Believers, have fear of Allah and believe in His Messenger,<sup foot_note="181925">1</sup> and He will grant you a two-fold portion of His Mercy, and will appoint for you a light whereby you shall walk;<sup foot_note="181926">2</sup> and He will forgive you.<sup foot_note="181927">3</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

(You should do this) so that the People of the Book know that they have no control over Allah's Bounty, and that all bounty is in Allah's Hand; He bestows it on whomsoever He pleases. Allah is the Lord of abounding bounty.

Allah<sup foot_note="181928">1</sup> has surely heard the words of her who contends with you concerning her husband and complains to Allah. Allah hears what both of you say.<sup foot_note="181929">2</sup> Verily Allah is All- Hearing, All-Seeing.

Those among you who divorce their wives by declaring them to be their mothers,<sup foot_note="181930">1</sup> such are not their mothers; none are their mothers except those who gave birth to them.<sup foot_note="181931">2</sup> Indeed what they say is highly contemptible and false.<sup foot_note="181932">3</sup> Verily Allah is Most Pardoning, Most Forgiving.<sup foot_note="181933">4</sup>

Those<sup foot_note="181935">1</sup> who declare their wives to be their mothers and thereafter go back on what they have said<sup foot_note="181936">2</sup> shall free a slave before they may touch each other. That is what you are exhorted to do.<sup foot_note="181937">3</sup> Allah is fully aware of all your deeds.<sup foot_note="181938">4</sup>

And he who does not find a slave (to free), shall fast for two months consecutively before they may touch each other; and he who is unable to do so shall feed sixty needy people.<sup foot_note="181939">1</sup> All this is in order that you may truly believe in Allah and His Messenger.<sup foot_note="181940">2</sup> These are the bounds set by Allah; and a grievous chastisement awaits the unbelievers.<sup foot_note="181941">3</sup>

Verily those who oppose Allah and His Messenger<sup foot_note="181942">1</sup> shall be brought low even as those before them were brought low.<sup foot_note="181943">2</sup> Surely We have sent down Clear Signs; and a humiliating chastisement awaits the unbelievers;<sup foot_note="181944">3</sup>

a chastisement that shall come upon them on the Day when Allah will raise them all to a new life and will inform them of their deeds.<sup foot_note="181945">1</sup> Allah has recorded it all while they have forgotten it. Allah is a witness over everything.

Are you not aware<sup foot_note="181946">1</sup> that Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth? Never is there any whispering among three but He is their fourth; nor among five but He is their sixth;<sup foot_note="181947">2</sup> nor fewer nor more but He is with them wherever they may be.<sup foot_note="181948">3</sup> And then He will tell them on the Day of Judgement all that they have done. Surely Allah knows everything.

Have you not seen those who were forbidden to whisper and yet they engaged in what they had been forbidden?<sup foot_note="181949">1</sup> They secretly converse among themselves concerning sin and transgression and disobedience to the Messenger. And when they come to you, they greet you in a manner that Allah does not greet you,<sup foot_note="181950">2</sup> and say to themselves: “Why does Allah not chastise us for these utterances of ours?”<sup foot_note="181951">3</sup> Hell it is that shall suffice them, and in it will they burn. How woeful is their destination!

Believers, when you converse in secrecy, let that not be concerning sin and transgression and disobedience to the Messenger; rather, converse concerning virtue and piety. And fear Allah to Whom all of you shall be mustered.<sup foot_note="181952">1</sup>

Whispering is an act of Satan, one that aims at causing grief to the believers; yet without Allah's leave no harm can be caused to them. So in Allah should the believers put all their trust.<sup foot_note="181953">1</sup>

Believers, when you are told: “Make room for one another in your assemblies,” then make room; Allah will bestow amplitude on you.<sup foot_note="181954">1</sup> And when it is said: “Rise up,” then rise up;<sup foot_note="181955">2</sup> Allah will raise to high ranks<sup foot_note="181956">3</sup> those of you who believe and are endowed with knowledge. Allah is well aware of all that you do.

Believers, when you come to the Messenger for private consultation, offer some charity before your consultation with him.<sup foot_note="181957">1</sup> That is better for you and more conducive to purity. But if you find nothing to offer in charity, then know that Allah is Most Merciful, Most Compassionate.

Are you afraid that you will have to offer charity when you hold private conversation with the Prophet? But if you are unable to do so and Allah pardons you, then establish Prayer and pay Zakah, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah is well aware of all that you do.<sup foot_note="181958">1</sup>

Do you not see those who took for friends a people whom Allah is wroth with?<sup foot_note="181959">1</sup> They neither belong to you nor you to them.<sup foot_note="181960">2</sup> They swear to a falsehood, and they do so knowingly.<sup foot_note="181961">3</sup>
Allah has prepared for them a grievous chastisement. Indeed, evil are the acts in which they are engaged.
They have taken their oaths as a shield by means of which they hinder people from the Way of Allah.<sup foot_note="181962">1</sup> Theirs shall be a humiliating chastisement.
Neither their possessions nor their offspring will be of any avail to them against Allah. They are the people of the Fire; therein they shall abide.

On the Day when Allah will raise them all from the dead they will swear before Him as they swear before you today,<sup foot_note="181963">1</sup> thinking that this will avail them. Behold, they are utter liars.
Satan has gained mastery over them and has made them neglect remembering Allah. They are the party of Satan. Behold, the party of Satan will be the losers.
Verily those who oppose Allah and His Messenger will be among the most abject beings.
Allah has written: “Surely I will prevail; I and My Messengers.”<sup foot_note="181964">1</sup> Verily Allah is Most Strong, Most Mighty.

You shall not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day befriending those who oppose Allah and His Messenger even though they be their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred.<sup foot_note="181966">1</sup> He has inscribed faith in their hearts and has strengthened them with a spirit from Him, and He shall make them enter Gardens beneath which rivers flow. Therein they shall abide. Allah is well-pleased with them, and they are well-pleased with Him. They belong to Allah's party. Verily Allah's party shall prosper.
All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth extols Allah's Glory: He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="181967">1</sup>

He it is Who in the first assault drove forth the People of the Book that disbelieved from their homes<sup foot_note="181968">1</sup> at the first gathering of forces.<sup foot_note="181969">2</sup> You did not believe that they would leave; while they too thought that their fortresses would defend them against Allah.<sup foot_note="181970">3</sup> Then Allah came upon them from whence they did not even imagine,<sup foot_note="181971">4</sup> casting such terror into their hearts that they destroyed their homes by their own hands and their destruction was also caused by the hands of the believers.<sup foot_note="181972">5</sup> So learn a lesson from this, O you who have perceptive eyes!<sup foot_note="181973">6</sup>
If Allah had not decreed banishment for them, He would certainly have chastised them in this world.<sup foot_note="181974">1</sup> As for the Hereafter, the chastisement of the Fire awaits them.
That is because they set themselves against Allah and His Messenger; and whoever sets himself against Allah should know that Allah is surely Most Stern in retribution.

The palm-trees that you cut down or those that you left standing on their roots, it was by Allah's leave that you did so.<sup foot_note="181975">1</sup> (Allah granted you this leave) in order that He might humiliate the evil-doers.<sup foot_note="181976">2</sup>

Whatever Allah has taken away from them and bestowed (as spoils) on His Messenger<sup foot_note="181977">1</sup> for which you spurred neither horses nor camels; but Allah grants authority to His Messengers over whomsoever He pleases. Allah has power over everything.<sup foot_note="181978">2</sup>

Whatever (from the possessions of the towns people) Allah has bestowed on His Messenger belongs to Allah, and to the Messenger, and to his kinsfolk, and to the orphans, and to the needy, and to the wayfarer<sup foot_note="181979">1</sup> so that it may not merely circulate between the rich among you.<sup foot_note="181980">2</sup> So accept whatever the Messenger gives you, and refrain from whatever he forbids you. And fear Allah: verily Allah is Most Stern in retribution.<sup foot_note="181981">3</sup>

It also belongs to the poor Emigrants who have been driven out of their homes and their possessions,<sup foot_note="181982">1</sup> those who seek Allah's favour and good pleasure and help Allah and His Messenger. Such are the truthful ones.

It also belongs to those who were already settled in this abode (of Hijrah) <sup foot_note="181983">1</sup> having come to faith before the (arrival of the) Muhajirun (Emigrants).They love those who have migrated to them and do not covet what has been given them; they even prefer them above themselves though poverty be their own lot.<sup foot_note="181984">2</sup> And whosoever are preserved from their own greed, such are the ones that will prosper.<sup foot_note="181985">3</sup>

(And it also belongs to) those who came after them,<sup foot_note="181986">1</sup> and who pray: “Lord, forgive us and our brethren who have preceded us in faith, and do not put in our hearts any rancour towards those who believe. Lord, You are the Most Tender, the Most Compassionate.”<sup foot_note="181987">2</sup>

Did<sup foot_note="181988">1</sup> you not see the hypocrites say to their brethren, the unbelievers among the People of the Book: “If you are banished we too will go with you and will not listen to anyone concerning you; and if war is waged against you, we will come to your aid.” But Allah bears witness that they are liars.

To be sure, if they are banished, they will not go with them and if war is waged against them, they will not aid them; and even if they provide any aid to them, they will still turn their backs, and thereafter no aid will be forthcoming to them.
Surely they have greater dread for you in their hearts than for Allah.<sup foot_note="181989">1</sup> That is because they are a people who are devoid of understanding.<sup foot_note="181990">2</sup>

They will never fight against you as a body (in an open battlefield); and if they fight against you they will fight only in fortified townships or from behind walls. Intense is their hostility to one another. You reckon them united while their hearts are divided.<sup foot_note="181991">1</sup> That is because they are a people devoid of reason.
They are like those who tasted the evil consequences of their deeds<sup foot_note="181992">1</sup> a short while before. A grievous chastisement awaits them.
Their parable is that of Satan when he says to man: “Disbelieve,” but when he disbelieves, he says: “I am quit of you. Verily I fear Allah, the Lord of the Universe.”<sup foot_note="181993">1</sup>
In the end both will be in the Fire, and will abide in it. That is the recompense of the wrong-doers.

Believers,<sup foot_note="181994">1</sup> fear Allah and let every person look to what he sends forward for the morrow.<sup foot_note="181995">2</sup> Fear Allah; Allah is well aware of all that you do.
And be not like those who forgot Allah and so He made them oblivious of themselves.<sup foot_note="181996">1</sup> They are the wicked ones.
Those destined for the Fire and those destined for Paradise cannot be alike. Verily it is those destined for Paradise who shall triumph.

Had We sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain you would indeed have seen it humbling itself and breaking asunder out of fear of Allah.<sup foot_note="181997">1</sup> We propound such parables to people that they may reflect.

He<sup foot_note="181998">1</sup> is Allah: there is no god but He;<sup foot_note="181999">2</sup> the Knower of the unseen and the manifest,<sup foot_note="182000">3</sup> He is the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="182001">4</sup>

He is Allah: there is no god but He: the King,<sup foot_note="182002">1</sup> the Holy,<sup foot_note="182003">2</sup> the All-Peace,<sup foot_note="182004">3</sup> the Giver of security,<sup foot_note="182005">4</sup> the Overseer,<sup foot_note="182006">5</sup> the Most Mighty,<sup foot_note="182007">6</sup> the Overpowering,<sup foot_note="182008">7</sup> the All-Great.<sup foot_note="182009">8</sup> Exalted be He from whatever they associate with Him.

He is Allah, the Planner,<sup foot_note="182010">1</sup> Executer and Fashioner of creation.<sup foot_note="182011">2</sup> His are the names most beautiful.<sup foot_note="182012">3</sup> Whatever is in the heavens and the earth extols His Glory.<sup foot_note="182013">4</sup> He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="182014">5</sup>

Believers,<sup foot_note="182015">1</sup> if you have left (your homes and) have come forth to struggle in My Way and to seek My good pleasure, do not make friends with My enemies and your enemies. You befriend them whereas they have spurned the Truth that has come to you; and (such is their enmity that) they expel the Messenger and yourselves for no other reason than that you believe in Allah, your Lord. You send to them messages of friendship in secrecy, although I know well whatever you do, be it secretly or publicly. And whosoever of you does so has indeed strayed far away from the Straight Path.
If they could overcome you, they would act as your foes and would hurt you by their hands and tongues, and would love to see you become unbelievers.<sup foot_note="182016">1</sup>

On the Day of Resurrection neither your blood-kindred nor your own offspring will avail you.<sup foot_note="182017">1</sup> (On that Day) He will separate you.<sup foot_note="182018">2</sup> Allah sees all that you do.<sup foot_note="182019">3</sup>

You have a good example in Abraham and his companions: they said to their people: “We totally dissociate ourselves from you, and from the deities that you worship instead of Allah. We renounce you<sup foot_note="182020">1</sup> and there has come to be enmity and hatred between us and you until you believe in Allah, the One True God.” (But you may not emulate) Abraham's saying to his father: “Certainly I will ask pardon for you, although I have no power over Allah to obtain anything on your behalf.”<sup foot_note="182021">2</sup> (And Abraham and his companions prayed): “Our Lord, in You have we put our trust, and to You have we turned, and to You is our ultimate return.
Our Lord, do not make us a test for the unbelievers,<sup foot_note="182022">1</sup> and forgive us, our Lord. Surely You are Most Mighty, Most Wise.”

Indeed there is a good example for you in them; a good example for anyone who looks forward to Allah and the Last Day.<sup foot_note="182023">1</sup> As for him who turns away, Allah is All-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="182024">2</sup>

It may well be that Allah will implant love between you and those with whom you have had enmity.<sup foot_note="182025">1</sup> Allah is Most Powerful; and Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

Allah does not forbid that you be kind and just to those who did not fight against you on account of religion, nor drove you out of your homes. Surely Allah loves those who are equitable.<sup foot_note="182026">1</sup>

Allah only forbids you to be friends with those who have fought against you on account of religion and who have driven you out of your homes and have abetted in your expulsion. And any who make friends with them, they are the wrong-doers.<sup foot_note="182027">1</sup>

Believers, when believing women come to you as Emigrants (in the cause of faith), examine them. Allah fully knows (the truth) concerning their faith. And when you have ascertained them to be believing women, do not send them back to the unbelievers.<sup foot_note="182028">1</sup> Those women are no longer lawful to the unbelievers, nor are those unbelievers lawful to those (believing) women. Give their unbelieving husbands whatever they have spent (as bridal-dues); and there is no offence for you to marry those women if you give them their bridal-dues.<sup foot_note="182029">2</sup> Do not hold on to your marriages with unbelieving women: ask for the return of the bridal-due you gave to your unbelieving wives and the unbelievers may ask for the return of the bridal-due they had given to their believing wives.<sup foot_note="182030">3</sup> Such is Allah's command. He judges between you. Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.

And if you fail to receive from the unbelievers a part of the bridal-due of your disbelieving wives, and then your turn comes, pay to those who have been left on the other side an amount the like of the bridal-due that they have paid.<sup foot_note="182032">1</sup> And have fear of Allah in Whom you believe.

O Prophet, when believing women come to you and pledge<sup foot_note="182033">1</sup> to you that they will not associate aught with Allah in His Divinity, that they will not steal,<sup foot_note="182034">2</sup> that they will not commit illicit sexual intercourse, that they will not kill their children,<sup foot_note="182035">3</sup> that they will not bring forth a calumny between their hands and feet,<sup foot_note="182036">4</sup> and that they will not disobey you in anything known to be good,<sup foot_note="182037">5</sup> then accept their allegiance<sup foot_note="182038">6</sup> and ask Allah to forgive them. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

Believers, do not make friends with those against whom Allah is wrathful and who are despaired of the Hereafter, as despaired as are the unbelievers lying in their graves.<sup foot_note="182039">1</sup>
All that is in the heavens and all that is on earth extols Allah's glory. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="182040">1</sup>
Believers, why do you profess that which you do not practise?
It is most loathsome in the sight of Allah that you should profess what you do not practise.<sup foot_note="182041">1</sup>
Allah indeed loves those who fight in His Way as though they are a solid wall cemented with molten lead.<sup foot_note="182042">1</sup>

And call to mind when Moses said to his people: “O my people, why do you torment me when you know well that I am Allah's Messenger to you?”<sup foot_note="182043">1</sup> So when they deviated, Allah made their hearts deviant. Allah does not direct the evil-doers to the Right Way.<sup foot_note="182044">2</sup>

And call<sup foot_note="182045">1</sup> to mind when Jesus, son of Mary, said: “O Children of Israel, I am Allah's Messenger to you, I verify the Torah which has come before me,<sup foot_note="182046">2</sup> and I give you the glad tiding of a Messenger who shall come after me, his name being Ahmad.”<sup foot_note="182047">3</sup> Yet when he came to them with Clear Signs they said: “This is sheer trickery.”<sup foot_note="182048">4</sup>

Who would be more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allah<sup foot_note="182049">1</sup> the while he is being called to Islam?<sup foot_note="182050">2</sup> Allah does not direct such evildoing folk to the Right Way.
They seek to extinguish Allah's light (by blowing) with their mouths, but Allah shall spread His light in all its fullness, howsoever the unbelievers may abhor this.<sup foot_note="182051">1</sup>

He it is Who has sent forth the Messenger with the Guidance and the True Religion that He may make it prevail over all religion, however those that associate aught with Allah in His Divinity might dislike this.<sup foot_note="182052">1</sup>
Believers, shall I direct you to a commerce<sup foot_note="182053">1</sup> that will deliver you from a grievous chastisement?

Have faith in Allah and His Messenger<sup foot_note="182054">1</sup> and strive in the Way of Allah with your possessions and your lives. That is better for you if you only knew.<sup foot_note="182055">2</sup>

He will forgive you your sins and will admit you to Gardens beneath which rivers flow. He will lodge you in excellent mansions in the Gardens of eternity. That is the supreme triumph.<sup foot_note="182056">1</sup>
He will also grant you the other favour that you desire: help from Allah and a victory that will come soon.<sup foot_note="182057">1</sup> Give glad tidings of this to the believers.

Believers, become Allah's helpers, as Jesus, son of Mary, said to the disciples:<sup foot_note="182058">1</sup> “Who is my helper in (calling people) to Allah?” The disciples had responded by saying: “We are Allah's helpers.”<sup foot_note="182059">2</sup> Then a section of the Children of Israel believed and a section rejected the call. Thereafter We aided the believers against their enemies, and they prevailed.<sup foot_note="182060">3</sup>
All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth extols the glory of Allah, the Sovereign, the Holy, the All- Mighty, the All-Wise.<sup foot_note="182061">1</sup>

He it is Who has sent to the gentiles a Messenger from among themselves,<sup foot_note="182062">1</sup> one who rehearses to them His verses, purifies their lives, and imparts to them the Book and the Wisdom<sup foot_note="182063">2</sup> although before that they were in utter error;<sup foot_note="182064">3</sup>
and (He has also) sent him to those others who have not yet joined them.<sup foot_note="182065">1</sup> He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="182066">2</sup>
Such is Allah's favour: He bestows it on whomsoever He pleases. Allah is the Lord of abounding favour.

The parable of those who were charged with the Torah and then they failed to live up to it<sup foot_note="182067">1</sup> is that of a donkey<sup foot_note="182068">2</sup> laden with books. Even more evil is the parable of the people who gave the lie to the Signs of Allah.<sup foot_note="182069">3</sup> Allah does not direct such wrong-doers to the Right Way.

Tell them: “O you who have become Judaised,<sup foot_note="182070">1</sup> if you arrogantly fancy that you are Allah's favourites<sup foot_note="182071">2</sup> to the exclusion of all people, then wish for death, if you are truthful in your claim.”<sup foot_note="182072">3</sup>
But they shall never wish for death because of the (evil) deeds they have committed.<sup foot_note="182073">1</sup> Allah is well aware of these evil-doers.

Tell them: “The death from which you flee will certainly overtake you. Then you will be returned to Him Who fully knows what is hidden and what is manifest. Thereupon He will let you know all that you used to do.”

Believers, when the call for Prayer is made on Friday,<sup foot_note="182074">1</sup> hasten to the remembrance of Allah and give up all trading.<sup foot_note="182075">2</sup> That is better for you, if you only knew.

But when the Prayer is ended, disperse in the land and seek Allah's Bounty,<sup foot_note="182076">1</sup> and remember Allah much<sup foot_note="182077">2</sup> so that you may prosper.<sup foot_note="182078">3</sup>

Yet no sooner than they saw some trading or amusement, they flocked to it and left you standing by yourself.<sup foot_note="182079">1</sup> Tell them: “That which is with Allah is far better than amusement and trading.<sup foot_note="182080">2</sup> Allah is the Best Provider of sustenance.”<sup foot_note="182081">3</sup>

(O Prophet), when the hypocrites come to you, they say: “We bear witness that you are certainly Allah's Messenger.” Allah certainly knows that you are His Messenger. But Allah also bears witness that the hypocrites are utter liars!<sup foot_note="182082">1</sup>
They shelter behind their oath,<sup foot_note="182083">1</sup> and thus hinder their own selves and others from the Path of Allah.<sup foot_note="182084">2</sup> Evil indeed is what they do.
All that is because they first believed and then disbelieved, and therefore a seal was set on their hearts; as a result they understand nothing.<sup foot_note="182085">1</sup>

When you look at them, their persons are pleasing, and when they speak, you pay heed to what they say.<sup foot_note="182086">1</sup> But in truth they are (merely) beams of timber propped-up (against a wall).<sup foot_note="182087">2</sup> They consider every shout they hear to be directed against them.<sup foot_note="182088">3</sup> They are your utter enemies;<sup foot_note="182089">4</sup> guard against them.<sup foot_note="182090">5</sup> May Allah do away with them!<sup foot_note="182091">6</sup> How are they being turned away (from the Truth)?<sup foot_note="182092">7</sup>
When it is said to them: “Come, Allah's Messenger will seek forgiveness for you,” they (contemptuously) shake their heads and you see them holding back in pride.<sup foot_note="182093">1</sup>

It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or not; for Allah shall never forgive them.<sup foot_note="182094">1</sup> Surely Allah does not direct the transgressing folk to the Right Way.<sup foot_note="182095">2</sup>

It is they who say: “Give nothing to those who are with the Messenger of Allah so that they may disperse.” (They say so although) the treasures of the heavens and the earth belong to Allah. But the hypocrites do not understand.

They say: “When we return to Madinah, the honourable ones will drive out from it those that are abject.”<sup foot_note="182096">1</sup> In truth, all honour belongs to Allah, and to His Messenger, and to the believers.<sup foot_note="182097">2</sup> But the hypocrites do not know.

Believers,<sup foot_note="182098">1</sup> let your possessions and your offspring not make you negligent of Allah's remembrance.<sup foot_note="182099">2</sup> For whoso does that, they will be the losers.

And spend of what Allah has granted you by way of sustenance before death should come to any of you and he should say: “Lord, why did You not defer my return for a while so that I might give alms and be among the righteous?”
But when a person's term comes to an end, Allah never grants any respite. Allah is well aware of all that you do.

All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth extols Allah's glory.<sup foot_note="182100">1</sup> His is the sovereignty<sup foot_note="182101">2</sup> and to Him is all praise due;<sup foot_note="182102">3</sup> He has power over everything.<sup foot_note="182103">4</sup>

He it is Who has created you: and among you are those that deny the Truth<sup foot_note="182104">1</sup> and among you are those that believe in it.<sup foot_note="182105">2</sup> Allah observes all that you do.
He created the heavens and the earth with Truth and shaped you, giving you excellent shapes. And to Him is your ultimate return.<sup foot_note="182106">1</sup>

He knows what is in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you conceal and what you disclose.<sup foot_note="182107">1</sup> Allah even knows what lies hidden in the breasts of people.<sup foot_note="182108">2</sup>
Has the news of the unbelievers of the past not reached you? (They disbelieved) and then tasted its evil consequence. A grievous chastisement awaits them.<sup foot_note="182109">1</sup>

This was because their Messengers would come to them with Clear Signs,<sup foot_note="182110">1</sup> but they would say: “Shall mortals (like ourselves) guide us to the Right Way?”<sup foot_note="182111">2</sup> They rejected the Truth and turned away. Thereupon Allah became unconcerned with them, for Allah is Self-Sufficient, Innately Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="182112">3</sup>

The unbelievers have vehemently contended that they shall not be raised to life.<sup foot_note="182113">1</sup> Say to them: “Yes, by my Lord, you shall surely be raised to life,<sup foot_note="182114">2</sup> and you shall certainly be fully informed of all that you did. <sup foot_note="182115">3</sup> That is easy enough for Allah.”<sup foot_note="182116">4</sup>
So believe in Allah and in His Messenger and in the Light that We have sent down.<sup foot_note="182117">1</sup> Allah is fully aware of what you do.

(You shall come to know that) when He will assemble you on the Day of Gathering.<sup foot_note="182118">1</sup> That shall be the Day (to determine) mutual gains and losses.<sup foot_note="182119">2</sup> Whoever believes in Allah and acts righteously,<sup foot_note="182120">3</sup> Allah will have his evil deeds expunged and will admit him to Gardens beneath which rivers flow. Therein they shall abide forever. That is the supreme triumph.
As for those who disbelieved and gave the lie to Our Signs:<sup foot_note="182121">1</sup> they shall be the inmates of the Fire, and will abide in it. That is a woeful resort!

No misfortune<sup foot_note="182122">1</sup> ever befalls unless it be by Allah's leave.<sup foot_note="182123">2</sup> And whosoever has faith in Allah, Allah directs his heart along the Right Path.<sup foot_note="182124">3</sup> Allah has knowledge of everything.<sup foot_note="182125">4</sup>
Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away from obedience, (then know that) Our Messenger has no other duty than to clearly convey the Truth.<sup foot_note="182126">1</sup>
Allah there is no god but He; in Allah should the believers put all their trust.<sup foot_note="182127">1</sup>

Believers, there are enemies to you from among your spouses and your off-spring, so beware of them. But if you forgive and overlook their offences and pardon them, then surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="182128">1</sup>
Your possessions and your offspring are nothing but a trial for you. And there awaits a great reward<sup foot_note="182129">1</sup> for you with Allah.

So hold Allah in awe as much as you can,<sup foot_note="182130">1</sup> and listen and obey, and be charitable. This is for your own good. And whoever remains safe from his own greediness, it is such that will prosper.<sup foot_note="182131">2</sup>

If you give Allah a goodly loan, He will increase it for you several fold<sup foot_note="182132">1</sup> and will forgive you. Allah is Most Appreciative, Most Forbearing.<sup foot_note="182133">2</sup>
He knows that which is beyond the ken of perception as well as that which can be perceived. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

O Prophet, when you divorce women, divorce them for their waiting-period,<sup foot_note="182134">1</sup> and compute the waiting period accurately,<sup foot_note="182135">2</sup> and hold Allah, your Lord, in awe. Do not turn them out of their homes (during the waiting period) – nor should they go away (from their homes)<sup foot_note="182136">3</sup>– unless they have committed a manifestly evil deed.<sup foot_note="182137">4</sup> Such are the bounds set by Allah; and he who transgresses the bounds set by Allah commits a wrong against himself. You do not know: maybe Allah will cause something to happen to pave the way (for reconciliation).<sup foot_note="182138">5</sup>

And when they reach the end of their term (of waiting), then either honourably retain them (in the bond of wedlock) or honourably part with them,<sup foot_note="182139">1</sup> and call two persons of known probity as witnesses from among yourselves,<sup foot_note="182140">2</sup> and (let these witnesses) give upright testimony for the sake of Allah. That is to what all those that believe in Allah and the Last Day are exhorted.<sup foot_note="182141">3</sup> Allah will find a way out for him who fears Allah,<sup foot_note="182142">4</sup>

and will provide him sustenance from whence he never even imagined.<sup foot_note="182143">1</sup> Whoever puts his trust in Allah, He shall suffice him. Surely Allah brings about what He decrees;<sup foot_note="182144">2</sup> Allah has set a measure for everything.

The waiting period of those of your women who have lost all expectation of menstruation shall be three months<sup foot_note="182146">1</sup> in case you entertain any doubt; and the same shall apply to those who have not yet menstruated.<sup foot_note="182147">2</sup> As for pregnant women, their waiting period shall be until the delivery of their burden.<sup foot_note="182148">3</sup> Allah will create ease for him who fears Allah.
This is the commandment of Allah that He has revealed to you. Whoever fears Allah, He will expunge his evil deeds and will richly reward him.<sup foot_note="182149">1</sup>

(During the waiting period) lodge them according to your means wherever you dwell, and do not harass them to make them miserable.<sup foot_note="182150">1</sup> And if they are pregnant, provide for them maintenance until they have delivered their burden.<sup foot_note="182151">2</sup> And if they suckle your offspring whom they bore you, then give them due recompense, and graciously settle the question of compensation between yourselves by mutual understanding.<sup foot_note="182152">3</sup> But if you experience difficulty (in determining the compensation for suckling) then let another woman suckle the child.<sup foot_note="182153">4</sup>

Whoever has abundant means, let him spend according to his means; and he whose means are straitened, let him spend out of what Allah has given him. Allah does not burden any human being beyond the means that He has bestowed upon him. Possibly Allah will grant ease after hardship.

How many towns<sup foot_note="182154">1</sup> rebelled against the commandment of their Lord and His Messengers. Then We called them to a stern accounting, and subjected them to a harrowing chastisement.
So they tasted the evil fruit of their deeds; and the fruit of their deeds was utter loss.
Allah has laid in store for them a grievous chastisement. So fear Allah, O people of understanding who have attained to faith. Allah has sent down to you an Exhortation,

a Messenger<sup foot_note="182155">1</sup> who rehearses to you Allah's verses that clearly expound the Guidance so that He may bring out those that believe and act righteously, from every kind of darkness into light.<sup foot_note="182156">2</sup> He will admit whosoever believes in Allah and acts righteously to Gardens beneath which rivers flow. They shall abide in them forever. For such has Allah made an excellent provision.

Allah it is He Who created seven heavens, and, like them, the earth.<sup foot_note="182157">1</sup> His commandment descends among them. (All this is being stated so that you know) that Allah has power over everything, and that Allah encompasses all things in His knowledge.

O Prophet, why do you forbid what Allah has made lawful for you?<sup foot_note="182158">1</sup> Is it to please your wives?<sup foot_note="182159">2</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="182160">3</sup>
Allah has prescribed for you a way for the absolution of your oaths.<sup foot_note="182161">1</sup> Allah is your Guardian. He is All-Knowing, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="182162">2</sup>

The Prophet confided something to one of his wives and then she disclosed it (to another); so after Allah revealed to the Prophet (that she had disclosed that secret), he made a part of it known to her and passed over a part of it. And when he told her about this (i.e., that she had disclosed the secret entrusted to her), she asked: “Who informed you of this?” He said: “I was told of it by He Who is All-Knowing, All-Aware.”<sup foot_note="182163">1</sup>

If the two of you turn in repentance to Allah (that is better for you), for the hearts of both of you have swerved from the Straight Path.<sup foot_note="182164">1</sup> But if you support one another against the Prophet,<sup foot_note="182165">2</sup> then surely Allah is his Protector; and after that Gabriel and all righteous believers and the angels are all his supporters.<sup foot_note="182166">3</sup>

Maybe if he were to divorce you, your Lord might grant him in exchange wives better than you<sup foot_note="182167">1</sup> – those who truly submit to Allah,<sup foot_note="182168">2</sup> are full of faith, obedient,<sup foot_note="182169">3</sup> disposed to repentance,<sup foot_note="182170">4</sup> and given to worship<sup foot_note="182171">5</sup> and fasting<sup foot_note="182172">6</sup> – both previously wedded ones and virgins.

Believers, guard yourselves and your kindred against a Fire whose fuel is human beings and stones,<sup foot_note="182173">1</sup> a Fire held in the charge of fierce and stern angels who never disobey what He has commanded them, and always do what they are bidden.<sup foot_note="182174">2</sup>
(It will then be said): “Unbelievers, make no excuses today. You are being recompensed for nothing else but your deeds.”<sup foot_note="182175">1</sup>

Believers, turn to Allah in sincere repentance;<sup foot_note="182176">1</sup> maybe your Lord will expunge your evil deeds and admit you to the Gardens beneath which rivers flow.<sup foot_note="182177">2</sup> This will be on the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who have embraced faith and are with him;<sup foot_note="182178">3</sup> their light will be running before them and on their right hands, and they will say: “Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Surely You have power over everything.”<sup foot_note="182179">4</sup>
O Prophet, strive against the unbelievers and the hypocrites, and be severe with them.<sup foot_note="182145">1</sup> Hell shall be their resort. What a grievous end!

Allah has set forth for the unbelievers the parable of the wives of Noah and Lot. They were wedded to two of Our righteous servants, but each acted treacherously with her husband,<sup foot_note="182180">1</sup> and their husbands could be of no avail to them against Allah. The two of them were told: “Enter the Fire with all the others who enter it.”

Allah has set forth for the believers the parable of Pharaoh's wife. She prayed: “My Lord, build for me a house with You in Paradise and deliver me from Pharaoh and his misdeeds;<sup foot_note="182181">1</sup> and deliver me from the iniquitous people.”

Allah has also set forth the parable of Mary, the daughter of Imran,<sup foot_note="182182">1</sup> who guarded her chastity,<sup foot_note="182183">2</sup> and into whom We breathed of Our Spirit,<sup foot_note="182184">3</sup> and who testified to the words of her Lord and His Books. She was among the obedient.<sup foot_note="182185">4</sup>
Blessed is He<sup foot_note="182186">1</sup> in Whose Hand is the dominion of the Universe,<sup foot_note="182187">2</sup> and Who has power over everything;<sup foot_note="182188">3</sup>
Who created death and life that He might try you as to which of you is better in deed.<sup foot_note="182189">1</sup> He is the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving;<sup foot_note="182190">2</sup>

Who created the seven heavens one upon another.<sup foot_note="182191">1</sup> You will see no incongruity in the Merciful One's creation.<sup foot_note="182192">2</sup> Turn your vision again, can you see any flaw?<sup foot_note="182193">3</sup>
Then turn your vision again, and then again; in the end your vision will come back to you, worn out and frustrated.

We have adorned the lower heaven<sup foot_note="182194">1</sup> with lamps,<sup foot_note="182195">2</sup> and have made them a means to drive away the satans.<sup foot_note="182196">3</sup> We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.
The chastisement of Hell awaits those who disbelieve in their Lord.<sup foot_note="182197">1</sup> What a wretched destination!
When they will be cast into it, they will hear it roar as it boils,<sup foot_note="182198">1</sup>
as though it will burst with rage. Every time a multitude is cast into it, its keepers will ask them: “Did no warner come to you?”<sup foot_note="182199">1</sup>
They will say: “Yes, a warner came to us, but we gave the lie to him and said: 'Allah has revealed nothing. You are surely in huge error.'<sup foot_note="182200">1</sup>
They will say: 'If we had only listened and understood,<sup foot_note="182201">1</sup> we would not be among the inmates of the Blazing Fire.'”
Thus will they confess their sins.<sup foot_note="182202">1</sup> Damned are these inmates of the Blazing Fire.
Surely forgiveness and a mighty reward<sup foot_note="182203">1</sup> await those who fear Allah without seeing Him.<sup foot_note="182204">2</sup>
Whether you speak in secrecy or aloud, (it is all the same to Allah). He even knows the secrets that lie hidden in the breasts of people.<sup foot_note="182205">1</sup>
Would He not know, He Who has created,<sup foot_note="182206">1</sup> when He is All-Subtle,<sup foot_note="182207">2</sup> All-Aware?

He it is Who made the earth subservient to you. So traverse in its tracks and partake of the sustenance<sup foot_note="182208">1</sup> He has provided. To Him will you be resurrected.<sup foot_note="182209">2</sup>
Do you feel secure that He Who is in the heaven<sup foot_note="182210">1</sup> will not cause the earth to cave in with you, and then suddenly it will begin to rock violently?

Do you feel secure that He Who is in the heaven will not let loose upon you a storm of stones?<sup foot_note="182211">1</sup> Then shall you know what My warning is like!<sup foot_note="182212">2</sup>
Those who came before them also gave the lie (to the Messengers): then how awesome was My chastisement!<sup foot_note="182213">1</sup>

Have they not seen birds above them spreading and closing their wings, with none holding them except the Merciful One?<sup foot_note="182214">1</sup> He oversees everything.<sup foot_note="182215">2</sup>
Which is your army that will come to your aid against the Merciful Lord?<sup foot_note="182216">1</sup> But the unbelievers are in utter delusion.
Who shall provide for you if He withholds His sustenance? Nay; but they persist in rebellion and aversion.
Who is better guided: he who walks grovelling on his face,<sup foot_note="182217">1</sup> or he who walks upright on a Straight Path?
Say: “He it is Who has brought you into being, and has given you hearing and sight, and has given you hearts to think and understand. How seldom do you give thanks!”<sup foot_note="182218">1</sup>
Say: “Allah it is Who multiplied you in the earth and to Him you will be mustered.”<sup foot_note="182219">1</sup>
They say: “If you are truthful, tell us when will this promise (of the Hereafter) be fulfilled?”<sup foot_note="182220">1</sup>
Say: “Allah alone knows about that; and I am no more than a plain warner.”<sup foot_note="182221">1</sup>

When they will see it near at hand, the faces of all those who had denied it will be distraught,<sup foot_note="182222">1</sup> and then they will be told: “This is the doom which you used to ask for.”

Say to them: “Did you ever consider: whether Allah destroys me and those that are with me, or shows mercy to us, who can protect the unbelievers from a grievous chastisement?”<sup foot_note="182223">1</sup>
Say to them: “He is Merciful, and it is in Him that we believe, and it is in Him that we put all our trust.<sup foot_note="182224">1</sup> Soon will you know who is in manifest error.”

Say to them: “Did you even consider: if all the water that you have (in the wells) were to sink down into the depths of the earth, who will produce for you clear, flowing water?”<sup foot_note="182225">1</sup>
Nun. By the pen and what the scribes write.<sup foot_note="182226">1</sup>
By your Lord's Grace, you are not afflicted with madness,<sup foot_note="182227">1</sup>
and surely yours shall be a never-ending reward,<sup foot_note="182228">1</sup>
and you are certainly on the most exalted standard of moral excellence.<sup foot_note="182229">1</sup>
So you will soon see, and they too will see,
which of you is afflicted with madness.
Surely your Lord knows well those who have strayed from His Way just as He knows well those who are on the Right Way.
Do not, then, yield to those who reject the Truth, decrying it as false;
they would wish you to be pliant so that they too may be pliant.<sup foot_note="182230">1</sup>
And do not yield to any contemptible swearer,<sup foot_note="182231">1</sup>
the fault-finder who goes around slandering,
the hinderer of good,<sup foot_note="182232">1</sup> the transgressor, the sinful;<sup foot_note="182233">2</sup>
the coarse-grained, and above all mean and ignoble;<sup foot_note="182234">1</sup>
(who so acts) simply because he has wealth and sons,<sup foot_note="182235">1</sup>
and whenever Our verses are rehearsed to him, he says: “These are fairy- tales of times gone by.”
Soon shall We brand him on his snout.<sup foot_note="182236">1</sup>

We have put them [i.e., the Makkans] to test even as We put to test the owners of the orchard<sup foot_note="182237">1</sup> when they vowed that they would gather the fruit of their orchard in the morning,
without making any allowance (for the will of Allah).<sup foot_note="182238">1</sup>
Thereupon a calamity from your Lord passed over it while they were asleep,
and so by morning the orchard lay as though it had been fully harvested.
At daybreak they called out to one another:
“Hurry to your orchard<sup foot_note="182239">1</sup> if you would gather its fruit.”
So off they went, whispering to one another:
“No destitute person shall enter it today.”
They went forth early, believing that they had the power (to gather the fruit).<sup foot_note="182240">1</sup>
But as soon as they beheld the orchard, (they cried out): “We have certainly lost the way;
rather, we are utterly ruined.”<sup foot_note="181934">1</sup>
The best among them said: “Did I not say to you: why do you not give glory to (your Lord)?”<sup foot_note="181965">1</sup>
They cried out: “Glory be to our Lord! Certainly we were sinners.”
Then they began to reproach one another.<sup foot_note="182241">1</sup>
They said: “Woe to us! We had indeed transgressed.
Maybe our Lord will give us a better orchard in its place; to our Lord do we penitently turn.”
Such is the chastisement; and the chastisement of the Hereafter is assuredly even greater, if only they knew.
Surely<sup foot_note="182242">1</sup> the God-fearing shall have Gardens of bliss with their Lord.
What! Shall We treat those who have submitted (to Our command) like those who have acted as criminals?
What is the matter with you? How ill do you judge!<sup foot_note="182243">1</sup>
Or do you have a Book<sup foot_note="182244">1</sup> wherein you read
that (in the Hereafter) you shall have all that you choose for yourselves?
Or have We sworn a covenant with you which We are bound to keep till the Day of Resurrection, (a covenant requiring that whatever you ordain for yourselves shall be yours)?
Ask them: “Which of them can guarantee that?<sup foot_note="182245">1</sup>
Or has something been guaranteed by any of those whom they associate with Allah in His Divinity?” If so, let them bring forth their associates, if they are truthful.<sup foot_note="182246">1</sup>
On the Day when the dreadful calamity will unfold,<sup foot_note="182247">1</sup> when people will be summoned to prostrate themselves, and yet they will not be able to prostrate.
Their eyes shall be downcast and ignominy shall overwhelm them. For when they were safe and sound, they were summoned to prostrate themselves, (and they refused).<sup foot_note="182248">1</sup>

So leave Me, (O Prophet), to deal with him who gives the lie to this Discourse.<sup foot_note="182249">1</sup> We shall draw them little by little (to their undoing) in a way that they will not know.<sup foot_note="182250">2</sup>
I am giving them a respite. Great is My scheme!<sup foot_note="182251">1</sup>
Or are you asking them for some compensation so that they feel burdened with debt?<sup foot_note="182252">1</sup>
Or do they have any knowledge of the Unseen which they are now writing down?<sup foot_note="182253">1</sup>

So bear with patience until the Judgement of your Lord<sup foot_note="182254">1</sup> comes, and do not belike the man in the fish (i.e., Jonah)<sup foot_note="182255">2</sup> who called out, choking with grief:<sup foot_note="182256">3</sup>
had his Lord not bestowed His favour upon him, he would have been cast upon that barren shore (and would have remained there) in disgrace.<sup foot_note="182257">1</sup>
But his Lord exalted him, and included him among His righteous servants.

When the unbelievers hear this Exhortation, they look at you as though they would knock you off your feet with their (hostile) glances.<sup foot_note="182258">1</sup> They say: “Surely he is afflicted with madness”;
although this is nothing but an Exhortation (to goodness) for everyone in the world.
The indubitable event!<sup foot_note="182259">1</sup>
And what is that indubitable event?
And what do you know what that indubitable event is?<sup foot_note="182260">1</sup>
The Thamud<sup foot_note="182261">1</sup> and the Ad denied the (possibility of a) sudden calamity,<sup foot_note="182262">2</sup> calling it false.
Then the Thamud were destroyed by an awesome upheaval;<sup foot_note="182263">1</sup>
and the Ad were destroyed by a furiously raging wind-storm

which He let loose upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession; so that (if you had been there) you might have seen people lying prostrate, as though they were uprooted trunks of hollowed palm trees.
Do you now see any trace of them?
Pharaoh and those before him and the people of the overturned habitations<sup foot_note="182264">1</sup> all engaged in the same great sin.
They did not follow the Messenger of their Lord, and so He seized them with a severe grip.
Verily when the water rose to great heights,<sup foot_note="182265">1</sup> We bore you upon a floating vessel (i.e. the Ark)<sup foot_note="182266">2</sup>
so that We might make it an instructive event for you, and retentive ears might preserve its memory.<sup foot_note="182267">1</sup>
So<sup foot_note="182268">1</sup> when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast
and the earth and the mountains are carried aloft and are crushed to bits at one stroke,
on that Day shall that indubitable event come to pass;
when the sky will be rent asunder, the grip holding it together having loosened on that Day,
and the angels will stand on the sides, with eight of them bearing aloft the Throne<sup foot_note="182269">1</sup> of your Lord on that Day.
That will be the Day when you shall be brought forth (before Allah) and no secret of yours shall remain hidden.
On that Day, he whose Record is given to him in his right hand<sup foot_note="182270">1</sup> will say: “Lo! Read my Record!<sup foot_note="182271">2</sup>
Verily I was sure that I would be handed over my account.”<sup foot_note="182272">1</sup>
Then he shall find himself in a life of bliss;
in a lofty Garden
the clusters of whose fruit will be hanging low to be within reach (of the inmates of Paradise).
(They will be told): “Eat and drink with good cheer as a reward for the good deeds you did in the days that have passed by.”
As for him whose Record will be given to him in his left hand,<sup foot_note="182273">1</sup> he will exclaim: “Would that I had never been given my Record,<sup foot_note="182274">2</sup>
and had not known my account.<sup foot_note="182275">1</sup>
Oh! Would that the death that came to me in the world had made an end of me!<sup foot_note="182276">1</sup>
My riches have not availed me,
and my authority has vanished.”<sup foot_note="182277">1</sup>
(A command will be issued): “Seize him and shackle him,
then cast him in the Fire,
then fasten him with a chain, seventy cubits long.
He would not believe in Allah, the Most Great;
nor would he urge the feeding of the poor.<sup foot_note="182278">1</sup>
Today he has been left here friendless;
and has no food except the filth from the washing of wounds,
which only the sinners will eat.”
But no;<sup foot_note="182279">1</sup> I swear by what you see,
and by what you do not see,
that this is the speech of an honourable Messenger,<sup foot_note="182280">1</sup>
not the speech of a poet. Little do you believe!<sup foot_note="182281">1</sup>
Nor is this the speech of a soothsayer. Little do you reflect!
It has been revealed by the Lord of the Universe.<sup foot_note="182282">1</sup>
And if he [i.e., the Prophets] had forged this Discourse and thereafter ascribed it to Us,
We would surely have seized him by the right hand,
and then severed his life vein;
and not one of you would have been able to withhold Us from doing so.<sup foot_note="182283">1</sup>
Surely it is a Good Counsel for the God-fearing.<sup foot_note="182284">1</sup>
We certainly know that some among you will give the lie to it,
and surely it will be a cause of regret for the unbelievers.<sup foot_note="182285">1</sup>
Certainly it is a Truth of absolute certainty.
So glorify the name of your Lord Most Great.
A beseecher besought the visitation of chastisement,<sup foot_note="182286">1</sup>
(a chastisement meant) for the unbelievers, one which none can avert;
a chastisement from Allah, the Lord of the ascending steps,<sup foot_note="182287">1</sup>
by which the angels and the Spirit<sup foot_note="182288">1</sup> ascend to Him<sup foot_note="182289">2</sup> in one Day the duration of which is fifty thousand years.<sup foot_note="182290">3</sup>
So, (O Prophet), persevere with gracious perseverance.<sup foot_note="182291">1</sup>
Verily they think that the chastisement is far off,
while We think that it is near at hand.<sup foot_note="182292">1</sup>
It shall befall on a Day<sup foot_note="182293">1</sup> whereon the sky will become like molten brass,<sup foot_note="182294">2</sup>
and the mountains will become like dyed tufts of wool,<sup foot_note="182295">1</sup>
and no bosom friend will enquire about any of his bosom friends
although they shall be within sight of one another.<sup foot_note="182296">1</sup> The guilty one would fain ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his children,
and his spouse and his brother,
and his kinsfolk who had stood by him,
and all persons of the earth, if only he could thus save himself.
By no means! It will be the fierce flame
that will strip off the scalp.
It shall insistently summon him who turned his back and retreated,
and amassed wealth and covetously hoarded it.<sup foot_note="182297">1</sup>
Verily man is impatient by nature:<sup foot_note="182298">1</sup>
bewailing when evil befalls him,
and tight-fisted when good fortune visits him,
except those that pray,<sup foot_note="182299">1</sup>
and are constant in their Prayer;<sup foot_note="182300">1</sup>
and those in whose wealth there is a known right
for those that ask and those that are dispossessed,<sup foot_note="182301">1</sup>
those who firmly believe in the Day of Recompense,<sup foot_note="182302">1</sup>
and fear the chastisement of their Lord<sup foot_note="182303">1</sup>–
surely the chastisement of their Lord is a thing none can feel secure from –
and those who guard their private parts,<sup foot_note="182304">1</sup>
except in regard to their spouses and those whom their right hands possess, for in regard to them they are not reproachable,<sup foot_note="182305">1</sup>
but any who seeks to go beyond that, it is indeed they who are the transgressors,
and those who fulfil their trusts and their covenants,<sup foot_note="182306">1</sup>
and those who are upright in their testimonies;<sup foot_note="182307">1</sup>
and who take due care of their Prayer:<sup foot_note="182308">1</sup>
all these shall live honourably in the Gardens.
But what is the matter with the unbelievers who are hurrying towards you
in crowds, both on the right and on the left?<sup foot_note="182309">1</sup>
Does everyone of them wish to enter the Garden of Bliss?<sup foot_note="182310">1</sup>
By no means! They know that which We have created them from.<sup foot_note="182311">1</sup>
I swear<sup foot_note="182312">1</sup> by the Lord of the easts and the wests<sup foot_note="182313">2</sup> that We have the power
to replace them by others who would be better than they; and We shall certainly not be overpowered.<sup foot_note="182314">1</sup>
So leave them to engage in vain talk and to amuse themselves until they come face to face with the Day which they are promised,
the Day on which they will hastily come forth from their graves, as though they were hurrying on to the altars of their deities.<sup foot_note="182315">1</sup>
Their eyes will be downcast and disgrace will overwhelm them. Such is the Day that they were promised.
We sent Noah to his people (and directed him): “Warn your people before a grievous chastisement<sup foot_note="182316">1</sup> comes upon them.”
Noah said: “My people, I have certainly been sent as a clear warner to you,
that you serve Allah and fear Him, and follow me;<sup foot_note="182317">1</sup>

He will forgive your sins<sup foot_note="182318">1</sup> and will grant you respite until an appointed term.<sup foot_note="182319">2</sup> Indeed when Allah's appointed term comes, it cannot be deferred;<sup foot_note="182320">3</sup> if you only knew!”<sup foot_note="182321">4</sup>
He said:<sup foot_note="182322">1</sup> “My Lord, I called my people by night and by day,
but the more I called, the farther they fled.<sup foot_note="182323">1</sup>

And every time I called them so that You might forgive them,<sup foot_note="182324">1</sup> they thrust their fingers into their ears and wrapped up their faces with their garments<sup foot_note="182325">2</sup> and obstinately clung to their attitude, and waxed very proud.<sup foot_note="182326">3</sup>
Then I summoned them openly,
and preached to them in public, and also addressed them in secret.
I said to them: “Ask forgiveness from your Lord; surely He is Most Forgiving.
He will shower upon you torrents from heaven,
and will provide you with wealth and children, and will bestow upon you gardens and rivers.<sup foot_note="182327">1</sup>
What is amiss with you that you do not look forward to the majesty of Allah<sup foot_note="182328">1</sup>
when He has created you in stages?<sup foot_note="182329">1</sup>
Do you not see how Allah has created seven heavens, one upon the other,
and has placed the moon in them as a light, and the sun as a radiant lamp?
And Allah has caused you to grow out of the earth so wondrously,<sup foot_note="182330">1</sup>
and He will later cause you to return to it and will then again bring you out of it.
Allah has made the earth a wide expanse for you
so that you may tread its spacious paths.”
Noah said: “My Lord, they did not pay heed to what I said, and followed those (nobles) whose possession of wealth and children has led them to an even greater loss.
They contrived a plot of great magnitude.<sup foot_note="182331">1</sup>
They said: “Do not abandon your deities; do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yaghuth, nor Yauq, nor Nasr.<sup foot_note="182332">1</sup>
They have misled many. So do not enable these evildoers to increase in anything except straying (from the Right Way).”<sup foot_note="182333">1</sup>

And so they were drowned on account of their sins, and then cast into the Fire,<sup foot_note="182334">1</sup> and did not find any other than Allah,<sup foot_note="182335">2</sup> to come forth to their help.
Noah said: “My Lord, do not leave out of these unbelievers even a single dweller on earth,
for certainly if You should leave them (alive), they will mislead Your servants, and will beget none but sinners and utter unbelievers.
My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and forgive all believers, both men and women, and do not increase the wrong-doers in anything except perdition.”
Say, (O Prophet), it was revealed to me that a band of jinn attentively listened<sup foot_note="182336">1</sup> to (the recitation of the Qur'an) and then (went back to their people) and said:

“We have indeed heard a wonderful Qur'an<sup foot_note="182337">1</sup> which guides to the Right Way; so we have come to believe in it, and we will not associate aught with Our Lord in His Divinity”;<sup foot_note="182338">2</sup>
and that “He – exalted be His Majesty – has not taken to Himself either a wife or a son”;<sup foot_note="182339">1</sup>
and that “the foolish among us<sup foot_note="182340">1</sup> have been wont to say outrageous things about Allah”;
and that “we had thought that men and jinn would never speak a lie about Allah”,<sup foot_note="182341">1</sup>
and that “some from among the humans used to seek protection of some among the jinn, and thus they increased the arrogance<sup foot_note="182342">1</sup> of the jinn”;
and that “they thought, even as you thought, that Allah would never raise anyone (as a Messenger)”;<sup foot_note="182343">1</sup>
and that “we tried to pry (the secrets of) the heaven, but we found it full of terrible guards and shooting meteors”;
and that “we would take up stations in the heaven to try to hear but anyone who now attempts to listen finds a shooting meteor in wait for him”;<sup foot_note="182344">1</sup>
and that “we do not know whether evil is intended for those on the earth, or whether their Lord intends to direct them to the Right Way”;<sup foot_note="182345">1</sup>
