and that “some of us are upright and some of us are otherwise for we follow widely divergent paths”;<sup foot_note="182346">1</sup>
and that “we thought that we will neither be able to frustrate Allah on earth, nor frustrate Him by flight”;<sup foot_note="182347">1</sup>

and that “when we heard the teaching of the Right Way we came to believe in it; he who believes in His Lord shall have no fear of suffering loss or being subjected to any injustice”;<sup foot_note="182348">1</sup>
and that “among us some are Muslims (Those who have submitted to Allah), and some of us are deviant. So those who became Muslims found the Right Course;
but those who deviated from the Truth, will be the fuel for Hell.”<sup foot_note="182349">1</sup>
If<sup foot_note="182350">1</sup> people were to keep firmly to the Right Way, We would have vouchsafed them abundant rain<sup foot_note="182351">2</sup>

so that We might try them through this bounty.<sup foot_note="182352">1</sup> Whoso turns away from the remembrance of his Lord,<sup foot_note="182353">2</sup> He will cause him to suffer a grievous chastisement;
and that “mosques belong to Allah, so do not invoke anyone with Him”;<sup foot_note="182354">1</sup>
and when Allah's servant<sup foot_note="182355">1</sup> stood up to call on Him, they well-nigh swarmed him.
Say, (O Prophet): “I call on my Lord alone, and I do not associate aught with Him in His Divinity.”<sup foot_note="182356">1</sup>
Say: “Surely neither it is in my power to hurt you nor to bring you to the Right Way.”
Say: “None can protect me from Allah, nor can I find a refuge apart from Him.

(My task is no more than) to deliver Allah's proclamation and His messages.<sup foot_note="182357">1</sup> And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, surely the Fire of Hell awaits him; therein he will abide in perpetuity.”<sup foot_note="182358">2</sup>

(They shall not change their ways) until they see that against which they had been warned, and then they will know whose helpers are weaker and whose supporters are fewer in number.<sup foot_note="182359">1</sup>
Say: “I know not whether what you are promised is near or whether my Lord will prolong its term.<sup foot_note="182360">1</sup>
He is the Knower of the Unseen, and He does not disclose His Unseen to anyone<sup foot_note="182361">1</sup>

other than to a Messenger whom He chooses<sup foot_note="182362">1</sup> (for the bestowal of any part of the knowledge of the Unseen), whereafter He appoints guards who go before him and behind him,<sup foot_note="182363">2</sup>

so that He may know that they have delivered the messages of their Lord.<sup foot_note="182364">1</sup> He encompasses in His knowledge their surroundings and keeps a count of all things.”<sup foot_note="182365">2</sup>
O you the (sleeping) enwrapped one!<sup foot_note="182366">1</sup>
Stand up in Prayer by night, all but a small part of it;<sup foot_note="182367">1</sup>
half of it, or reduce it a little;
or add to it a little;<sup foot_note="182368">1</sup> and recite the Qur'an slowly and distinctly.<sup foot_note="182369">2</sup>
Behold, We shall cast upon you a Weighty Word.<sup foot_note="182370">1</sup>

Surely getting up at night<sup foot_note="182371">1</sup> is the best means of subduing the self<sup foot_note="182372">2</sup> and is more suitable for uprightness in speech.<sup foot_note="182373">3</sup>
You are indeed much occupied during the day with the affairs of the world.
So remember the name of your Lord<sup foot_note="182374">1</sup> and devote yourself to Him with exclusive devotion.
He is the Lord of the East and the West; there is no god but He. So take Him alone for your Guardian,<sup foot_note="182375">1</sup>
And bear patiently the vain things they utter, and gracefully<sup foot_note="182376">1</sup> forsake them.
Leave it to Me to deal with the affluent ones who give the lie<sup foot_note="182377">1</sup> (to the Truth), and bear with them for a while.
We have heavy fetters<sup foot_note="182378">1</sup> and a blazing Fire in store for them;
and a food that chokes, and a grievous chastisement.
(They will come across all this) on the Day when the earth and the mountains shall tremble violently and the mountains shall crumble into heaps of scattered sand.<sup foot_note="182379">1</sup>
Surely<sup foot_note="182380">1</sup> We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness over you,<sup foot_note="182381">2</sup> just as We had sent a Messenger to Pharaoh.
But Pharaoh disobeyed Our Messenger, so We seized him with a terrible seizing.
If you persist in disbelieving, how will you guard yourself against the (woe of the) Day that will turn children grey-haired,<sup foot_note="182382">1</sup>
the Day whose severity shall cause the heaven to split asunder? Allah's promise is ever bound to be fulfilled.
Indeed this is nothing but a Good Counsel; so let him who will take a way leading to his Lord.

(O Prophet),<sup foot_note="182384">1</sup> your Lord knows that you sometimes stand up in Prayer nearly two-thirds of the night, and sometimes half or one-third of it, <sup foot_note="182385">2</sup> and so does a party of those with you;<sup foot_note="182386">3</sup> Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He has shown mercy to you. So now recite as much of the Qur'an as you can.<sup foot_note="182387">4</sup> He knows that there are among you those who are sick and others who are journeying in the land in quest of Allah's bounty,<sup foot_note="182388">5</sup> and still others who are fighting in the cause of Allah.<sup foot_note="182389">6</sup> So recite as much of the Qur'an as you easily can, and establish Prayer, and pay Zakah,<sup foot_note="182390">7</sup> and give Allah a goodly loan.<sup foot_note="182391">8</sup> Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you shall find it with Allah. That is better and its reward is greater.<sup foot_note="182392">9</sup> And ask for Allah's forgiveness; surely He is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.
O you enveloped in your cloak!<sup foot_note="182393">1</sup>
Arise, and warn,<sup foot_note="182394">1</sup>
and magnify the glory of your Lord,<sup foot_note="182395">1</sup>
and purify your robes,<sup foot_note="182396">1</sup>
and shun uncleanness,<sup foot_note="182397">1</sup>
and bestow not favour in order to seek from others a greater return,<sup foot_note="182398">1</sup>
and persevere for your Lord's sake.<sup foot_note="182399">1</sup>
When the Trumpet shall be sounded,
that will surely be a hard day,<sup foot_note="182400">1</sup>
not an easy day for the unbelievers.<sup foot_note="182401">1</sup>
Leave Me with him<sup foot_note="182402">1</sup> whom I alone have created,<sup foot_note="182403">2</sup>
whom I have endowed with abundant riches,
and sons ever present with him,<sup foot_note="182404">1</sup>
and for whom I have smoothed the way (to power and riches),
and who still greedily desires that I should bestow upon him more.<sup foot_note="182405">1</sup>
By no means; he is stubbornly opposed to Our Signs.
I shall soon constrain him to a hard ascent.
He reflected and then hatched a scheme.
Ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?
Again, ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?
He looked (at others);
then frowned and scowled;
then he retreated and waxed proud,
and said: “This (Qur'an) is merely a sorcery of yore;
this is nothing but the word of a mere mortal!”<sup foot_note="182406">1</sup>
Him shall I soon roast in Hell.
And what do you know what Hell is?
It spares nothing; it leaves nothing intact;<sup foot_note="182407">1</sup>
it scorches (even) the skin.<sup foot_note="182408">1</sup>
Over it are nineteen keepers.

We<sup foot_note="182410">1</sup> have appointed none but angels as the keepers of the Fire,<sup foot_note="182411">2</sup> and We have not made their number but as a trial for the unbelievers<sup foot_note="182412">3</sup> so that those who have been endowed with the Book will be convinced<sup foot_note="182413">4</sup> and the believers' faith will increase, <sup foot_note="182414">5</sup> and neither those who have been endowed with the Book nor the believers will fall into any doubt. As for those in whose hearts there is a sickness<sup foot_note="182415">6</sup> as well as the unbelievers, they will say: “What did Allah aim at by this strange parable?”<sup foot_note="182416">7</sup> Thus does Allah let whomsoever He pleases to go astray, and directs whomsoever He pleases<sup foot_note="182417">8</sup> to the Right Way. And none knows the hosts of your Lord but He.<sup foot_note="182418">9</sup> (And Hell has only been mentioned here) that people may take heed.<sup foot_note="182419">10</sup>
Nay,<sup foot_note="182420">1</sup> by the moon,
and by the night when it recedes,
and by the day when it dawns (with its radiance),
surely (Hell) is one of the greatest Signs,<sup foot_note="182421">1</sup>
a warning to humankind,
a warning to everyone of you whether he would like to come forward or lag behind.<sup foot_note="182422">1</sup>
Each one is a hostage to one's deeds,<sup foot_note="182423">1</sup>
save the People of the Right Hand
who shall be in the Gardens,<sup foot_note="182424">1</sup> and shall ask
about the guilty ones:<sup foot_note="182425">1</sup>
“What drove you to Hell?”
They will answer: “We were not among those who observed Prayer,<sup foot_note="182426">1</sup>
and we did not feed the poor,<sup foot_note="182427">1</sup>
and we indulged in vain talk with those who indulged in vain talk,
and we gave the lie to the Day of Judgement
until the inevitable event overtook us.”<sup foot_note="182428">1</sup>
The intercession of the intercessors shall then be of no avail to them.<sup foot_note="182429">1</sup>
What is the matter with people that they are turning away from this Exhortation,
as though they were frightened wild asses,
fleeing from a lion?<sup foot_note="182430">1</sup>
No indeed; each one of them desires that open letters be sent to each of them.<sup foot_note="182431">1</sup>
No indeed; the truth is that they have no fear of the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="182432">1</sup>
Nay;<sup foot_note="182433">1</sup> this is an Exhortation.
So, whoever wills may benefit from it.

But they will not benefit from it unless Allah Himself so wills.<sup foot_note="182434">1</sup> He is worthy to be feared;<sup foot_note="182435">2</sup> and He is worthy to forgive (those that fear Him).<sup foot_note="182436">3</sup>
Nay,<sup foot_note="182437">1</sup> I swear by the Day of Resurrection;
and nay, I swear by the self-reproaching soul!<sup foot_note="182438">1</sup>
Does man imagine that We will not be able to bring his bones together again?<sup foot_note="182439">1</sup>
Yes indeed; We have the power to remould even his finger-tips.<sup foot_note="182440">1</sup>
But man desires to persist in his evil ways.<sup foot_note="182441">1</sup>
He asks: “When will the Day of Resurrection be?”<sup foot_note="182442">1</sup>
When the sight is dazed,<sup foot_note="182443">1</sup>
and the moon is eclipsed,
and the sun and the moon are joined together,<sup foot_note="182383">1</sup>
on that Day will man say: “Whither the refuge?”
No, there is no refuge.
With your Lord alone will be the retreat that Day.
On that Day will man be apprised of his deeds, both the earlier and the later.<sup foot_note="182409">1</sup>
But lo, man is well aware of himself,
even though he might make up excuses.<sup foot_note="182444">1</sup>
(O Prophet),<sup foot_note="182445">1</sup> do not stir your tongue hastily (to commit the Revelation to memory).
Surely it is for Us to have you commit it to memory and to recite it.
And so when We recite it,<sup foot_note="182446">1</sup> follow its recitation attentively;
then it will be for Us to explain it.<sup foot_note="182447">1</sup>
Nay;<sup foot_note="182448">1</sup> the truth is that you love ardently (the good of this world) that can be obtained hastily,
and are oblivious of the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="182449">1</sup>
Some faces on that Day will be fresh and resplendent,<sup foot_note="182450">1</sup>
and will be looking towards their Lord;<sup foot_note="182451">1</sup>
and some faces on that Day will be gloomy,
believing that a crushing calamity is about to strike them.
Nay;<sup foot_note="182452">1</sup> when a man's soul reaches up to the throat,
and it is said: “Is there any enchanter who can step forward and help (by his chanting)?”<sup foot_note="182453">1</sup>
and he realises that the hour of parting is come,
and calf is inter-twined with calf.<sup foot_note="182454">1</sup>
On that Day you will be driven to your Lord.
But he did not verify the Truth, nor did he observe Prayer;
on the contrary, he gave the lie to the Truth and turned his back upon it,
then he went back to his kinsfolk, elated with pride.<sup foot_note="182455">1</sup>
This (attitude) is worthy of you, altogether worthy;
again, it is worthy of you, altogether worthy.<sup foot_note="182456">1</sup>
Does man<sup foot_note="182457">1</sup> think that he will be left alone, unquestioned?<sup foot_note="182458">2</sup>
Was he not a drop of ejaculated semen,
then he became a clot, and then Allah made it into a living body and proportioned its parts,
and then He made of him a pair, male and female?
Does He, then, not have the power to bring back the dead to life?<sup foot_note="182459">1</sup>
Was there a period of time when man was not even worthy of a mention?<sup foot_note="182460">1</sup>

Verily We created man out of a drop of intermingled sperm<sup foot_note="182461">1</sup> so that We might try him,<sup foot_note="182462">2</sup> and We therefore endowed him with hearing and sight.<sup foot_note="182463">3</sup>
Surely We showed him the Right Path, regardless of whether he chooses to be thankful or unthankful<sup foot_note="182464">1</sup> (to his Lord).
For the unbelievers, We have kept ready chains and fetters and a Blazing Fire.
The virtuous<sup foot_note="182465">1</sup> shall drink from a cup tempered with camphor water.

This will be a gushing spring<sup foot_note="182466">1</sup> wherefrom Allah's servants<sup foot_note="182467">2</sup> shall drink wine, a spring from which they will take out channels wherever they wish.<sup foot_note="182468">3</sup>
These will be the ones who fulfil their vows<sup foot_note="182469">1</sup> and dread the Day whose woe shall be spread far and wide;
those who, for the love of Him,<sup foot_note="182470">1</sup> feed the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,<sup foot_note="182471">2</sup>
(saying):<sup foot_note="182472">1</sup> “We feed you only for Allah's sake; we do not seek of you any recompense or thanks,<sup foot_note="182473">2</sup>
we fear from our Lord a Day that shall be long and distressful.”
So Allah shall guard them against the woe of that Day, and will procure them freshness and joy,<sup foot_note="182474">1</sup>
and will reward them for their steadfastness<sup foot_note="182475">1</sup> with Paradise and robes of silk.
There they will recline on elevated couches and will be subjected neither to the burning heat of the sun nor to bitter cold.
The shades of Paradise will bend over them, and its fruits will be brought within their easy reach;
and there shall be passed around them vessels of silver<sup foot_note="182476">1</sup> and goblets of crystal,<sup foot_note="182477">2</sup>
goblets bright as crystal but made of silver, filled to exact measure.<sup foot_note="182478">1</sup>
Therein they shall be served a cup flavoured with ginger,
drawn from a spring (in Paradise) called Salsabil.<sup foot_note="182479">1</sup>
There boys of everlasting youth shall go about attending them: when you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.<sup foot_note="182480">1</sup>
Whitherto you look around, you will see an abundance of bliss and the glories of a great kingdom.<sup foot_note="182481">1</sup>

They [i.e., the virtuous] shall be attired in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade<sup foot_note="182482">1</sup> and will be adorned with bracelets of silver.<sup foot_note="182483">2</sup> Their Lord will give them a pure wine to drink.<sup foot_note="182484">3</sup>
Behold, this is your recompense and your endeavour has been appreciated.<sup foot_note="182485">1</sup>
(O Prophet), indeed We have revealed the Qur'an to you in portions.<sup foot_note="182486">1</sup>
So persevere with the command of your Lord<sup foot_note="182487">1</sup> and do not pay any heed to the wicked and the unbelieving,<sup foot_note="182488">2</sup>
and remember the name of your Lord, morning and evening;
and prostrate yourself before Him at night, and extol His Glory during the long watches of the night.<sup foot_note="182489">1</sup>
Verily they love (the good of this world) that is hastily obtainable and are oblivious of the burdensome Day ahead of them.<sup foot_note="182490">1</sup>
We created them and strengthened their joints; and whenever We wish, We can change their faces entirely.<sup foot_note="182491">1</sup>
Verily this is an Exhortation; so let him who so will take a way to his Lord.
But your willing shall be of no avail until Allah Himself so wills.<sup foot_note="182492">1</sup> Surely Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.
He admits to His Mercy whomsoever He pleases. As for the wrong-doers, He has prepared for them a grievous chastisement.<sup foot_note="182493">1</sup>
By the (winds) sent forth in quick succession,
which then blow tempestuously
and raise (clouds) and scatter them around,
then winnow them thoroughly,
and then cast (Allah's) remembrance (in people's hearts),
to serve as an excuse or a warning.<sup foot_note="182494">1</sup>
Surely what you are promised<sup foot_note="182495">1</sup> shall come to pass. <sup foot_note="182496">2</sup>
So when the stars are extinguished,<sup foot_note="182497">1</sup>
and the sky is rent asunder,<sup foot_note="182498">1</sup>
and the mountains are blown away,
and the appointed time to bring the Messengers together arrives,(then shall the promised event come to pass).<sup foot_note="182499">1</sup>
To which Day has this task been deferred?
To the Day of Judgement.
What do you know what the Day of Judgement is?
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!<sup foot_note="182500">1</sup>
Did We not destroy many a nation of the earlier times?<sup foot_note="182501">1</sup>
And We shall cause those of later times<sup foot_note="182502">1</sup> to follow them.
Thus do We deal with the guilty.
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!<sup foot_note="182503">1</sup>
Did We not create you of a mean fluid,
which We then placed in a secure repository<sup foot_note="182504">1</sup>
until an appointed time?<sup foot_note="182505">1</sup>
See that We had the power to do so. Great indeed is Our power to do what We will.<sup foot_note="182506">1</sup>
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!<sup foot_note="182507">1</sup>
Did We not make the earth a receptacle,
for the living and the dead,
and did We not firmly fix towering mountains on it and give you sweet water to drink?<sup foot_note="182508">1</sup>
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!<sup foot_note="182509">1</sup>
Proceed<sup foot_note="182510">1</sup> now towards that which you were wont to deny as false;
proceed towards the three-pronged shadow,<sup foot_note="182511">1</sup>
which neither provides (cooling) shade nor protection against the flames;
it indeed throws up sparks like castles,
which seem as though they are yellow-coloured camels.<sup foot_note="182512">1</sup>
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!
That will be the Day on which they will not (be able to) utter a word,
nor will they be allowed to proffer excuses.<sup foot_note="182513">1</sup>
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!
That is the Day of Judgement on which We have assembled you as well as all those who went before you.
So if you have any ploy, try it against Me!<sup foot_note="182514">1</sup>
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!
Behold, today the God-fearing<sup foot_note="182515">1</sup> will be amidst shades and springs,
and the fruits that they desire (will be ready at hand).
Eat and drink and may every joy attend you as a reward for your deeds.
Thus do We reward those that do good.
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!<sup foot_note="182516">1</sup>
Eat<sup foot_note="182517">1</sup> and enjoy yourselves for a while.<sup foot_note="182518">2</sup> Surely you are evil-doers.
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!
When it is said to them: “Bow down (before Allah),” they do not bow down.<sup foot_note="182519">1</sup>
Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!
In what discourse after this (Qur'an) will they, then, believe?<sup foot_note="182520">1</sup>
About what are they asking one another?
Is it about the awesome tiding
that they are in utter disagreement?<sup foot_note="182521">1</sup>
No indeed;<sup foot_note="182522">1</sup> soon will they come to know;<sup foot_note="182523">2</sup>
again, no indeed; soon will they come to know.
Have We not spread the earth like a bed,<sup foot_note="182524">1</sup>
and fixed the mountains like pegs,<sup foot_note="182525">1</sup>
and created you in pairs (as men and women),<sup foot_note="182526">1</sup>
and made your sleep a means of repose,<sup foot_note="182527">1</sup>
and made the night a covering,
and made the day to seek livelihood,<sup foot_note="182528">1</sup>
and built above you seven strong firmaments,<sup foot_note="182529">1</sup>
and placed therein a hot, shining lamp,<sup foot_note="182530">1</sup>
and sent down abundant water from the clouds
so that We may thereby bring forth grain and vegetation,
and gardens dense with foliage?<sup foot_note="182531">1</sup>
Surely the Day of Judgement has an appointed time;
the Day when the Trumpet shall be blown, and you will come forth in multitudes;<sup foot_note="182532">1</sup>
and when the sky shall be opened up and will become all doors;
and the mountains will be set in motion and become a mirage.<sup foot_note="182533">1</sup>
Surely the Hell is an ambush,<sup foot_note="182534">1</sup>
a resort for the rebellious;
therein they shall abide for ages,<sup foot_note="182535">1</sup>
they shall taste in it no coolness, nor any pleasant drink
save boiling water and wash of the wounds;<sup foot_note="182536">1</sup>
a befitting recompense for their deeds.
For indeed they did not look forward to any reckoning,
and roundly denied Our Signs as false.<sup foot_note="182537">1</sup>
And everything have We recorded in a Book.<sup foot_note="182538">1</sup>
So taste (the fruit of your deeds). We shall only increase your torment.
Surely the state of triumph awaits the God-fearing:<sup foot_note="182539">1</sup>
gardens and vineyards,
and youthful maidens of like age,<sup foot_note="182540">1</sup>
and an overflowing cup.
Therein they shall hear no idle talk, nor any falsehood;<sup foot_note="182541">1</sup>
a recompense from your Lord and an ample reward<sup foot_note="182542">1</sup>
from the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of that which is between them; the Most Merciful Lord before Whom none dare utter a word.<sup foot_note="182543">1</sup>

The Day when the Spirit<sup foot_note="182544">1</sup> and the angels are ranged row on row. None shall speak save he whom the Merciful Lord will permit; and he too will speak what is right.<sup foot_note="182545">2</sup>
That Day is sure to come. So let him who will seek a resort with his Lord.

Lo! We warn you of a chastisement near at hand;<sup foot_note="182546">1</sup> the Day when a man will look on what his own hands have sent forth, and the unbelievers shall say: “Oh would that I were utter dust.”<sup foot_note="182547">2</sup>
By those (angels) that pluck out the soul from depths,
and gently take it away;
and by those that speedily glide along (the cosmos),
and vie with the others(in carrying out their Lord's behests);
and then manage the affairs of the Universe(according to their Lord's commands).<sup foot_note="182548">1</sup>
The Day when the quaking will cause a violent convulsion,
and will be followed by another quaking.<sup foot_note="182549">1</sup>
On that Day some hearts shall tremble (with fright),<sup foot_note="182550">1</sup>
and their eyes shall be downcast with dread.
They say: “Shall we indeed be restored to life,
even after we have been reduced to bones, hollow and rotten?”
They say: “That will then be a return with a great loss!”<sup foot_note="182551">1</sup>
Surely they will need no more than a single stern blast,
and lo, they will all be in the open plain.<sup foot_note="182552">1</sup>
Has<sup foot_note="182553">1</sup> Moses' story reached you?
When his Lord called him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,<sup foot_note="182554">1</sup>
and directed him: “Go to Pharaoh, he has rebelled,
and say to him: 'Are you willing to be purified,
that I may direct you to your Lord and then you hold Him<sup foot_note="182555">1</sup> in awe?' ”
Then Moses (went to Pharaoh and) showed him the Great Sign;<sup foot_note="182556">1</sup>
but he denied it as false and disobeyed,
and then he turned back to have recourse to his craftiness,<sup foot_note="182557">1</sup>
and gathered his people and declared:<sup foot_note="182558">1</sup>
“I am the supreme lord of you all.”
Thereupon Allah seized him for the chastisement of the World to Come as well as of the present.
Surely there is a great lesson in it for whoever would fear (Allah).<sup foot_note="182559">1</sup>
Is<sup foot_note="182560">1</sup> it harder to create you or the heaven?<sup foot_note="182561">2</sup> But Allah built it,
and raised its vault high and proportioned it;
and covered its night with darkness and brought forth from it its day;<sup foot_note="182562">1</sup>
and thereafter spread out the earth,<sup foot_note="182563">1</sup>
and brought out of it its water and its pasture,<sup foot_note="182564">1</sup>
and firmly fixed in it mountains;
all this as provision for you and your cattle.<sup foot_note="182565">1</sup>
But when the great calamity will come about<sup foot_note="182566">1</sup>
on the Day when man will recall all his strivings,<sup foot_note="182567">1</sup>
and Hell will be brought in sight for anyone to see:
then he who transgressed
and preferred the life of this world,
most surely his abode shall be Hell.
But he who feared to stand before his Lord, and restrained himself from evil desires,
most surely his abode shall be Paradise.<sup foot_note="182568">1</sup>
They ask you about the Hour: “When will it be?”<sup foot_note="182569">1</sup>
What concern do you have to speak about that?
Its knowledge rests with your Lord.
You are only a warner to him who has a fear of it.<sup foot_note="182570">1</sup>
On the Day they see it, they will feel as though they had stayed (in the grave) no more than one evening or one morning.<sup foot_note="182571">1</sup>
He frowned and turned away
that the blind man came to him.<sup foot_note="182572">1</sup>
How could you know? Perhaps he would cleanse himself,
or he might be mindful and good counsel might avail him.
Now he who waxes indifferent,
you attend to him,
though you are not to blame if he would not cleanse himself.
But he who comes to you running,
and fears (Allah),
you pay no heed to him.<sup foot_note="182573">1</sup>
No indeed;<sup foot_note="182574">1</sup> this is only a Reminder.<sup foot_note="182575">2</sup>
So whoso wills may give heed to it.
It is contained in scrolls highly honoured,
most exalted and purified,<sup foot_note="182576">1</sup>
borne by the hands of scribes,
noble<sup foot_note="182577">1</sup> and purified.<sup foot_note="182578">2</sup>
Accursed<sup foot_note="182579">1</sup> be man!<sup foot_note="182580">2</sup> How stubbornly he denies the Truth.
Out of what did Allah create him?
Out of a sperm-drop<sup foot_note="182581">1</sup> did He create him and then determined a measure for him,<sup foot_note="182582">2</sup>
and then made the course of life easy for him,<sup foot_note="182583">1</sup>
then He caused him to die and brought him to the grave,<sup foot_note="182584">1</sup>
and then, whenever He wishes, He will raise him back to life.<sup foot_note="182585">1</sup>
Nay, but man did not fulfil what Allah had enjoined upon him.<sup foot_note="182586">1</sup>
So let man just consider his food:<sup foot_note="182587">1</sup>
We poured water, pouring it in great abundance,<sup foot_note="182588">1</sup>
and cleaved the earth, cleaving it asunder;<sup foot_note="182589">1</sup>
then caused the grain to grow out of it,
together with grapes and vegetables,
and olives and palms,
and dense orchards,
and fruits and pastures –
all this as a provision for you and your cattle.<sup foot_note="182590">1</sup>
But when the deafening cry shall be sounded<sup foot_note="182591">1</sup>
on the Day when each man shall flee from his brother,
and his mother and his father;
and his consort and his children;<sup foot_note="182592">1</sup>
on that Day each will be occupied with his own business, making him oblivious of all save himself.<sup foot_note="182593">1</sup>
Some faces on that Day shall be beaming with happiness,
and be cheerful and joyous.
Some faces on that Day shall be dust-ridden,
enveloped by darkness.
These will be the unbelievers, the wicked.
When the sun shall be folded up,<sup foot_note="182594">1</sup>
when the stars shall scatter away,<sup foot_note="182595">1</sup>
when the mountains shall be set in motion,<sup foot_note="182596">1</sup>
when the ten-months pregnant camels shall be abandoned,<sup foot_note="182597">1</sup>
when the savage beasts shall be brought together,<sup foot_note="182598">1</sup>
when the seas shall be set boiling,<sup foot_note="182599">1</sup>
when<sup foot_note="182600">1</sup> the souls shall be rejoined (with their bodies),<sup foot_note="182601">2</sup>
and when the girl-child buried alive shall be asked:
for what offence was she killed?<sup foot_note="182602">1</sup>
and when the scrolls of (men's) deeds shall be unfolded,
and when Heaven is laid bare;<sup foot_note="182603">1</sup>
and Hell is stoked,
and Paradise brought nigh:<sup foot_note="182604">1</sup>
then shall each person know what he has brought along.
No indeed;<sup foot_note="182605">1</sup> I swear by the alternating stars
that hide,
and by the night as it recedes,
and the morn as it breathes.<sup foot_note="182606">1</sup>
Verily this is the word of a noble message-bearer;<sup foot_note="182607">1</sup>
one mighty<sup foot_note="182608">1</sup> and held in honour with the Lord of the Throne;
there he is obeyed<sup foot_note="182609">1</sup> and held trustworthy.<sup foot_note="182610">2</sup>
(O people of Makkah), your companion<sup foot_note="182611">1</sup> is not mad;
he indeed saw the message-bearer on the clear horizon;<sup foot_note="182612">1</sup>
nor does he grudge (conveying this knowledge about) the Unseen;<sup foot_note="182613">1</sup>
nor is it a word of an accursed Satan.<sup foot_note="182614">1</sup>
Where to are you then heading?
It is nothing but Good Counsel for everyone in the world,
for everyone of you who wishes to follow the Straight Way;<sup foot_note="182615">1</sup>
but your wishing will not avail unless Allah, the Lord of the Universe, so wishes.<sup foot_note="182616">1</sup>
When the heaven is split asunder,<sup foot_note="182617">1</sup>
when the stars are scattered,
when the seas are made to burst forth,
and when graves are laid open,<sup foot_note="182618">1</sup>
everyone shall know all his deeds, both the earlier and the later.<sup foot_note="182619">1</sup>
O man! What has deceived you about your generous Lord
Who created you, shaped you, and made you well-proportioned,
and set you in whatever form He pleased?<sup foot_note="182620">1</sup>
No indeed;<sup foot_note="182621">1</sup> (the fact is that) you deny the Reckoning,<sup foot_note="182622">2</sup> declaring it a lie;
you do so the while there are watchers over you;
noble scribes,
who know what you do.<sup foot_note="182623">1</sup>
Surely the virtuous shall be in Bliss,
and the wicked shall be in the Blazing Fire.
They shall enter it on the Day of Recompense
and then shall never come out of it.
What do you know what the Day of Recompense is?
Again, what do you know what the Day of Recompense is?
It is the Day when no one shall have the power to do anything for another,<sup foot_note="182624">1</sup> and all command shall be Allah's.
Woe to the stinters; <sup foot_note="182625">1</sup>
those who, when they take from others by measure, take their full share; <sup foot_note="182626">1</sup>
but who, when they measure or weigh for others, give less than their due.
Do they not realise that they will be raised to life
on a Great Day, <sup foot_note="182627">1</sup>
a Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the Universe?
No indeed!<sup foot_note="182628">1</sup> Verily the deeds of the wicked are in the Record locked up in the prison-house!<sup foot_note="182629">2</sup>
And how would you know what the Record of the prison-house is?
It is a Book inscribed.
Woe, then, to those that give the lie,
those that give the lie to the Day of Recompense.
Yet none gives the lie to it except the transgressor immersed in sin;
who, when Our verses are recited to him,<sup foot_note="182630">1</sup> says: “Mere tales of olden times!”
No indeed! The truth is that their hearts have become rusted on account of their evil deeds.<sup foot_note="182631">1</sup>
No indeed! On that Day they will be screened off from seeing their Lord,<sup foot_note="182632">1</sup>
and then they shall enter Hell,
whereafter they will be told: “This is what you used to give the lie to.”
No indeed!<sup foot_note="182633">1</sup> Verily, the deeds of the virtuous shall be in the record of the exalted ones.
And what do you know what the Record of the exalted ones is?
It is a Book inscribed,
which the angels placed near Allah to safeguard.
Verily the virtuous shall be in Bliss;
resting on couches, looking around.
You shall see upon their faces the glow of bliss.
They will be served a drink of the finest sealed wine,<sup foot_note="182634">1</sup>
whose seal is musk – so let all aspirants aspire after that –
a wine whose mixture is Tasnim,<sup foot_note="182635">1</sup>
a fountain at which the chosen ones shall drink.
Behold, the wicked were wont to laugh at the believers:
when they passed by them they winked,
and when they went back to their families, they went back jesting,<sup foot_note="182636">1</sup>
and when they saw the believers, they said: “Lo! These are the erring ones”;<sup foot_note="182637">1</sup>
(they said so although) they had not been appointed watchers over them.<sup foot_note="182638">1</sup>
But today the believers are laughing at the unbelievers;
seated upon their couches, they are looking around.
Have the unbelievers been duly rewarded for their deeds?<sup foot_note="182639">1</sup>
When the sky is rent asunder
and hearkens to the command<sup foot_note="182640">1</sup> of its Lord, doing what it should;
and when the earth is stretched out<sup foot_note="182641">1</sup>
and casts out what is within it and is emptied,<sup foot_note="182642">1</sup>
and hearkens to the command of its Lord, doing what it should.<sup foot_note="182643">1</sup>
O man, you are striving unto your Lord<sup foot_note="182644">1</sup> and you will meet Him.
Whoever is given the Record in his right hand
shall be called to an easy accounting,<sup foot_note="182645">1</sup>
and shall return to his people joyfully.<sup foot_note="182646">1</sup>
But he who is given the Record behind his back,<sup foot_note="182647">1</sup>
shall cry for “perdition,”
and will enter the Blazing Fire.
He used to live joyfully among his people,<sup foot_note="182648">1</sup>
thinking he would never revert (to Us).
But no; (how would he not revert)? His Lord was ever watching him.<sup foot_note="182649">1</sup>
Nay; I swear by the twilight;
and by the night and what it enfolds,
and by the moon, when it reaches its fullness:
you shall proceed onwards from stage to stage.<sup foot_note="182650">1</sup>
So, what is the matter with them that they do not believe,
and when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not prostrate<sup foot_note="182651">1</sup> themselves?
Instead, the unbelievers reject it, calling it a lie.
Allah knows best what they are accumulating (in their Record).<sup foot_note="182652">1</sup>
So give them the good news of a painful chastisement,
except for those who believe and do good deeds. Theirs shall be an unending reward.
By the heaven with its impregnable castles;<sup foot_note="182653">1</sup>
by the Promised Day,<sup foot_note="182654">1</sup>
and by the witness and what is witnessed:<sup foot_note="182655">1</sup>
the people of the pit were destroyed
with fire abounding in fuel,
while they sat around it,
and were witnessing what they did to the believers.<sup foot_note="182656">1</sup>
Against these they had no grudge except that they believed in Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Praiseworthy,
to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Allah witnesses everything.<sup foot_note="182657">1</sup>

Surely those who tormented the believing men and the believing women and then did not repent, theirs shall be the chastisement of Hell, and theirs shall be the chastisement of burning.<sup foot_note="182658">1</sup>
As for those who believed and acted righteously, theirs shall be Gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great triumph.
Stern indeed is your Lord's punishment.
He it is Who creates for the first time and He it is Who will create again,
and He is the Ever Forgiving, the Most Loving
– the Lord of the Glorious Throne,
the Executor of what He wills.<sup foot_note="182659">1</sup>
Has the story of the armies reached you,
the armies of Pharaoh and Thamud?<sup foot_note="182660">1</sup>
The unbelievers are indeed engaged in denying it, calling it a lie,
although Allah surrounds them.
Nay; but this is a glorious Qur'an,
inscribed on a well-guarded Tablet.<sup foot_note="182661">1</sup>
By the heaven, and the night-visitor,
what do you know what the night-visitor is?
It is the piercing star.
There is no living being but there is a protector over it.<sup foot_note="182662">1</sup>
So let man consider of what he was created.<sup foot_note="182663">1</sup>
He was created of a gushing fluid,
emanating from between the loins and the ribs.<sup foot_note="182664">1</sup>
Surely He (the Creator) has the power to bring him back (to life).<sup foot_note="182665">1</sup>
On the Day when man's deepest secrets shall be put to the test<sup foot_note="182666">1</sup>
he shall have no power, and no helper.
By the heaven with its recurring cycle of rain,<sup foot_note="182667">1</sup>
and by the earth ever bursting with verdure,
this (Qur'an) is surely a decisive Word,
not a flippant jest.<sup foot_note="182668">1</sup>
They are devising a guile,<sup foot_note="182669">1</sup>
and I too am devising a guile.<sup foot_note="182670">1</sup>
So leave the unbelievers to themselves; respite them awhile.<sup foot_note="182671">1</sup>
Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High,<sup foot_note="182672">1</sup>
Who created all things and fashioned them in good proportion;<sup foot_note="182673">1</sup>
Who determined<sup foot_note="182674">1</sup> and guided them,<sup foot_note="182675">2</sup>
Who brought forth the pasture,<sup foot_note="182676">1</sup>
and then made it into a blackish straw.<sup foot_note="182677">1</sup>
We shall make you recite and then you will not forget,<sup foot_note="182678">1</sup>
except what Allah should wish.<sup foot_note="182679">1</sup> He knows all that is manifest and all that is hidden.<sup foot_note="182680">2</sup>
We shall ease you to follow the way of Ease.
So render good counsel if good counsel will avail.<sup foot_note="182681">1</sup>
He who fears (Allah) shall heed it,<sup foot_note="182682">1</sup>
but the wretched will turn away from it.
He will be cast into the Great Fire.
Then he will neither die in it, nor live.<sup foot_note="182683">1</sup>
He who purified himself shall prosper,<sup foot_note="182684">1</sup>
remembering his Lord's name<sup foot_note="182685">1</sup> and praying.<sup foot_note="182686">2</sup>
No; but you prefer the present life,<sup foot_note="182687">1</sup>
whereas the Hereafter is better and more enduring.<sup foot_note="182688">1</sup>
This, indeed, was in the ancient Scrolls,
the Scrolls of Abraham and Moses.<sup foot_note="182689">1</sup>
Has the news of the overwhelming event reached you?<sup foot_note="182690">1</sup>
Some faces<sup foot_note="182691">1</sup> that Day shall be downcast with fear,
be toiling and worn-out;
they shall burn in a Scorching Fire;
their drink shall be from a boiling spring.
They shall have no food except bitter dry thorns<sup foot_note="182692">1</sup>
that will neither nourish nor satisfy their hunger.
On that very Day some faces shall be radiant with joy,
well-pleased with their striving.<sup foot_note="182693">1</sup>
They will be in a lofty Garden
wherein they shall hear no vain talk.<sup foot_note="182694">1</sup>
In it there shall be a flowing spring,
and couches raised high,
and goblets laid out,<sup foot_note="179983">1</sup>
and cushions arrayed in rows,
and rich carpets levelled out.
Do (these unbelievers) not observe the camels: how they were created?
And the sky: how it was raised high?
And the mountains: how they were fixed?
And the earth: how it was spread out?<sup foot_note="182695">1</sup>
So render good counsel, for you are simply required to counsel,
and are not invested with the authority to compel them.<sup foot_note="182696">1</sup>
But whoever will turn away (from the Truth),
Allah will chastise him with the most terrible chastisement.
Surely to Us is their return;
and then it is for Us to call them to account.
By the dawn,
and the ten nights,
and the even and the odd,
and by the night when it departs.
Is there in this an oath for one endowed with understanding?<sup foot_note="182697">1</sup>
Have you<sup foot_note="182698">1</sup> not seen how your Lord dealt with Ad
of Iram,<sup foot_note="182699">1</sup> known for their lofty columns,
the like of whom no nation was ever created in the lands of the world?<sup foot_note="182700">1</sup>
And how did He deal with Thamud who hewed out rocks in the valley?<sup foot_note="182701">1</sup>
And with Pharaoh of the tent pegs<sup foot_note="182702">1</sup>
who transgressed in the countries of the world
spreading in them much corruption?
Then their Lord unloosed upon them the lash of chastisement.
Truly your Lord is ever watchful.<sup foot_note="182703">1</sup>
As for man,<sup foot_note="182704">1</sup> when his Lord tests him by exalting him and bestowing His bounties upon him, he says: “My Lord has exalted me.”
But when He tests him by straitening his sustenance, he says: “My Lord has humiliated me.”<sup foot_note="182705">1</sup>
But no;<sup foot_note="182706">1</sup> you do not treat the orphan honourably,<sup foot_note="182707">2</sup>
and do not urge one another to feed the poor,<sup foot_note="182708">1</sup>
and greedily devour the entire inheritance,<sup foot_note="182709">1</sup>
and love the riches, loving them ardently.<sup foot_note="182710">1</sup>
But no;<sup foot_note="182711">1</sup> when the earth is ground to powder,
and when your Lord appears<sup foot_note="182712">1</sup> with rows upon rows of angels,
and when Hell is brought near that Day. On that Day will man understand, but of what avail will that understanding be?<sup foot_note="182713">1</sup>
He will say: “Would that I had sent ahead what would be of avail for this life of mine!”
Then on that Day Allah will chastise as none other can chastise;
and Allah will bind as none other can bind.
(On the other hand it will be said): “O serene soul!<sup foot_note="182714">1</sup>
Return to your Lord<sup foot_note="182715">1</sup> well-pleased (with your blissful destination), well-pleasing (to your Lord).
So enter among My (righteous) servants
and enter My Paradise.”
Nay!<sup foot_note="182716">1</sup> I swear by this city<sup foot_note="182717">2</sup>
– this city wherein you have been rendered violable–<sup foot_note="182718">1</sup>
and I swear by the parent and his offspring:<sup foot_note="182719">1</sup>
Verily We have created man into toil and hardship.<sup foot_note="182720">1</sup>
Does he think that no one can overpower him?<sup foot_note="182721">1</sup>
He says: “I have squandered enormous wealth.”<sup foot_note="182722">1</sup>
Does he believe that none has seen him?<sup foot_note="182723">1</sup>
Did We not grant him two eyes,
and a tongue and two lips?<sup foot_note="182724">1</sup>
And did We not show him the two highroads (of good and evil)?<sup foot_note="182725">1</sup>
But he did not venture to scale the difficult steep.<sup foot_note="182726">1</sup>
And what do you know what that difficult steep is?
It is freeing someone's neck from slavery;
or giving food on a day of hunger
to an orphan near of kin;
or to a destitute lying in dust;<sup foot_note="182727">1</sup>

and, then besides this, he be one of those who believed,<sup foot_note="182728">1</sup> and enjoined upon one another steadfastness and enjoined upon one another compassion.<sup foot_note="182729">2</sup>
These are the People of the Right Hand.
As for those who rejected Our Signs, they are the People of the Left Hand.<sup foot_note="182730">1</sup>
Upon them shall be a Fire that will hem them in.<sup foot_note="182731">1</sup>
By the sun and its heat and brightness,<sup foot_note="182732">1</sup>
and by the moon as it follows it;
and by the day as it displays the sun's glory,
and by the night as it envelopes the sun;<sup foot_note="182733">1</sup>
and by the sky and by Him Who made it;<sup foot_note="182734">1</sup>
and by the earth and by Him Who stretched it out;
and by the soul and by Him Who perfectly proportioned it,<sup foot_note="182735">1</sup>
and imbued it with (the consciousness of) its evil and its piety:<sup foot_note="182736">1</sup>
He who purifies it will prosper,
and he who suppresses it will be ruined.<sup foot_note="182737">1</sup>
In their presumptuous insolence the Thamud<sup foot_note="182738">1</sup> called the Truth a lie<sup foot_note="182739">2</sup>
when their arch-criminal rose up in rage.
Then Allah's Messenger warned them: “Hands off the she-camel and her drink!”<sup foot_note="182740">1</sup>
But they rejected his statement as a lie and hamstrung the she-camel.<sup foot_note="182741">1</sup> For that crime their Lord rumbled down upon them, utterly razing them to the ground.
He has no fear of its sequel.<sup foot_note="182742">1</sup>
By the night when it enshrouds,
and by the day when it breaks in its glory,
and by Him Who created the male and the female:
surely your strivings are divergent.<sup foot_note="182743">1</sup>
As for him who gave out his wealth (for Allah's sake) and abstained (from disobeying Him),
and affirmed the Truth of goodness:<sup foot_note="182744">1</sup>
We shall facilitate for him the Way to Bliss.<sup foot_note="182745">1</sup>
As for him who was a miser and behaved with aversion (to Allah),
and denied the Truth of goodness:<sup foot_note="182746">1</sup>
We shall facilitate for him the way to Hardship,<sup foot_note="182747">1</sup>
and his wealth shall be of no avail to him when he perishes.<sup foot_note="182748">1</sup>
Surely it is for Us to show the Right Way,<sup foot_note="182749">1</sup>
and to Us belong the Next Life and the present.<sup foot_note="182750">1</sup>
I have now warned you of a Blazing Fire,
where none shall burn except the most wicked,
who rejected the Truth, calling it falsehood and turned his back on it.
But the God-fearing shall be kept away from it,
the Godfearing who spends his wealth to purify himself;<sup foot_note="182751">1</sup>
not as payment for any favours that he received,
but only to seek the good pleasure of his Lord Most High.<sup foot_note="182752">1</sup>
He will surely be well-pleased (with him).<sup foot_note="182753">1</sup>
By the bright forenoon,<sup foot_note="182754">1</sup>
and by the night when it covers the world with peace:<sup foot_note="182755">1</sup>
(O Prophet), your Lord has neither forsaken you, nor is He displeased.<sup foot_note="182756">1</sup>
Indeed what is to come will be better for you than what has gone by.<sup foot_note="182757">1</sup>
Verily your Lord will soon give you so amply that you will be well-pleased.<sup foot_note="182758">1</sup>
Did He not find you an orphan and then gave you shelter?<sup foot_note="182759">1</sup>
Did He not find you unaware of the Right Way, and then directed you to it?<sup foot_note="182760">1</sup>
And did He not find you in want, and then enriched you?<sup foot_note="182761">1</sup>
Therefore, be not harsh with the orphan;<sup foot_note="182762">1</sup>
and chide not him who asks,<sup foot_note="182763">1</sup>
and proclaim the bounty of your Lord.<sup foot_note="182764">1</sup>
(O Prophet), Did We not lay open your breast<sup foot_note="182765">1</sup>
and relieve you of the burden
that had well-nigh broken your back?<sup foot_note="182766">1</sup>
And did We not exalt your fame?<sup foot_note="182767">1</sup>
Indeed, there is ease with hardship.
Most certainly, there is ease with hardship.<sup foot_note="182768">1</sup>
So, whenever you are free, strive in devotion,
and turn to your Lord with longing.<sup foot_note="182769">1</sup>
By the fig and the olive;<sup foot_note="182770">1</sup>
and by the Mount Sinai,<sup foot_note="182031">1</sup>
and by this city (of Makkah), a haven of peace:
surely We created man in the best mould;<sup foot_note="182771">1</sup>
then We reverted him to the lowest of the low,<sup foot_note="182772">1</sup>
except those who have faith and do righteous deeds. Theirs is a never ending reward.<sup foot_note="182773">1</sup>
Who, then, can give the lie to you, (O Prophet), about the Reward and the Punishment?<sup foot_note="182774">1</sup>
Is not Allah the Greatest of all sovereigns?<sup foot_note="182775">1</sup>
Recite<sup foot_note="182776">1</sup> in the name of your Lord<sup foot_note="182777">2</sup> Who created,<sup foot_note="182778">3</sup>
created man from a clot of congealed blood.<sup foot_note="182779">1</sup>
Recite: and your Lord is Most Generous,
Who taught by the pen,<sup foot_note="182780">1</sup>
taught man what he did not know.<sup foot_note="182781">1</sup>
Nay,<sup foot_note="182782">1</sup> surely man transgresses;
for he believes himself to be self-sufficient.<sup foot_note="182783">1</sup>
Surely to your Lord is your return.<sup foot_note="182784">1</sup>
Did you see him who forbids
a servant (of Allah) when he prays?<sup foot_note="182785">1</sup>
Did you consider: what if he is on the Right Way,
and enjoins piety?
Did you consider: what if he gives the lie (to the Truth) and turns away (from it)?
Does he not know that Allah sees everything?<sup foot_note="182786">1</sup>
No indeed;<sup foot_note="182787">1</sup> if he does not desist, We shall drag him by the forelock;
by the lying forelock steeped in sin.<sup foot_note="182788">1</sup>
So let him summon his helpmates;<sup foot_note="182789">1</sup>
We too shall summon the guards of Hell.<sup foot_note="182790">1</sup>
No, not at all. Never obey him. But prostrate yourself and become nigh (to your Lord).<sup foot_note="182791">1</sup>
Behold, We revealed this (Qur'an) on the Night of Power.<sup foot_note="182792">1</sup>
And what do you know what the Night of Power is?
The Night of Power is better than a thousand months.<sup foot_note="182793">1</sup>
The angels along with the Spirit<sup foot_note="182794">1</sup> descend in it by the permission of their Lord<sup foot_note="182795">2</sup> with all kinds of decrees.
All peace is that night until the rise of dawn.<sup foot_note="182796">1</sup>

Those who disbelieved<sup foot_note="182797">1</sup> – be they from the People of the Book or from those who associated<sup foot_note="182798">2</sup> others with Allah in His Divinity – will not desist from unbelief until the Clear Proof should come to them;<sup foot_note="182799">3</sup>
a Messenger<sup foot_note="182800">1</sup> from Allah, reciting from Purified Scrolls;<sup foot_note="182801">2</sup>
in writings wherein are scriptures, absolutely true and unerring.
Nor did those to whom the Book had been given split up until after the Proof (of the Right Way) had come to them.<sup foot_note="182802">1</sup>

Yet all that they had been commanded was that they serve Allah, with utter sincerity, devoting themselves exclusively to Him, and that they establish Prayer and pay Zakah. That is the Right Faith.<sup foot_note="182803">1</sup>

Those who disbelieved<sup foot_note="182804">1</sup> – be they from among the People of the Book or among those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity– shall be in the Fire, and will abide in it. They are the worst of creatures.<sup foot_note="182805">2</sup>
But those that believe and work righteous deeds, they are the best of creatures.<sup foot_note="182806">1</sup>

Their recompense lies with their Lord: Gardens of eternity beneath which rivers flow; therein they shall dwell, forever and ever. Allah is well-pleased with them, and they are well-pleased with Him. All this is for him who fears his Lord.<sup foot_note="182807">1</sup>
When the earth will be shaken with a mighty shaking,<sup foot_note="182808">1</sup>
and the earth will throw up all her burdens,<sup foot_note="182809">1</sup>
and man will cry out: “What is the matter with her?”<sup foot_note="182810">1</sup>
On that Day it will relate all her news,<sup foot_note="182811">1</sup>
for your Lord will have commanded her (to do so).
On that Day people will go forth in varying states<sup foot_note="182812">1</sup> so that they be shown their deeds.<sup foot_note="182813">2</sup>
So, whoever does an atom's weight of good shall see it;
and whoever does an atom's weight of evil shall see it.<sup foot_note="182814">1</sup>
By (the horses) that charge snorting,<sup foot_note="182815">1</sup>
then raise sparks of fire (by their hoofs),<sup foot_note="182816">1</sup>
then raid by the dawn,<sup foot_note="182817">1</sup>
and blaze a trail of dust,
and penetrate deep into a host.
Verily man is most ungrateful to his Lord;<sup foot_note="182818">1</sup>
and he himself is a witness to that,<sup foot_note="182819">1</sup>
and surely he loves riches with a passionate loving.<sup foot_note="182820">1</sup>
Is he not aware that when whatever lies (buried) in the graves is overthrown;<sup foot_note="182821">1</sup>
and the secrets of the hearts are laid bare (and examined)?<sup foot_note="182822">1</sup>
Surely on that Day will their Lord be fully informed about them.<sup foot_note="182823">1</sup>
The Calamity!<sup foot_note="182824">1</sup>
What is the Calamity?
And what do you know what the Calamity is?
On that Day human beings shall be like scattered moths,
and the mountains shall be like fluffs of carded wool in varying colours.<sup foot_note="182825">1</sup>
Then<sup foot_note="182826">1</sup> he whose scales weigh heavier
shall have a blissful life;
but he whose scales weigh lighter,<sup foot_note="182827">1</sup>
his shall be the deep pit for a dwelling.<sup foot_note="182828">1</sup>
And what do you know what that is?
A Blazing Fire!<sup foot_note="182829">1</sup>
The craving for ever-greater worldly gains and to excel others in that regard keeps you occupied<sup foot_note="182830">1</sup>
until you reach your graves.<sup foot_note="182831">1</sup>
Nay, you will soon come to know;<sup foot_note="182832">1</sup>
nay, again, you shall soon come to know.
Nay, would that you knew with certainty of knowledge (what your attitude will lead to, you would never have acted the way you do).
You will surely end up seeing Hell;
again, you shall most certainly end up seeing it with absolute certainty.
Then, on that Day, you will be called to account for all the bounties you enjoyed.<sup foot_note="182833">1</sup>
By the time!
Lo! Man is in a state of loss;
save those who have faith and do righteous deeds, and counsel each other to hold on to truth and counsel each other to be steadfast.<sup foot_note="182834">1</sup>
Woe to every fault-finding backbiter;<sup foot_note="182835">1</sup>
who amasses wealth and counts it over and again.<sup foot_note="182836">1</sup>
He thinks that his wealth will immortalise him forever.<sup foot_note="182837">1</sup>
Nay, he shall be thrown<sup foot_note="182838">1</sup> into the Crusher.<sup foot_note="182839">2</sup>
And what do you know what the Crusher is?
It is the Fire<sup foot_note="182840">1</sup> kindled by Allah,
the Fire that shall rise to the hearts (of criminals).<sup foot_note="182841">1</sup>
Verily it will close in upon them,<sup foot_note="182842">1</sup>
in outstretched columns.<sup foot_note="182843">1</sup>
Have you not seen<sup foot_note="182844">1</sup> how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephants?<sup foot_note="182845">2</sup>
Did He not bring their plan<sup foot_note="182846">1</sup> to naught?<sup foot_note="182847">2</sup>
And He sent against them swarms of birds<sup foot_note="182848">1</sup>
which smote them with stones of baked clay,<sup foot_note="182849">1</sup>
and made them like straw eaten up (by cattle).<sup foot_note="182850">1</sup>
Since the Quraysh became accustomed,<sup foot_note="182851">1</sup>
accustomed to the journey of winter and summer,<sup foot_note="182852">1</sup>
therefore, let them worship the Lord of this House;<sup foot_note="182853">1</sup>
Who fed them against hunger,<sup foot_note="182854">1</sup> and secured them against fear.<sup foot_note="182855">2</sup>
Did you see him<sup foot_note="182856">1</sup> who gives the lie to the Reward and Punishment<sup foot_note="182857">2</sup> of the Hereafter?<sup foot_note="182858">3</sup>
Such is<sup foot_note="182859">1</sup> the one who repulses the orphans away,<sup foot_note="182860">2</sup>
and urges<sup foot_note="182861">1</sup> not the feeding of the needy.<sup foot_note="182862">2</sup>
Woe, then, to those who pray,<sup foot_note="182863">1</sup>
but are heedless in their Prayers,<sup foot_note="182864">1</sup>
those who do good (in order) to be seen,<sup foot_note="182865">1</sup>
and deny people the articles of common necessity.<sup foot_note="182866">1</sup>
(O Prophet), We have surely bestowed upon you good in abundance.<sup foot_note="182867">1</sup>
So offer Prayer and sacrifice<sup foot_note="182868">1</sup> to your Lord alone.
Verily your enemy<sup foot_note="182869">1</sup> alone has been cut off from the roots.<sup foot_note="182870">2</sup>
Say: “O unbelievers!”<sup foot_note="182871">1</sup>
I do not worship those that you worship<sup foot_note="182872">1</sup>
neither do you worship Him Whom I worship;<sup foot_note="182873">1</sup>
nor will I worship those whom you have worshipped;
nor are you going to worship Him Whom I worship.<sup foot_note="182874">1</sup>
To you is your religion, and to me, my religion.<sup foot_note="182875">1</sup>
When the help comes from Allah, and victory (is granted),<sup foot_note="182876">1</sup>
and you see people entering Allah's religion in multitudes,<sup foot_note="182877">1</sup>
then extol the praise<sup foot_note="182878">1</sup> of your Lord and pray to Him for forgiveness.<sup foot_note="182879">2</sup> For He indeed is ever disposed to accept repentance.
Destroyed were the hands of Abu Lahab, and he lay utterly doomed.<sup foot_note="182880">1</sup>
His wealth did not avail him, nor his acquisitions.<sup foot_note="182881">1</sup>
Surely, he will be cast into a Flaming Fire
along with his wife,<sup foot_note="182882">1</sup> that carrier of slanderous tales;<sup foot_note="182883">2</sup>
upon her neck shall be a rope of palm-fibre.<sup foot_note="182884">1</sup>
Say:<sup foot_note="182885">1</sup> “He is Allah,<sup foot_note="182886">2</sup> the One and Unique;<sup foot_note="182887">3</sup>
Allah, Who is in need of none and of Whom all are in need;<sup foot_note="182888">1</sup>
He neither begot any nor was He begotten,<sup foot_note="182889">1</sup>
and none is comparable to Him.”<sup foot_note="182890">1</sup>
Say:<sup foot_note="182891">1</sup> “I seek refuge<sup foot_note="182892">2</sup> with the Lord of the rising day;<sup foot_note="182893">3</sup>
from the evil of all that He created;<sup foot_note="182894">1</sup>
from the evil of night's darkness when it spreads around;<sup foot_note="182895">1</sup>
from the evil of the women who blow on knots;<sup foot_note="182896">1</sup>
and from the evil of the envier when he envies.”<sup foot_note="182897">1</sup>
Say: “I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind;
the King of mankind,
the True God of mankind,<sup foot_note="182898">1</sup>
from the mischief of the whispering, elusive prompter who returns again and again,<sup foot_note="182899">1</sup>
who whispers in the hearts of people;
whether he be from the jinn or humans.”<sup foot_note="182900">1</sup>
